original: @1b # // rgya gar skad du /
analyzed: @1b # // rgya gar skad du /
translated: In Sanskrit:

original: m'u la m'a dhy'a mi ki pratti pra san na pa da n'a ma /
analyzed: m'u la m'a dhy'a mi ki pratti pra san na pa da n'a ma /
translated: Mulamadhyamakavrttiprasannapada-nama

original: bod skad du /
analyzed: bod skad du /
translated: In Tibetan:

original: dbu ma rtsa ba'i 'grel pa tshigs gsal ba zhes bya ba /
analyzed: dbu ma rtsa ba'i 'grel pa tshigs gsal ba zhes bya ba /
translated: The commentary on the root of the middle way called “The clear words”

original: 'phags pa 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: 'phags pa 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to the noble Mañjuśrī, the youthful one.

original: gang zhig mtha' gnyis gnas la gnas bsal zhing //
analyzed: gang zhig mtha' gnyis gnas la gnas bsal zhing //
translated: He who, dwelling in the two extremes, has dispelled the dwelling,

original: rdzogs sangs rgyas blo rgya mtshor skye ba brnyes //
analyzed: rdzogs sangs rgyas blo rgya mtshor skye ba brnyes //
translated: Has attained birth in the ocean of the mind of the perfect Buddha.

original: dam chos mdzod kyi zab mo nyid ji ltar //
analyzed: dam chos mdzod kyi zab mo nyid ji ltar //
translated: Just as he realized the profound treasure of the holy Dharma,

original: rjes su rtogs bzhin thugs rjes ston par mdzad //
analyzed: rjes su rtogs bzhin thugs rjes ston par mdzad //
translated: He teaches it out of compassion.

original: gang gis lta ba'i me dag gis //🔽da dung phas rgol gzhung lugs kyi //🔽bud shing dang ni 'jig rten gyi //
analyzed: gang gis lta ba'i me dag gis // da dung phas rgol gzhung lugs kyi // bud shing dang ni 'jig rten gyi //
translated: By the fires of his views,🔽He still burns the fuel of the scriptures of the opponents

original: yid kyi mun rnams 'joms par mdzad //
analyzed: yid kyi mun rnams 'joms par mdzad //
translated: And the darkness of the minds of the world.

original: gang gi gnyis med ye shes gsung mda'i tshogs //
analyzed: gang gi gnyis med ye shes gsung mda'i tshogs //
translated: He who, with the arrows of the speech of his non-dual wisdom,

original: lha dang bcas pa'i gdul bya'i 'jig rten la //
analyzed: lha dang bcas pa'i gdul bya'i 'jig rten la //
translated: In the world of disciples together with the gods,

original: khams gsum dag tu rgyal thabs legs mdzad pas //
analyzed: khams gsum dag tu rgyal thabs legs mdzad pas //
translated: Has well performed the duties of kingship in the three realms,

original: srid pa'i dgra sde ma lus 'joms mdzad pa'i //
analyzed: srid pa'i dgra sde ma lus 'joms mdzad pa'i //
translated: Having paid homage to that Nāgārjuna,

original: klu sgrub de la phyag 'tshal nas ni de'i //
analyzed: klu sgrub de la phyag 'tshal nas ni de'i //
translated: who conquers the entire army of the foes of existence,🔽I will compose a commentary on his Verses

original: tshig le'ur byas pa'i 'grel pa sla ba dang // sdeb legs ngag gis sbyar zhing @2a * //🔽rtog ge yi //
analyzed: tshig le'ur byas pa'i 'grel pa sla ba dang // sdeb legs ngag gis sbyar zhing @2a * // rtog ge yi //
translated: with easy words and good meter,🔽unagitated by the winds of sophistry,

original: rlung gis ma dkrugs rab tu gsal bar bya //🔽de la bdag las ma yin gzhan las min //
analyzed: rlung gis ma dkrugs rab tu gsal bar bya // de la bdag las ma yin gzhan las min //
translated: and very clear.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni 'chad par 'gyur ba'i bstan bcos so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni 'chad par 'gyur ba'i bstan bcos so //
translated: The treatise to be explained begins with the words “Not from self, not from other . . .”

original: de'i 'brel pa dang brjod par bya ba dang / dgos pa'i dgos pa dag gang yin zhes 'dri na //
analyzed: de'i 'brel pa dang brjod par bya ba dang / dgos pa'i dgos pa dag gang yin zhes 'dri na //
translated: If someone asks, “What is the connection, the subject matter, and the purpose of this treatise?”

original: dbu ma la 'jug pa las bstan pa'i tshul gyis sems bskyed pa dang po gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kyis brgyan pa /
analyzed: dbu ma la 'jug pa las bstan pa'i tshul gyis sems bskyed pa dang po gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kyis brgyan pa /
translated: The first two chapters of the Entrance to the Middle Way are adorned with the wisdom of nonduality,

original: snying rje chen po sngon du 'gro ba /
analyzed: snying rje chen po sngon du 'gro ba /
translated: preceded by great compassion,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes 'byung ba'i rgyur gyur pa thog mar mdzad nas /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes 'byung ba'i rgyur gyur pa thog mar mdzad nas /
translated: and serve as the cause for the arising of the wisdom of the tathāgatas.

original: mthar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i tshul phyin ci ma log pa thugs su chud par gyur pa'i slob dpon klu sgrub kyis gzhan khong du chud par bya ba'i phyir snying rjes bstan bcos mdzad de zhes bya ba 'di ni re zhig bstan bcos kyi 'brel
analyzed: mthar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i tshul phyin ci ma log pa thugs su chud par gyur pa'i slob dpon klu sgrub kyis gzhan khong du chud par bya ba'i phyir snying rjes bstan bcos mdzad de zhes bya ba 'di ni re zhig bstan bcos kyi 'brel
translated: Finally, the master Nagarjuna, who has comprehended the unerring way of the perfection of wisdom, has composed this treatise out of compassion in order to help others understand it.

original: pa yin no //🔽slob dpon rang nyid 'chad par 'gyur ba'i bstan bcos mtha' dag gi brjod par bya ba'i don dgos pa dang bcas pa ston zhing /
analyzed: pa yin no // slob dpon rang nyid 'chad par 'gyur ba'i bstan bcos mtha' dag gi brjod par bya ba'i don dgos pa dang bcas pa ston zhing /
translated: This, in brief, is the connection of the treatise.🔽The master Nagarjuna, having expressed his greatness by showing that he is teaching the meaning of the entire treatise that he is about to expound, together with its purpose,

original: de phyin ci ma log par ston par mdzad pa nyid kyi sgo nas che ba'i bdag nyid brjod nas de'i ngo bo dang tha mi dad par bzhugs pa'i bla ma dam pa /
analyzed: de phyin ci ma log par ston par mdzad pa nyid kyi sgo nas che ba'i bdag nyid brjod nas de'i ngo bo dang tha mi dad par bzhugs pa'i bla ma dam pa /
translated: and that he is teaching it without error, wishes to pay homage to the holy guru who abides in nondifferentiability from him,🔽and to the Tathagata, the cause of the composition of the treatise.🔽He therefore says:

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la bstan bcos rtsom pa'i rgyu can gyi phyag mdzad @2b par bzhed pas /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la bstan bcos rtsom pa'i rgyu can gyi phyag mdzad @2b par bzhed pas /
translated: I pay homage to the perfect Buddha,🔽the best of teachers,🔽who taught that

original: gang gis rten cing 'brel par 'byung //🔽'gag pa med pa skye med pa //
analyzed: gang gis rten cing 'brel par 'byung // 'gag pa med pa skye med pa //
translated: which is dependently arisen,🔽free from cessation and from origination,

original: chad pa med pa rtag med pa //
analyzed: chad pa med pa rtag med pa //
translated: from annihilation and from permanence,🔽from coming and from going,🔽and which is at peace.

original: 'ong ba med pa 'gro med pa //
analyzed: 'ong ba med pa 'gro med pa //
translated: It does not come, it does not go.

original: tha dad don min don gcig min //
analyzed: tha dad don min don gcig min //
translated: It is not a multiplicity, nor is it a unity.

original: spros pa nyer zhi zhi zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: spros pa nyer zhi zhi zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: It is the pacification of all fabrication, peace itself.

original: de la rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba 'gag pa med pa la sogs pa khyad par brgyad kyis khyad par du byas pa ni /
analyzed: de la rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba 'gag pa med pa la sogs pa khyad par brgyad kyis khyad par du byas pa ni /
translated: Dependent origination is qualified by eight special attributes, such as “non-cessation,” and so on.

original: bstan bcos kyi brjod par bya ba yin zhing mya ngan las 'das pa spros pa thams cad nye bar zhi zhing zhi ba'i mtshan nyid can ni bstan bcos kyi dgos par bstan la /
analyzed: bstan bcos kyi brjod par bya ba yin zhing mya ngan las 'das pa spros pa thams cad nye bar zhi zhing zhi ba'i mtshan nyid can ni bstan bcos kyi dgos par bstan la /
translated: It is the subject matter of the treatise. Nirvana, which is characterized by the pacification of all fabrication, is taught to be the purpose of the treatise.

original: smra rnams kyi /
analyzed: smra rnams kyi /
translated: The homage of the author is taught in the verse:

original: dam pa de la phyag 'tshal lo //🔽zhes bya ba 'dis ni phyag 'tshal ba bstan te /
analyzed: dam pa de la phyag 'tshal lo // zhes bya ba 'dis ni phyag 'tshal ba bstan te /
translated: I pay homage to that most excellent one.

original: de ltar na 'di ni re zhig tshigs su bcad pa gnyis kyi spyi'i don yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na 'di ni re zhig tshigs su bcad pa gnyis kyi spyi'i don yin no //
translated: Thus, this is the general meaning of the first two verses.

original: yan lag gi don yang rnam par dbye bar bya ste /
analyzed: yan lag gi don yang rnam par dbye bar bya ste /
translated: The specific meaning should also be analyzed.

original: de la pra ti ni phrad pa'i don to //
analyzed: de la pra ti ni phrad pa'i don to //
translated: In this regard, prati has the meaning of “meeting.”

original: ai ti ni 'gro ba'i don to //
analyzed: ai ti ni 'gro ba'i don to //
translated: Iti has the meaning of “going.”

original: l+yab kyi mtha' can pra ti tya'i sgra ni phrad pa ste ltos pa la 'jug pa yin te /
analyzed: l+yab kyi mtha' can pra ti tya'i sgra ni phrad pa ste ltos pa la 'jug pa yin te /
translated: The word pratītya, which has the suffix ya, means “meeting,” that is, “depending,”

original: skad kyi byings ni nye bar bsgyur bas yongs su bsgyur ba'i phyir ro //🔽nye bar bsgyur ba'i dbang gis na //
analyzed: skad kyi byings ni nye bar bsgyur bas yongs su bsgyur ba'i phyir ro // nye bar bsgyur ba'i dbang gis na //
translated: because the verbal root is transformed by the prefix.🔽As it is said:🔽The meaning of the verbal root is transformed

original: skad byings don ni yongs bsgyur te //
analyzed: skad byings don ni yongs bsgyur te //
translated: by the power of the prefix.

original: gang g'a'i chu ni mngar mod kyi //
analyzed: gang g'a'i chu ni mngar mod kyi //
translated: The water of the Ganges is sweet,

original: rgya mtsho chu yis ji bzhin no //🔽zhes bshad do //
analyzed: rgya mtsho chu yis ji bzhin no // zhes bshad do //
translated: but the water of the ocean is not.

original: sa mud gong na yod pa'i p'a ta ni 'byung ba'i don can yin pas sa mud p'a ta'i sgra ni 'byung ba la 'jug go //
analyzed: sa mud gong na yod pa'i p'a ta ni 'byung ba'i don can yin pas sa mud p'a ta'i sgra ni 'byung ba la 'jug go //
translated: The word pratītya is used to mean “arising,” because the verbal root pa, which is above the prefix ti, has the meaning of “arising.”

original: de'i phyir dngos po rnams kyi 'byung ba rgyu dang rkyen la ltos pa ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i don to //
analyzed: de'i phyir dngos po rnams kyi 'byung ba rgyu dang rkyen la ltos pa ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i don to //
translated: Therefore, the meaning of pratītyasamutpāda is “arising in dependence on causes and conditions.”

original: gzhan dag pra ti ni zlos pa'i don to //
analyzed: gzhan dag pra ti ni zlos pa'i don to //
translated: Others say that prati has the meaning of “repeating,”

original: ai ti ni 'gro ba ste chas pa dang 'jig pa'o //
analyzed: ai ti ni 'gro ba ste chas pa dang 'jig pa'o //
translated: and i means “going,” that is, “departing” and “perishing.”

original: ai tya ni 'gro bar rung ba dag go zhes de ltar ai tya'i sgra de la phan pa'i mtha' can du bye brag tu bshad nas /
analyzed: ai tya ni 'gro bar rung ba dag go zhes de ltar ai tya'i sgra de la phan pa'i mtha' can du bye brag tu bshad nas /
translated: The suffix i is added to the root gam, meaning to go, and the suffix ta is added to the root vid, meaning to destroy, and the suffix i is added to the root vid, meaning to know.🔽The suffix i is added to the root gam, meaning to go, and the suffix ta is added to the root vid, meaning to destroy, and the suffix i is added to the root vid, meaning to know.🔽The suffix i is added to the root gam, meaning to go, and the suffix ta is added to the root vid, meaning to destroy, and the suffix i is added to the root vid, meaning to know.

original: so so so sor 'gro zhing 'jig pa dang ldan pa rnams kyi 'byung ba ni rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'o zhes brjod par byed do //🔽de dag gi ltar na dge slong dag khyed la rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba bstan par bya yis /🔽sus rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba mthong ba des chos mthong ngo zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa'i yul la ni zlos pa'i don srid pa'i phyir dang / tshig @3a * //
analyzed: so so so sor 'gro zhing 'jig pa dang ldan pa rnams kyi 'byung ba ni rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'o zhes brjod par byed do // de dag gi ltar na dge slong dag khyed la rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba bstan par bya yis / sus rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba mthong ba des chos mthong ngo zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa'i yul la ni zlos pa'i don srid pa'i phyir dang / tshig @3a * //
translated: The suffix i is added to the root gam, meaning to go, and the suffix ta is added to the root vid, meaning to destroy, and the suffix i is added to the root vid, meaning to know.🔽The suffix i is added to the root gam, meaning to go, and the suffix ta is added to the root vid, meaning to destroy, and the suffix i is added to the root vid, meaning to know.🔽The suffix i is added to the root gam, meaning to go, and the suffix ta is added to the root vid, meaning to destroy, and the suffix i is added to the root vid, meaning to know.🔽The suffix i is added to the root gam, meaning to go, and the suffix ta is added to the root vid, meaning to destroy, and the suffix i is added to the root vid, meaning to know.🔽The suffix i is added to the root gam, meaning to go, and the suffix ta is added to the root vid, meaning to destroy, and the suffix i is added to the root vid, meaning to know.🔽The suffix i is added to the root gam, meaning to go, and the suffix ta is added to the root vid, meaning to destroy, and the suffix i is added to the root vid, meaning to know.🔽The suffix i is added to the root gam, meaning to go, and the suffix ta is added to the root vid, meaning to destroy, and the suffix i is added to the root vid, meaning to know.

original: bsdu ba yod pa'i phyir bye brag tu bshad pa legs par 'gyur na /
analyzed: bsdu ba yod pa'i phyir bye brag tu bshad pa legs par 'gyur na /
translated: The suffix i is added to the root gam, meaning to go, and the suffix ta is added to the root vid, meaning to destroy, and the suffix i is added to the root vid, meaning to know.🔽The suffix i is added to the root gam, meaning to go, and the suffix

original: mig dang gzugs la brten nas mig gi rnam par shes pa 'byung ngo zhes bya ba 'di lta bu la sogs pa'i yul 'dir ni mig dang gzugs la brten nas zhes don gyi khyad par dngos su zhal gyis bzhes shing /
analyzed: mig dang gzugs la brten nas mig gi rnam par shes pa 'byung ngo zhes bya ba 'di lta bu la sogs pa'i yul 'dir ni mig dang gzugs la brten nas zhes don gyi khyad par dngos su zhal gyis bzhes shing /
translated: In such statements as “The eye consciousness arises in dependence on the eye and form,” the term “in dependence on” explicitly accepts the qualification “in dependence on the eye and form.”

original: mig gi dbang po gcig gi rgyu can gyi rnam par shes pa gcig kyang skye bar bzhed pa na brten nas zhes bya ba'i sgra la zlos pa'i don nyid yod par ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: mig gi dbang po gcig gi rgyu can gyi rnam par shes pa gcig kyang skye bar bzhed pa na brten nas zhes bya ba'i sgra la zlos pa'i don nyid yod par ga la 'gyur /
translated: When it is asserted that a single eye consciousness arises from a single eye faculty, how could the term “in dependence on” have the meaning of a dvandva compound?

original: phrad pa'i don ni phrad nas 'byung ba ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'o zhes don gyi khyad par zhal gyis ma bzhes pa'i rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i sgra la yang yod pa yin la /
analyzed: phrad pa'i don ni phrad nas 'byung ba ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'o zhes don gyi khyad par zhal gyis ma bzhes pa'i rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i sgra la yang yod pa yin la /
translated: The meaning of “meeting” is that which arises from meeting is dependent origination. The term “dependent origination” has the meaning of “meeting” even when the qualification “meeting” is not explicitly accepted.

original: don gyi khyad par zhal gyis bzhes pa la yang yod pa yin te /
analyzed: don gyi khyad par zhal gyis bzhes pa la yang yod pa yin te /
translated: It also has the meaning of “meeting” when the qualification is accepted.

original: mig dang gzugs la brten nas mig dang gzugs phrad cing mig dang gzugs la ltos nas zhes bshad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mig dang gzugs la brten nas mig dang gzugs phrad cing mig dang gzugs la ltos nas zhes bshad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is explained that the eye and form are in contact with each other, and the eye and form are dependent on each other.

original: ai tya'i sgra de la phan pa'i mtha' can yin na ni mig dang gzugs la brten nas mig gi rnam par shes pa 'byung ngo zhes bya ba 'dir pra ti tya'i sgra mi zad par ma yin pa'i phyir dang / tshig bsdu ba yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir rnam par dbye ba thos par 'gyur ba yin dang /
analyzed: ai tya'i sgra de la phan pa'i mtha' can yin na ni mig dang gzugs la brten nas mig gi rnam par shes pa 'byung ngo zhes bya ba 'dir pra ti tya'i sgra mi zad par ma yin pa'i phyir dang / tshig bsdu ba yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir rnam par dbye ba thos par 'gyur ba yin dang /
translated: If the word iti has a final i, then since the word pratyaya is not repeated in the statement “Eye consciousness arises in dependence on the eye and form,” and since there is no compound, the analysis would be heard as “The eye and form are dependent on consciousness.”

original: mig dang gzug la brten pa rnam par shes pa zhes bya bar 'don par 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: mig dang gzug la brten pa rnam par shes pa zhes bya bar 'don par 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: And it would be recited as “The eye and form are dependent on consciousness.”

original: 'di ni de lta bu yang ma yin pas /
analyzed: 'di ni de lta bu yang ma yin pas /
translated: But that is not the case.

original: l+yab kyi mtha' can mi zad pa kho nar bye brag tu bshad pa khas blang bar bya'o //
analyzed: l+yab kyi mtha' can mi zad pa kho nar bye brag tu bshad pa khas blang bar bya'o //
translated: Therefore, you should accept that the word iti has a final i and is not repeated.

original: gang zhig kha cig na re rten cing zhes bya ba'i nye bar bsgyur ba ni zlos pa'i don yin pa'i phyir dang / 'brel pa zhes bya ba phrad pa'i don yin pa'i phyir dang / 'byung ba zhes bya ba'i sgra ni skye ba'i don yin pa'i phyir rkyen de dang de la brten nas 'byung ba ste phrad nas 'byung ba'o zhe'o //
analyzed: gang zhig kha cig na re rten cing zhes bya ba'i nye bar bsgyur ba ni zlos pa'i don yin pa'i phyir dang / 'brel pa zhes bya ba phrad pa'i don yin pa'i phyir dang / 'byung ba zhes bya ba'i sgra ni skye ba'i don yin pa'i phyir rkyen de dang de la brten nas 'byung ba ste phrad nas 'byung ba'o zhe'o //
translated: Some say: The prefix pratī in pratītyasamutpāda has the sense of repetition, the prefix sam has the sense of contact, and the verbal root utpāda has the sense of origination. Therefore dependent origination means origination through contact with those conditions.🔽Others say: Dependent origination is the origination of those that possess individual disintegration.

original: gzhan dag na re so so so sor 'jig pa dang ldan pa rnams kyi 'byung ba ni rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'o zhe'o zhes gzhan gyi bshad pa rjes su brjod nas sun 'byin par byed pa de ni /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re so so so sor 'jig pa dang ldan pa rnams kyi 'byung ba ni rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'o zhe'o zhes gzhan gyi bshad pa rjes su brjod nas sun 'byin par byed pa de ni /
translated: After repeating the explanations of others, he refutes them.

original: re zhig gzhan gyi phyogs rjes su brjod pa la mi mkhas pa nyid do snyam mo //
analyzed: re zhig gzhan gyi phyogs rjes su brjod pa la mi mkhas pa nyid do snyam mo //
translated: I think that he is not skilled in repeating the positions of others.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gang zhig rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i sgra phrad pa'i don can du 'chad pa des ni rten cing zhes bya ba @3b zlos pa'i don du ma yin zhing 'brel par zhes bya ba phrad pa'i don du yang ma yin no //
analyzed: gang zhig rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i sgra phrad pa'i don can du 'chad pa des ni rten cing zhes bya ba @3b zlos pa'i don du ma yin zhing 'brel par zhes bya ba phrad pa'i don du yang ma yin no //
translated: If one explains the term dependent origination as having the meaning of contact, then the term dependent would not have the meaning of repetition, and the term origination would not have the meaning of contact.

original: 'o na ci zhe na rten cing ni phrad pa'i don yin zhing /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na rten cing ni phrad pa'i don yin zhing /
translated: What then? Dependent has the meaning of contact,

original: 'brel par 'gro ba'i don yin la /
analyzed: 'brel par 'gro ba'i don yin la /
translated: and origination has the meaning of going.

original: tshogs pa rten cing 'brel ba'i sgra ni phrad pa nyid yin par 'chad par byed do //
analyzed: tshogs pa rten cing 'brel ba'i sgra ni phrad pa nyid yin par 'chad par byed do //
translated: The term dependent origination is explained as the mere contact of a collection.

original: des na da ni phrad nas 'byung ba ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'o zhes de ltar bshad par gyur pa'i rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i sgras gal te dngos po srid tshad ma lus pa 'dzin par brjod par 'dod pa de'i tshe ni /
analyzed: des na da ni phrad nas 'byung ba ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'o zhes de ltar bshad par gyur pa'i rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i sgras gal te dngos po srid tshad ma lus pa 'dzin par brjod par 'dod pa de'i tshe ni /
translated: Therefore, if one wishes to state that the term dependent origination, which is explained as origination through contact, refers to all existing things without exception,

original: rgyu dang rkyen gyi tshogs pa de dang de phrad nas 'byung ba ni rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'o zhes zlos pa dang 'brel par byed la /
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen gyi tshogs pa de dang de phrad nas 'byung ba ni rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'o zhes zlos pa dang 'brel par byed la /
translated: The meeting of this or that assemblage of causes and conditions is dependent origination.

original: 'on te bye brag 'dzin pa de'i tshe ni mig dang gzugs la brten nas zhes zlos pa dang 'brel pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'on te bye brag 'dzin pa de'i tshe ni mig dang gzugs la brten nas zhes zlos pa dang 'brel pa ma yin no //
translated: But if you hold the view that there is a difference, then the meeting of the eye and form is not related to the repetition.

original: de ltar na re zhig slob dpon ni rjes su brjod pa la mi mkhas so //
analyzed: de ltar na re zhig slob dpon ni rjes su brjod pa la mi mkhas so //
translated: Thus, the master is not skilled in repetition.

original: de yang mi rung ste mig dang gzugs la brten nas mig gi rnam par shes pa 'byung zhes gsungs pa 'di la don gnyi ga med pa'i phyir ro zhes sun 'byin smras pa gang yin pa de yang mi 'thad do //🔽ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de yang mi rung ste mig dang gzugs la brten nas mig gi rnam par shes pa 'byung zhes gsungs pa 'di la don gnyi ga med pa'i phyir ro zhes sun 'byin smras pa gang yin pa de yang mi 'thad do // ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: But that is not correct. The refutation that you have stated, namely, that the statement, “The eye consciousness arises in dependence on the eye and form,” is meaningless because both meanings are absent, is not correct.🔽Why?

original: ji ltar med ces bya ba'i rigs pa ma bkod pas /
analyzed: ji ltar med ces bya ba'i rigs pa ma bkod pas /
translated: Because you have not presented a reason why it is meaningless.

original: dam bca' ba tsam yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dam bca' ba tsam yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is mere assertion.

original: 'on te rnam par shes pa ni gzugs can ma yin pa'i phyir mig dang phrad pa yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'on te rnam par shes pa ni gzugs can ma yin pa'i phyir mig dang phrad pa yod pa ma yin te /
translated: But if you say that the eye consciousness does not meet the eye because consciousness is not physical,

original: gzugs can rnams kho na la de dang phrad pa mthong ba'i phyir ro snyam pa'i bsam pa 'di yin na ni /
analyzed: gzugs can rnams kho na la de dang phrad pa mthong ba'i phyir ro snyam pa'i bsam pa 'di yin na ni /
translated: For we see that only those with form contact it.

original: de yang mi rigs te /
analyzed: de yang mi rigs te /
translated: But this is illogical,🔽because in the statement “This monk has attained the fruit,” contact is accepted, and the term “having contacted” is a synonym of “having relied.”

original: dge slong 'di ni 'bras bu thob pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di la phrad pa khas blangs pa'i phyir dang / phrad nas zhes bya ba'i sgra yang ltos nas zhes bya ba'i sgra'i rnam grangs yin pa'i phyir dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba zhes bya ba'i sgra ni /
analyzed: dge slong 'di ni 'bras bu thob pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di la phrad pa khas blangs pa'i phyir dang / phrad nas zhes bya ba'i sgra yang ltos nas zhes bya ba'i sgra'i rnam grangs yin pa'i phyir dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba zhes bya ba'i sgra ni /
translated: And the term “dependent origination”🔽is accepted by Master Nāgārjuna to have the meaning of “having contacted,”🔽because he says:

original: de dang de rten gang 'byung ba //
analyzed: de dang de rten gang 'byung ba //
translated: Whatever arises in dependence on this

original: rang gi dngos por de ma skyes //🔽zhes slob dpon klu sgrub kyis kyang phrad nas zhes bya ba'i don nyid du zhal gyis bzhes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi dngos por de ma skyes // zhes slob dpon klu sgrub kyis kyang phrad nas zhes bya ba'i don nyid du zhal gyis bzhes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: does not arise by its own nature.

original: des na skyon yang mi 'thad do zhes gzhan dag zer ro //
analyzed: des na skyon yang mi 'thad do zhes gzhan dag zer ro //
translated: Thus others say that the error is not tenable.

original: gang yang 'o na gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: gang yang 'o na gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is it?

original: 'di yod pas 'di 'byung la /
analyzed: 'di yod pas 'di 'byung la /
translated: Because this exists, that arises.

original: 'di skyes pa'i phyir 'di skye ba ste zhes bya ba rkyen 'di dang ldan pa nyid kyi don ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung @4a * //🔽ba'i don to zhes rang gi lugs rnam par gzhag pa de yang 'thad pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di skyes pa'i phyir 'di skye ba ste zhes bya ba rkyen 'di dang ldan pa nyid kyi don ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung @4a * // ba'i don to zhes rang gi lugs rnam par gzhag pa de yang 'thad pa ma yin te /
translated: “Because this arises, that arises” means that the meaning of “endowed with conditions” is the meaning of dependent origination.

original: rten cing 'brel bar zhes bya ba dang 'byung ba zhes bya ba'i sgra gnyis re re la don gyi khyad par ma brjod pa'i phyir la de bye brag tu bshad pa yang brjod par 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel bar zhes bya ba dang 'byung ba zhes bya ba'i sgra gnyis re re la don gyi khyad par ma brjod pa'i phyir la de bye brag tu bshad pa yang brjod par 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But that is not tenable, because the two terms “dependent” and “origination” do not express a specific meaning individually, and because it is necessary to explain the specific meaning of the compound.

original: ci ste yang dgon pa'i thig le zhes bya ba la sogs pa ltar rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i sgra ni gting tshugs pa'i sgrar khas blangs nas de skad du brjod do zhe na /
analyzed: ci ste yang dgon pa'i thig le zhes bya ba la sogs pa ltar rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i sgra ni gting tshugs pa'i sgrar khas blangs nas de skad du brjod do zhe na /
translated: But if you accept that the term “dependent origination” is a compound word like “desert island,” and that it is used in that way,

original: de yang mi 'thad de /
analyzed: de yang mi 'thad de /
translated: that is also untenable.

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i sgra ni slob dpon gyis /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i sgra ni slob dpon gyis /
translated: The master Nāgārjuna said:

original: de dang de brten gang 'byung ba //
analyzed: de dang de brten gang 'byung ba //
translated: Whatever arises in dependence on this and that

original: rang gi dngos por de ma skyes //
analyzed: rang gi dngos por de ma skyes //
translated: Does not have its own nature.

original: zhes yan lag gi don dang rjes su 'brel pa nyid du zhal gyis bzhes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes yan lag gi don dang rjes su 'brel pa nyid du zhal gyis bzhes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because he accepts the meaning of the parts as being just that.🔽But if you explain this passage as follows:

original: ci ste / 'di yod na ni 'di 'byung ste //
analyzed: ci ste / 'di yod na ni 'di 'byung ste //
translated: If this exists, that arises,

original: thung ngu yod na ring po bzhin //🔽zhes bya bas 'chad par byed pas ni thung ngu dang phrad cing thung ngu la brten te /
analyzed: thung ngu yod na ring po bzhin // zhes bya bas 'chad par byed pas ni thung ngu dang phrad cing thung ngu la brten te /
translated: like long if short exists,🔽then you accept that long is dependent on short, it is contingent on short,

original: thung ngu la ltos nas ring par 'gyur ro zhes de nyid khas blangs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thung ngu la ltos nas ring par 'gyur ro zhes de nyid khas blangs par 'gyur ro //
translated: and it is relative to short.

original: de'i phyir gang zhig sun 'byin pa de nyid khas blangs par rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir gang zhig sun 'byin pa de nyid khas blangs par rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not right to accept that very refutation.

original: shin tu spros pas chog go //
analyzed: shin tu spros pas chog go //
translated: Enough of this extensive analysis!

original: de'i phyir de ltar na 'dir bcom ldan 'das kyis dngos po rnams kyi 'byung ba rgyu dang rkyen la ltos pa yongs su gsal bar mdzad pa na /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar na 'dir bcom ldan 'das kyis dngos po rnams kyi 'byung ba rgyu dang rkyen la ltos pa yongs su gsal bar mdzad pa na /
translated: Thus, when the Lord Buddha clearly elucidated the fact that the occurrence of things depends on causes and conditions,

original: dngos po rnams rgyu med pa nyid dang / rgyu gcig pu nyid dang / mi mthun pa'i rgyu las byung ba nyid dang / rang dang gzhan dang gnyi gas byas pa nyid bkag par 'gyur la /
analyzed: dngos po rnams rgyu med pa nyid dang / rgyu gcig pu nyid dang / mi mthun pa'i rgyu las byung ba nyid dang / rang dang gzhan dang gnyi gas byas pa nyid bkag par 'gyur la /
translated: It refutes that things are without cause, have a single cause, arise from an incompatible cause, and are created by self, other, or both.

original: de dag bkag pas ni dngos po kun rdzob pa rnams kyi rang gi ngo bo kun rdzob pa ji ltar gnas pa bzhin gsungs par 'gyur ro //🔽da ni rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba kun rdzob pa de nyid rang bzhin gyis ma skyes pa nyid kyi phyir 'phags pa'i ye shes la ltos nas 'di la 'gag pa yod pa ma yin pa nas /
analyzed: de dag bkag pas ni dngos po kun rdzob pa rnams kyi rang gi ngo bo kun rdzob pa ji ltar gnas pa bzhin gsungs par 'gyur ro // da ni rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba kun rdzob pa de nyid rang bzhin gyis ma skyes pa nyid kyi phyir 'phags pa'i ye shes la ltos nas 'di la 'gag pa yod pa ma yin pa nas /
translated: Since those are refuted, it is said that the nature of conventional things is just as it is conventionally.

original: 'di la don gcig pu yod pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba'i bar 'gag pa med pa la sogs pa khyad par brgyad kyis khyad par du byed de /
analyzed: 'di la don gcig pu yod pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba'i bar 'gag pa med pa la sogs pa khyad par brgyad kyis khyad par du byed de /
translated: Now, that very conventional dependent origination is distinguished by eight distinctions, from “cessation does not exist in this” up to “singularity does not exist in this.”

original: 'gag pas na 'gag pa ste /
analyzed: 'gag pas na 'gag pa ste /
translated: Cessation is cessation.

original: skad cig mar 'jig pa la 'gag pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: skad cig mar 'jig pa la 'gag pa zhes brjod do //
translated: Momentary disintegration is called cessation.

original: skye bas na skye ba ste bdag nyid kyi dngos por red pa'o //
analyzed: skye bas na skye ba ste bdag nyid kyi dngos por red pa'o //
translated: “Arising” means arising, that is, the acquisition of one’s own nature.

original: chad pas na chad pa ste rgyun chad pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: chad pas na chad pa ste rgyun chad pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: “Annihilation” means annihilation, that is, the cessation of the continuum.

original: rtag pa na ther zug pa ste dus @4b thams cad du gnas pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rtag pa na ther zug pa ste dus @4b thams cad du gnas pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: “Permanence” means eternal, that is, remaining for all time.

original: 'ong bas na 'ong ba ste yul ring po na gnas pa rnams yul nye bar 'ong ba'o //🔽'grogs na 'gro ba ste /
analyzed: 'ong bas na 'ong ba ste yul ring po na gnas pa rnams yul nye bar 'ong ba'o // 'grogs na 'gro ba ste /
translated: “Coming” means coming, that is, those who are far away come to the place.

original: yul nye ba na gnas pa rnams yul ring por 'gro ba'o //🔽tha dad pa'i don ni don tha dad pa ste //
analyzed: yul nye ba na gnas pa rnams yul ring por 'gro ba'o // tha dad pa'i don ni don tha dad pa ste //
translated: “Going” means going, that is, those who are near go to a distant place.

original: don so so bzhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: don so so bzhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: “Different” means different, that is, having a separate object.🔽“One” means one, that is, not having a separate object.

original: don yang de yin la gcig kyang de yin pas na don gcig ste /
analyzed: don yang de yin la gcig kyang de yin pas na don gcig ste /
translated: “Object” means object, that is, the object of the mind.

original: don tha mi dad cing so so ma yin zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: don tha mi dad cing so so ma yin zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: “Different” means different, that is, not separate.

original: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba la ji ltar 'gag pa la sogs pa med pa de ltar ni bstan bcos mtha' dag gis ston par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba la ji ltar 'gag pa la sogs pa med pa de ltar ni bstan bcos mtha' dag gis ston par 'gyur ro //
translated: How dependent origination is free from cessation and so on will be shown by the entire treatise.

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la khyad par mtha' yas pa yod du zin kyang brgyad dag gcig kho na nye bar bkod pa ni 'di dag kho na gtsor rtsod pa'i yan lag tu gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la khyad par mtha' yas pa yod du zin kyang brgyad dag gcig kho na nye bar bkod pa ni 'di dag kho na gtsor rtsod pa'i yan lag tu gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Although there are an infinite number of distinctions in dependent origination, only these eight are set forth because they are the most important and are the limbs of the dispute.

original: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba ji ltar gnas pa bzhin du 'phags pa rnams kyis gzigs na /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba ji ltar gnas pa bzhin du 'phags pa rnams kyis gzigs na /
translated: When the noble ones see dependent origination as it is,

original: brjod bya dang rjod byed dang / mtshan nyid dang mtshon bya la sogs pa'i spros pa rnams rnam pa thams cad du bzlog pa'i phyir //
analyzed: brjod bya dang rjod byed dang / mtshan nyid dang mtshon bya la sogs pa'i spros pa rnams rnam pa thams cad du bzlog pa'i phyir //
translated: all conceptual elaborations of the expressed and the expresser, characteristics and the characterized, and so on are completely eliminated.

original: 'dir spros pa dag nye bar zhi bas rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba de nyid spros pa nyer zhi zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir spros pa dag nye bar zhi bas rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba de nyid spros pa nyer zhi zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, since conceptual elaborations are pacified in this context, dependent origination is called “the pacification of conceptual elaborations.”

original: 'di la sems dang sems las byung ba'i 'jug pa yang med pa dang / shes pa dang shes bya'i tha snyad log pa'i sgo nas skye ba dang rga ba dang na ba dang 'chi ba la sogs pa'i nye bar 'tshe ba ma lus pa dang bral ba'i phyir na zhi pa'o //
analyzed: 'di la sems dang sems las byung ba'i 'jug pa yang med pa dang / shes pa dang shes bya'i tha snyad log pa'i sgo nas skye ba dang rga ba dang na ba dang 'chi ba la sogs pa'i nye bar 'tshe ba ma lus pa dang bral ba'i phyir na zhi pa'o //
translated: It is peace because it is free from all the troubles of birth, aging, sickness, death, and so on, since it is devoid of the activity of mind and mental factors and since the conventions of knower and known are reversed.

original: ji skad bstan pa'i khyad par can gyis rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba ni bstan par bya ba'i sgo nas 'dod pa dam pa yin pa'i phyir las su bstan te /🔽gang gis rten cing 'brel par 'byung //🔽'gag pa med pa skye med pa //
analyzed: ji skad bstan pa'i khyad par can gyis rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba ni bstan par bya ba'i sgo nas 'dod pa dam pa yin pa'i phyir las su bstan te / gang gis rten cing 'brel par 'byung // 'gag pa med pa skye med pa //
translated: Dependent origination, which has the special characteristics as they have been presented, is taught as the object because it is the highest object of desire from the point of view of being the object of teaching.🔽The perfection of wisdom🔽is taught as the object

original: chad pa med pa rtag med pa //
analyzed: chad pa med pa rtag med pa //
translated: because it is the highest object of desire

original: 'ong ba med pa 'gro med pa //🔽tha dad don min don gcig min //🔽spros pa nyer zhi zhi bstan pa //
analyzed: 'ong ba med pa 'gro med pa // tha dad don min don gcig min // spros pa nyer zhi zhi bstan pa //
translated: from the point of view of being the object of teaching.🔽The perfection of wisdom is taught as the object because it is the highest object of desire from the point of view of being the object of teaching.

original: rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas smra rnams kyi //🔽dam pa de la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas smra rnams kyi // dam pa de la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: It is taught as the object because it is the highest object of desire from the point of view of being the object of teaching.🔽It is taught as the object because it is the highest object of desire from the point of view of being the object of teaching.🔽It is taught as the object because it is the highest object of desire from the point of view of being the object of teaching.🔽It is taught as the object because it is the highest object of desire from the point of view of being the object of teaching.🔽It is taught as the object because it is the highest object of desire from the point of view of being the object of teaching.🔽It is taught as the object because it is the highest object of desire from the point of view of being the object of teaching.🔽It is taught as the object because it is the highest object of desire from the point of view of being the object of teaching.🔽It is taught as the object because it is the highest object of desire from the point of view of being the object of teaching.🔽It is taught as the object because it is the highest object of desire from the point of view of being the object of teaching.🔽It is taught as the object because it is the highest object of desire from the point of view of being the object of teaching.🔽It is taught as the object because it is the highest object of desire from the point of view of being the object of teaching.🔽It is taught as the object because it is the highest object of desire from the point of view of being the object of teaching.🔽It is taught as the object because it is the highest object of desire from the point of view of being the object of teaching.

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is taught as the object because

original: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba ji skad bstan pa thugs su chud pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba ji skad bstan pa thugs su chud pa'i phyir /
translated: Because he comprehends dependent origination as it is taught,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa nyag gcig don phyin ci ma log par gsung ba nyid du gzigs shing pha rol po'i smra ba thams cad byis pa rtol thabs smra ba dang 'dra bar thugs @5a * //🔽su chud de /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa nyag gcig don phyin ci ma log par gsung ba nyid du gzigs shing pha rol po'i smra ba thams cad byis pa rtol thabs smra ba dang 'dra bar thugs @5a * // su chud de /
translated: he alone sees the Tathagata as the one who teaches the meaning without error and he comprehends that all the speech of others is like the prattle of infants.

original: de nas slob dpon shin tu dad pa dang ldan par gyur pas slar yang bcom ldan 'das la khyad par du mdzad pa ni /
analyzed: de nas slob dpon shin tu dad pa dang ldan par gyur pas slar yang bcom ldan 'das la khyad par du mdzad pa ni /
translated: Then, the master, having become endowed with great faith, again praises the Bhagavan with a special verse:

original: smra rnams kyi dam pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: smra rnams kyi dam pa zhes bya'o //
translated: He is the best of speakers.

original: 'dir 'gag pa sngar bkag pa ni skye ba dang 'gag pa dag la snga phyi'i rnam par gzhag pa med par bstan pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'dir 'gag pa sngar bkag pa ni skye ba dang 'gag pa dag la snga phyi'i rnam par gzhag pa med par bstan pa'i phyir te /
translated: Here, the refutation of cessation prior to this is in order to demonstrate that arising and cessation are not established as sequential.

original: gal te skye ba sngar gyur la //
analyzed: gal te skye ba sngar gyur la //
translated: If arising were prior

original: rga shi phyi ma yin na ni //
analyzed: rga shi phyi ma yin na ni //
translated: and aging and death were later,🔽there would be arising without aging and death

original: skye ba rga shi med pa dang // ma shi bar yang skye bar 'gyur //
analyzed: skye ba rga shi med pa dang // ma shi bar yang skye bar 'gyur //
translated: and birth without having died.

original: zhes 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhes 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: This will be explained.

original: de'i phyir skye ba ni sngar 'gyur la /
analyzed: de'i phyir skye ba ni sngar 'gyur la /
translated: Therefore, arising would be prior and aging and death would be later.

original: rga shi ni phyis so zhes bya ba'i nges pa gang yin pa 'di med do //
analyzed: rga shi ni phyis so zhes bya ba'i nges pa gang yin pa 'di med do //
translated: There is no such certainty as “aging and death are later.”

original: da ni slob dpon rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba 'gag pa med pa la sogs pas khyad par du 'phags par gyur pa bstan par bzhed nas /
analyzed: da ni slob dpon rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba 'gag pa med pa la sogs pas khyad par du 'phags par gyur pa bstan par bzhed nas /
translated: Now, the master wishes to teach the superiority of dependent origination through its distinctive features of non-cessation and so on.

original: skye ba bkag pas 'gag pa la sogs pa dgag pa sla bar dgongs shing thog mar skye ba dgag pa rtsom pa mdzad do //
analyzed: skye ba bkag pas 'gag pa la sogs pa dgag pa sla bar dgongs shing thog mar skye ba dgag pa rtsom pa mdzad do //
translated: Thinking that the refutation of cessation and so on is easy through the refutation of arising, he first undertakes the refutation of arising.

original: skye ba yang gzhan gyis brtags pa na bdag gam gzhan nam gnyi ga 'am rgyu med pa zhig las rtog grang na /
analyzed: skye ba yang gzhan gyis brtags pa na bdag gam gzhan nam gnyi ga 'am rgyu med pa zhig las rtog grang na /
translated: When arising is imagined by others, it is imagined to arise from itself, from another, from both, or without a cause.

original: thams cad du 'thad pa ma yin no snyam du nges par mdzad nas bshad pa /
analyzed: thams cad du 'thad pa ma yin no snyam du nges par mdzad nas bshad pa /
translated: Having ascertained that none of these are tenable, he explains:

original: bdag las ma yin gzhan las min //
analyzed: bdag las ma yin gzhan las min //
translated: Not from self, not from another,

original: gnyis las ma yin rgyu med min //
analyzed: gnyis las ma yin rgyu med min //
translated: Not from both, not without cause,

original: dngos po gang dag gang na yang //
analyzed: dngos po gang dag gang na yang //
translated: Nowhere and in no way

original: skye ba nam yang yod ma yin //
analyzed: skye ba nam yang yod ma yin //
translated: Is there ever any arising.

original: de la gang dag ces bya ba'i sgra ni rten pa'i tshig ste /
analyzed: de la gang dag ces bya ba'i sgra ni rten pa'i tshig ste /
translated: Here, the term “any” is a term that indicates a basis.

original: su dag ces bya ba'i sgra'i rnam grangs so //
analyzed: su dag ces bya ba'i sgra'i rnam grangs so //
translated: “Anyone” is a synonym for “someone.”

original: gang na yang zhes bya ba'i sgra ni rten gyi tshig ste /🔽'ga' zhig na yang zhes bya ba'i sgra'i rnam grangs so //
analyzed: gang na yang zhes bya ba'i sgra ni rten gyi tshig ste / 'ga' zhig na yang zhes bya ba'i sgra'i rnam grangs so //
translated: “ Anywhere” is a word that indicates a basis.🔽“ Anything” is a synonym for “anything at all.”

original: nam yang zhes bya ba ni gzhan yang zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: nam yang zhes bya ba ni gzhan yang zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: “ Ever” means “at any time.”

original: de'i phyir bdag las dngos po gang dag gang na yang skye ba nam yang yod pa ma yin no zhes de ltar sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir bdag las dngos po gang dag gang na yang skye ba nam yang yod pa ma yin no zhes de ltar sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the statement “No entity whatsoever arises ever or anywhere from itself” should be applied in this way.

original: de bzhin du dam bca' ba gsum po la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du dam bca' ba gsum po la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The three theses should be applied in the same way.

original: gal te bdag las skye ba ma yin pa nyid do zhes bya bar nges par gzung ba na /
analyzed: gal te bdag las skye ba ma yin pa nyid do zhes bya bar nges par gzung ba na /
translated: If it is ascertained that “no entity arises from itself,”

original: gzhan las skye'o zhes mi 'dod pa nyid du 'gyur ba ma yin nam zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan las skye'o zhes mi 'dod pa nyid du 'gyur ba ma yin nam zhe na ma yin te /
translated: doesn’t that imply that “entities arise from other”?

original: med par dgag pa brjod par 'dod pa'i phyir dang / gzhan las skye ba yang 'gog par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: med par dgag pa brjod par 'dod pa'i phyir dang / gzhan las skye ba yang 'gog par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: No, it does not, because we assert a nonimplicative negation and because we refute arising from other.

original: 'thad pa gang gis bdag las skye bar mi 'gyur ba de ni /
analyzed: 'thad pa gang gis bdag las skye bar mi 'gyur ba de ni /
translated: The reason why it is not tenable for things to arise from themselves is as follows.

original: de las @5b de ni 'byung na yon tan 'ga' yang yod ma yin //
analyzed: de las @5b de ni 'byung na yon tan 'ga' yang yod ma yin //
translated: If something arises from itself, there is no purpose at all.

original: skyes par gyur pa slar yang skye bar rigs pa 'ang ma yin nyid //
analyzed: skyes par gyur pa slar yang skye bar rigs pa 'ang ma yin nyid //
translated: And it is also not tenable for what has arisen to arise again.

original: ces bya ba la sogs pas dbu ma la 'jug pa la sogs pa'i sgo nas nges par bya'o //
analyzed: ces bya ba la sogs pas dbu ma la 'jug pa la sogs pa'i sgo nas nges par bya'o //
translated: You should ascertain this by means of such reasonings as these, as presented in such works as Candrakīrti’s Introduction to the Middle Way.

original: slob dpon sangs rgyas bskyangs kyis kyang /
analyzed: slob dpon sangs rgyas bskyangs kyis kyang /
translated: The master Buddhapālita also says:

original: dngos po rnams bdag las skye ba med de /
analyzed: dngos po rnams bdag las skye ba med de /
translated: Things do not arise from themselves.

original: de dag gi skye ba don med pa nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir dang / shin tu thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag gi skye ba don med pa nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir dang / shin tu thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because their arising would be pointless and because there would be an extreme fallacy.

original: dngos po bdag gi bdag nyid du yod pa rnams la ni yang skye ba la dgos pa med do //
analyzed: dngos po bdag gi bdag nyid du yod pa rnams la ni yang skye ba la dgos pa med do //
translated: For things that exist in their own nature, there is no need for them to arise again.

original: ci ste yod kyang skye na nam yang mi skye bar mi 'gyur ro zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: ci ste yod kyang skye na nam yang mi skye bar mi 'gyur ro zhes gsungs so //
translated: If they arose even though they already existed, then they would never not arise.

original: 'di la kha cig gis de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di la kha cig gis de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: In response to this, someone might say, “This is not a correct response.

original: gtan tshigs dang dpe ma brjod pa'i phyir dang / gzhan gyis smras pa'i nyes pa ma bsal ba'i phyir ro //🔽thal bar 'gyur ba'i tshig yin pa'i phyir skabs kyi don las bzlog pas bsgrub par bya ba dang / de'i chos bzlog pa'i don mngon pas dngos po rnams gzhan las skye bar 'gyur ba dang / skye ba 'bras bu dang bcas pa nyid du 'gyur ba dang /
analyzed: gtan tshigs dang dpe ma brjod pa'i phyir dang / gzhan gyis smras pa'i nyes pa ma bsal ba'i phyir ro // thal bar 'gyur ba'i tshig yin pa'i phyir skabs kyi don las bzlog pas bsgrub par bya ba dang / de'i chos bzlog pa'i don mngon pas dngos po rnams gzhan las skye bar 'gyur ba dang / skye ba 'bras bu dang bcas pa nyid du 'gyur ba dang /
translated: Because you do not state a reason and an example, and because you do not rebut the errors stated by others.🔽Because the words of the reductio are stated, the opposite of the proposition and its property are explicitly stated, and so it follows that things are produced from other, that production would have a point,

original: skye ba thug pa yod par 'gyur pa'i phyir grub pa'i mtha' dang 'gal bar 'gyur ro zhes skyon smra ste /
analyzed: skye ba thug pa yod par 'gyur pa'i phyir grub pa'i mtha' dang 'gal bar 'gyur ro zhes skyon smra ste /
translated: and that production would be endless. Thus, you contradict your own tenets.

original: skyon 'di dag thams cad ni rigs pa ma yin par kho bo cag gis mthong ngo //
analyzed: skyon 'di dag thams cad ni rigs pa ma yin par kho bo cag gis mthong ngo //
translated: We see that all of these objections are unreasonable.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: de la re zhig gtan tshigs dang dpe ma brjod pa'i phyir dang zhes gang smra ba de ni mi rigs so //
analyzed: de la re zhig gtan tshigs dang dpe ma brjod pa'i phyir dang zhes gang smra ba de ni mi rigs so //
translated: First, to say, “Because you do not state a reason and an example,” is unreasonable.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: gang gi phyir bdag las zhes bya ba ni yod pa rgyu nyid dang de nyid skye'o zhes smras pa yin la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir bdag las zhes bya ba ni yod pa rgyu nyid dang de nyid skye'o zhes smras pa yin la /
translated: Because of the statement “from itself,” it is said that an existent thing itself is the cause and it itself arises.

original: yod pa ni yang skye ba la dgos pa ma mthong zhing /
analyzed: yod pa ni yang skye ba la dgos pa ma mthong zhing /
translated: But since an existent thing is seen to have no need to arise again,

original: thug pa med par yang mthong la /🔽khyod kyis skyes pa slar yang skye bar mi 'dod cing /
analyzed: thug pa med par yang mthong la / khyod kyis skyes pa slar yang skye bar mi 'dod cing /
translated: and since it is seen that there would be an infinite regress,🔽you do not assert that what has arisen arises again,

original: thug pa med par yang mi 'dod do //
analyzed: thug pa med par yang mi 'dod do //
translated: and you do not assert that there would be an infinite regress.

original: de'i phyir khyed cag gi rtsod pa ni 'thad pa dang bral ba dang / rang gis khas blangs pa dang 'gal ba yin no zhes pha rol po bdag las skye bar 'dod pa la 'dri bar byed pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir khyed cag gi rtsod pa ni 'thad pa dang bral ba dang / rang gis khas blangs pa dang 'gal ba yin no zhes pha rol po bdag las skye bar 'dod pa la 'dri bar byed pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, the opponent asks, “Your argument is untenable and contradicts your own beliefs.”

original: gang las gtan tshigs dang dpe bkod pa 'bras bu dang bcas par 'gyur ba 'di dag tsam zhig gis brtsad pa na ci pha rol po khas len par mi byed dam /🔽'on te pha rol po rang gi khas blangs pa dang 'gal bas brtsad @6a * //
analyzed: gang las gtan tshigs dang dpe bkod pa 'bras bu dang bcas par 'gyur ba 'di dag tsam zhig gis brtsad pa na ci pha rol po khas len par mi byed dam / 'on te pha rol po rang gi khas blangs pa dang 'gal bas brtsad @6a * //
translated: When you debate with the mere statement of these, “from itself” and so on, which are the basis for the statement of the reason and example, do you not make the opponent accept them?

original: pas kyang mi ldog na ni /
analyzed: pas kyang mi ldog na ni /
translated: Or, if the opponent does not stop debating even when he contradicts his own beliefs,🔽then what else can you do?

original: de'i tshe ngo tsha med pa nyid kyis gtan tshigs dang dpe gnyis kyis kyang ldog par mi 'gyur ba nyid do //
analyzed: de'i tshe ngo tsha med pa nyid kyis gtan tshigs dang dpe gnyis kyis kyang ldog par mi 'gyur ba nyid do //
translated: At that time, because of shamelessness, one cannot be turned away even by two reasons and an example.

original: kho bo cag ni smyon pa dang lhan cig rtsod pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: kho bo cag ni smyon pa dang lhan cig rtsod pa yang ma yin no //
translated: We are not arguing with a madman.

original: de'i phyir slob dpon ni gnas ma yin par yang rjes su dpag pa tshang bar byed pa na /
analyzed: de'i phyir slob dpon ni gnas ma yin par yang rjes su dpag pa tshang bar byed pa na /
translated: Therefore, when the master [Nāgārjuna] completes a proof by inference even in an improper place,

original: bdag nyid rjes su dpag pa la dga' ba nyid mngon par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: bdag nyid rjes su dpag pa la dga' ba nyid mngon par byed pa yin no //
translated: he makes it clear that he himself delights in inference.

original: dbu ma pa yin na ni rang gi rgyud kyi rjes su dpag par bya ba rigs pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: dbu ma pa yin na ni rang gi rgyud kyi rjes su dpag par bya ba rigs pa yang ma yin te /
translated: But if one is a Mādhyamika, it is not right to infer for oneself,

original: phyogs gzhan khas blangs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyogs gzhan khas blangs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because one does not accept any other position.

original: de skad du yang 'phags pa'i lhas //🔽yod dang med dang yod med ces //
analyzed: de skad du yang 'phags pa'i lhas // yod dang med dang yod med ces //
translated: Āryadeva says this:🔽No position at all🔽exists for anyone

original: phyogs ni gang la 'ang yod min pa //
analyzed: phyogs ni gang la 'ang yod min pa //
translated: in any place.

original: de la yun ni ring po na'ang //
analyzed: de la yun ni ring po na'ang //
translated: Even if one tried for a long time,

original: klan ka brjod par nus ma yin //🔽zhes bshad do //
analyzed: klan ka brjod par nus ma yin // zhes bshad do //
translated: one could not find fault with it.

original: rtsod pa bzlog pa las kyang //
analyzed: rtsod pa bzlog pa las kyang //
translated: And in the Vigrahavyāvartanī it is said:

original: gal te ngas dam bcas 'ga' yod //
analyzed: gal te ngas dam bcas 'ga' yod //
translated: If I had any thesis,🔽then I would have that fault.

original: des na nga la skyon de yod //
analyzed: des na nga la skyon de yod //
translated: Therefore, I have no fault.

original: nga la dam bca' med pas na //
analyzed: nga la dam bca' med pas na //
translated: Since I have no thesis,

original: nga la skyon med kho na yin //🔽gal te mngon sum la sogs pa'i //
analyzed: nga la skyon med kho na yin // gal te mngon sum la sogs pa'i //
translated: I alone am beyond all dispute.🔽If I were to apprehend anything

original: don gyis 'ga' zhig dmigs na ni //
analyzed: don gyis 'ga' zhig dmigs na ni //
translated: Through direct perception and so on,

original: sgrub pa 'ang bzlog par bya na de //
analyzed: sgrub pa 'ang bzlog par bya na de //
translated: I could be disputed on the ground that🔽That which I apprehend exists.

original: med phyir nga la klan ka med //
analyzed: med phyir nga la klan ka med //
translated: But since I apprehend nothing,

original: ces gsungs so //
analyzed: ces gsungs so //
translated: I am beyond all dispute.🔽When the Madhyamika does not state autonomous inferences,

original: gang gi tshe de ltar dbu ma pas rang gi rgyud kyi rjes su dpag pa mi brjod pa nyid yin par de'i tshe /🔽gang la grangs can pa dag gis //
analyzed: gang gi tshe de ltar dbu ma pas rang gi rgyud kyi rjes su dpag pa mi brjod pa nyid yin par de'i tshe / gang la grangs can pa dag gis //
translated: then at that time,

original: dam bca' ba'i don 'di gang yin //🔽ci bdag las zhes bya ba 'bras bu'i bdag nyid las sam /
analyzed: dam bca' ba'i don 'di gang yin // ci bdag las zhes bya ba 'bras bu'i bdag nyid las sam /
translated: what is the meaning of the thesis that the Samkhyas state?

original: 'on te rgyu'i bdag nyid las yin grang /
analyzed: 'on te rgyu'i bdag nyid las yin grang /
translated: Is it that the effect exists in the cause or does not exist in the cause?

original: de las cir 'gyur /🔽gal te 'bras bu'i bdag nyid las yin na ni grub pa la sgrub pa yin la /
analyzed: de las cir 'gyur / gal te 'bras bu'i bdag nyid las yin na ni grub pa la sgrub pa yin la /
translated: What follows from this?🔽If it is that the effect exists in the cause, then it would be the establishment of what is already established.

original: rgyu'i bdag nyid las yin na ni 'gal ba'i don nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: rgyu'i bdag nyid las yin na ni 'gal ba'i don nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: If it is that the effect does not exist in the cause, then it would be the establishment of what is contradictory.

original: skye ba dang ldan pa thams cad ni rgyu'i bdag nyid du yod pa kho na skye ba'i phyir ro //🔽zhes bya bar gang la grangs can pa dag gis phyir zlog par byed par 'gyur la /
analyzed: skye ba dang ldan pa thams cad ni rgyu'i bdag nyid du yod pa kho na skye ba'i phyir ro // zhes bya bar gang la grangs can pa dag gis phyir zlog par byed par 'gyur la /
translated: because all that exists as the nature of a cause alone is produced.

original: nang gi skye mched rnams dag las skye ba med de zhes bya ba'i rang gi rgyud kyi dam bca' ba lta ga la yod /
analyzed: nang gi skye mched rnams dag las skye ba med de zhes bya ba'i rang gi rgyud kyi dam bca' ba lta ga la yod /
translated: How could there be a thesis of one’s own, “Internal sources are not produced from themselves,”

original: kho bo cag la ni gang zhig grub pa la sgrub pa nyid dam /🔽'gal ba'i don nyid du 'gyur zhing //
analyzed: kho bo cag la ni gang zhig grub pa la sgrub pa nyid dam / 'gal ba'i don nyid du 'gyur zhing //
translated: to which the Sāṃkhyas could respond?

original: grub pa la sgrub pa nyid gang yin pa dang / 'gal ba'i don nyid gang yin pa spang bar @6b bya ba'i phyir 'bad pa byed par 'gyur ba yod pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs kyang ga la yod /
analyzed: grub pa la sgrub pa nyid gang yin pa dang / 'gal ba'i don nyid gang yin pa spang bar @6b bya ba'i phyir 'bad pa byed par 'gyur ba yod pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs kyang ga la yod /
translated: How could there be a reason, “because we make an effort to avoid the error that would occur if we accepted that which is established as established or that which is contradictory”?

original: de'i phyir gzhan gyis smras pa'i nyes par thal bar mi 'gyur ba nyid kyi phyir slob dpon sangs rgyas bskyangs kyis de'i lan brjod par bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir gzhan gyis smras pa'i nyes par thal bar mi 'gyur ba nyid kyi phyir slob dpon sangs rgyas bskyangs kyis de'i lan brjod par bya ba ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, since the error that the opponent has stated does not follow, it is not necessary for Master Buddhapalita to respond to that.

original: ci ste yang dbu ma pa rnams kyi ltar na phyogs dang gtan tshigs dang dpe dag ma grub pas rang gi rgyud kyi rjes su dpag pa ma brjod pa nyid kyi phyir bdag las skye ba dgag pa'i dam bca' ba'i don sgrub pa dang / gnyi ga la grub pa'i rjes su dpag pas gzhan gyi dam bca' bsal bar ma gyur mod /
analyzed: ci ste yang dbu ma pa rnams kyi ltar na phyogs dang gtan tshigs dang dpe dag ma grub pas rang gi rgyud kyi rjes su dpag pa ma brjod pa nyid kyi phyir bdag las skye ba dgag pa'i dam bca' ba'i don sgrub pa dang / gnyi ga la grub pa'i rjes su dpag pas gzhan gyi dam bca' bsal bar ma gyur mod /
translated: But if, according to the Madhyamikas, the subject, reason, and example are not established, then since they do not state autonomous inferences, they cannot establish the meaning of the thesis refuting arising from self, and they cannot clear away the opponent’s thesis by means of an inference that is established for both the proponent and the opponent.

original: gzhan gyi dam bca' ba la rang gi rjes su dpag pas 'gal ba brjod par ni bya dgos pas /
analyzed: gzhan gyi dam bca' ba la rang gi rjes su dpag pas 'gal ba brjod par ni bya dgos pas /
translated: So they must state a contradiction in the opponent’s thesis by means of an inference that is established for the opponent.

original: rang nyid la phyogs la sogs pa dang gtan tshigs dpe'i skyon dang bral ba dag yod par bya dgos so //
analyzed: rang nyid la phyogs la sogs pa dang gtan tshigs dpe'i skyon dang bral ba dag yod par bya dgos so //
translated: So they must have positions, reasons, and examples that are free from faults.

original: de'i phyir de ma brjod pa'i phyir dang / de'i nyes pa ma bsal ba'i phyir nyes pa de nyid du 'gyur ro snyam na /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ma brjod pa'i phyir dang / de'i nyes pa ma bsal ba'i phyir nyes pa de nyid du 'gyur ro snyam na /
translated: Therefore, since you do not state that, and since you do not clear away that fault, the fault still applies to you.

original: bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: bshad par bya ste /
translated: We reply:

original: de ni de ltar ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni de ltar ma yin no //
translated: That is not so.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: gang gi phyir don gang zhig gang gis dam bcas pa des ni rang nyid kyis nges pa bzhin du gzhan dag la nges pa bskyed par 'dod pas /🔽don 'di'i 'thad pa gang gi sgo nas khong du chud pa'i 'thad pa de nyid gzhan la bsnyad par bya dgos so //
analyzed: gang gi phyir don gang zhig gang gis dam bcas pa des ni rang nyid kyis nges pa bzhin du gzhan dag la nges pa bskyed par 'dod pas / don 'di'i 'thad pa gang gi sgo nas khong du chud pa'i 'thad pa de nyid gzhan la bsnyad par bya dgos so //
translated: Because when someone asserts something, he wishes to generate certainty in others just as he himself has generated certainty.🔽Therefore, he must explain to others the very means of understanding by which he himself has understood the meaning of his assertion.

original: de'i phyir rang gis khas blangs pa'i dam bcas pa'i don gyi sgrub par byed pa ni pha rol po kho nas nye bar dgod par bya ba gang yin pa 'di ni re zhig lugs ma yin no /
analyzed: de'i phyir rang gis khas blangs pa'i dam bcas pa'i don gyi sgrub par byed pa ni pha rol po kho nas nye bar dgod par bya ba gang yin pa 'di ni re zhig lugs ma yin no /
translated: Thus, it is not at all proper for you to posit as the proof of the meaning of your thesis only what your opponent accepts.

original: 'di ni gzhan la gtan tshigs kyang ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni gzhan la gtan tshigs kyang ma yin no //
translated: This is not even a reason for others.

original: gtan tshigs dang / dpe med pa'i phyir rang gi dam bca' ba'i don gyi sgrub par byed pa ni khas 'ches pa'i rjes su 'brangs pa 'ba' zhig nye bar bkod pa yin te /
analyzed: gtan tshigs dang / dpe med pa'i phyir rang gi dam bca' ba'i don gyi sgrub par byed pa ni khas 'ches pa'i rjes su 'brangs pa 'ba' zhig nye bar bkod pa yin te /
translated: Because there is no logical reason or example, the proof of the meaning of your thesis is merely a repetition of your assertion.

original: de'i phyir 'thad pa dang bral ba'i phyogs khas blangs pas 'di ni bdag nyid kho na la slu bar byed pas gzhan la nges pa bskyed par mi nus so //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'thad pa dang bral ba'i phyogs khas blangs pas 'di ni bdag nyid kho na la slu bar byed pas gzhan la nges pa bskyed par mi nus so //
translated: Therefore, since you accept a position that is not tenable, you deceive only yourself, and so you are unable to generate certainty in others.

original: zhes bya bar gang rang gi dam bca' ba'i don gyi sgrub par byed pa la nus pa med pa 'di nyid 'di'i sun 'byin pa ches gsal po yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya bar gang rang gi dam bca' ba'i don gyi sgrub par byed pa la nus pa med pa 'di nyid 'di'i sun 'byin pa ches gsal po yin te /
translated: This very lack of capacity to prove the meaning of your thesis is the clearest refutation of you.

original: 'dir rjes su dpag pas gnod pa brjod pa la dgos pa go ci zhig yod /
analyzed: 'dir rjes su dpag pas gnod pa brjod pa la dgos pa go ci zhig yod /
translated: What need is there to state a refutation by way of a reductio?

original: ci ste yang rang gi rjes su dpag pas 'gal ba gdon mi za bar brjod par bya ba yin no zhe na //🔽de yang slob dpon @7a * //
analyzed: ci ste yang rang gi rjes su dpag pas 'gal ba gdon mi za bar brjod par bya ba yin no zhe na // de yang slob dpon @7a * //
translated: But if you say that you must state a contradiction with your own inference,

original: sangs rgyas bskyangs kyis brjod pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bskyangs kyis brjod pa nyid yin no //
translated: then that is stated by Master Buddhapālita.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: gang gi phyir des ni 'di skad du bshad pa yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir des ni 'di skad du bshad pa yin te /
translated: Because this is what is being said:

original: dngos po rnams bdag las skye ba med de /
analyzed: dngos po rnams bdag las skye ba med de /
translated: Things do not arise from themselves,

original: de dag gi skye ba don med pa nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir dang zhes bshad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag gi skye ba don med pa nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir dang zhes bshad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because their arising would be pointless.

original: de la de dag ces bya ba 'dis ni rang gi bdag nyid du yod pa 'dzin pa yin no //
analyzed: de la de dag ces bya ba 'dis ni rang gi bdag nyid du yod pa 'dzin pa yin no //
translated: In this context, “those” refers to the apprehension of their own nature.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽'di ltar rang gi bdag nyid du yod pa dag la ni yang skye ba la dgos pa med do zhes bya ba 'di ni mdor bzhag pa'i ngag de'i 'grel pa'i ngag yin la ngag 'dis ni chos mthun pa'i dpe gzhan la rab tu grags pa bsgrub par bya
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na / 'di ltar rang gi bdag nyid du yod pa dag la ni yang skye ba la dgos pa med do zhes bya ba 'di ni mdor bzhag pa'i ngag de'i 'grel pa'i ngag yin la ngag 'dis ni chos mthun pa'i dpe gzhan la rab tu grags pa bsgrub par bya
translated: Why?

original: ba dang sgrub par byed pa'i chos dang ldan pa nye bar gzung ba yin no //
analyzed: ba dang sgrub par byed pa'i chos dang ldan pa nye bar gzung ba yin no //
translated: Because there is no need for things that exist by way of their own nature to arise again. This is the explanatory passage for the brief passage. This passage presents an example that is commonly recognized as being similar to the thesis and the reason.

original: de la rang gi bdag nyid du yod pa zhes bya ba 'dis ni gtan tshigs 'dzin pa yin no //
analyzed: de la rang gi bdag nyid du yod pa zhes bya ba 'dis ni gtan tshigs 'dzin pa yin no //
translated: In this context, “their own nature” is the apprehension of the reason.

original: skye ba don med pa nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir dang zhes bya ba 'dis ni bsgrub par bya ba'i chos 'dzin pa yin no //🔽de la ji ltar sgra mi rtag ste //🔽byas pa mi rtag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skye ba don med pa nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir dang zhes bya ba 'dis ni bsgrub par bya ba'i chos 'dzin pa yin no // de la ji ltar sgra mi rtag ste // byas pa mi rtag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase “because arising would be pointless” indicates the property to be proven.

original: byas pa ni mi rtag par mthong ste /
analyzed: byas pa ni mi rtag par mthong ste /
translated: In the case of the argument “Sound is impermanent because it is produced,” the property to be proven is impermanence.🔽The reason is “produced,” and the example is “like a pot.”🔽The argument is stated as follows: “Sound is impermanent because it is produced.”🔽The reason is “produced,” and the example is “like a pot.”🔽In the same way, the reason in the present case is “because things do not arise from themselves.”

original: dper na bum pa bzhin no //🔽de bzhin du sgra yang byas pa yin te /🔽de'i phyir byas pa nyid kyi phyir mi rtag pa yin no zhes 'dir nye bar sbyar bas gsal bar byas pa'i byas pa gtan tshigs yin pa de bzhin du /🔽'dir yang dngos po rnams bdag las skye ba med de /
analyzed: dper na bum pa bzhin no // de bzhin du sgra yang byas pa yin te / de'i phyir byas pa nyid kyi phyir mi rtag pa yin no zhes 'dir nye bar sbyar bas gsal bar byas pa'i byas pa gtan tshigs yin pa de bzhin du / 'dir yang dngos po rnams bdag las skye ba med de /
translated: The example is “like a pot.”

original: rang gi bdag nyid du yod pa la yang skye ba don med pa nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi bdag nyid du yod pa la yang skye ba don med pa nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The argument is stated as follows: “Things do not arise from themselves because it would be pointless for things that exist in and of themselves to arise again.”

original: 'di na ji ltar bum pa la sogs pa mdun na gnas shing gsal ba rang gi bdag nyid du yod pa ni yang skye ba la mi ltos par mthong ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: 'di na ji ltar bum pa la sogs pa mdun na gnas shing gsal ba rang gi bdag nyid du yod pa ni yang skye ba la mi ltos par mthong ba de bzhin du /
translated: In this case, a pot and other things that are present in front of us and are clearly manifest are seen not to arise again, even though they exist in and of themselves.

original: 'jim pa'i gong bu la sogs pa'i gnas skabs na yang gal te rang gi bdag nyid du yod pa'i bum pa la sogs pa yod do snyam du sems na ni de'i tshe yang rang gi bdag nyid du yod pa de la skye ba yod pa ma yin no
analyzed: 'jim pa'i gong bu la sogs pa'i gnas skabs na yang gal te rang gi bdag nyid du yod pa'i bum pa la sogs pa yod do snyam du sems na ni de'i tshe yang rang gi bdag nyid du yod pa de la skye ba yod pa ma yin no
translated: If you think that a pot, etc., which exists by way of its own entity also exists at the time of the lump of clay, etc., then at that time also, that which exists by way of its own entity does not have arising.

original: // de ltar na gtan tshigs nye bar sbyar bas gsal bar byas pa /
analyzed: // de ltar na gtan tshigs nye bar sbyar bas gsal bar byas pa /
translated: Thus, the syllogism is clarified by the application of the reason.

original: yang skye ba dgag pa la mi 'khrul pa /
analyzed: yang skye ba dgag pa la mi 'khrul pa /
translated: Moreover, the non-erroneous refutation of arising is

original: rang gi bdag nyid du yod pa nyid kyis grangs can la rang nyid kyis rjes su dpag pas 'gal ba brjod pa mdzad pa yin te /
analyzed: rang gi bdag nyid du yod pa nyid kyis grangs can la rang nyid kyis rjes su dpag pas 'gal ba brjod pa mdzad pa yin te /
translated: the expression of the contradiction by the Sāṃkhya himself through inference.

original: des na de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: des na de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, that is not logical.

original: gtan tshigs dang dpe ma brjod pa'i phyir dang zhes ci ste rjod par byed /
analyzed: gtan tshigs dang dpe ma brjod pa'i phyir dang zhes ci ste rjod par byed /
translated: Why is it said, “because the reason and example are not stated”?

original: gtan tshigs dang dpe ma brjod pa @7b ma yin pa 'ga' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
analyzed: gtan tshigs dang dpe ma brjod pa @7b ma yin pa 'ga' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
translated: Not only are the reason and example not stated,

original: gzhan gyis smras pa'i nyes pa ma bsal ba yang ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan gyis smras pa'i nyes pa ma bsal ba yang ma yin no //
translated: but also the fault stated by the opponent is not removed.

original: ci ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ci ltar zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: grangs can pa dag mdun na gnas pa'i bum pa mngon par gsal ba'i rang bzhin can ni yang mngon par gsal bar mi 'dod cing /
analyzed: grangs can pa dag mdun na gnas pa'i bum pa mngon par gsal ba'i rang bzhin can ni yang mngon par gsal bar mi 'dod cing /
translated: The Sāṃkhya do not assert that a pot that exists in front of us, which has the nature of manifest phenomena, is manifest again.

original: de nyid 'dir dpe nyid du grub pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir la /🔽nus pa'i ngo bor gyur cing mngon par gsal ba'i rang bzhin ma yin pa skye ba bkag pas khyad par du byas pa ni bsgrub par bya ba yin pa nyid kyi phyir grub pa la sgrub pa'i phyogs kyi skyon nyid du dogs pa 'am /
analyzed: de nyid 'dir dpe nyid du grub pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir la / nus pa'i ngo bor gyur cing mngon par gsal ba'i rang bzhin ma yin pa skye ba bkag pas khyad par du byas pa ni bsgrub par bya ba yin pa nyid kyi phyir grub pa la sgrub pa'i phyogs kyi skyon nyid du dogs pa 'am /
translated: Because that itself is the nature that is established as the example.

original: gtan tshigs 'gal ba'i don nyid du dogs pa ga la yod /
analyzed: gtan tshigs 'gal ba'i don nyid du dogs pa ga la yod /
translated: Since the probandum is qualified by the negation of the arising of that which is not manifest phenomena, which is the nature of potency, how could there be the fault of proving what is already established, or the fault of the reason being contradictory?

original: de'i phyir rang gi rjes su dpag pas 'gal ba brjod pa na yang ji skad smras pa'i nyes pa brjod pa med pa'i phyir /🔽gzhan gyis smras pa'i nyes pa ma bsal ba med pa nyid de /
analyzed: de'i phyir rang gi rjes su dpag pas 'gal ba brjod pa na yang ji skad smras pa'i nyes pa brjod pa med pa'i phyir / gzhan gyis smras pa'i nyes pa ma bsal ba med pa nyid de /
translated: Therefore, when we state a contradiction through our own inference, the faults that you ascribe to us are not stated.

original: de'i phyir sun 'byin pa 'di dag ni 'brel pa med pa nyid do zhes shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir sun 'byin pa 'di dag ni 'brel pa med pa nyid do zhes shes par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, since we do not fail to dispel the faults that you ascribe to us, you should understand that these refutations of yours are irrelevant.

original: bum pa la sogs pa zhes bya ba sogs pa'i sgras ni skye bar 'dod pa'i dngos po ma lus pa bsdu bar 'dod pa'i phyir snam bu la sogs pa dag gis ma nges par 'gyur ba yang ma yin no //
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa zhes bya ba sogs pa'i sgras ni skye bar 'dod pa'i dngos po ma lus pa bsdu bar 'dod pa'i phyir snam bu la sogs pa dag gis ma nges par 'gyur ba yang ma yin no //
translated: The phrase “such things as pots” is used because it is held that the word “such” includes all things that are held to arise.

original: yang na sbyor ba 'di ni tshul gzhan yin te /
analyzed: yang na sbyor ba 'di ni tshul gzhan yin te /
translated: Or, this syllogism has a different structure:

original: rang las skye bar smra ba'i skyes bu las tha dad pa'i don rnams ni bdag nyid las skye ba med de /
analyzed: rang las skye bar smra ba'i skyes bu las tha dad pa'i don rnams ni bdag nyid las skye ba med de /
translated: Things that are different from the person who is said to arise from himself do not arise from themselves,

original: rang gi bdag nyid du yod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rang gi bdag nyid du yod pa'i phyir /
translated: because they exist by way of their own identity.

original: skyes bu bzhin no zhes dper brjod pa 'di nyid dper brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: skyes bu bzhin no zhes dper brjod pa 'di nyid dper brjod par bya'o //
translated: This very example should be given as an example.🔽If the refutation of arising does not undermine the assertion of manifestation, then the word “arising” is applied to manifestation.

original: gal te yang skye ba bkag pas mngon par gsal bar smra ba la gnod par byed pa ma yin pa de lta na yang skye ba'i sgra mngon par gsal ba la btags nas sngon dang phyi mar ma dmigs pa dang dmigs par chos mthun pas skye ba'i sgras
analyzed: gal te yang skye ba bkag pas mngon par gsal bar smra ba la gnod par byed pa ma yin pa de lta na yang skye ba'i sgra mngon par gsal ba la btags nas sngon dang phyi mar ma dmigs pa dang dmigs par chos mthun pas skye ba'i sgras
translated: Because of the similarity of the nonobservation and observation of the prior and subsequent, the word “arising”

original: mngon par gsal ba nyid brjod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mngon par gsal ba nyid brjod pa'i phyir /
translated: expresses manifestation.

original: 'di bkag pas gnod par byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di bkag pas gnod par byed pa ma yin no //
translated: But this does not invalidate our refutation.

original: yang ji skad smras pa'i don gyi rjod par byed pa med par rnam par dpyod pa 'di lta bu 'di ji ltar rnyed ce na /
analyzed: yang ji skad smras pa'i don gyi rjod par byed pa med par rnam par dpyod pa 'di lta bu 'di ji ltar rnyed ce na /
translated: How is it that you have found this kind of analysis that does not rely on the meaning of the words that are spoken?

original: bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: bshad par bya ste /
translated: We will explain this.

original: don gyi ngag 'di dag ni don chen po can yin pas ji skad smras pa'i don bsdus nas 'jug pa yin la /
analyzed: don gyi ngag 'di dag ni don chen po can yin pas ji skad smras pa'i don bsdus nas 'jug pa yin la /
translated: These statements have great meaning, so we engage in them by condensing the meaning of what is said.

original: de dag kyang bshad na ji skad smras pa'i don gyi bdag nyid 'byin par byed pa yin pas /
