analyzed: de dag kyang bshad na ji skad smras pa'i don gyi bdag nyid 'byin par byed pa yin pas /
translated: And when we explain them, we extract the meaning of what is said.

original: 'dir ma bstan pa cung zad kyang mi srid do //
analyzed: 'dir ma bstan pa cung zad kyang mi srid do //
translated: Therefore it is impossible that we do not teach anything here.

original: thal bar 'gyur ba bzlog pa'i don dang @8a * //
analyzed: thal bar 'gyur ba bzlog pa'i don dang @8a * //
translated: The meaning of the reversal of the reductio

original: yang pha rol po nyid 'brel pa yin gyi /
analyzed: yang pha rol po nyid 'brel pa yin gyi /
translated: The opponent is related to the reductio,

original: kho bo cag ni ma yin te /
analyzed: kho bo cag ni ma yin te /
translated: but we are not.

original: rang la dam bca' ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang la dam bca' ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because we have no thesis.

original: de'i phyir kho bo cag la grub pa'i mtha' dang 'gal ba ga la yod /
analyzed: de'i phyir kho bo cag la grub pa'i mtha' dang 'gal ba ga la yod /
translated: Therefore how could we contradict our own philosophical tenets?

original: thal ba las bzlog pa bsgrubs pas pha rol po la nyes pa mang po ci tsam du 'gyur ba de tsam kho bo cag mngon par 'dod pa kho na yin pas /
analyzed: thal ba las bzlog pa bsgrubs pas pha rol po la nyes pa mang po ci tsam du 'gyur ba de tsam kho bo cag mngon par 'dod pa kho na yin pas /
translated: Since we assert that the opponent will be implicated in many faults by the reverse of the reductio,

original: gang las 'di la gzhan gyis glags rnyed par 'gyur ba slob dpon klu sgrub kyi lugs phyin ci ma log pa'i rjes su 'brang ba slob dpon sangs rgyas bskyangs la glags dang bcas pa'i tshig gsung pa nyid ga la yod /
analyzed: gang las 'di la gzhan gyis glags rnyed par 'gyur ba slob dpon klu sgrub kyi lugs phyin ci ma log pa'i rjes su 'brang ba slob dpon sangs rgyas bskyangs la glags dang bcas pa'i tshig gsung pa nyid ga la yod /
translated: how could the master Buddhapalita, who follows the unerring system of the master Nagarjuna, have any words that are open to dispute?

original: rang bzhin med par smra bas rang bzhin dang bcas par smra ba la thal ba bsgrubs pa na thal ba las bzlog pa'i don can du thal bar ga la 'gyur te /
analyzed: rang bzhin med par smra bas rang bzhin dang bcas par smra ba la thal ba bsgrubs pa na thal ba las bzlog pa'i don can du thal bar ga la 'gyur te /
translated: When the proponent of essencelessness posits a reductio to the proponent of essence, how could the reverse of the reductio come to be accepted?

original: sgra rnams ni dbyug pa dang zhags pa can bzhin du smra ba po rang dbang med par byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: sgra rnams ni dbyug pa dang zhags pa can bzhin du smra ba po rang dbang med par byed pa ma yin no //
translated: Words are not like sticks and ropes that force the speaker against his will.

original: 'o na ci zhe na nus pa yod na smra ba po'i brjod par 'dod pa'i rjes su byed pa yin no //
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na nus pa yod na smra ba po'i brjod par 'dod pa'i rjes su byed pa yin no //
translated: Rather, when there is a capacity, words follow the speaker's desire to express.

original: de'i phyir thal ba sgrub pa ni pha rol po'i dam bca' la 'gog pa tsam gyi 'bras bu can yin pa'i phyir thal ba las / zlog pa'i don du 'gyur ba yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir thal ba sgrub pa ni pha rol po'i dam bca' la 'gog pa tsam gyi 'bras bu can yin pa'i phyir thal ba las / zlog pa'i don du 'gyur ba yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, since the consequence is only the effect of refuting the opponent’s thesis, the opposite of the consequence does not follow.

original: de ltar yang slob dpon ni //
analyzed: de ltar yang slob dpon ni //
translated: Thus, the master Nāgārjuna said:

original: nam mkha'i mtshan nyid snga rol na //
analyzed: nam mkha'i mtshan nyid snga rol na //
translated: Prior to the characteristic of space,

original: nam mkha' cung zad yod ma yin //
analyzed: nam mkha' cung zad yod ma yin //
translated: space does not exist in the least.

original: gal te mtshan las sngar gyur na //
analyzed: gal te mtshan las sngar gyur na //
translated: If it existed prior to the characteristic,

original: mtshan nyid med par thal bar 'gyur //
analyzed: mtshan nyid med par thal bar 'gyur //
translated: it would follow it is without a characteristic.

original: zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du /🔽gzugs kyi rgyu ni ma gtogs par //
analyzed: zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du / gzugs kyi rgyu ni ma gtogs par //
translated: And similarly:🔽Apart from the cause of form,

original: gzugs ni gzugs kyi rgyu med par //
analyzed: gzugs ni gzugs kyi rgyu med par //
translated: form does not exist without a cause of form.

original: thal bar 'gyur te don gang yang //
analyzed: thal bar 'gyur te don gang yang //
translated: It follows that any object

original: rgyu med pa ni gang na'ang med //
analyzed: rgyu med pa ni gang na'ang med //
translated: does not exist without a cause.

original: ces bya ba dang // de bzhin du /
analyzed: ces bya ba dang // de bzhin du /
translated: And similarly:

original: mya ngan 'das pa dngos po min //
analyzed: mya ngan 'das pa dngos po min //
translated: Nirvāṇa is not a thing.

original: rga shi'i mtshan nyid thal bar 'gyur //
analyzed: rga shi'i mtshan nyid thal bar 'gyur //
translated: It follows it has the characteristic of aging and death.

original: rga dang 'chi ba med pa yin //
analyzed: rga dang 'chi ba med pa yin //
translated: It is without aging and death.

original: dngos po yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos po yod pa ma yin no //
translated: A thing does not exist.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas phal cher thal ba sgrub pa kho na'i sgo nas gzhan gyi phyogs sel bar mdzad do //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas phal cher thal ba sgrub pa kho na'i sgo nas gzhan gyi phyogs sel bar mdzad do //
translated: Thus, for the most part, he refutes the opponent’s position by way of reductio arguments.

original: ci skye slob dpon gyi ngag rnams ni don gyi ngag yin pa'i phyir don chen po nyid yin pas sbyor ba du ma'i rgyu nyid du rtogs na ni /
analyzed: ci skye slob dpon gyi ngag rnams ni don gyi ngag yin pa'i phyir don chen po nyid yin pas sbyor ba du ma'i rgyu nyid du rtogs na ni /
translated: If you think that the master’s statements are statements of fact and therefore are of great significance, and thus that they are the source of many disputes,🔽why do you not think that the statements of the master Buddhapalita are also like that?

original: slob dpon sangs rgyas bskyangs kyi ngag dag kyang ci'i phyir de ltar yongs su mi rtog /'on te sbyor ba'i ngag @8b rgyas par rjod par byed pa gang yin pa 'di ni 'grel pa mkhan po rnams kyi lugs yin no zhe na /
analyzed: slob dpon sangs rgyas bskyangs kyi ngag dag kyang ci'i phyir de ltar yongs su mi rtog /'on te sbyor ba'i ngag @8b rgyas par rjod par byed pa gang yin pa 'di ni 'grel pa mkhan po rnams kyi lugs yin no zhe na /
translated: But if you think that the one who makes the statement of the syllogism is the commentator,

original: de yang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: that is not so,

original: rtsod pa bzlog pa'i 'grel pa mdzad pa na /
analyzed: rtsod pa bzlog pa'i 'grel pa mdzad pa na /
translated: because when he wrote the commentary to Vigrahavyiivartani,

original: slob dpon gyis kyang sbyor ba'i ngag ma gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: slob dpon gyis kyang sbyor ba'i ngag ma gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: the master Nagarjuna did not state the syllogism.

original: gzhan yang rtog ge ba 'dis bdag nyid rtog ge'i bstan bcos la shin tu mkhas pa tsam zhig bstan par 'dod pas /
analyzed: gzhan yang rtog ge ba 'dis bdag nyid rtog ge'i bstan bcos la shin tu mkhas pa tsam zhig bstan par 'dod pas /
translated: Moreover, this logician, wishing to show that he is an expert in the treatises of logic,

original: dbu ma pa'i lta ba khas len bzhin du yang rang rgyud kyi sbyor ba'i ngag brjod pa gang yin pa de ni ches shin tu nyes pa du ma'i tshogs kyi gnas su rtogs te /
analyzed: dbu ma pa'i lta ba khas len bzhin du yang rang rgyud kyi sbyor ba'i ngag brjod pa gang yin pa de ni ches shin tu nyes pa du ma'i tshogs kyi gnas su rtogs te /
translated: We understand that any statement of an autonomous syllogism while accepting the Madhyamaka view is a source of many faults.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: de la re zhig gang 'di skad du 'dir sbyor ba'i tshig tu 'gyur ba ni /🔽don dam par na nang gi skye mched rnams bdag las skye ba med par nges te /
analyzed: de la re zhig gang 'di skad du 'dir sbyor ba'i tshig tu 'gyur ba ni / don dam par na nang gi skye mched rnams bdag las skye ba med par nges te /
translated: First, someone might say, “The syllogism would be stated as follows:

original: yod pa'i phyir dper na shes pa yod pa nyid bzhin no zhes smras pa yin no //
analyzed: yod pa'i phyir dper na shes pa yod pa nyid bzhin no zhes smras pa yin no //
translated: Ultimately, the internal sense bases do not arise from self because they exist, like, for example, the existence of consciousness.

original: 'dir don dam pa zhes bya ba'i khyad par ci'i phyir nye bar bkod pa yin /
analyzed: 'dir don dam pa zhes bya ba'i khyad par ci'i phyir nye bar bkod pa yin /
translated: Here, why is the distinction ‘ultimately’ stated?

original: gal te 'jig rten gyi kun rdzob tu skye bar khas blangs pa dgag par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir dang / 'gog na yang khas blangs pas gnod par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: gal te 'jig rten gyi kun rdzob tu skye bar khas blangs pa dgag par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir dang / 'gog na yang khas blangs pas gnod par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: If you say, ‘Because it is not to be refuted that arising exists conventionally in the world, and if it is refuted, then it follows that your assertion is undermined,’

original: 'di ni rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: that is illogical.

original: bdag las skye ba ni kun rdzob tu yang khas ma blangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag las skye ba ni kun rdzob tu yang khas ma blangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because we do not accept arising from self even conventionally.🔽As a sutra declares:

original: ji skad du mdo las sa bon gyi rgyu las byung ba'i myu gu de yang skye ba na /🔽bdag gis ma byas /🔽gzhan gyis ma byas /
analyzed: ji skad du mdo las sa bon gyi rgyu las byung ba'i myu gu de yang skye ba na / bdag gis ma byas / gzhan gyis ma byas /
translated: When the sprout arises from the seed as its cause,🔽it is not created by itself.

original: gnyi gas ma byas /
analyzed: gnyi gas ma byas /
translated: It is not created by another.🔽It is not created by both.

original: dbang phyug gis ma byas /
analyzed: dbang phyug gis ma byas /
translated: It is not created by God.

original: dus kyis ma bsgyur /
analyzed: dus kyis ma bsgyur /
translated: It is not transformed by time.

original: rdul phra rab las ma byung /🔽rang bzhin las ma byung /
analyzed: rdul phra rab las ma byung / rang bzhin las ma byung /
translated: It does not arise from particles.🔽It does not arise from a creator.

original: ngo bo nyid las ma byung /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid las ma byung /
translated: It does not arise from its own essence.🔽It does not arise causelessly.

original: rgyu med pa las ma skyes zhes gsungs pa dang / de bzhin du /
analyzed: rgyu med pa las ma skyes zhes gsungs pa dang / de bzhin du /
translated: And similarly:

original: sa bon yod na myu gu ji bzhin te //🔽sa bon gang yin myu gu de nyid min //
analyzed: sa bon yod na myu gu ji bzhin te // sa bon gang yin myu gu de nyid min //
translated: Just as the sprout arises from the seed,🔽The seed is not the sprout.

original: de las gzhan min de yang ma yin te //
analyzed: de las gzhan min de yang ma yin te //
translated: It is not different from the seed, nor is it the seed itself.

original: de ltar rtag min chad min chos nyid do //
analyzed: de ltar rtag min chad min chos nyid do //
translated: Thus, it is neither annihilated nor eternal.

original: zhes gsungs pa dang / 'di nyid las kyang /
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa dang / 'di nyid las kyang /
translated: And this text also says:

original: gang la brten te gang 'byung ba //
analyzed: gang la brten te gang 'byung ba //
translated: Whatever arises in dependence on something

original: de ni re zhig de nyid min //🔽de las gzhan pa 'ang ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni re zhig de nyid min //🔽de las gzhan pa 'ang ma yin te /
translated: Is not that, nor is it different.

original: de phyir chad min rtag ma yin //
analyzed: de phyir chad min rtag ma yin //
translated: Therefore, it is neither annihilated nor eternal.

original: zhes 'chad do //
analyzed: zhes 'chad do //
translated: This is the explanation.

original: gzhan gyi lugs la ltos te khyad par du byas so zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan gyi lugs la ltos te khyad par du byas so zhe na /
translated: If you say that the distinction is made in relation to the systems of others,

original: de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: that also is not reasonable,

original: de dag gi rnam par gzhag pa ni kun rdzob tu yang khas blangs pa med pa'i phyir ro //🔽bden pa gnyis phyin ci ma log par @9a * //
analyzed: de dag gi rnam par gzhag pa ni kun rdzob tu yang khas blangs pa med pa'i phyir ro // bden pa gnyis phyin ci ma log par @9a * //
translated: because the systems of the tīrthikas are not accepted even conventionally.

original: mthong ba las nyams pa'i mu stegs pa dag ji srid du gnyi ga'i sgo nas 'gog pa de srid du yon tan nyid yin par rtogs so //
analyzed: mthong ba las nyams pa'i mu stegs pa dag ji srid du gnyi ga'i sgo nas 'gog pa de srid du yon tan nyid yin par rtogs so //
translated: The tīrthikas, who are impaired in their ability to see the two truths without error, understand that the refutation in both ways is a good quality.

original: de ltar na gzhan gyi gzhung la ltos te khyad par brjod pa yang rigs pa ma yin no //🔽gang las de la ltos nas kyang khyad par 'bras bu dang bcas par 'gyur ba 'jig rten las kyang bdag las skye bar mi rtogs te /
analyzed: de ltar na gzhan gyi gzhung la ltos te khyad par brjod pa yang rigs pa ma yin no // gang las de la ltos nas kyang khyad par 'bras bu dang bcas par 'gyur ba 'jig rten las kyang bdag las skye bar mi rtogs te /
translated: Thus, it is also unreasonable to state a distinction in relation to the systems of others.🔽Even in the world, arising from self is not accepted, in dependence upon which a distinction could be made that has a point.

original: 'jig rten pas ni bdag dang gzhan las zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa'i rnam par spyod pa 'jug pa med par byas nas /
analyzed: 'jig rten pas ni bdag dang gzhan las zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa'i rnam par spyod pa 'jug pa med par byas nas /
translated: Because worldly people do not engage in analysis in terms of such distinctions as “arising from self” or “arising from another.”

original: rgyu las 'bras bu 'byung ngo zhes bya ba 'di tsam zhig rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: rgyu las 'bras bu 'byung ngo zhes bya ba 'di tsam zhig rtogs pa yin no //
translated: One simply understands that an effect arises from a cause.

original: slob dpon yang de ltar rnam par gzhag pa mdzad pa yin te /
analyzed: slob dpon yang de ltar rnam par gzhag pa mdzad pa yin te /
translated: The master Nāgārjuna also posits things in that way.

original: de'i phyir rnam pa thams cad du khyad par don med pa nyid do zhes bya bar nges so //
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam pa thams cad du khyad par don med pa nyid do zhes bya bar nges so //
translated: Therefore it is certain that the distinction is completely meaningless.

original: gzhan yang gal te kun rdzob tu skye ba dgag par 'dod nas khyad par 'di 'god par byed na ni de'i tshe /🔽rang la gzhi ma grub pa'i phyogs kyi nyes pa'am /
analyzed: gzhan yang gal te kun rdzob tu skye ba dgag par 'dod nas khyad par 'di 'god par byed na ni de'i tshe / rang la gzhi ma grub pa'i phyogs kyi nyes pa'am /
translated: Moreover, if you posit this distinction in order to refute arising on the conventional level,🔽then you commit the error of having a subject that is not established for you,

original: gzhi ma grub pa'i gtan tshigs kyi skyon du 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhi ma grub pa'i gtan tshigs kyi skyon du 'gyur te /
translated: or you commit the error of having a reason that is not established for you.

original: rang gis don dam par mig la sogs pa'i skye mched rnams khas ma blangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gis don dam par mig la sogs pa'i skye mched rnams khas ma blangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because you yourself do not accept such things as the eyes as ultimate.

original: gal te kun rdzob tu mig la sogs pa yod pa'i phyir nyes pa med do zhe na /
analyzed: gal te kun rdzob tu mig la sogs pa yod pa'i phyir nyes pa med do zhe na /
translated: If you say that there is no error because eyes and so on exist conventionally,

original: 'o na don dam par zhes bya ba 'di gang gi khyad par yin /
analyzed: 'o na don dam par zhes bya ba 'di gang gi khyad par yin /
translated: then what is the distinction of “ultimately”?

original: gal te mig la sogs pa kun rdzob pa rnams don dam par skye ba 'gog pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gal te mig la sogs pa kun rdzob pa rnams don dam par skye ba 'gog pa'i phyir /
translated: If you say that the ultimate is mentioned in order to refute the ultimate production of such things as eyes, which are conventional,

original: don dam pa smos pa ni skye ba 'gog pa'i khyad par yin no zhe na /
analyzed: don dam pa smos pa ni skye ba 'gog pa'i khyad par yin no zhe na /
translated: then the distinction of refuting production is the ultimate.

original: de lta na ni 'on mig la sogs pa kun rdzob pa rnams don dam par skye ba yod pa ma yin te zhes de skad brjod par bya bar 'gyur na /
analyzed: de lta na ni 'on mig la sogs pa kun rdzob pa rnams don dam par skye ba yod pa ma yin te zhes de skad brjod par bya bar 'gyur na /
translated: In that case, you would have to say, “Such things as eyes, which are conventional, do not have ultimate production,”

original: de skad du yang ma smras so //
analyzed: de skad du yang ma smras so //
translated: but you do not say that.

original: smra na yang pha rol po dag gis mig la sogs pa rnams rdzas su yod pa nyid du khas blangs pa'i phyir dang / brtags par yod par khas ma blangs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: smra na yang pha rol po dag gis mig la sogs pa rnams rdzas su yod pa nyid du khas blangs pa'i phyir dang / brtags par yod par khas ma blangs pa'i phyir /
translated: If you do say that, then because the opponent accepts that such things as eyes exist substantially and does not accept that they exist as imputations,

original: gzhan la gzhi ma grub pa'i phyogs kyi skyon du 'gyur bas 'di ni mi rigs so //
analyzed: gzhan la gzhi ma grub pa'i phyogs kyi skyon du 'gyur bas 'di ni mi rigs so //
translated: the fault of the basis of your reason not being established for the other party would occur. Therefore this is illogical.

original: ci ste ji ltar sgra mi rtag ces bya ba la chos dang chos can gnyis spyi nyid gzung ba yin gyi /
analyzed: ci ste ji ltar sgra mi rtag ces bya ba la chos dang chos can gnyis spyi nyid gzung ba yin gyi /
translated: If you say that in the statement “Sound is impermanent,” both the quality and the basis of the quality are taken to be universals and not instances,

original: khyad par ni ma yin te //
analyzed: khyad par ni ma yin te //
translated: then that is not the case.

original: khyad par 'dzin na ni rjes su dpag pa dang rjes su dpag par bya ba'i tha snyad med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: khyad par 'dzin na ni rjes su dpag pa dang rjes su dpag par bya ba'i tha snyad med par 'gyur ro //
translated: If you do hold them to be different, then the conventions of “inferring” and “what is inferred” would not exist.

original: 'di ltar gal te 'byung ba chen po bzhi las gyur pa'i @9b sgra 'dzin na ni de pha rol po la ma grub po //
analyzed: 'di ltar gal te 'byung ba chen po bzhi las gyur pa'i @9b sgra 'dzin na ni de pha rol po la ma grub po //
translated: In this way, if you hold that sound is apprehended as being derived from the four great elements, then that is not established for the opponent.

original: 'on te nam mkha'i yon tan 'dzin na ni de rang nyid sangs rgyas pa la ma grub pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on te nam mkha'i yon tan 'dzin na ni de rang nyid sangs rgyas pa la ma grub pa yin no //
translated: But if you hold that sound is apprehended as a quality of space, then that is not established for the Buddhist himself.

original: de bzhin du bye brag pa sgra mi rtag par dam 'cha' ba na yang /
analyzed: de bzhin du bye brag pa sgra mi rtag par dam 'cha' ba na yang /
translated: In the same way, when the Vaiśeṣika asserts that sound is impermanent,

original: byas pa'i sgra 'dzin na de gzhan la ma grub po //
analyzed: byas pa'i sgra 'dzin na de gzhan la ma grub po //
translated: if you hold that sound is apprehended as produced, then that is not established for the other party.

original: 'on te mngon par gsal bar byas pa yin na ni de rang la ma grub pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on te mngon par gsal bar byas pa yin na ni de rang la ma grub pa yin no //
translated: But if you hold that sound is apprehended as being made manifest, then that is not established for the Buddhist himself.

original: de bzhin du ci rigs par 'jig pa yang gal te rgyu dang bcas pa yin na ni //
analyzed: de bzhin du ci rigs par 'jig pa yang gal te rgyu dang bcas pa yin na ni //
translated: In the same way, if you hold that destruction is caused,

original: de sangs rgyas pa rang la ma grub pa yin la /
analyzed: de sangs rgyas pa rang la ma grub pa yin la /
translated: then that is not established for the Buddhist himself.

original: 'on te rgyu med pa yin na ni de pha rol po la ma grub pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on te rgyu med pa yin na ni de pha rol po la ma grub pa yin no //
translated: But if you hold that destruction is uncaused, then that is not established for the other party.

original: de'i phyir ji ltar 'dir chos dang chos can spyi tsam zhig 'dzin pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: de'i phyir ji ltar 'dir chos dang chos can spyi tsam zhig 'dzin pa de bzhin du /
translated: Therefore, just as here the subject and predicate are taken as mere generalities,

original: 'dir yang khyad par dor ba'i chos can tsam zhig 'dzin par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'dir yang khyad par dor ba'i chos can tsam zhig 'dzin par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: in the same way, here too, the subject is taken as a mere subject, without any qualifications.

original: de ni de ltar yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni de ltar yang ma yin te /
translated: This is not so.

original: 'di ltar gang gi tshe 'dir skye ba bkag pa bsgrub par bya ba'i chos su 'dod pa'i de'i tshe de kho nar de'i rten chos can phyin ci log tsam gyis bdag gi dngos po rnyed pa ni nyams par 'gyur bar 'dis rang nyid kyis khas blangs pa nyid
analyzed: 'di ltar gang gi tshe 'dir skye ba bkag pa bsgrub par bya ba'i chos su 'dod pa'i de'i tshe de kho nar de'i rten chos can phyin ci log tsam gyis bdag gi dngos po rnyed pa ni nyams par 'gyur bar 'dis rang nyid kyis khas blangs pa nyid
translated: When here the negation of arising is asserted to be the predicate of the probandum, then it is the very basis of that, the subject, that is undermined, for it is found to be a thing that exists only in error, as the opponent himself accepts.

original: do // phyin ci log dang phyin ci ma log pa dag ni tha dad pa yin no //
analyzed: do // phyin ci log dang phyin ci ma log pa dag ni tha dad pa yin no //
translated: Error and non-error are different.

original: de'i phyir / gang gi tshe rab rib can gyis skra shad la sogs pa ltar phyin ci log gis yod pa ma yin pa yod pa nyid du 'dzin pa de'i tshe ni yod par gyur pa'i don cha tsam yang dmigs par ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: de'i phyir / gang gi tshe rab rib can gyis skra shad la sogs pa ltar phyin ci log gis yod pa ma yin pa yod pa nyid du 'dzin pa de'i tshe ni yod par gyur pa'i don cha tsam yang dmigs par ga la 'gyur /
translated: Therefore, just as a person with an eye disease sees such things as falling hairs, when one grasps as existent what is not existent due to error, how could one ever observe even the slightest existent object?

original: gang gi tshe rab rib can ma yin pas skra shad la sogs pa ltar phyin ci ma log pas yang dag pa ma yin pa sgro mi 'dogs pa de'i tshe na yang gang gis na de'i tshe na kun rdzob tu 'gyur ba yod pa ma yin par gyur
analyzed: gang gi tshe rab rib can ma yin pas skra shad la sogs pa ltar phyin ci ma log pas yang dag pa ma yin pa sgro mi 'dogs pa de'i tshe na yang gang gis na de'i tshe na kun rdzob tu 'gyur ba yod pa ma yin par gyur
translated: When one who is not afflicted by eye disease does not superimpose the unreal, such as floating hairs, due to being nonerroneous, at that time, what is there that is not existent?🔽

original: pa'i don cha tsam yang dmigs pa ga la yod /
analyzed: pa'i don cha tsam yang dmigs pa ga la yod /
translated: When one who is not afflicted by eye disease does not superimpose the unreal, such as floating hairs, due to error, then at that time, how could one observe even the slightest existent object that is nonexistent?

original: de nyid kyi phyir slob dpon gyi zhal snga nas kyang /🔽gal te mngon sum la sogs pa'i //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir slob dpon gyi zhal snga nas kyang / gal te mngon sum la sogs pa'i //
translated: For that very reason, the master Nāgārjuna said:🔽If one were to observe any object

original: don gyis 'ga' zhig dmigs na ni //
analyzed: don gyis 'ga' zhig dmigs na ni //
translated: by means of direct perception and so on,

original: sgrub par ma bzlog par bya na de //🔽med phyir nga la klan ka med //
analyzed: sgrub par ma bzlog par bya na de // med phyir nga la klan ka med //
translated: then I would refute it.

original: ces gsungs so //
analyzed: ces gsungs so //
translated: But since it does not exist, I have no fault.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar phyin ci log pa dang phyin ci ma log pa dag tha dad pa de'i phyir phyin ci ma log pa'i gnas skabs na phyin ci log yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar phyin ci log pa dang phyin ci ma log pa dag tha dad pa de'i phyir phyin ci ma log pa'i gnas skabs na phyin ci log yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir na /
translated: Therefore, since error and nonerror are different, error does not exist at the time of nonerror.

original: gang zhig chos can nyid du 'gyur ba mig kun rdzob pa lta ga la yod /
analyzed: gang zhig chos can nyid du 'gyur ba mig kun rdzob pa lta ga la yod /
translated: So how could there be a conventional eye that is the basis of properties?

original: de'i phyir gzhi ma grub pa'i phyogs kyi skyon dang / gzhi ma grub pa'i @10a * //
analyzed: de'i phyir gzhi ma grub pa'i phyogs kyi skyon dang / gzhi ma grub pa'i @10a * //
translated: Therefore, since the fault of the unestablished basis of the reason is not

original: gtan tshigs kyi skyon ldog pa med pa nyid pas 'di lan ma yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: gtan tshigs kyi skyon ldog pa med pa nyid pas 'di lan ma yin pa nyid do //
translated: avoided, this is not an answer.

original: dpe la yang 'dra ba yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dpe la yang 'dra ba yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Nor is there a similarity between the example and the case in question.🔽In that case, the mere sound and the mere impermanence, which are not

original: der ni sgra'i spyi dang mi rtag pa nyid kyi spyi khyad par brjod par mi 'dod pa gnyi ga la yang yod na /🔽da bzhin du mig gi spyi ni stong pa nyid dang stong pa nyid ma yin par smra ba dag gis kun rdzob tu yang khas ma blangs la /
analyzed: der ni sgra'i spyi dang mi rtag pa nyid kyi spyi khyad par brjod par mi 'dod pa gnyi ga la yang yod na / da bzhin du mig gi spyi ni stong pa nyid dang stong pa nyid ma yin par smra ba dag gis kun rdzob tu yang khas ma blangs la /
translated: intended to be the qualifiers, exist for both parties.🔽But the mere eye is not accepted by the proponents of emptiness and nonemptiness even conventionally, nor ultimately. Therefore, there is no similarity

original: don dam par yang ma yin pas dpe la yang 'dra ba yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: don dam par yang ma yin pas dpe la yang 'dra ba yod pa ma yin no //
translated: between the example and the case in question.

original: gzhi ma grub pa'i phyogs kyi nyes pa brjod pa'i tshul gang yin pa 'di nyid ni /
analyzed: gzhi ma grub pa'i phyogs kyi nyes pa brjod pa'i tshul gang yin pa 'di nyid ni /
translated: The method of expressing the fault of the unestablished basis of the reason🔽can be applied to the expression of the fault of the unestablished basis of the

original: yod pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs 'di la ma grub pa'i skyon brjod pa la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: yod pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs 'di la ma grub pa'i skyon brjod pa la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: reason “because of existing.”

original: de lta bu de ni 'di ltar yin te /
analyzed: de lta bu de ni 'di ltar yin te /
translated: Such is the case, for the following reason.

original: gang gi phyir ji skad bsnyad pa'i don 'di ni rtog ge ba 'dis rang nyid kyis khas blangs pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir ji skad bsnyad pa'i don 'di ni rtog ge ba 'dis rang nyid kyis khas blangs pa yin no //
translated: This very meaning that is being explained has been accepted by this logician himself.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: nang gi skye mched rnams skyed par byed pa rgyu la sogs pa ni yod pa 'o na yin te /
analyzed: nang gi skye mched rnams skyed par byed pa rgyu la sogs pa ni yod pa 'o na yin te /
translated: The causes and so on that give rise to the internal sense spheres do exist,

original: de ltar de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the Tathagata has said so.

original: gang de bzhin gshegs pas ji skad gsungs pa de ni de bzhin te /
analyzed: gang de bzhin gshegs pas ji skad gsungs pa de ni de bzhin te /
translated: Whatever the Tathagata has said is just so,🔽like, for example, the statement, “Nirvana is peace.”

original: dper na mya ngan las 'das pa ni zhi ba'o zhes bya ba bzhin no zhes bya ba gzhan gyis bkod pa'i sgrub byed 'di la /
analyzed: dper na mya ngan las 'das pa ni zhi ba'o zhes bya ba bzhin no zhes bya ba gzhan gyis bkod pa'i sgrub byed 'di la /
translated: In response to this proof statement formulated by the opponent,

original: 'dir khyod kyi gtan tshigs kyi don du 'dod pa gang yin de bzhin gshegs pas kun rdzob tu de skad gsungs pa'i phyir ram /
analyzed: 'dir khyod kyi gtan tshigs kyi don du 'dod pa gang yin de bzhin gshegs pas kun rdzob tu de skad gsungs pa'i phyir ram /
translated: here, what is it that you accept as the meaning of your reason? Is it because the Tathagata has said that conventionally,

original: 'on te don dam par gsungs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'on te don dam par gsungs pa'i phyir /
translated: or is it because he has said that ultimately?

original: gal te kun rdzob tu yin na ni rang la gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid do //
analyzed: gal te kun rdzob tu yin na ni rang la gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid do //
translated: If it is conventionally, then the meaning of your reason is not established for you.

original: 'on te don dam par ni /
analyzed: 'on te don dam par ni /
translated: But in terms of the ultimate,🔽since a phenomenon is not established as existent,

original: gang tshe chos ni yod pa dang // med dang yod med mi 'grub pas //
analyzed: gang tshe chos ni yod pa dang // med dang yod med mi 'grub pas //
translated: nonexistent, or both existent and nonexistent,

original: de'i tshe 'bras bu yod pa dang med pa dang / gnyi ga'i bdag nyid kyi rkyen bsal ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i tshe 'bras bu yod pa dang med pa dang / gnyi ga'i bdag nyid kyi rkyen bsal ba'i phyir /
translated: at that time, the effect is not existent, not nonexistent, and not both existent and nonexistent.

original: ji ltar sgrub byed rgyu zhes bya //
analyzed: ji ltar sgrub byed rgyu zhes bya //
translated: How could a cause be established?

original: de lta yin na mi rigs so //
analyzed: de lta yin na mi rigs so //
translated: If it were so, it would not be tenable.

original: de ni sgrub par byed pa'i rgyu ma yin pa kho na'o zhes bya ba ni dag gi don to //
analyzed: de ni sgrub par byed pa'i rgyu ma yin pa kho na'o zhes bya ba ni dag gi don to //
translated: The meaning of “it is not a cause that establishes” is that it is not a cause that establishes.

original: de'i phyir don dam par bsgrub par bya ba dang / sgrub par byed pa nyid ma grub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i phyir don dam par bsgrub par bya ba dang / sgrub par byed pa nyid ma grub pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, since the object to be established and the means of establishment are not established in the ultimate,

original: gtan tshigs ma grub pa'i don nyid dang 'gal ba'i don nyid do zhes 'dis skyon 'di smras pa yin no //
analyzed: gtan tshigs ma grub pa'i don nyid dang 'gal ba'i don nyid do zhes 'dis skyon 'di smras pa yin no //
translated: the meaning of “unproven” and the meaning of “contradictory” are stated by this.🔽Since in this way he himself accepts that the reason is not established by his own method,

original: gang gi phyir de ltar 'dis rang nyid kyi tshul 'dis gtan tshigs ma grub par khas blangs pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar 'dis rang nyid kyi tshul 'dis gtan tshigs ma grub par khas blangs pa de'i phyir /
translated: therefore,

original: dngos @10b po'i chos gtan tshigs su bkod pa'i rjes su dpag pa thams cad la gtan tshigs la sogs par rang la ma grub pa'i phyir sgrub par byed pa thams cad rnam par 'jig par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dngos @10b po'i chos gtan tshigs su bkod pa'i rjes su dpag pa thams cad la gtan tshigs la sogs par rang la ma grub pa'i phyir sgrub par byed pa thams cad rnam par 'jig par 'gyur ro //
translated: In all inferences in which a real entity is stated as the reason, the reason and so on are not established for oneself, and so all proofs are destroyed.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: For example:

original: don dam par na nang gi skye mched rnams de dag gi rkyen gzhan dag las skye ba med de /
analyzed: don dam par na nang gi skye mched rnams de dag gi rkyen gzhan dag las skye ba med de /
translated: Ultimately, the internal sense bases are not produced from their conditions, which are other,

original: gzhan yin pa'i phyir dper na bum pa bzhin no //
analyzed: gzhan yin pa'i phyir dper na bum pa bzhin no //
translated: because they are other, like a pot.

original: yang na don dam par gzhan gyis brjod par 'dod pa'i mig la sogs pa nang gi skye mched 'grub par byed pa dag rkyen ma yin par nges te /
analyzed: yang na don dam par gzhan gyis brjod par 'dod pa'i mig la sogs pa nang gi skye mched 'grub par byed pa dag rkyen ma yin par nges te /
translated: Or, ultimately, the conditions that are asserted by the other to produce the internal sense bases such as the eyes are ascertained as not being conditions,

original: gzhan yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gzhan yin pa'i phyir /
translated: because they are other.🔽For example, this is like the nose and so on.

original: dper na sna lam la sogs pa bzhin no zhes bya ba 'dir gzhan nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa rang nyid la ma grub pa yin no //
analyzed: dper na sna lam la sogs pa bzhin no zhes bya ba 'dir gzhan nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa rang nyid la ma grub pa yin no //
translated: Here, in statements such as “otherness,” the reason is not established for oneself.

original: ji ltar 'dis nang gi skye mched rnams skyes pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: ji ltar 'dis nang gi skye mched rnams skyes pa kho na yin te /
translated: How is it that the internal sense bases are produced?

original: de dag gi yul dang ldan pa'i tha snyad khyad par can byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag gi yul dang ldan pa'i tha snyad khyad par can byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the basis of the special conventional expressions.

original: zhes gzhan gyis brjod pa'i gtan tshigs 'di la ma grub par brjod par 'dod pas /
analyzed: zhes gzhan gyis brjod pa'i gtan tshigs 'di la ma grub par brjod par 'dod pas /
translated: Thus, wishing to state that the reason expressed by the opponent is not established,

original: 'di skad du 'on te don dam par rnal 'byor pa mnyam par gzhag pa'i shes rab kyi mig gis dngos po rnams kyi yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin nyid mthong ba'i skye ba dang 'gro ba la sogs pa dag yod par bsgrubs na ni /
analyzed: 'di skad du 'on te don dam par rnal 'byor pa mnyam par gzhag pa'i shes rab kyi mig gis dngos po rnams kyi yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin nyid mthong ba'i skye ba dang 'gro ba la sogs pa dag yod par bsgrubs na ni /
translated: it is said: “If you prove that the existence of birth, transmigration, and so on is the suchness of things as they are seen by the eye of wisdom of the yogi in meditative equipoise in the ultimate,

original: de'i tshe de dag gi yul dang ldan pa'i tha snyad khyad par can byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs ma grub pa'i don nyid do //
analyzed: de'i tshe de dag gi yul dang ldan pa'i tha snyad khyad par can byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs ma grub pa'i don nyid do //
translated: then the reason, ‘because it is the basis of the special conventional expressions,’ is not established.”

original: 'gro ba yang skye ba bkag pa kho nas bkag pa'i phyir ro zhes smras pa yin te /
analyzed: 'gro ba yang skye ba bkag pa kho nas bkag pa'i phyir ro zhes smras pa yin te /
translated: This is because transmigration is refuted simply by the refutation of birth.

original: de bzhin du rang gis byas pa'i sgrub par byed pa la yang /🔽don dam par ma song ba la 'gro ba med de /
analyzed: de bzhin du rang gis byas pa'i sgrub par byed pa la yang / don dam par ma song ba la 'gro ba med de /
translated: Thus, in the case of the proof formulated by the opponent,

original: lam yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: lam yin pa'i phyir /
translated: it is said: “In the ultimate, there is no going where one has gone because it is a path.”

original: song ba'i lam bzhin no //
analyzed: song ba'i lam bzhin no //
translated: Like the path that has been gone over.

original: zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs lam nyid rang nyid lam grub pa'i don nyid du sbyar bar bya la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs lam nyid rang nyid lam grub pa'i don nyid du sbyar bar bya la /
translated: The reason “because of being a path” should be applied to the meaning of “the path itself is established.”

original: don dam par brten pa dang bcas pa'i mig ni gzugs la lta bar mi byed de /
analyzed: don dam par brten pa dang bcas pa'i mig ni gzugs la lta bar mi byed de /
translated: In the ultimate, the eye that possesses a basis does not see form,

original: mig gi dbang po yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mig gi dbang po yin pa'i phyir /
translated: because of being the eye faculty.🔽For example, it is like that which is similar to it.

original: dper na de dang mtshungs pa bzhin no zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du mig ni gzugs la lta bar mi byed do //
analyzed: dper na de dang mtshungs pa bzhin no zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du mig ni gzugs la lta bar mi byed do //
translated: And likewise, the eye does not see form,

original: 'byung ba las gyur pa nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: 'byung ba las gyur pa nyid kyi phyir /
translated: because of being a derivative of the elements.🔽For example, it is like form.

original: dper na gzugs bzhin no zhes bya ba dang / sa ni sra ba'i ngo bo ma yin te /
analyzed: dper na gzugs bzhin no zhes bya ba dang / sa ni sra ba'i ngo bo ma yin te /
translated: And earth is not the essence of solidity,

original: 'byung ba yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'byung ba yin pa'i phyir /
translated: because of being an element.

original: dper na rlung bzhin no //🔽zhes bya ba la sogs pa dag tu yang gtan tshigs la sogs @11a * //
analyzed: dper na rlung bzhin no // zhes bya ba la sogs pa dag tu yang gtan tshigs la sogs @11a * //
translated: For example, it is like wind.

original: pa rang nyid la grub pa sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: pa rang nyid la grub pa sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: And so on. In these cases, the reason and so on are applied to what is established for the opponent.

original: yod pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs 'di yang pha rol po'i ltar na /
analyzed: yod pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs 'di yang pha rol po'i ltar na /
translated: This reason “because of existing” is, according to the opponent,

original: ci nang gi skye mched rnams yod pa'i phyir shes pa yod pa ltar bdag las mi skye ba zhig gam /
analyzed: ci nang gi skye mched rnams yod pa'i phyir shes pa yod pa ltar bdag las mi skye ba zhig gam /
translated: Is it that consciousness exists because the internal sense sources exist, but it does not arise from self?

original: 'on te bum pa la sogs pa bzhin du bdag las skye ba zhig yin zhes ma nges pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on te bum pa la sogs pa bzhin du bdag las skye ba zhig yin zhes ma nges pa yin no //
translated: But it is not certain whether consciousness exists because the internal sense spheres exist, as in the case of arising from self, or whether it arises from self, as in the case of a pot and so on.

original: gal te bum pa la sogs pa yang bsgrub byar mtshungs pa'i phyir ma nges pa nyid ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te bum pa la sogs pa yang bsgrub byar mtshungs pa'i phyir ma nges pa nyid ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is not uncertain because a pot and so on are similar to the probandum,

original: de ni de ltar ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni de ltar ma yin te /
translated: that is not so.

original: de skad du ma smras pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de skad du ma smras pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because we do not say that.

original: gal te gzhan gyi rjes su dpag pa dag la skyon ji skad du smras pa de bzhin du rang gi rjes su dpag pa la yang ji skad smras pa'i nyes par thal bas gzhi ma grub pa dang / gtan tshigs ma grub pa la sogs pa'i skyon de nyid du 'gyur ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te gzhan gyi rjes su dpag pa dag la skyon ji skad du smras pa de bzhin du rang gi rjes su dpag pa la yang ji skad smras pa'i nyes par thal bas gzhi ma grub pa dang / gtan tshigs ma grub pa la sogs pa'i skyon de nyid du 'gyur ba ma yin nam /
translated: If the faults you ascribe to the inferences of others are also entailed by your own inferences, then the faults of the reason and so on, such as the reason not being established, would also apply to you.

original: de'i phyir gang gnyi ga la skyon du 'gyur ba des ni gcig la brgal bar mi bya ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir gang gnyi ga la skyon du 'gyur ba des ni gcig la brgal bar mi bya ste /
translated: Therefore, you should not argue that the faults that apply to both are only faults for one.

original: des na skyon 'di dag thams cad mi rigs par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: des na skyon 'di dag thams cad mi rigs par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: Therefore, all of these faults are illogical.

original: brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: brjod par bya ste /
translated: We respond:

original: rang gi rgyud kyi rjes su dpag pa smra ba dag la nyes pa 'dir 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: rang gi rgyud kyi rjes su dpag pa smra ba dag la nyes pa 'dir 'gyur gyi /
translated: This fault would apply to those who speak of autonomous inferences.

original: kho bo cag ni rang rgyud kyi rjes su dpag pa mi sbyor te /
analyzed: kho bo cag ni rang rgyud kyi rjes su dpag pa mi sbyor te /
translated: But we do not employ autonomous inferences.

original: rjes su dpag pa dag ni gzhan gyi dam bca' ba 'gog pa tsam gyi 'bras bu can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa dag ni gzhan gyi dam bca' ba 'gog pa tsam gyi 'bras bu can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because inferences have the effect of merely refuting the thesis of the other party.

original: 'di ltar gzhan mig lta'o zhes bya bar rtog pa de ni mig la rang gi bdag nyid mi lta ba'i chos kyang 'dod la /
analyzed: 'di ltar gzhan mig lta'o zhes bya bar rtog pa de ni mig la rang gi bdag nyid mi lta ba'i chos kyang 'dod la /
translated: Thus, when one conceives of the eye as seeing other things, one asserts that the eye has the property of not seeing itself.

original: gzhan la lta ba'i chos med na mi 'byung ba nyid du yang khas blangs pa yin te /
analyzed: gzhan la lta ba'i chos med na mi 'byung ba nyid du yang khas blangs pa yin te /
translated: And one also asserts that the property of seeing other things does not occur without the eye.

original: de'i phyir gang dang gang la rang gi bdag nyid lta ba med pa de dang de la ni gzhan la lta ba yang yod pa ma yin te /🔽dper na bum pa bzhin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir gang dang gang la rang gi bdag nyid lta ba med pa de dang de la ni gzhan la lta ba yang yod pa ma yin te / dper na bum pa bzhin no //
translated: Therefore, whatever does not see itself also does not see other things, just as a pot does not.

original: mig la yang rang gi bdag nyid mi lta ba yod pa yin te /
analyzed: mig la yang rang gi bdag nyid mi lta ba yod pa yin te /
translated: The eye also has the property of not seeing itself.

original: de'i phyir gzhan lta ba yang 'di la med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir gzhan lta ba yang 'di la med do //
translated: Therefore, it does not see itself.

original: de'i phyir rang gi bdag nyid mi lta ba dang 'gal bar sngon po la sogs pa gzhan la lta ba rang la grags pa'i rjes su dpag pa dang 'gal ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir rang gi bdag nyid mi lta ba dang 'gal bar sngon po la sogs pa gzhan la lta ba rang la grags pa'i rjes su dpag pa dang 'gal ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, the thesis that it sees another, such as blue, is contradicted by inference based on what is commonly acknowledged.

original: zhes de la grub pa'i rjes su dpag pas sel bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes de la grub pa'i rjes su dpag pas sel bar byed pa yin no //
translated: Thus, it is refuted by the inference that is accepted by the opponent.

original: gang gi phyir rjes su dpag pa dag gis 'di tsam zhig brjod par bya ba yin pas /🔽gang las nyes pa mtshungs par 'gyur ba /
analyzed: gang gi phyir rjes su dpag pa dag gis 'di tsam zhig brjod par bya ba yin pas / gang las nyes pa mtshungs par 'gyur ba /
translated: Since this is all that can be said by means of inference,🔽how can we be faulted?

original: kho bo cag gi phyogs la ji skad bsnyad pa'i skyon 'dug pa gal yong @11b yang ci gang yang rung ba la grub pa'i rjes su dpag pa'i sgo nas kyang rjes su dpag pas gnod pa yod dam zhe na /
analyzed: kho bo cag gi phyogs la ji skad bsnyad pa'i skyon 'dug pa gal yong @11b yang ci gang yang rung ba la grub pa'i rjes su dpag pa'i sgo nas kyang rjes su dpag pas gnod pa yod dam zhe na /
translated: But if the inference is established for one or the other, is it not the case that the inference is contradicted?

original: yod de de yang rang nyid la grub pa'i gtan tshigs nyid kyis yin gyi /
analyzed: yod de de yang rang nyid la grub pa'i gtan tshigs nyid kyis yin gyi /
translated: Yes, it is. But it is contradicted by an inference that is established for us,

original: gzhan la grub pas ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan la grub pas ni ma yin te /
translated: not by one that is established for the other party.

original: 'jig rten nyid du mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten nyid du mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because we see it in the world.

original: 'jig rten na ni res 'ga' dbang po'i rgol ba dang phyir rgol gnyis kyi tshad mar byas pa'i tshig gis rgyal ba 'am pham par 'gyur la /
analyzed: 'jig rten na ni res 'ga' dbang po'i rgol ba dang phyir rgol gnyis kyi tshad mar byas pa'i tshig gis rgyal ba 'am pham par 'gyur la /
translated: In the world, sometimes one is victorious or defeated by means of a statement that is valid knowledge for both the challenger and the one challenged.

original: res 'ga' ni rang gi tshig kho nas 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: res 'ga' ni rang gi tshig kho nas 'gyur gyi /
translated: Sometimes one is victorious or defeated by means of one’s own statement alone.

original: gzhan gyi tshig gis ni rgyal ba 'am pham par 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan gyi tshig gis ni rgyal ba 'am pham par 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: One is not victorious or defeated by means of the statement of another.

original: 'jig rten na ji ltar yin pa de bzhin du rigs pa la yang yin te /
analyzed: 'jig rten na ji ltar yin pa de bzhin du rigs pa la yang yin te /
translated: Just as it is in the world, so it is in reasoning.

original: 'jig rten pa'i tha snyad kho na rigs pa'i bstan bcos su skabs su bab pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i tha snyad kho na rigs pa'i bstan bcos su skabs su bab pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Only worldly conventions are relevant in a treatise on reasoning.

original: de nyid kyi phyir 'ga' zhig gis gzhan la grags pa'i dbang gis ni rjes su dpag pa'i gnod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir 'ga' zhig gis gzhan la grags pa'i dbang gis ni rjes su dpag pa'i gnod pa ma yin te /
translated: For that very reason, it is explained that it is not a case of the contradiction of inference by means of what is renowned to others.

original: gzhan la grags pa nyid dgag par 'dod pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad do //
analyzed: gzhan la grags pa nyid dgag par 'dod pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad do //
translated: Because what is renowned to others is itself what is to be refuted.

original: gang zhig gang gnyi ga la nges par brjod pa de ni sgrub pa 'am sun 'byin pa yin gyi /
analyzed: gang zhig gang gnyi ga la nges par brjod pa de ni sgrub pa 'am sun 'byin pa yin gyi /
translated: Whatever is stated to be certain for both parties is a proof or a refutation.

original: gang yang rung ba la grub pa 'am the tshom za ba smra ba ni ma yin no snyam du sems pa des kyang 'jig rten gyi tha snyad kyi rnam par gzhag pa la brten nas rjes su dpag pa la ji skad smras pa'i tshul 'di nyid khas blang
analyzed: gang yang rung ba la grub pa 'am the tshom za ba smra ba ni ma yin no snyam du sems pa des kyang 'jig rten gyi tha snyad kyi rnam par gzhag pa la brten nas rjes su dpag pa la ji skad smras pa'i tshul 'di nyid khas blang
translated: One should not speak of what is not established or is doubtful for either party.🔽Thus, one should accept this very method of explanation with regard to inference based on the principles of mundane conventions.

original: bar bya'o // 'di ltar lung gis gnod pa ni gnyi ga la grub pa'i lung kho na'i sgo nas ma yin te /
analyzed: bar bya'o // 'di ltar lung gis gnod pa ni gnyi ga la grub pa'i lung kho na'i sgo nas ma yin te /
translated: With regard to refutation by scripture, it is not only by means of scripture established for both parties.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What then?

original: rang la grub pa'i sgo nas kyang yin no //
analyzed: rang la grub pa'i sgo nas kyang yin no //
translated: It is also by means of scripture established for oneself.

original: rang gi don gyi rjes su dpag pa ni thams cad du rang la grub pa nyid brling ba yin gyi /
analyzed: rang gi don gyi rjes su dpag pa ni thams cad du rang la grub pa nyid brling ba yin gyi /
translated: In all cases, inference for oneself is more forceful than that established for oneself,

original: gnyi ga la grub pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gnyi ga la grub pa ni ma yin no //
translated: but not that established for both.

original: de nyid kyi phyir rtog ge'i mtshan nyid brjod pa ni dgos pa med pa yin te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir rtog ge'i mtshan nyid brjod pa ni dgos pa med pa yin te /
translated: For this very reason, it is pointless to state the definition of a logicians.

original: sangs rgyas rnams kyis rang la ji ltar grags pa'i 'thad pas de kho na mi shes pa'i gdul bya'i skye bo la phan btags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyis rang la ji ltar grags pa'i 'thad pas de kho na mi shes pa'i gdul bya'i skye bo la phan btags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the buddhas benefit those disciples who do not understand reality by means of what is tenable for them.

original: shin tu spros pas chog go //
analyzed: shin tu spros pas chog go //
translated: Enough with too much elaboration!

original: dkyus ma nyid bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: dkyus ma nyid bshad par bya'o //
translated: I will explain the simple one.

original: dngos po rnams ni gzhan las skye ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: dngos po rnams ni gzhan las skye ba yang ma yin te /
translated: Things do not arise from other,

original: gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because other does not exist.🔽This is explained in the following:

original: 'di yang / dngos po rnams kyi rang bzhin ni //
analyzed: 'di yang / dngos po rnams kyi rang bzhin ni //
translated: The essence of things

original: rkyen la sogs la yod ma yin //
analyzed: rkyen la sogs la yod ma yin //
translated: Does not exist in the conditions and so on.

original: zhes bya ba der 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba der 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: And:🔽Because other does not exist,

original: de'i phyir gzhan med pa nyid kyi phyir gzhan las kyang skye ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir gzhan med pa nyid kyi phyir gzhan las kyang skye ba ma yin no //
translated: Things do not arise from other.

original: @12a * // gzhan yang gzhan la brten nas gal te gzhan zhig 'byung bar 'gyur na ni /
analyzed: @12a * // gzhan yang gzhan la brten nas gal te gzhan zhig 'byung bar 'gyur na ni /
translated: Moreover, if another thing arose in dependence on another,

original: 'o na me lce las kyang mun pa mthug po 'byung 'gyur zhing //
analyzed: 'o na me lce las kyang mun pa mthug po 'byung 'gyur zhing //
translated: then thick darkness would arise from the flames of a fire,

original: thams cad las kyang thams cad skye bar 'gyur te gang gi phyir //
analyzed: thams cad las kyang thams cad skye bar 'gyur te gang gi phyir //
translated: and everything would arise from everything, because

original: skyed par byed pa ma yin ma lus pa la'ang gzhan nyid mtshungs //
analyzed: skyed par byed pa ma yin ma lus pa la'ang gzhan nyid mtshungs //
translated: And to all that is not a producer, otherness is the same.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas gzhan las skye ba dgag pa dbu ma la 'jug pa las nges par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas gzhan las skye ba dgag pa dbu ma la 'jug pa las nges par bya'o //
translated: Thus, the refutation of production from other should be ascertained from the Madhyamakaavatara.

original: slob dpon sangs rgyas bskyangs ni dngos po rnams gzhan las skye ba med de /
analyzed: slob dpon sangs rgyas bskyangs ni dngos po rnams gzhan las skye ba med de /
translated: The Acarya Buddhapalita explains this as follows: Things are not produced from other,

original: thams cad las kyang thams cad skye bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //🔽zhes rnam par 'chad do //
analyzed: thams cad las kyang thams cad skye bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro // zhes rnam par 'chad do //
translated: because everything would be produced from everything.

original: 'di la slob dpon legs ldan byed ni des na de la thal bar 'gyur ba'i ngag yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di la slob dpon legs ldan byed ni des na de la thal bar 'gyur ba'i ngag yin pa'i phyir /
translated: To this, the Acarya Bhavaviveka objects: Since this is a reductio argument,

original: bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub par byed pa bzlog par byas na /
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub par byed pa bzlog par byas na /
translated: if the probandum and the proof are reversed,

original: dngos po rnams bdag gam gnyis sam rgyu med pa las skye bar 'gyur ba dang / 'ga' zhig las 'ga' zhig skye bar 'gyur ba'i phyir phyogs gong ma dang 'gal par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dngos po rnams bdag gam gnyis sam rgyu med pa las skye bar 'gyur ba dang / 'ga' zhig las 'ga' zhig skye bar 'gyur ba'i phyir phyogs gong ma dang 'gal par 'gyur ro //
translated: it contradicts the previous position that things are produced from self, from both, or without cause, and that something is produced from something.

original: gzhan du na yang thams cad las thams cad las skye bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan du na yang thams cad las thams cad las skye bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Otherwise, everything would arise from everything.

original: de bas na de la sgrub pa dang sun 'byin pa nyid med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de bas na de la sgrub pa dang sun 'byin pa nyid med pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, since there is no proof or refutation,

original: de ni don 'brel pa med pa yin te zhes sun 'byin smra'o //
analyzed: de ni don 'brel pa med pa yin te zhes sun 'byin smra'o //
translated: it is meaningless.

original: 'di yang don 'brel pa med pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di yang don 'brel pa med pa ma yin te /
translated: This is not meaningless,

original: gong kho nar bstan zin pa'i phyir dang gzhan gyis dam bcas pa'i don sun 'byin par byed pa yin dang / sun 'byin pa nyid kyang yin pa'i phyir 'di ni gyi na'o //
analyzed: gong kho nar bstan zin pa'i phyir dang gzhan gyis dam bcas pa'i don sun 'byin par byed pa yin dang / sun 'byin pa nyid kyang yin pa'i phyir 'di ni gyi na'o //
translated: because it was explained above, and because it refutes the meaning that others believe, and because it is a refutation.

original: des na slar yang 'bad par mi bya'o //
analyzed: des na slar yang 'bad par mi bya'o //
translated: Therefore, one should not make an effort again.

original: dngos po rnams ni gnyi ga las skye ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: dngos po rnams ni gnyi ga las skye ba yang ma yin te /
translated: Things do not arise from both self and another,

original: phyogs gnyi ga la smras pa'i nyis par thal ba'i phyir dang / re re la skyed par byed pa'i nus pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyogs gnyi ga la smras pa'i nyis par thal ba'i phyir dang / re re la skyed par byed pa'i nus pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the error mentioned in both cases would apply, and because each lacks the ability to produce.

original: gal te re res byas 'gyur na //
analyzed: gal te re res byas 'gyur na //
translated: If it were produced by each,

original: sdug bsngal gnyi gas byas par 'gyur //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gnyi gas byas par 'gyur //
translated: suffering would be produced by both.

original: zhes 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhes 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: This will be explained.

original: rgyu med pa las kyang mi skye ste /
analyzed: rgyu med pa las kyang mi skye ste /
translated: It does not arise without a cause,🔽because the error that will be explained,

original: rgyu med na ni 'bras bu dang // rgyu yang 'thad par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgyu med na ni 'bras bu dang // rgyu yang 'thad par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: that if there is no cause, then neither effect nor cause would be tenable,🔽and the error stated in such passages as:

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par 'gyur ba'i skyon du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir dang / gal te rgyu yis stong na 'gro ba 'di dag gzung bya min //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par 'gyur ba'i skyon du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir dang / gal te rgyu yis stong na 'gro ba 'di dag gzung bya min //
translated: If the world were empty, then there would be no apprehended object,

original: ji ltar nam mkha'i autpala yi dri dang kha dog bzhin //
analyzed: ji ltar nam mkha'i autpala yi dri dang kha dog bzhin //
translated: just as there is no odor or color in an utpala of the sky.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i nyes par thal bar @12b 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i nyes par thal bar @12b 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: would ensue.

original: slob dpon sangs rgyas bskyangs ni dngos po rnams rgyu med pa las kyang skye ba med de /
analyzed: slob dpon sangs rgyas bskyangs ni dngos po rnams rgyu med pa las kyang skye ba med de /
translated: Master Buddhapalita explains that things do not arise from a noncause,

original: rtag tu thams cad las thams cad skye bar thal bar 'gyur ro zhes 'chad do //
analyzed: rtag tu thams cad las thams cad skye bar thal bar 'gyur ro zhes 'chad do //
translated: because the error that everything would always arise from everything would ensue.

original: 'di la yang slob dpon legs ldan byed /
analyzed: 'di la yang slob dpon legs ldan byed /
translated: Here, Master Bhavaviveka says:

original: de la yang thal bar 'gyur ba'i ngag yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de la yang thal bar 'gyur ba'i ngag yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it is a reductio argument,

original: gal te bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub par byed pa bzlog pa gsal ba ngag gi don du mngon par 'dod na /🔽de'i tshe 'di skad du /🔽dngos po rnams rgyu las skye bar 'gyur ba dang / lan 'ga' kha cig las kha cig skye bar 'gyur ba dang / rtsom pa 'bras bu dang bcas pa nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //🔽zhes bstan par 'gyur na /
analyzed: gal te bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub par byed pa bzlog pa gsal ba ngag gi don du mngon par 'dod na / de'i tshe 'di skad du / dngos po rnams rgyu las skye bar 'gyur ba dang / lan 'ga' kha cig las kha cig skye bar 'gyur ba dang / rtsom pa 'bras bu dang bcas pa nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro // zhes bstan par 'gyur na /
translated: If you assert that the meaning of the statement “The effect is not in the conditions collectively” is that the effect is not in the conditions individually, then that is also untenable.🔽If you assert that the meaning of the statement “The effect is not in the conditions individually or collectively” is that the effect is not in the conditions individually or collectively, then that is also untenable.🔽If you assert that the meaning of the statement “The effect is not in the conditions individually or collectively” is that the effect is not in the conditions individually or collectively, then that is also untenable.

original: bshad pa de ni mi rigs te /
analyzed: bshad pa de ni mi rigs te /
translated: If you assert that the meaning of the statement “The effect is not in the conditions individually or collectively” is that the effect is in the conditions individually or collectively, then that is also untenable.

original: sngar smras pa'i skyon du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //🔽zhes sun 'byin pa smra'o //🔽gzhan dag na re 'di ni mi rigs te sngar lan btab zin pa'i phyir ro zhe'o //
analyzed: sngar smras pa'i skyon du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro // zhes sun 'byin pa smra'o // gzhan dag na re 'di ni mi rigs te sngar lan btab zin pa'i phyir ro zhe'o //
translated: If you assert that the meaning of the statement “The effect is not in the conditions individually or collectively” is that the effect is in the conditions individually or collectively, then that is also untenable.🔽If you assert that the meaning of the statement “The effect is not in the conditions individually or collectively” is that the effect is not in the conditions individually or collectively, then that is also untenable.

original: gang yang dbang phyug la sogs pa nye bar bsdu pa'i phyir yin no zhes bya ba de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang yang dbang phyug la sogs pa nye bar bsdu pa'i phyir yin no zhes bya ba de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: If you assert that the meaning of the statement “The effect is not in the conditions individually or collectively” is that the effect is not in the conditions individually or collectively, then that is also untenable.

original: dbang phyug la sogs pa rnams ni khas blangs pa ji lta ba bzhin du bdag dang gzhan dang gnyi ga'i phyogs dag tu 'du bya'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbang phyug la sogs pa rnams ni khas blangs pa ji lta ba bzhin du bdag dang gzhan dang gnyi ga'i phyogs dag tu 'du bya'i phyir ro //
translated: because the proponents of God and so on are subsumed under the positions of self, other, and both, just as they are accepted.

original: de'i phyir skye ba yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di bsgrubs pa yin la /
analyzed: de'i phyir skye ba yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di bsgrubs pa yin la /
translated: Therefore, this establishes that arising does not exist.

original: skye ba yod pa ma yin pas /
analyzed: skye ba yod pa ma yin pas /
translated: Since arising does not exist,

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba skye ba med pa la sogs pas khyad par du byas pa grub pa yin no //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba skye ba med pa la sogs pas khyad par du byas pa grub pa yin no //
translated: dependent origination is established as qualified by nonarising and so on.

original: 'dir smras pa gal te de ltar rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba skye ba med pa la sogs pas khyad par du byas pa rnam par gzhag na ni /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa gal te de ltar rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba skye ba med pa la sogs pas khyad par du byas pa rnam par gzhag na ni /
translated: Here, someone might say, “If dependent origination is presented as qualified by nonarising and so on,

original: 'o na bcom ldan 'das kyis ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed rnams skye ba dang / ma rig pa 'gags pas 'du byed 'gag ces bya ba dang / de bzhin du /
analyzed: 'o na bcom ldan 'das kyis ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed rnams skye ba dang / ma rig pa 'gags pas 'du byed 'gag ces bya ba dang / de bzhin du /
translated: then how could the Blessed One have said, ‘Conditioned by ignorance, there are actions,’ and ‘Through the cessation of ignorance, actions cease,’ and so on, and also,🔽Alas! Conditioned phenomena are impermanent.

original: kye ma 'du byed rnams mi rtag / skye zhing 'jig pa'i chos can yin //
analyzed: kye ma 'du byed rnams mi rtag / skye zhing 'jig pa'i chos can yin //
translated: They have the nature of arising and disintegration.

original: skye nas 'jig par 'gyur ba ste //
analyzed: skye nas 'jig par 'gyur ba ste //
translated: Having arisen, they disintegrate.

original: de dag nye bar zhi ba bde //
analyzed: de dag nye bar zhi ba bde //
translated: Their pacification is happiness.

original: zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa rnams byung yang rung /🔽de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ma byung yang rung /
analyzed: zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa rnams byung yang rung / de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ma byung yang rung /
translated: And similarly, whether or not the Tathagatas arise,🔽the dharmata of phenomena is just so.

original: chos rnams kyi chos nyid 'di ni gnas pa kho na ste zhes bya ba dang / sems can gnas par byed pa'i chos ni gcig ste /
analyzed: chos rnams kyi chos nyid 'di ni gnas pa kho na ste zhes bya ba dang / sems can gnas par byed pa'i chos ni gcig ste /
translated: And, The Dharma that causes sentient beings to abide is one,

original: gang tsas bzhi'o //
analyzed: gang tsas bzhi'o //
translated: namely, the four noble truths.

original: @13a * // 'jig rten skyong bar byed pa'i chos ni gnyis te /
analyzed: @13a * // 'jig rten skyong bar byed pa'i chos ni gnyis te /
translated: The Dharma that protects the world is two,🔽namely, shame and embarrassment.

original: ngo tsha shes pa dang khrel yod pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang / de bzhin du 'jig rten pha rol nas 'dir 'ongs so //
analyzed: ngo tsha shes pa dang khrel yod pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang / de bzhin du 'jig rten pha rol nas 'dir 'ongs so //
translated: And similarly, one comes from the next world to this world,🔽and from this world one goes to the next world.

original: 'jig rten 'di nas 'jig rten pha rol du 'gro'o zhes de ltar rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba 'gag pa la sogs pas khyad par du byas pa bstan pa gang yin pa de ji ltar 'gal bar mi 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: 'jig rten 'di nas 'jig rten pha rol du 'gro'o zhes de ltar rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba 'gag pa la sogs pas khyad par du byas pa bstan pa gang yin pa de ji ltar 'gal bar mi 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How could it not be contradictory to teach that dependent origination is qualified by cessation and so on?

original: gang gi phyir de ltar rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba 'gag pa la sogs pa dag yod par thos par 'gyur ba de nyid kyi phyir slob dpon gyis drang pa dang nges pa dang nges pa'i don gyi mdo sde'i rnam par dbye ba bstan par bya ba'i phyir
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba 'gag pa la sogs pa dag yod par thos par 'gyur ba de nyid kyi phyir slob dpon gyis drang pa dang nges pa dang nges pa'i don gyi mdo sde'i rnam par dbye ba bstan par bya ba'i phyir
translated: Because it is heard that dependent origination has cessation and so on, the master Nāgārjuna taught this treatise in order to demonstrate the classification of sūtras into provisional and definitive and the meaning of the definitive sūtras.🔽

original: dbu ma'i bstan bcos 'di mdzad pa yin no //
analyzed: dbu ma'i bstan bcos 'di mdzad pa yin no //
translated: Because of this, the Master composed this treatise on the middle way in order to teach the classification of sutras into interpretable and definitive, and the meaning of the definitive sutras.

original: de la rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i skye ba la sogs pa dag bstan pa gang yin pa de dag ni ma rig pa'i rab rib dang bral ba dag gi ye shes zag pa med pa'i yul gyi rang bzhin la ltos nas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de la rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i skye ba la sogs pa dag bstan pa gang yin pa de dag ni ma rig pa'i rab rib dang bral ba dag gi ye shes zag pa med pa'i yul gyi rang bzhin la ltos nas ni ma yin no //
translated: The arising, etc. of dependent origination are taught in dependence upon the objects of the uncontaminated wisdom of those who are free from the cataracts of ignorance, but not in dependence upon the objects of the consciousnesses of those whose eyes of intelligence are covered by the cataracts of ignorance.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: Well then, what is it?

original: ma rig pa'i rab rib kyis blo gros kyi mig nyams par byas pa dag gi shes pa'i yul la ltos nas yin no //
analyzed: ma rig pa'i rab rib kyis blo gros kyi mig nyams par byas pa dag gi shes pa'i yul la ltos nas yin no //
translated: It is the objects of the consciousnesses of those whose eyes of intelligence are covered by the cataracts of ignorance.

original: de kho na nyid gzigs pa la ltos nas ni bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong dag 'di ni bden pa dam pa ste /
analyzed: de kho na nyid gzigs pa la ltos nas ni bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong dag 'di ni bden pa dam pa ste /
translated: In dependence upon the vision of reality, the Bhagavan said, “Monks, this is the highest truth,

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: slu ba med pa'i chos can mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: slu ba med pa'i chos can mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
translated: The nature of phenomena that is not deceptive is nirvana.

original: 'du byed thams cad ni brdzun pa slu ba'i chos can no zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: 'du byed thams cad ni brdzun pa slu ba'i chos can no zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: All compounded phenomena are false and deceptive phenomena.

original: de bzhin du 'di ni de bzhin nyid dam phyin ci ma log pa'i bzhin nyid ni med kyi /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'di ni de bzhin nyid dam phyin ci ma log pa'i bzhin nyid ni med kyi /
translated: In the same way, it is said, “This is not reality or the nature that is not erroneous.

original: 'di dag ni slu bar byad pa'i chos can no //
analyzed: 'di dag ni slu bar byad pa'i chos can no //
translated: These are phenomena that deceive.

original: 'di dag ni brdzun pa sgyu ma byis pa 'drid pa'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'di dag ni brdzun pa sgyu ma byis pa 'drid pa'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: These are false, illusory, and delude the childish.”

original: de bzhin du /
analyzed: de bzhin du /
translated: In the same way,

original: gzugs ni dbu ba rdos pa 'dra //
analyzed: gzugs ni dbu ba rdos pa 'dra //
translated: Form is like a mass of foam,

original: tshor ba chu yi chu bur bzhin //
analyzed: tshor ba chu yi chu bur bzhin //
translated: Feeling is like a water bubble,

original: 'du shes smig rgyu lta bu ste //
analyzed: 'du shes smig rgyu lta bu ste //
translated: Perception is like a mirage,

original: 'du byed chu shing sdod po 'dra //
analyzed: 'du byed chu shing sdod po 'dra //
translated: Formation is like a plantain tree,

original: rnam shes sgyu ma lta bu zhes //
analyzed: rnam shes sgyu ma lta bu zhes //
translated: And consciousness is like an illusion.

original: nyi ma'i gnyen gyis bka' stsal to //
analyzed: nyi ma'i gnyen gyis bka' stsal to //
translated: Thus spoke the Friend of the Sun.

original: zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du dge slong brtson 'grus brtsams pa dran pa dang shes bzhin dang ldan pa nyin dang mtshan du chos la so sor rtog par byed pa na /
analyzed: zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du dge slong brtson 'grus brtsams pa dran pa dang shes bzhin dang ldan pa nyin dang mtshan du chos la so sor rtog par byed pa na /
translated: And similarly, a monk who is diligent, mindful, and alert, who investigates phenomena day and night,

original: 'du byed thams cad ni nye bar zhi pa'i go 'phang zhi ba /
analyzed: 'du byed thams cad ni nye bar zhi pa'i go 'phang zhi ba /
translated: will understand that all conditioned things are the state of peace,

original: chos rnams bdag med pa nyid rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chos rnams bdag med pa nyid rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: and will realize that phenomena are selfless.

original: @13b zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: @13b zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: de lta bur bstan pa'i dgongs pa mi shes pas /
analyzed: de lta bur bstan pa'i dgongs pa mi shes pas /
translated: Not knowing the intention behind such teachings,🔽one might wonder, “What here is a teaching that has a meaning that is definitive?

original: 'dir de kho na'i don can gyi bstan pa ni gang zhig yin /
analyzed: 'dir de kho na'i don can gyi bstan pa ni gang zhig yin /
translated: What here is a teaching that is provisional?”

original: dgongs pa can ni 'dir gang zhig yin snyam du gang zhig the tshom du 'gyur ba dang / gang zhig blo zhan pa nyid kyis drang ba'i don gyi bstan pa la nges pa'i don du rtogs pa de gnyi ga'i the tshom dang log pa'i shes pa dag rigs pa dang lung gnyis kyi sgo nas bsal bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: dgongs pa can ni 'dir gang zhig yin snyam du gang zhig the tshom du 'gyur ba dang / gang zhig blo zhan pa nyid kyis drang ba'i don gyi bstan pa la nges pa'i don du rtogs pa de gnyi ga'i the tshom dang log pa'i shes pa dag rigs pa dang lung gnyis kyi sgo nas bsal bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to dispel the doubts of those who wonder this and in order to dispel the mistaken understanding of those who, due to their feeble intelligence, think that the teachings that are provisional have a definitive meaning, the root text says, “In order to dispel doubts and mistaken understanding.”

original: slob dpon gyis 'di brtsams so //
analyzed: slob dpon gyis 'di brtsams so //
translated: The Master has composed this treatise.

original: de la bdag las ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni rigs pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de la bdag las ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni rigs pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: In this regard, the statement “not from self” and so on sets forth the reasoning.🔽The Lord has said that any phenomenon

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis chos gang zhig / slu ba de ni brdzun zhes gsungs //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis chos gang zhig / slu ba de ni brdzun zhes gsungs //
translated: that is deceptive is false.

original: 'du byed thams cad slu ba'i chos //
analyzed: 'du byed thams cad slu ba'i chos //
translated: All compounded things are deceptive phenomena.

original: des na de dag brdzun pa yin //
analyzed: des na de dag brdzun pa yin //
translated: Therefore, they are false.

original: sngon mtha' sngon nam zhes zhus tshe //
analyzed: sngon mtha' sngon nam zhes zhus tshe //
translated: When asked about the prior limit,

original: thub pa chen pos min zhes gsungs //
analyzed: thub pa chen pos min zhes gsungs //
translated: the Great Sage said “no.”

original: 'khor ba thog ma mtha' med de //
analyzed: 'khor ba thog ma mtha' med de //
translated: Cyclic existence has no beginning or end.

original: de la sngon med phyi ma med //
analyzed: de la sngon med phyi ma med //
translated: It has no “before” or “after.”

original: bcom ldan dngos dang dngos med pa //
analyzed: bcom ldan dngos dang dngos med pa //
translated: The Lord, who knows reality and nonreality,

original: mkhyen pas k'a ta ya na yi //
analyzed: mkhyen pas k'a ta ya na yi //
translated: in the advice to Katyayana,

original: gdams ngag las ni yod pa dang // med pa gnyi ga 'ang dgag pa mdzad //
analyzed: gdams ngag las ni yod pa dang // med pa gnyi ga 'ang dgag pa mdzad //
translated: refuted both existence and nonexistence.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa lung gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa lung gsungs pa yin no //
translated: And so on.🔽In the noble Aksayamatinirdesa-sutra,

original: 'phags pa blo gros mi zad pas bstan pa'i mdo las /🔽nges pa'i don gyi mdo sde ni gang /
analyzed: 'phags pa blo gros mi zad pas bstan pa'i mdo las / nges pa'i don gyi mdo sde ni gang /
translated: it says,

original: drang ba'i don gyi mdo sde ni gang zhe na /
analyzed: drang ba'i don gyi mdo sde ni gang zhe na /
translated: “What is a sutra of definitive meaning? What is a sutra of provisional meaning?”

original: mdo sde gang dag lam la 'jug pa'i phyir bstan pa de dag ni drang ba'i don zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mdo sde gang dag lam la 'jug pa'i phyir bstan pa de dag ni drang ba'i don zhes bya'o //
translated: Those sūtras that are taught for the purpose of engaging the path are called “interpretable in meaning.”

original: mdo sde gang dag 'bras bu la 'jug pa'i phyir bstan pa de dag ni nges pa'i don zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mdo sde gang dag 'bras bu la 'jug pa'i phyir bstan pa de dag ni nges pa'i don zhes bya'o //
translated: Those sūtras that are taught for the purpose of engaging the result are called “definitive in meaning.”

original: mdo sde gang dag bdag dang / sems can dang / srog dang / 'gro ba dang / gso ba dang / skyes bu dang / gang zag dang / shed las skyes dang / shed pa dag dang / byed pa po dang / tshor ba po dang /
analyzed: mdo sde gang dag bdag dang / sems can dang / srog dang / 'gro ba dang / gso ba dang / skyes bu dang / gang zag dang / shed las skyes dang / shed pa dag dang / byed pa po dang / tshor ba po dang /
translated: Those sūtras that teach a self, a sentient being, a life-force, an individual, a human being, a human, a human birth, an agent, a feeler,

original: sgra rnam pa sna tshogs su bshad pa dang / bdag po med pa la bdag po dang bcas par bstan pa de dag ni drang ba'i don zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sgra rnam pa sna tshogs su bshad pa dang / bdag po med pa la bdag po dang bcas par bstan pa de dag ni drang ba'i don zhes bya'o //
translated: and various words, and that teach a master where there is no master, are called “interpretable in meaning.”

original: mdo sde gang dag stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par 'du mi byed pa dang / ma skyes pa dang / ma byung ba dang / dngos po med @14a * //
analyzed: mdo sde gang dag stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par 'du mi byed pa dang / ma skyes pa dang / ma byung ba dang / dngos po med @14a * //
translated: Those sūtras that teach emptiness, signlessness, wishlessness, non-composition, non-arising, non-occurrence, non-entity,

original: pa dang / bdag med pa dang / sems can med pa dang / srog med pa dang / gang zag med pa dang / bdag po med pa nas /
analyzed: pa dang / bdag med pa dang / sems can med pa dang / srog med pa dang / gang zag med pa dang / bdag po med pa nas /
translated: and the non-existence of self, sentient beings, life, persons, and owners,
