original: rnam par thar pa'i sgo'i bar du bstan pa de dag ni nges pa'i don zhes bya ste /🔽'di dag ni nges pa'i don gyi mdo sde la rton gyi /
analyzed: rnam par thar pa'i sgo'i bar du bstan pa de dag ni nges pa'i don zhes bya ste / 'di dag ni nges pa'i don gyi mdo sde la rton gyi /
translated: up to the teaching of the doors of liberation are called the “definitive meaning.”🔽These are called “relying on the sūtras of definitive meaning”🔽and “not relying on the sūtras of provisional meaning.”

original: drang ba'i don gyi mdo sde la mi rton pa zhes bya'o zhes gsungs pa dang / de bzhin du 'phags pa ting nge 'dzin gyi rgyal po las kyang /
analyzed: drang ba'i don gyi mdo sde la mi rton pa zhes bya'o zhes gsungs pa dang / de bzhin du 'phags pa ting nge 'dzin gyi rgyal po las kyang /
translated: Similarly, the noble King of Samādhis says:

original: stong pa bde bar gshegs pas bshad pa ltar //
analyzed: stong pa bde bar gshegs pas bshad pa ltar //
translated: The Sugata taught emptiness.

original: nges don mdo sde dag gi bye brag shes //
analyzed: nges don mdo sde dag gi bye brag shes //
translated: Know it to be the distinction of the sūtras of definitive meaning.

original: gang las sems can gang zag skyes bu bsten //🔽chos de thams cad drang ba'i don du shes //
analyzed: gang las sems can gang zag skyes bu bsten // chos de thams cad drang ba'i don du shes //
translated: Where sentient beings, persons, and individuals are taught,

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: know all those Dharmas to be of provisional meaning.

original: de'i phyir skye ba la sogs pa bstan pa rnams brdzun pa'i don can du bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i phyir skye ba la sogs pa bstan pa rnams brdzun pa'i don can du bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, in order to teach that the teachings on arising and so on have a false meaning, the root text says:

original: slob dpon gyis rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba rdzas su ston pa brtsams so //
analyzed: slob dpon gyis rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba rdzas su ston pa brtsams so //
translated: The Master composed the treatise Dependent-Arising to demonstrate that dependent-arising is substantial.

original: gal te skye ba la sogs pa mi srid pa yin dang / chos thams cad brdzun pa nyid du bstan par bya ba'i phyir slob dpon gyis 'di brtsams pa yin no //
analyzed: gal te skye ba la sogs pa mi srid pa yin dang / chos thams cad brdzun pa nyid du bstan par bya ba'i phyir slob dpon gyis 'di brtsams pa yin no //
translated: If arising and so on are impossible, then the Master composed this treatise to demonstrate that all phenomena are false.

original: de lta na ni gang brdzun pa de ni yod pa ma yin pas mi dge ba'i las dag med par 'gyur la /
analyzed: de lta na ni gang brdzun pa de ni yod pa ma yin pas mi dge ba'i las dag med par 'gyur la /
translated: In that case, since whatever is false does not exist, nonvirtuous karma would not exist.

original: de med pas ngan 'gro dag med par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: de med pas ngan 'gro dag med par 'gyur zhing /
translated: Since that does not exist, the miserable realms would not exist.

original: dge ba dang bde 'gro dag kyang med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dge ba dang bde 'gro dag kyang med par 'gyur ro //
translated: And virtue and happy realms would not exist.

original: bde 'gro dang ngan 'gro med pa'i phyir 'khor ba yang yod pa ma yin pas /
analyzed: bde 'gro dang ngan 'gro med pa'i phyir 'khor ba yang yod pa ma yin pas /
translated: Since happy and miserable realms do not exist, cyclic existence would not exist.

original: rtsom pa thams cad don med pa nyid du 'gyur ba ma yin nam zhe na bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: rtsom pa thams cad don med pa nyid du 'gyur ba ma yin nam zhe na bshad par bya ste /
translated: So would it not be the case that all striving would be pointless?

original: kun rdzob kyi bden pa la ltos nas 'di bden par mngon par zhen pa'i 'jig rten pa'i gnyen po nyid du kho bo cag gis dngos po rnams brdzun pa'i don du bstan gyi /
analyzed: kun rdzob kyi bden pa la ltos nas 'di bden par mngon par zhen pa'i 'jig rten pa'i gnyen po nyid du kho bo cag gis dngos po rnams brdzun pa'i don du bstan gyi /
translated: In dependence on the conventional truth, we teach that things are false in order to counteract the worldly attitude that conceives of them as truly existent.

original: gang zhig brdzun pa'am brdzun pa ma yin par 'gyur ba 'phags pa rnams kyis ni cung zad kyang gzigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang zhig brdzun pa'am brdzun pa ma yin par 'gyur ba 'phags pa rnams kyis ni cung zad kyang gzigs pa ma yin no //
translated: But the noble beings do not see anything at all as either false or not false.

original: gzhan yang gang gis chos thams cad brdzun pa'i don can nyid du yongs su mkhyen pa de la ci las yod cing 'khor ba yod dam /
analyzed: gzhan yang gang gis chos thams cad brdzun pa'i don can nyid du yongs su mkhyen pa de la ci las yod cing 'khor ba yod dam /
translated: Moreover, if one fully understands that all phenomena are false, how could there be karma and cyclic existence?

original: 'dis ni chos 'ga' yang yod pa nyid dam med pa nyid du dmigs pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni chos 'ga' yang yod pa nyid dam med pa nyid du dmigs pa yang ma yin no //
translated: This shows that one does not observe any phenomenon as either existent or nonexistent.

original: ji skad du bcom ldan 'das kyis 'phags pa don mchog brtsegs pa'i mdo las /
analyzed: ji skad du bcom ldan 'das kyis 'phags pa don mchog brtsegs pa'i mdo las /
translated: As the Transcendent Lord said in the Sublime Great Bounteousness of the Buddhas:

original: 'od srungs sems ni kun du btsal na mi rnyed do //🔽gong ma rnyed @14b pa de ni mi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: 'od srungs sems ni kun du btsal na mi rnyed do // gong ma rnyed @14b pa de ni mi dmigs pa'o //
translated: KaSyapa, if one searches for the mind, it is not found.🔽What is not found is not observed.

original: gang mi dmigs pa de ni 'das pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: gang mi dmigs pa de ni 'das pa yang ma yin /
translated: What is not observed does not exist in the past,

original: ma 'ongs pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa yang ma yin /
translated: It is not the future.

original: da ltar byung ba yang ma yin no //
analyzed: da ltar byung ba yang ma yin no //
translated: It is not the present.

original: gang 'das pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: gang 'das pa yang ma yin /
translated: That which is not the past,

original: ma 'ongs pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa yang ma yin /
translated: not the future,

original: da ltar byung ba yang ma yin pa de la ni ngo bo nyid med do //
analyzed: da ltar byung ba yang ma yin pa de la ni ngo bo nyid med do //
translated: and not the present does not have intrinsic reality.

original: gang ngo bo nyid med pa de la 'byung ba med do //
analyzed: gang ngo bo nyid med pa de la 'byung ba med do //
translated: That which does not have intrinsic reality does not arise.

original: gang 'byung ba med pa de la 'gag pa med do //
analyzed: gang 'byung ba med pa de la 'gag pa med do //
translated: That which does not arise does not cease.

original: zhes rgya cher gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: zhes rgya cher gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: Thus it is extensively taught.

original: gang dag phyin ci log dang ldan pas chos rnams brdzun pa nyid du khong du mi chud cing /
analyzed: gang dag phyin ci log dang ldan pas chos rnams brdzun pa nyid du khong du mi chud cing /
translated: Those who, due to error, do not understand that phenomena are false,

original: dngos po rnams rang bzhin yod par rtogs nas mngon par zhen pa de ni chos rnams la 'di bden par mngon par zhen pa nyid kyi sgo nas mngon par zhen par gyur dang / las kyang byed cing 'khor ba na yang 'khor bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: dngos po rnams rang bzhin yod par rtogs nas mngon par zhen pa de ni chos rnams la 'di bden par mngon par zhen pa nyid kyi sgo nas mngon par zhen par gyur dang / las kyang byed cing 'khor ba na yang 'khor bar 'gyur la /
translated: and who, conceiving that things exist intrinsically, are attached to them, are attached to phenomena through the view that this is the truth. They also create karma and wander in cyclic existence.

original: phyin ci log la gnas pas mya ngan las 'das pa thob pa'i skal ba can du yang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phyin ci log la gnas pas mya ngan las 'das pa thob pa'i skal ba can du yang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Since they abide in error, they are not fortunate to attain nirvana.

original: yang ci dngos po brdzun pa'i rang bzhin can rnams kyang kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i rgyur 'gyur ram zhe na /
analyzed: yang ci dngos po brdzun pa'i rang bzhin can rnams kyang kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i rgyur 'gyur ram zhe na /
translated: Do things that are false by nature also serve as causes of affliction and purification?

original: 'gyur te dper na sgyu ma'i na chung ni de'i rang bzhin mngon par mi shes pa rnams kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rgyu yin la /
analyzed: 'gyur te dper na sgyu ma'i na chung ni de'i rang bzhin mngon par mi shes pa rnams kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rgyu yin la /
translated: They do, for example, a magical woman is a cause of affliction for those who do not understand her nature.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sprul pa ni dge ba'i rtsa ba bsags pa rnams kyi rnam par byang ba'i rgyur 'gyur ba bzhin no //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sprul pa ni dge ba'i rtsa ba bsags pa rnams kyi rnam par byang ba'i rgyur 'gyur ba bzhin no //
translated: A tathagata’s emanation is a cause of purification for those who have accumulated roots of virtue.

original: lhag pa'i bsam pa bstan pa'i mdo las /
analyzed: lhag pa'i bsam pa bstan pa'i mdo las /
translated: The Sutra Teaching Superior Intention says:

original: rigs kyi bu 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu 'di lta ste /
translated: Son of noble family, it is like this.

original: dper na la la zhig gis sgyu ma mkhan gyi rol mo byung ba'i tshe /
analyzed: dper na la la zhig gis sgyu ma mkhan gyi rol mo byung ba'i tshe /
translated: When a magician’s performance occurs,

original: sgyu ma mkhan gyis sprul pa'i bud med mthong nas 'dod chags kyis sems dkris nas 'khor gyis 'jigs shing bag tsha ste /
analyzed: sgyu ma mkhan gyis sprul pa'i bud med mthong nas 'dod chags kyis sems dkris nas 'khor gyis 'jigs shing bag tsha ste /
translated: someone sees a woman conjured up by the magician and, their mind bound up with desire, they are afraid of the crowd and embarrassed.

original: stan las langs nas song ste /
analyzed: stan las langs nas song ste /
translated: They get up from their seat and leave.

original: de song nas bud med pa de nyid la /
analyzed: de song nas bud med pa de nyid la /
translated: After they have left, they think about that very woman.

original: mi sdug pa dang / mi gtsang ba dang / mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / stong pa dang / bdag med par yid la byad na zhes rgyas par gsungs so //
analyzed: mi sdug pa dang / mi gtsang ba dang / mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / stong pa dang / bdag med par yid la byad na zhes rgyas par gsungs so //
translated: If you attend to it as foul, as impure, as impermanent, as suffering, as empty, or as nonself, then you will be freed from the defilement of desire.

original: 'dul ba las kyang /
analyzed: 'dul ba las kyang /
translated: The Vinaya also says:

original: 'khrul 'khor mkhan gyis byas pa'i 'khrul 'khor gyi na chung ni yang dag par bden pa'i na chung gis stong bzhin du /
analyzed: 'khrul 'khor mkhan gyis byas pa'i 'khrul 'khor gyi na chung ni yang dag par bden pa'i na chung gis stong bzhin du /
translated: The young woman made by a master of mechanical arts is empty of a real, true young woman.

original: ri mo mkhan gyi 'dod pa'i 'dod chags kyi gzhir gyur par bshad de //
analyzed: ri mo mkhan gyi 'dod pa'i 'dod chags kyi gzhir gyur par bshad de //
translated: But she is the basis for the desire and passion of the painter.

original: dpe de bzhin du dngos po brdzun pa'i rang bzhin can rnams kyang byis pa rnams kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rgyu yin no //🔽de bzhin du 'phags pa dkon mchog @15a * //
analyzed: dpe de bzhin du dngos po brdzun pa'i rang bzhin can rnams kyang byis pa rnams kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rgyu yin no // de bzhin du 'phags pa dkon mchog @15a * //
translated: In the same way, things that are false by nature are the cause of the defilement of fools.

original: brtsegs pa las kyang /
analyzed: brtsegs pa las kyang /
translated: In the same way, the noble Multitude of Jewels says:

original: de nas dge slong bsam gtan thob pa lnga brgya ni bcom ldan 'das kyis chos bstan pa 'di la mi 'jug ste /
analyzed: de nas dge slong bsam gtan thob pa lnga brgya ni bcom ldan 'das kyis chos bstan pa 'di la mi 'jug ste /
translated: Then five hundred monks who had attained meditation did not understand this teaching of the Dharma that the Lord had given.

original: ma rtogs ma mos pas stan las langs te dong ngo //
analyzed: ma rtogs ma mos pas stan las langs te dong ngo //
translated: Not understanding and not believing, they got up from their seats and left.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong de dag lam gang nas dong ba'i lam der dge slong gnyis shig sprul pa sprul te /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong de dag lam gang nas dong ba'i lam der dge slong gnyis shig sprul pa sprul te /
translated: Then the Blessed One emanated two monks on the road that those monks had taken.

original: de nas dge slong lnga brgya po de dag dge slong de gnyis lam gang nas dong ba'i lam der dong ste phyin pa dang 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: de nas dge slong lnga brgya po de dag dge slong de gnyis lam gang nas dong ba'i lam der dong ste phyin pa dang 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: Then those five hundred monks went on the road that those two monks had taken, and when they arrived, they said this:

original: tshe dang ldan pa dag gar dong /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa dag gar dong /
translated: “Venerable ones, where are you going?”

original: sprul pa gnyis kyis smras pa /
analyzed: sprul pa gnyis kyis smras pa /
translated: The two emanations said,

original: kho bo cag ni dgon pa'i gnas su bsam gtan gyi bde ba la reg par gnas par bya bar dong ngo //
analyzed: kho bo cag ni dgon pa'i gnas su bsam gtan gyi bde ba la reg par gnas par bya bar dong ngo //
translated: “We are going to the wilderness to experience the bliss of concentration.”

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: kho bo cag ni bcom ldan 'das kyis chos bstan pa gang yin pa'ang chos bstan pa de la mi 'jug ste /
analyzed: kho bo cag ni bcom ldan 'das kyis chos bstan pa gang yin pa'ang chos bstan pa de la mi 'jug ste /
translated: We do not engage with the Dharma teaching that the Blessed One gave.

original: mi rtogs mi mos shing /
analyzed: mi rtogs mi mos shing /
translated: We do not understand it, we are not inspired by it,

original: skrag ste kun du dang ngas /
analyzed: skrag ste kun du dang ngas /
translated: and we are afraid of it.

original: kun du rab tu dang ngas par gyur nas kho bo cag dgon pa'i gnas rnams su bsam gtan gyi bde ba la reg par gnas pa rnams kyis gnas par bya'o //
analyzed: kun du rab tu dang ngas par gyur nas kho bo cag dgon pa'i gnas rnams su bsam gtan gyi bde ba la reg par gnas pa rnams kyis gnas par bya'o //
translated: Having become completely and perfectly serene, we will dwell in the bliss of meditation in the forest.

original: de nas dge slong lnga brgya po rnams kyis 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: de nas dge slong lnga brgya po rnams kyis 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: Then the five hundred monks said,

original: tshe dang ldan pa dag / kho bo cag kyang bcom ldan 'das kyis chos bstan pa la mi 'jug ste /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa dag / kho bo cag kyang bcom ldan 'das kyis chos bstan pa la mi 'jug ste /
translated: “Venerable ones, we too do not understand the teaching of the Bhagavān.

original: ma rtogs ma mos shing skrag ste /
analyzed: ma rtogs ma mos shing skrag ste /
translated: We do not comprehend it, we do not have faith in it, and we are afraid of it.

original: kun du dang ngas kun du rab tu dang ngas par gyur te /
analyzed: kun du dang ngas kun du rab tu dang ngas par gyur te /
translated: We have become completely and perfectly serene, completely and perfectly delighted.

original: de'i phyir kho bo cag kyang dgon pa'i gnas rnams su bsam gtan gyi bde ba la reg par gnas pa rnams kyis gnas par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir kho bo cag kyang dgon pa'i gnas rnams su bsam gtan gyi bde ba la reg par gnas pa rnams kyis gnas par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, we too will dwell in the bliss of meditation in the forest.”

original: sprul pa dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: sprul pa dag gis smras pa /
translated: The emanations said,

original: tshe dang ldan pa dag de'i phyir bdag cag yang dag par 'gro bar bya'o //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa dag de'i phyir bdag cag yang dag par 'gro bar bya'o //
translated: “Venerable ones, therefore we should go to the Bhagavān.

original: rtsod par mi bya'o //
analyzed: rtsod par mi bya'o //
translated: We should not dispute.

original: rtsod pa med pa lhur byed pa de ni dge sbyong gi chos so //
analyzed: rtsod pa med pa lhur byed pa de ni dge sbyong gi chos so //
translated: The foremost practice of the Dharma of the renunciant is to be without dispute.”

original: tshe dang ldan pa dag gang 'di yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ba gang /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa dag gang 'di yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ba gang /
translated: “Venerable ones, what is this called ‘nirvāṇa’?

original: yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur ba'i chos de gang /🔽lus 'di las bdag gam /🔽sems can nam /🔽srog gam / skye ba po 'am /🔽skyes bu'am gang zag gam /🔽shed las skyes sam /
analyzed: yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur ba'i chos de gang / lus 'di las bdag gam / sems can nam / srog gam / skye ba po 'am / skyes bu'am gang zag gam / shed las skyes sam /
translated: What is the dharma that will attain nirvāṇa?

original: shed bu'am / gang yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur /
analyzed: shed bu'am / gang yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur /
translated: Is it the self, or a being, or a life force, or a person, or a human, or a human being, or one born of strength, or a child of strength, that will attain nirvāṇa?

original: gang zad pas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' / de dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: gang zad pas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' / de dag gis smras pa /
translated: What will cease to exist in nirvāṇa?”

original: 'dod chags zad zhe sdang zad gti mug zad pas yongs su mya ngan las 'da'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags zad zhe sdang zad gti mug zad pas yongs su mya ngan las 'da'o //
translated: They replied, “It is the cessation of desire, the cessation of anger, and the cessation of ignorance that is nirvāṇa.”

original: sprul pa gnyis @15b kyis smras pa /
analyzed: sprul pa gnyis @15b kyis smras pa /
translated: The two emanations said,

original: tshe dang ldan pa dag /'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug yod pa yin nam /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa dag /'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug yod pa yin nam /
translated: “Venerable ones, are desire, anger, and ignorance existent?

original: ci nam de zad par bya /🔽de dag gis smras pa /🔽de dag ni nang na yang med phyi rol na yang med /
analyzed: ci nam de zad par bya / de dag gis smras pa / de dag ni nang na yang med phyi rol na yang med /
translated: Should they be brought to cessation?”🔽They replied, “They are not internal, nor are they external;

original: gnyi ga med par yang mi dmigs te /
analyzed: gnyi ga med par yang mi dmigs te /
translated: nor are they apprehended as being other than those two.

original: de dag ni yongs su ma brtags pa las kyang mi skye'o //
analyzed: de dag ni yongs su ma brtags pa las kyang mi skye'o //
translated: They do not arise from non-examination.

original: sprul pa gnyis kyis smras pa /
analyzed: sprul pa gnyis kyis smras pa /
translated: The two emanations said:

original: tshe dang ldan pa dag de lta bas na bdag tu ma rtog rnam par ma rtog shig / tshe dang ldan pa dag nam mi rtog rnam par mi rtog pa de'i tshe chags par mi 'gyur chags pa dang bral bar yang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa dag de lta bas na bdag tu ma rtog rnam par ma rtog shig / tshe dang ldan pa dag nam mi rtog rnam par mi rtog pa de'i tshe chags par mi 'gyur chags pa dang bral bar yang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: “Venerable Ones, therefore, do not conceive of a self, do not discriminate a self. Venerable Ones, when you do not conceive and do not discriminate, then you will not be attached and you will not be averse.

original: chags pa med cing chags pa dang bral ba yang med pa gang yin pa de ni zhi ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: chags pa med cing chags pa dang bral ba yang med pa gang yin pa de ni zhi ba zhes bya'o //
translated: That which is neither attached nor averse is called ‘peace.’

original: tshe dang ldan pa dag tshul khrims ni mi 'khor zhing yongs su mya ngan las mi 'da'o //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa dag tshul khrims ni mi 'khor zhing yongs su mya ngan las mi 'da'o //
translated: Venerable Ones, morality does not revolve and does not transcend.

original: tshe dang ldan pa dag ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab dang / rnam par grol ba dang / rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba yang mi 'khor zhing yongs su mya ngan las mi 'da'o //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa dag ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab dang / rnam par grol ba dang / rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba yang mi 'khor zhing yongs su mya ngan las mi 'da'o //
translated: Venerable Ones, concentration, wisdom, liberation, and the vision of the wisdom of liberation do not revolve and do not transcend.

original: tshe dang ldan pa dag / tshes de dag gis yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar ston na /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa dag / tshes de dag gis yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar ston na /
translated: “Venerable ones, if those days are taught to be nirvāṇa,

original: chos de dag kyang stong pa dpen pa gzung du med pa'o //
analyzed: chos de dag kyang stong pa dpen pa gzung du med pa'o //
translated: those phenomena are empty, secluded, and ungraspable.

original: tshe dang ldan pa dag 'di lta ste /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa dag 'di lta ste /
translated: Venerable ones, it is like this:

original: mya ngan las 'das pa'i 'du shes spongs shig /'du shes la yang 'du shes su ma byed cing //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa'i 'du shes spongs shig /'du shes la yang 'du shes su ma byed cing //
translated: Abandon the notion of nirvāṇa, do not conceive of notions,🔽and do not fully understand notions with notions.

original: 'du shes la 'du shes kyis yongs su shes par ma byed cig / gang 'du shes la 'du shes kyis yongs su shes pa de'i de ni 'du shes la yongs su bcings pa yin no //
analyzed: 'du shes la 'du shes kyis yongs su shes par ma byed cig / gang 'du shes la 'du shes kyis yongs su shes pa de'i de ni 'du shes la yongs su bcings pa yin no //
translated: For whoever fully understands notions with notions, that is a full bondage to notions.🔽Venerable ones, enter into the meditative absorption that stops notions and feelings.

original: tshe dang ldan pa dag / khyed 'du shes dang tshor ba 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la snyoms par zhugs shig / tshe dang ldan pa dag / dge slong 'du shes dang tshor ba 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la snyoms par zhugs pa las gong na
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa dag / khyed 'du shes dang tshor ba 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la snyoms par zhugs shig / tshe dang ldan pa dag / dge slong 'du shes dang tshor ba 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la snyoms par zhugs pa las gong na
translated: Venerable ones, for a monk who has entered into the meditative absorption that stops notions and feelings, there is no activity🔽above, below, or in the crosswise direction.”

original: bya ba med do zhes smra'o //
analyzed: bya ba med do zhes smra'o //
translated: “There is no activity.”

original: chos kyi rnam grangs 'di bshad pa'i tshe dge slong lnga brgya po de dag len pa med par zag pa rnams las sems rnam par grol lo //
analyzed: chos kyi rnam grangs 'di bshad pa'i tshe dge slong lnga brgya po de dag len pa med par zag pa rnams las sems rnam par grol lo //
translated: When this Dharma discourse was being taught, the minds of those five hundred monks were liberated from defilements with no further grasping.

original: de dag sems rnam par grol nas bcom ldan 'das gal ba der dong ste lhags pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la mgo bos phyag 'tshal te /
analyzed: de dag sems rnam par grol nas bcom ldan 'das gal ba der dong ste lhags pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la mgo bos phyag 'tshal te /
translated: With their minds liberated, they went to where the Blessed One was, bowed their heads at his feet,

original: phyogs gcig tu 'khod do //
analyzed: phyogs gcig tu 'khod do //
translated: and sat to one side.

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis dge slong dag la 'di skad ces @16a * //
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis dge slong dag la 'di skad ces @16a * //
translated: Then the venerable Subhūti said to the monks,

original: smras so // tshe dang ldan pa dag gar dong /
analyzed: smras so // tshe dang ldan pa dag gar dong /
translated: “Venerable ones, where are you going?

original: gang nas lhags /
analyzed: gang nas lhags /
translated: Where have you come from?”

original: de dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: de dag gis smras pa /
translated: They replied,

original: btsun pa rab 'byor gang du yang 'gro ba med pa dang / gang nas kyang 'ong ba med pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis chos bstan to //
analyzed: btsun pa rab 'byor gang du yang 'gro ba med pa dang / gang nas kyang 'ong ba med pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis chos bstan to //
translated: “Venerable Subhūti, the Blessed One has taught the Dharma so that there is nowhere to go and nothing to come from.”

original: smras pa tshe dang ldan pa dag khyed kyi ston pa gang yin /
analyzed: smras pa tshe dang ldan pa dag khyed kyi ston pa gang yin /
translated: Subhūti said, “Venerable ones, who is your teacher?”

original: smras pa gang ma skyes shing yongs su mya ngan las mi 'da' ba'o //
analyzed: smras pa gang ma skyes shing yongs su mya ngan las mi 'da' ba'o //
translated: They replied, “The one who has not been born and will not pass into parinirvāṇa.”

original: smras pa khyed kyis ji ltar chos thos /
analyzed: smras pa khyed kyis ji ltar chos thos /
translated: “How did you hear the Dharma?”

original: smras pa bcings pa'i phyir yang ma yin /
analyzed: smras pa bcings pa'i phyir yang ma yin /
translated: “Not for the sake of bondage,

original: thar pa'i phyir yang ma yin no //
analyzed: thar pa'i phyir yang ma yin no //
translated: nor for the sake of liberation.”

original: smras pa khyed sus btul /
analyzed: smras pa khyed sus btul /
translated: “Who is your teacher?”

original: smras pa su la lus med cing sems med pas so //
analyzed: smras pa su la lus med cing sems med pas so //
translated: “He who has no body and no mind.”

original: smras pa khyed ji ltar brtson //
analyzed: smras pa khyed ji ltar brtson //
translated: “What is your practice?”

original: smras pa ma rig pa spang ba'i phyir yang ma yin rig pa skyed pa'i phyir yang ma yin no //
analyzed: smras pa ma rig pa spang ba'i phyir yang ma yin rig pa skyed pa'i phyir yang ma yin no //
translated: “Not for the sake of eliminating ignorance, nor for the sake of producing knowledge.”

original: smras pa khyod ji ltar rnam par grol /
analyzed: smras pa khyod ji ltar rnam par grol /
translated: “How are you liberated?”

original: smras pa sbyor ba'i phyir yang ma yin /
analyzed: smras pa sbyor ba'i phyir yang ma yin /
translated: “Not for the sake of union,

original: spang ba'i phyir yang ma yin no //
analyzed: spang ba'i phyir yang ma yin no //
translated: nor for the sake of separation.”

original: smras pa khyed su'i nyan thos /
analyzed: smras pa khyed su'i nyan thos /
translated: “Who is your disciple?”

original: smras pa gang gis thob pa med cing mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa med pa'i'o //
analyzed: smras pa gang gis thob pa med cing mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa med pa'i'o //
translated: “He who has nothing to attain and nothing to fully awaken to.”

original: smras pa khyed kyi tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa gang /
analyzed: smras pa khyed kyi tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa gang /
translated: “Who are your companions in the holy life?”

original: smras pa gang khams gsum na mi rgyu ba rnams so //
analyzed: smras pa gang khams gsum na mi rgyu ba rnams so //
translated: “Those who do not move through the three realms.”

original: smras pa tshe dang ldan pa dag ji srid cig na yongs su mya ngan las 'da'/
analyzed: smras pa tshe dang ldan pa dag ji srid cig na yongs su mya ngan las 'da'/
translated: “Venerable ones, when will you pass into complete nirvāṇa?”

original: smras pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i sprul pa nam yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba na'o //
analyzed: smras pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i sprul pa nam yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba na'o //
translated: “When the emanations of the Tathāgata pass into complete nirvāṇa.”

original: smras pa khyod kyis bya ba byas sam /
analyzed: smras pa khyod kyis bya ba byas sam /
translated: “Have you done what you had to do?”

original: smras pa ngar 'dzin pa dang nga yir 'dzin pa yongs su shes pas so //
analyzed: smras pa ngar 'dzin pa dang nga yir 'dzin pa yongs su shes pas so //
translated: “We have, through the complete understanding of grasping at ‘I’ and grasping at ‘mine.’”

original: smras pa khyed kyi nyon mongs pa zad dam /
analyzed: smras pa khyed kyi nyon mongs pa zad dam /
translated: “Have you exhausted your afflictions?”

original: smras pa chos thams cad gtan du zad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: smras pa chos thams cad gtan du zad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “We have, because all phenomena are ultimately exhausted.”

original: smras pa khyed kyis bdud btul lam /
analyzed: smras pa khyed kyis bdud btul lam /
translated: “Have you subdued the māras?”

original: smras pa phung po'i bdud mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: smras pa phung po'i bdud mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “We have, because we do not observe the māra of the aggregates.”

original: smras pa khyed kyis ston pa la bsnyen bkur byas sam /
analyzed: smras pa khyed kyis ston pa la bsnyen bkur byas sam /
translated: “Have you served the Teacher?”

original: smras pa lus kyis kyang ma byas /
analyzed: smras pa lus kyis kyang ma byas /
translated: “We have not served him with our bodies,

original: ngag gis kyang ma byas /
analyzed: ngag gis kyang ma byas /
translated: nor with our speech,

original: sems kyis kyang ma byas so //
analyzed: sems kyis kyang ma byas so //
translated: nor with our minds.”

original: smras pa khyod kyis yon gnas kyis sbyangs sam /
analyzed: smras pa khyod kyis yon gnas kyis sbyangs sam /
translated: “Have you purified the field of merit?”

original: smras pa 'dzin pa med cing sdud pa med pas so //
analyzed: smras pa 'dzin pa med cing sdud pa med pas so //
translated: “We have, because we do not grasp and we do not accumulate.”

original: smras pa khyed 'khor ba las rgal tam /
analyzed: smras pa khyed 'khor ba las rgal tam /
translated: They replied, “Have you crossed over saṃsāra?”

original: smras pa chad pa med cing rtag pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: smras pa chad pa med cing rtag pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They replied, “Because there is no annihilation and no permanence.”

original: smras pa khyed yon gnas kyi sar zhugs sam /
analyzed: smras pa khyed yon gnas kyi sar zhugs sam /
translated: They said, “Have you entered the ground of the field of merit?”

original: smras pa 'dzin pa thams cad las rnam par grol ba'i phyir ro //🔽smras pa tshe dang ldan pa dag gar 'gro /
analyzed: smras pa 'dzin pa thams cad las rnam par grol ba'i phyir ro // smras pa tshe dang ldan pa dag gar 'gro /
translated: They replied, “Because we are completely liberated from all grasping.”🔽They said, “Venerable ones, where are you going?”

original: @16b smras pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i sprul pa gang du bzhud par ro //
analyzed: @16b smras pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i sprul pa gang du bzhud par ro //
translated: They replied, “To where the emanations of the Tathāgata go.”

original: de ltar tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis yongs su dris te /
analyzed: de ltar tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis yongs su dris te /
translated: In this way, the venerable Subhūti asked questions,

original: dge slong de dag gis lan btab nas 'khor de'i dge slong brgyad brgya ni len pa med par zag pa rnams las sems rnam par grol lo //
analyzed: dge slong de dag gis lan btab nas 'khor de'i dge slong brgyad brgya ni len pa med par zag pa rnams las sems rnam par grol lo //
translated: and when those monks had answered, the minds of eight hundred monks in that assembly were liberated from the contaminations without further appropriation.

original: srog chags sum khri nyis stong ni chos rnams la chos kyi mig rdul med cing dri ma dang bral ba rnam par dag go zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: srog chags sum khri nyis stong ni chos rnams la chos kyi mig rdul med cing dri ma dang bral ba rnam par dag go zhes gsungs so //
translated: And thirty-two thousand living beings purified the stainless and immaculate eye of Dharma with regard to phenomena.”

original: de ltar na dge slong de bzhin gshegs pa'i sprul pa brdzun pa'i rang bzhin can gnyis kyis dge slong lnga brgya'i rnam par byang ba'i rgyu byas pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na dge slong de bzhin gshegs pa'i sprul pa brdzun pa'i rang bzhin can gnyis kyis dge slong lnga brgya'i rnam par byang ba'i rgyu byas pa yin no //
translated: Thus, two monks who were emanations of the Tathāgata served as causes for the purification of the five hundred monks.

original: 'phags pa rdo rje snying po las kyang /
analyzed: 'phags pa rdo rje snying po las kyang /
translated: And the noble Vajra-Heart says,

original: 'jam dpal 'di lta ste dper na /
analyzed: 'jam dpal 'di lta ste dper na /
translated: Mañjuśrī, it is like this:

original: gtsub shing dang gtsub gtan la brten /
analyzed: gtsub shing dang gtsub gtan la brten /
translated: depending on the fire stick and the stick for churning,

original: mi'i lag pa'i rtsol ba la brten nas du ba 'byung zhing /
analyzed: mi'i lag pa'i rtsol ba la brten nas du ba 'byung zhing /
translated: depending on the effort of the person’s hands, smoke appears

original: me mngon par 'grub ste /
analyzed: me mngon par 'grub ste /
translated: and fire is produced.

original: me de yang gtsub shing la yang mi gnas gtsub gtan la yang mi gnas /
analyzed: me de yang gtsub shing la yang mi gnas gtsub gtan la yang mi gnas /
translated: But that fire does not rest in the fire stick, nor does it rest in the stick for churning,

original: mi'i lag pa'i rtsol ba la yang mi gnas so //
analyzed: mi'i lag pa'i rtsol ba la yang mi gnas so //
translated: nor does it rest in the effort of the person’s hands.

original: 'jam dpal de bzhin du med pa las skyes bu gang zag rmongs pa la 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug gi yongs su gdung ba 'ang 'byung ste /
analyzed: 'jam dpal de bzhin du med pa las skyes bu gang zag rmongs pa la 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug gi yongs su gdung ba 'ang 'byung ste /
translated: Mañjuśrī, in the same way, in the absence of anything, the burning of desire, hatred, and ignorance appears in deluded persons.

original: yongs su gdung ba de yang nang na yang mi gnas phyi rol na'ang mi gnas /
analyzed: yongs su gdung ba de yang nang na yang mi gnas phyi rol na'ang mi gnas /
translated: And that burning does not rest internally, nor does it rest externally,

original: gnyi ga med par yang mi gnas mod kyi /
analyzed: gnyi ga med par yang mi gnas mod kyi /
translated: They do not abide in the absence of both.

original: 'jam dpal 'on kyang gti mug ces bya'o //
analyzed: 'jam dpal 'on kyang gti mug ces bya'o //
translated: Mañjuśrī, nevertheless, it is called delusion.

original: de ci'i phyir gti mug ces brjod par bya zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir gti mug ces brjod par bya zhe na /
translated: Why is it called delusion?

original: 'jam dpal gti mug ni chos thams cad rab tu grol ba ste /
analyzed: 'jam dpal gti mug ni chos thams cad rab tu grol ba ste /
translated: Mañjuśrī, delusion is the complete liberation of all phenomena.🔽Therefore, it is called delusion.

original: des na gti mug ces bya'o zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du 'jam dpal chos thams cad ni sems can dmyal ba'i sgo ste /
analyzed: des na gti mug ces bya'o zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du 'jam dpal chos thams cad ni sems can dmyal ba'i sgo ste /
translated: And likewise, Mañjuśrī, all phenomena are the gateway to the hells.

original: 'di ni gzungs kyi tshig go //
analyzed: 'di ni gzungs kyi tshig go //
translated: This is the dhāraṇī-dhāraṇī.

original: gsol ba bcom ldan 'das ji ltar na 'di gzungs kyi tshig lags /
analyzed: gsol ba bcom ldan 'das ji ltar na 'di gzungs kyi tshig lags /
translated: Mañjuśrī said, “Blessed One, how is this a dhāraṇī-dhāraṇī?”

original: bka' stsal pa 'jam dpal sems can dmyal ba dag ni byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams kyis yod pa ma yin pa la phyin ci log gis bsgrubs shing /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa 'jam dpal sems can dmyal ba dag ni byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams kyis yod pa ma yin pa la phyin ci log gis bsgrubs shing /
translated: The Blessed One said, “Mañjuśrī, the hells are accomplished by foolish ordinary beings through error in what does not exist.

original: rang gi rnam par rtog pa las byung ba'o //
analyzed: rang gi rnam par rtog pa las byung ba'o //
translated: They arise from their own conceptualization.

original: gsol pa bcom ldan 'das sems can dmyal ba dag gang du yang dag par 'du bar 'gyur /
analyzed: gsol pa bcom ldan 'das sems can dmyal ba dag gang du yang dag par 'du bar 'gyur /
translated: Mañjuśrī said, “Blessed One, where do the hells come together?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: 'jam dpal sems can dmyal ba dag ni nam mkhar yang dag par 'du bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'jam dpal sems can dmyal ba dag ni nam mkhar yang dag par 'du bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Mañjuśrī, the hells will gather in the sky.

original: 'jam dpal de ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: 'jam dpal de ji snyam du sems /
translated: Mañjuśrī, what do you think?

original: @17a * // sems can dmyal ba rang gi rnam par rtog pa las byung ngam /
analyzed: @17a * // sems can dmyal ba rang gi rnam par rtog pa las byung ngam /
translated: Are the hells produced from one’s own thoughts,

original: 'on te ngo bo nyid las byung /
analyzed: 'on te ngo bo nyid las byung /
translated: or are they produced from their own nature?

original: gsol pa bcom ldan 'das byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams ni rang gi rnam par rtog pa kho nas sems can dmyal ba dang / dud 'gro'i skye gnas dang / gshin rje'i 'jig rten du 'du shes te /
analyzed: gsol pa bcom ldan 'das byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams ni rang gi rnam par rtog pa kho nas sems can dmyal ba dang / dud 'gro'i skye gnas dang / gshin rje'i 'jig rten du 'du shes te /
translated: The Blessed One said, “Mañjuśrī, childish ordinary beings, due to their own thoughts, perceive the hells, the animal realm, and the world of Yama.

original: de dag ma mchis pa la sgro btags pa'i slad du tshor ba sdug bsngal myong zhing /
analyzed: de dag ma mchis pa la sgro btags pa'i slad du tshor ba sdug bsngal myong zhing /
translated: Because they superimpose what does not exist, they experience the feeling of suffering.

original: ngan song gsum du sdug bsngal nyams su myong bar 'gyur lags so //
analyzed: ngan song gsum du sdug bsngal nyams su myong bar 'gyur lags so //
translated: They experience the suffering of the three lower realms.”

original: bcom ldan 'das bdag gis ni ji ltar sems can dmyal ba ma khums pa de bzhin du sems can dmyal ba'i sdug bsngal yang ma khums so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das bdag gis ni ji ltar sems can dmyal ba ma khums pa de bzhin du sems can dmyal ba'i sdug bsngal yang ma khums so //
translated: “Blessed One, just as I do not see the hells, in the same way I do not see the suffering of the hells.

original: bcom ldan 'das 'di lta ste skyes bu la la zhig gnyid kyis log ste rmi lam na bdag nyid sems can dmyal bar ltung bar 'du shes par 'gyur la /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das 'di lta ste skyes bu la la zhig gnyid kyis log ste rmi lam na bdag nyid sems can dmyal bar ltung bar 'du shes par 'gyur la /
translated: Blessed One, it is like this: a certain person, having fallen asleep, in a dream perceives himself falling into a hell.

original: des de ni lcags kyi bum pa skyes bu du ma dang ldan pa khol ba 'bar bar bdag nyid bcug par yang 'du shes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des de ni lcags kyi bum pa skyes bu du ma dang ldan pa khol ba 'bar bar bdag nyid bcug par yang 'du shes par 'gyur ro //
translated: He perceives himself being placed in a burning iron pot by many people.

original: des de na sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba drag cing mi bzad la brnag par dka' zhing yid du mi 'ong ba myong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des de na sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba drag cing mi bzad la brnag par dka' zhing yid du mi 'ong ba myong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: He experiences there a painful, sharp, unbearable, unpleasant feeling.

original: des de na yid kyi gdung ba yongs su myang bar 'gyur /
analyzed: des de na yid kyi gdung ba yongs su myang bar 'gyur /
translated: He experiences there a mental anguish.

original: de de na skrag par 'gyur /🔽dngangs par 'gyur /
analyzed: de de na skrag par 'gyur / dngangs par 'gyur /
translated: He is frightened there.🔽He is terrified there.

original: kun tu dngangs par 'gyur ro //🔽de de nas sad par 'gyur zhing rlom pa dang bcas pas kyi ma sdug bsngal lo //
analyzed: kun tu dngangs par 'gyur ro // de de nas sad par 'gyur zhing rlom pa dang bcas pas kyi ma sdug bsngal lo //
translated: He is completely terrified there.🔽He wakes up from that, and with conceit, he cries out, “Alas, suffering!

original: kye ma sdug bsngal lo zhes du zhing cho nges 'debs la smre sngags 'don par 'gyur lags so //
analyzed: kye ma sdug bsngal lo zhes du zhing cho nges 'debs la smre sngags 'don par 'gyur lags so //
translated: Alas, suffering!” and he wails and laments.

original: de nas de la grogs po dang gnyen dang snag gi gnyen mtshams rnams kyis ci zhig gis 'di ltar khyod sdug bsngal bar gyur zhes dris pa dang / de grogs po dang gnyen dang snag gi gnyen mtshams de dag la 'di skad du ngas ni sems can dmyal ba'i sdug bsngal nyams su myong ngo zhes smra bar bgyid /
analyzed: de nas de la grogs po dang gnyen dang snag gi gnyen mtshams rnams kyis ci zhig gis 'di ltar khyod sdug bsngal bar gyur zhes dris pa dang / de grogs po dang gnyen dang snag gi gnyen mtshams de dag la 'di skad du ngas ni sems can dmyal ba'i sdug bsngal nyams su myong ngo zhes smra bar bgyid /
translated: He will say to them, ‘I have experienced the suffering of the hell realms.’

original: de bdag gis ni sems can dmyal ba'i sdug bsngal nyams su myong na /
analyzed: de bdag gis ni sems can dmyal ba'i sdug bsngal nyams su myong na /
translated: ‘We have experienced the suffering of the hell realms,

original: khyed cag ci zhig gis 'di ltar khyed sdug bsngal bar gyur zhes 'dri par byed dam zhes de dag la cho nges 'debs par bgyid /
analyzed: khyed cag ci zhig gis 'di ltar khyed sdug bsngal bar gyur zhes 'dri par byed dam zhes de dag la cho nges 'debs par bgyid /
translated: so why are you asking us, “Why are you suffering like this?”’

original: spyo bar bgyid do //
analyzed: spyo bar bgyid do //
translated: He will shout at them and scold them.

original: de nas skyes bu de la grogs po dang gnyen dang snag gi gnyen mtshams de dag 'di skad du /
analyzed: de nas skyes bu de la grogs po dang gnyen dang snag gi gnyen mtshams de dag 'di skad du /
translated: Then his friends, relatives, and blood relations will say to him,

original: kye skyes bu mi 'jigs shig ma 'jigs shig khyod ni gnyid kyis log pa yin gyi /
analyzed: kye skyes bu mi 'jigs shig ma 'jigs shig khyod ni gnyid kyis log pa yin gyi /
translated: ‘Hey, man, don’t be afraid, don’t be afraid! You were asleep.

original: khyod khyim 'di nas gar @17b yang song ba med do zhes smra bar bgyid do //
analyzed: khyod khyim 'di nas gar @17b yang song ba med do zhes smra bar bgyid do //
translated: “You have not gone anywhere from this house.”

original: de yang bdag ni gnyid kyis log par gyur te /
analyzed: de yang bdag ni gnyid kyis log par gyur te /
translated: “I was asleep and dreaming.

original: yang dag pa ma yin pa 'di bdag gis kun du brtags so snyam du de la dran pa skye bar 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: yang dag pa ma yin pa 'di bdag gis kun du brtags so snyam du de la dran pa skye bar 'gyur zhing /
translated: I imagined all this that is not so.”

original: slar yang de yid bde ba 'thob par 'gyur lags so //
analyzed: slar yang de yid bde ba 'thob par 'gyur lags so //
translated: “And so he regains his composure.

original: bcom ldan 'das ji ltar skyes bu gnyid kyis log pa de yod pa ma yin pa la sgro btags nas bdag nyid rmi lam du dmyal bar song bas 'du shes par 'gyur ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ji ltar skyes bu gnyid kyis log pa de yod pa ma yin pa la sgro btags nas bdag nyid rmi lam du dmyal bar song bas 'du shes par 'gyur ba de bzhin du /
translated: “Blessed One, just as that man, while asleep and dreaming, imagines that he has gone to hell, even though he is not,

original: bcom ldan 'das byis pa so so'i skye bo bden pa ma lags pa'i 'dod chags kyis kun nas bcings pa thams cad bud med la mtshan mar rtog par bgyid do //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das byis pa so so'i skye bo bden pa ma lags pa'i 'dod chags kyis kun nas bcings pa thams cad bud med la mtshan mar rtog par bgyid do //
translated: “Blessed One, in the same way, all foolish ordinary beings, bound by false desire, imagine that women have defining characteristics.

original: de dag bud med la mtshan mar brtags nas bdag nyid de dag dang lhan cig rtse zhing dga' bar 'du shes so //
analyzed: de dag bud med la mtshan mar brtags nas bdag nyid de dag dang lhan cig rtse zhing dga' bar 'du shes so //
translated: Imagining that women have defining characteristics, they imagine that they are playing and enjoying themselves with them.

original: byis pa so so'i skye bo de 'di snyam du bdag ni skyes pa'o //
analyzed: byis pa so so'i skye bo de 'di snyam du bdag ni skyes pa'o //
translated: “Childish ordinary beings think, ‘I am a man.’

original: 'di ni bud med do //
analyzed: 'di ni bud med do //
translated: ‘This is a woman.’🔽‘This woman is mine.’

original: bud med 'di bdag gi'o snyam du 'gyur zhing de 'dun pa'i 'dod chags kyis kun nas dkris pa'i sems des longs spyod tshol bar sems 'jug par 'gyur lags so //
analyzed: bud med 'di bdag gi'o snyam du 'gyur zhing de 'dun pa'i 'dod chags kyis kun nas dkris pa'i sems des longs spyod tshol bar sems 'jug par 'gyur lags so //
translated: With a mind that is completely bound by desirous attachment, they pursue enjoyments.

original: de gzhi de las 'thab pa dang rtsod pa dang g-yul 'gyed par bgyid cing /
analyzed: de gzhi de las 'thab pa dang rtsod pa dang g-yul 'gyed par bgyid cing /
translated: On that basis, they fight, argue, and quarrel.

original: gdug pa'i dbang po dang ldan pa de la khon du 'dzin pa 'byung bar 'gyur lags so //
analyzed: gdug pa'i dbang po dang ldan pa de la khon du 'dzin pa 'byung bar 'gyur lags so //
translated: They become angry and hold grudges.

original: rlom pa dang bcas pa de 'du shes phyin ci log des 'chi ba'i dus bgyis par gyur nas bdag nyid bskal pa stong phrag mang por sems can dmyal ba dag tu sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba myong bar 'du shes so //
analyzed: rlom pa dang bcas pa de 'du shes phyin ci log des 'chi ba'i dus bgyis par gyur nas bdag nyid bskal pa stong phrag mang por sems can dmyal ba dag tu sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba myong bar 'du shes so //
translated: With such mistaken perceptions, they die and think, ‘For many thousands of eons, I will experience the suffering of the hells.’

original: bcom ldan 'das ji ltar skyes bu de la grogs po dang / gnyen dang snag gi gnyen mtshams rnams kyis 'di skad du kye skyes bu ma 'jigs shig ma 'jigs shig khyod ni gnyid kyis log pa yin gyi /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ji ltar skyes bu de la grogs po dang / gnyen dang snag gi gnyen mtshams rnams kyis 'di skad du kye skyes bu ma 'jigs shig ma 'jigs shig khyod ni gnyid kyis log pa yin gyi /
translated: You are asleep.

original: khyod khyim 'di nas gar yang song ba med do zhes smra bar bgyid pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: khyod khyim 'di nas gar yang song ba med do zhes smra bar bgyid pa de bzhin du /
translated: You have not gone anywhere from this house,’

original: bcom ldan 'das sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis kyang phyin ci log bzhis phyin ci log tu gyur pa'i sems can rnams la 'di skad du chos bstan te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis kyang phyin ci log bzhis phyin ci log tu gyur pa'i sems can rnams la 'di skad du chos bstan te /
translated: in the same way, Blessed One, the blessed buddhas teach the Dharma to sentient beings who are deluded by the four errors, saying,

original: 'di la bud med kyang med /
analyzed: 'di la bud med kyang med /
translated: ‘Here there is no woman,

original: skyes pa yang med /
analyzed: skyes pa yang med /
translated: no man,

original: sems can yang med /🔽sreg kyang med /
analyzed: sems can yang med / sreg kyang med /
translated: no sentient being,🔽no life-force,

original: gso ba yang med /
analyzed: gso ba yang med /
translated: no nourisher,

original: gang zag kyang med de /
analyzed: gang zag kyang med de /
translated: and no person.

original: chos 'di dag thams cad na lag pa /
analyzed: chos 'di dag thams cad na lag pa /
translated: All these phenomena are like a banana tree—hollow and without substance.

original: chos 'di dag thams cad ni yod pa ma yin pa /
analyzed: chos 'di dag thams cad ni yod pa ma yin pa /
translated: All these phenomena are nonexistent.

original: chos 'di dag thams cad @18a * //
analyzed: chos 'di dag thams cad @18a * //
translated: All these phenomena

original: ni phyin ci log gis bsgrubs pa /
analyzed: ni phyin ci log gis bsgrubs pa /
translated: are established by error.

original: chos 'di dag thams cad ni sgyu ma lta bu /🔽chos 'di dag thams cad ni rmi lam lta bu /
analyzed: chos 'di dag thams cad ni sgyu ma lta bu / chos 'di dag thams cad ni rmi lam lta bu /
translated: All these phenomena are like an illusion.🔽All these phenomena are like a dream.

original: chos 'di dag thams cad ni sbrul pa lta bu /
analyzed: chos 'di dag thams cad ni sbrul pa lta bu /
translated: All these phenomena are like a magical creation.🔽All these phenomena are like a reflection of the moon in water.

original: chos 'di dag thams cad ni chu zla lta bu ste zhes rgyas par 'byung ba dang / de bzhin du de dag de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos bstan pa thos nas chos thams cad 'dod chags dang bral bar khums so //
analyzed: chos 'di dag thams cad ni chu zla lta bu ste zhes rgyas par 'byung ba dang / de bzhin du de dag de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos bstan pa thos nas chos thams cad 'dod chags dang bral bar khums so //
translated: In the same way, when they hear the Tathāgata’s teaching of the Dharma, they understand that all phenomena are free from attachment.

original: chos thams cad zhe sdang dang bral ba dang / gti mug dang bral ba dang / ngo bo nyid med pa dang sgrib pa med par khums so //
analyzed: chos thams cad zhe sdang dang bral ba dang / gti mug dang bral ba dang / ngo bo nyid med pa dang sgrib pa med par khums so //
translated: They understand that all phenomena are free from aversion, free from delusion, essenceless, and unobstructed.

original: de dag sems nam mkha' la gnas pas 'chi ba'i dus bgyid par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: de dag sems nam mkha' la gnas pas 'chi ba'i dus bgyid par 'gyur zhing /
translated: Since their minds abide in space, they die.

original: 'chi ba'i dus bgyis ma thag tu phung po lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ste /
analyzed: 'chi ba'i dus bgyis ma thag tu phung po lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ste /
translated: Immediately after they die, they pass into complete nirvāṇa in the element of nirvāṇa without any remainder of the skandhas.

original: bcom ldan 'das de ltar bdag gis sems can dmyal ba khums lags so zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de ltar bdag gis sems can dmyal ba khums lags so zhes gsungs so //
translated: Blessed One, I have seen the hell of the wailing hell beings.

original: 'phags pa nye ba 'khor gyis zhus pa las kyang /
analyzed: 'phags pa nye ba 'khor gyis zhus pa las kyang /
translated: And in the noble Inquiry of Upāli,

original: sems dmyal 'jigs pa nga yis bstan byas te //
analyzed: sems dmyal 'jigs pa nga yis bstan byas te //
translated: I have taught the terrors of the hells,

original: sems can stong phrag du ma skyo byas kyang //
analyzed: sems can stong phrag du ma skyo byas kyang //
translated: And have made many thousands of beings feel revulsion,🔽But I have never seen any beings

original: gang dag shi 'phos ngan song drag 'gro ba'i //🔽'gro ba de dag nam yang yod ma yin //
analyzed: gang dag shi 'phos ngan song drag 'gro ba'i // 'gro ba de dag nam yang yod ma yin //
translated: Who, having died and passed on, go to a terrible lower realm.

original: gang dag ral gri mda' chen mtshon 'byin pa'i //🔽gnod pa byed pa yod pa ma yin te //
analyzed: gang dag ral gri mda' chen mtshon 'byin pa'i // gnod pa byed pa yod pa ma yin te //
translated: The weapons that are used to harm them

original: rtog pa'i dbang gis ngan song de dag na //
analyzed: rtog pa'i dbang gis ngan song de dag na //
translated: Are not real, but are seen because of their thoughts.

original: lus la 'bab mthong de na mtshon cha med //
analyzed: lus la 'bab mthong de na mtshon cha med //
translated: They see weapons falling on their bodies🔽In the lower realms, which are created by their thoughts.

original: sna tshogs yid dga' me tog kha bye zhing //
analyzed: sna tshogs yid dga' me tog kha bye zhing //
translated: The beautiful, delightful, and varied flowers,

original: gser gyi khang mchog 'bar ba yid 'ong ba //
analyzed: gser gyi khang mchog 'bar ba yid 'ong ba //
translated: And the delightful, blazing, golden palaces,

original: 'di na de la 'ang byed pa 'ga' med do //
analyzed: 'di na de la 'ang byed pa 'ga' med do //
translated: Are not created by anyone.

original: de dag rtog pa'i dbang gis gzhag pa yin //
analyzed: de dag rtog pa'i dbang gis gzhag pa yin //
translated: They are created by the power of thoughts.

original: rtog pa'i dbang gis 'jig rten rnam brtags te //
analyzed: rtog pa'i dbang gis 'jig rten rnam brtags te //
translated: The world is imagined by the power of thought.

original: 'du shes 'dzin pas byis pa rnam par phye //
analyzed: 'du shes 'dzin pas byis pa rnam par phye //
translated: The childish are distinguished by their discriminations.

original: 'dzin dang 'dzin med de yang 'byung min te //🔽yongs su rtog pa sgyu ma smig rgyu bzhin //
analyzed: 'dzin dang 'dzin med de yang 'byung min te // yongs su rtog pa sgyu ma smig rgyu bzhin //
translated: But neither grasping nor non-grasping occurs.

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: Imagination is like a magical creation or a mirage.

original: de'i phyir de ltar na dngos po yod pa ma yin pa'i rang bzhin can phyin ci log gis bzhag pa rnams ni 'khor ba na byis pa rnams kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rgyur 'gyur ro zhes bya bar gnas so //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar na dngos po yod pa ma yin pa'i rang bzhin can phyin ci log gis bzhag pa rnams ni 'khor ba na byis pa rnams kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rgyur 'gyur ro zhes bya bar gnas so //
translated: Thus, those things which are essentially non-existent, but are posited by error, are the cause of the defilement of the childish in cyclic existence.

original: dngos po brdzun pa'i rang bzhin can rnams ji ltar kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i rgyu nyid yin pa de ltar ni rgyas par dbu ma la 'jug pa las nges par bya'o //
analyzed: dngos po brdzun pa'i rang bzhin can rnams ji ltar kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i rgyu nyid yin pa de ltar ni rgyas par dbu ma la 'jug pa las nges par bya'o //
translated: How things which are essentially false can be the cause of defilement and purification should be understood in detail from the Madhyamakavatara.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here someone might say:

original: @18b gal te bdag dang gzhan dang gnyi ga dang rgyu med pa las dngos po rnams skye ba yod pa ma yin na /
analyzed: @18b gal te bdag dang gzhan dang gnyi ga dang rgyu med pa las dngos po rnams skye ba yod pa ma yin na /
translated: If things do not arise from self, from another, from both, or causelessly,

original: ji ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed rnams zhes gsungs /🔽bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: ji ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed rnams zhes gsungs / bshad par bya ste /
translated: How does the Lord state that formations are conditioned by ignorance?

original: 'di ni kun rdzob pa yin gyi de kho na nyid ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni kun rdzob pa yin gyi de kho na nyid ni ma yin no //
translated: This is a conventional truth, not an ultimate truth.

original: ci kun rdzob kyi rnam par gzhag pa brjod par bya ba yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: ci kun rdzob kyi rnam par gzhag pa brjod par bya ba yin nam zhe na /
translated: Should the conventional truth be stated?

original: rkyen nyid 'di pa tsam gyis kun rdzob grub par khas len gyi /
analyzed: rkyen nyid 'di pa tsam gyis kun rdzob grub par khas len gyi /
translated: We accept that the conventional truth is established by mere conditionedness.

original: phyogs bzhi khas blangs pa'i sgo nas ni ma yin te /
analyzed: phyogs bzhi khas blangs pa'i sgo nas ni ma yin te /
translated: We do not accept it from the four positions,

original: dngos po rang bzhin dang bcas pa smra bar thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir dang / de yang rigs pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po rang bzhin dang bcas pa smra bar thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir dang / de yang rigs pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would follow, absurdly, that we would be propounding that things have essences, and that is illogical.

original: rkyen nyid 'di pa tsam zhig khas blangs na ni rgyu dang 'bras bu gnyis phan tshun ltos pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rkyen nyid 'di pa tsam zhig khas blangs na ni rgyu dang 'bras bu gnyis phan tshun ltos pa'i phyir /
translated: If we accept mere conditionedness, then because cause and effect are mutually dependent,

original: ngo bo nyid kyis grub pa yod pa ma yin pas dngos po rang bzhin dang bcas par smra bar 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyis grub pa yod pa ma yin pas dngos po rang bzhin dang bcas par smra bar 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: they do not exist inherently, and so we do not become proponents of things having essences.

original: de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: For this very reason,

original: sdug bsngal rang gis byas pa dang // gzhan gyis byas dang gnyi gas byas //
analyzed: sdug bsngal rang gis byas pa dang // gzhan gyis byas dang gnyi gas byas //
translated: Suffering is self-produced, produced by another, produced by both,

original: rgyu med rtog ge ba yis 'dod //
analyzed: rgyu med rtog ge ba yis 'dod //
translated: or it arises without a cause.🔽This is the opinion of the philosophers.

original: khyod kyis brtan nas 'byung bar gsungs //🔽zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: khyod kyis brtan nas 'byung bar gsungs // zhes gsungs so //
translated: But you have taught that it arises in dependence.

original: 'di nyid las kyang /🔽byed po las la brten byas shing //🔽las kyang byed po de nyid la //
analyzed: 'di nyid las kyang / byed po las la brten byas shing // las kyang byed po de nyid la //
translated: And in this scripture it is said:🔽The agent is dependent on the action,🔽and the action is dependent on the agent.

original: brten nas 'byung ba ma gtogs pa //
analyzed: brten nas 'byung ba ma gtogs pa //
translated: Apart from this,

original: grub pa'i rgyu ni ma mthong ngo //
analyzed: grub pa'i rgyu ni ma mthong ngo //
translated: no cause for their existence is seen.

original: zhes 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhes 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: And this will be explained.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang de la chos kyi brda ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang de la chos kyi brda ni 'di yin te /
translated: The Blessed One has said this: “This is the conventional expression of the Dharma:

original: 'di lta ste 'di yod pas 'di 'byung la /
analyzed: 'di lta ste 'di yod pas 'di 'byung la /
translated: ‘When this exists, that comes to be;

original: 'di skyes pas 'di skye ste /
analyzed: 'di skyes pas 'di skye ste /
translated: with the arising of this, that arises.

original: gang 'di ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed rnams /
analyzed: gang 'di ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed rnams /
translated: Namely, with ignorance as condition, there are volitions;

original: 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'di tsam zhig kho na gsungs so //
analyzed: 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'di tsam zhig kho na gsungs so //
translated: with volitions as condition, there is consciousness.’ And so on.

original: 'dir 'ga' zhig dag rgol bar byed de /
analyzed: 'dir 'ga' zhig dag rgol bar byed de /
translated: Here, some argue:

original: dngos po rnams skye ba med do snyam pa'i nges pa 'di tshad ma las skyes pa zhig gam /
analyzed: dngos po rnams skye ba med do snyam pa'i nges pa 'di tshad ma las skyes pa zhig gam /
translated: Does this ascertainment that things are not produced arise from a valid cognition?

original: 'on te tshad ma ma yin pa las skyes pa zhig yin grang /
analyzed: 'on te tshad ma ma yin pa las skyes pa zhig yin grang /
translated: Or does it arise from something that is not a valid cognition?

original: de la gal te tshad ma las skyes par 'dod na ni /
analyzed: de la gal te tshad ma las skyes par 'dod na ni /
translated: If you assert that it arises from a valid cognition,

original: tshad ma dag ni du zhig / mtshan nyid ni gang /
analyzed: tshad ma dag ni du zhig / mtshan nyid ni gang /
translated: then how many valid cognitions are there? What are their characteristics?

original: yul dag ni ci zhig / ci bdag las skyes pa zhig gam /
analyzed: yul dag ni ci zhig / ci bdag las skyes pa zhig gam /
translated: What are their objects? Do they arise from themselves,🔽from another, from both, or without a cause?

original: gzhan nam gnyi ga'am rgyu med pa las yin zhes bya ba 'di brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan nam gnyi ga'am rgyu med pa las yin zhes bya ba 'di brjod par bya'o //
translated: You must explain this.

original: 'on te tshad ma ma yin pa las skyes pa yin na ni /
analyzed: 'on te tshad ma ma yin pa las skyes pa yin na ni /
translated: But if it arises from something that is not a valid cognition,

original: de ni mi rigs te /
analyzed: de ni mi rigs te /
translated: that is illogical.

original: gzhal bya rtogs pa ni tshad ma la rag las pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: gzhal bya rtogs pa ni tshad ma la rag las pa'i phyir te /
translated: This is because the realization of an object depends on a valid cognition.

original: @19a * // rtogs par ma gyur pa'i don ni tshad ma med par rtogs par mi nus so //
analyzed: @19a * // rtogs par ma gyur pa'i don ni tshad ma med par rtogs par mi nus so //
translated: An object that has not been realized cannot be realized without a valid cognition.

original: tshad ma med pas don rtogs pa yang med na ni khyod kyi yang dag pa'i nges pa 'di ga las 'gyur te /
analyzed: tshad ma med pas don rtogs pa yang med na ni khyod kyi yang dag pa'i nges pa 'di ga las 'gyur te /
translated: If there is no realization of an object because there is no valid cognition, then how could you have this correct ascertainment?

original: de'i phyir dngos po rnams skye ba med do zhes bya ba 'di ni rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir dngos po rnams skye ba med do zhes bya ba 'di ni rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is illogical to say, “Things do not arise.”

original: yang na khyed kyi dngos po rnams skye ba med do zhes bya ba'i nges pa 'di gang las gyur pa 'di nyid las nga'i dngos po thams cad yod pa yin no zhes bya ba yang yin la /
analyzed: yang na khyed kyi dngos po rnams skye ba med do zhes bya ba'i nges pa 'di gang las gyur pa 'di nyid las nga'i dngos po thams cad yod pa yin no zhes bya ba yang yin la /
translated: Or, if you have a reason for saying, “Things do not arise,” then I also have a reason for saying, “All things exist.”

original: yang ji ltar khyod kyi dngos po thams cad skye ba med do zhes bya ba'i nges pa 'dir 'gyur ba de kho na ltar nga'i dngos po thams cad skye bar yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang ji ltar khyod kyi dngos po thams cad skye ba med do zhes bya ba'i nges pa 'dir 'gyur ba de kho na ltar nga'i dngos po thams cad skye bar yang 'gyur ro //
translated: And just as you have a reason for saying, “All things do not arise,” in the same way I have a reason for saying, “All things arise.”

original: ci ste khyod la dngos po thams cad skye ba med do snyam pa'i nges pa 'di med na ni /
analyzed: ci ste khyod la dngos po thams cad skye ba med do snyam pa'i nges pa 'di med na ni /
translated: But if you do not have a reason for saying, “All things do not arise,”

original: de'i tshe rang nyid kyis kyang ma nges pas gzhan khong du chud par byed pa mi srid pa'i phyir bstan bcos rtsom pa don med pa nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i tshe rang nyid kyis kyang ma nges pas gzhan khong du chud par byed pa mi srid pa'i phyir bstan bcos rtsom pa don med pa nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: then since you yourself have no certainty, it is impossible for you to cause others to understand, and therefore it would be pointless to compose this treatise.

original: des na dngos po thams cad bkag pa med par yod pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: des na dngos po thams cad bkag pa med par yod pa yin no zhe na /
translated: Therefore, all things exist without being refuted.”

original: brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: brjod par bya ste /
translated: We will respond to that.

original: gal te kho bo cag la nges pa zhes bya ba 'ga' zhig yod par 'gyur na ni /🔽de tshad ma las skyes pa'am /
analyzed: gal te kho bo cag la nges pa zhes bya ba 'ga' zhig yod par 'gyur na ni / de tshad ma las skyes pa'am /
translated: If we had something called “ascertainment,”🔽it would arise from a valid cognition

original: tshad ma ma yin pa las skyes pa zhig tu 'gyur na /
analyzed: tshad ma ma yin pa las skyes pa zhig tu 'gyur na /
translated: or it would arise from an invalid cognition.

original: yod pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: yod pa ni ma yin no //
translated: But it does not exist.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'dir ma nges pa yod na ni de la ltos shing de'i gnyen por gyur pa'i nges pa yang yod par 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: 'dir ma nges pa yod na ni de la ltos shing de'i gnyen por gyur pa'i nges pa yang yod par 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: If nonascertainment existed, then in dependence on that, its antidote, ascertainment, would also exist.

original: gang gi tshe re zhig kho bo cag la ma nges pa nyid yod pa ma yin pa de'i tshe ni de dang 'gal ba'i nges pa yod par gal 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang gi tshe re zhig kho bo cag la ma nges pa nyid yod pa ma yin pa de'i tshe ni de dang 'gal ba'i nges pa yod par gal 'gyur te /
translated: But when we do not have nonascertainment, how could ascertainment, which is incompatible with it, exist?

original: 'brel ba can gzhan la ma ltos pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'brel ba can gzhan la ma ltos pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it does not depend on another related object.

original: bong bu'i rva'i ring po dang thung ba nyid bzhin no //
analyzed: bong bu'i rva'i ring po dang thung ba nyid bzhin no //
translated: It is just like the shortness and length of the rabbit’s horns.

original: gang gi tshe de ltar nges pa med pa de'i tshe ci zhig 'grub par bya ba'i phyir tshad ma dag yongs su rtog par byed /
analyzed: gang gi tshe de ltar nges pa med pa de'i tshe ci zhig 'grub par bya ba'i phyir tshad ma dag yongs su rtog par byed /
translated: When ascertainment does not exist in that way, then for the sake of establishing what do you imagine valid cognitions to be?

original: de dag gi grangs dang mtshan nyid dang yul dang / bdag gam gzhan nam gnyi ga'am rgyu med pa las skye zhes bya bar yang ga la 'gyur te /
analyzed: de dag gi grangs dang mtshan nyid dang yul dang / bdag gam gzhan nam gnyi ga'am rgyu med pa las skye zhes bya bar yang ga la 'gyur te /
translated: How could it be said that they arise from a number, from a characteristic, from an object, from a self, from another, from both, or causelessly?

original: 'di dag thams cad ni kho bo cag gis brjod par bya ba ma yin pa zhig go //
analyzed: 'di dag thams cad ni kho bo cag gis brjod par bya ba ma yin pa zhig go //
translated: All of these are not to be expressed by us.

original: gal te de ltar khyod la nges pa yod pa ma yin na /
analyzed: gal te de ltar khyod la nges pa yod pa ma yin na /
translated: If you do not have such certainty,🔽then how could you observe this definitive statement

original: khyed cag gi dngos po rnams ni /
analyzed: khyed cag gi dngos po rnams ni /
translated: that all things

original: bdag las ma yin gzhan las min //
analyzed: bdag las ma yin gzhan las min //
translated: Do not arise from self, nor from another,

original: gnyis las ma yin rgyu med min //🔽zhes bya ba'i nges pa'i rang bzhin gyi ngag 'di ji ltar dmigs zhe na /
analyzed: gnyis las ma yin rgyu med min // zhes bya ba'i nges pa'i rang bzhin gyi ngag 'di ji ltar dmigs zhe na /
translated: Nor from both, nor causelessly?

original: brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: brjod par bya ste /
translated: We respond:

original: nges par gyur pa'i ngag 'di ni rang la grub pa'i 'thad @19b pa'i sgo nas 'jig rten la yod kyi /
analyzed: nges par gyur pa'i ngag 'di ni rang la grub pa'i 'thad @19b pa'i sgo nas 'jig rten la yod kyi /
translated: This definitive statement is based on what is established for us, and it exists for the world,

original: 'phags pa rnams la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'phags pa rnams la ni ma yin no //
translated: but not for āryas.

original: ci 'phags pa rnams la rigs pa mi mnga' 'am zhe na /
analyzed: ci 'phags pa rnams la rigs pa mi mnga' 'am zhe na /
translated: Do āryas not possess reasoning?

original: yod pa'am med pa 'di sus smras /
analyzed: yod pa'am med pa 'di sus smras /
translated: Who said that they exist or do not exist?

original: 'phags pa rnams kyi don dam pa ni cang mi gsung ba yin te /
analyzed: 'phags pa rnams kyi don dam pa ni cang mi gsung ba yin te /
translated: The ultimate of the āryas is complete silence.

original: de'i phyir gang la 'thad pa dang 'thad pa ma yin pa mi mnga' bar 'gyur ba de dag la spros pa mnga' bar ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: de'i phyir gang la 'thad pa dang 'thad pa ma yin pa mi mnga' bar 'gyur ba de dag la spros pa mnga' bar ga la 'gyur /
translated: Therefore, how could they have conceptual elaborations, since they would not have what is tenable or untenable?

original: gal te 'phags pa rnams 'thad pa gsung bar mi mdzad na /
analyzed: gal te 'phags pa rnams 'thad pa gsung bar mi mdzad na /
translated: If the āryas do not speak of what is tenable,

original: da ni ci zhig gis 'jig rten pas don dam pa khong du chud par mdzad ce na /
analyzed: da ni ci zhig gis 'jig rten pas don dam pa khong du chud par mdzad ce na /
translated: then what does the world understand in terms of the ultimate?🔽The āryas do not speak of what is tenable in terms of worldly conventions.🔽However, they do accept what is tenable that is renowned only in the world in order to make others understand.

original: 'phags pa rnams ni 'jig rten gyi tha snyad kyis 'thad pa mi gsung gi /'on kyang 'jig rten kho na la rab tu grags pa'i 'thad pa gang yin pa de dag gzhan rtogs par bya ba'i phyir zhal gyis bzhes nas de nyid kyis 'jig rten khong du chud🔽par mdzad do //
analyzed: 'phags pa rnams ni 'jig rten gyi tha snyad kyis 'thad pa mi gsung gi /'on kyang 'jig rten kho na la rab tu grags pa'i 'thad pa gang yin pa de dag gzhan rtogs par bya ba'i phyir zhal gyis bzhes nas de nyid kyis 'jig rten khong du chud par mdzad do //
translated: They make the world understand that very [tenability].

original: ji ltar lus la mi gtsang ba nyid yod du zin kyang phyin ci log gi rjes su song ba'i 'dod chags can rnams kyis dmigs par mi 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: ji ltar lus la mi gtsang ba nyid yod du zin kyang phyin ci log gi rjes su song ba'i 'dod chags can rnams kyis dmigs par mi 'gyur zhing /
translated: Even though the body has impurity, those who are attached due to error do not observe it.

original: yang dag pa ma yin yang gtsang ba'i rnam par sgro btags nas yongs su nyon mongs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang dag pa ma yin yang gtsang ba'i rnam par sgro btags nas yongs su nyon mongs par 'gyur ro //
translated: and, superimposing the aspect of purity on what is impure, they become defiled.

original: de dag 'dod chags dang bral bar bya ba'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa'i sprul pa'am lhas /
analyzed: de dag 'dod chags dang bral bar bya ba'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa'i sprul pa'am lhas /
translated: In order to free them from attachment, the Tathagata, through his emanations or through the gods,

original: lus 'di la skra zhes bya ba la sogs pas sngar gtsang ba'i 'du shes kyis bkab pa'i lus kyi skyon rnams nye bar ston par byed do //
analyzed: lus 'di la skra zhes bya ba la sogs pas sngar gtsang ba'i 'du shes kyis bkab pa'i lus kyi skyon rnams nye bar ston par byed do //
translated: reveals the faults of the body, which are concealed by the notion of purity, by saying, “In this body there are head hairs, body hairs, etc.”🔽And they, by being freed from that notion of purity, obtain freedom from attachment.

original: de dag kyang gtsang ba'i 'du shes de dang bral bas 'dod chags dang bral ba thob par 'gyur ba de bzhin du 'di na so so'i skye bo dag kyang ma rig pa'i rab rib kyis blo gros kyi mig nyams pa nyid kyis dngos po rnams kyi rang bzhin
analyzed: de dag kyang gtsang ba'i 'du shes de dang bral bas 'dod chags dang bral ba thob par 'gyur ba de bzhin du 'di na so so'i skye bo dag kyang ma rig pa'i rab rib kyis blo gros kyi mig nyams pa nyid kyis dngos po rnams kyi rang bzhin
translated: In the same way, here, ordinary people, by the defect of the eye of intelligence being obscured by the cataracts of ignorance, do not see the nature of entities as it is.

original: phyin ci log /'phags pa rnams kyis rnam pa thams cad du ma dmigs pa'i bdag nyid can dang / 'ga' zhig tu khyad par 'ga' zhig lhag par sgro btags nas chos shin tu nyon mongs par 'gyur te /🔽de dag da ltar 'phags pa rnams kyis bum pa yod pa 'jim pa la sogs pa dag las skye ba ma yin no zhes khas blangs pa de bzhin du skyes pa'i snga rol nas yod pa la yang skye ba yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: phyin ci log /'phags pa rnams kyis rnam pa thams cad du ma dmigs pa'i bdag nyid can dang / 'ga' zhig tu khyad par 'ga' zhig lhag par sgro btags nas chos shin tu nyon mongs par 'gyur te / de dag da ltar 'phags pa rnams kyis bum pa yod pa 'jim pa la sogs pa dag las skye ba ma yin no zhes khas blangs pa de bzhin du skyes pa'i snga rol nas yod pa la yang skye ba yod pa ma yin te /
translated: and the selflessness of persons, which is the non-observation of any self by the noble ones in any way, and some superimpose some special quality on them and are greatly afflicted by the phenomena of defilement.🔽Just as the noble ones assert that a pot does not arise from clay and so on, in the same way, that which exists prior to arising does not arise because it exists.

original: yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar nges par gyis shig / yang ji ltar me dang sol ba la sogs pa gzhan du gyur pa dag las myu gu skye ba yod pa ma yin no zhes @20a * //
analyzed: yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar nges par gyis shig / yang ji ltar me dang sol ba la sogs pa gzhan du gyur pa dag las myu gu skye ba yod pa ma yin no zhes @20a * //
translated: Just as a sprout does not arise from a seed that is different from it, in the same way, a sprout does not arise from a seed that is not different from it.

original: bya bar khas blangs pa de bzhin du sa bon la sogs pa brjod par 'dod pa dag las kyang yod pa ma yin no zhes nges par gyis shig / ci ste yang 'di ni kho bo cag gis nyams su myong ba yin no snyam na 'di yang mi
analyzed: bya bar khas blangs pa de bzhin du sa bon la sogs pa brjod par 'dod pa dag las kyang yod pa ma yin no zhes nges par gyis shig / ci ste yang 'di ni kho bo cag gis nyams su myong ba yin no snyam na 'di yang mi
translated: But if you think, “This is experienced by us,”🔽then that is illogical.

original: rigs te / 'di ltar nyams su myong ba ni brdzun pa'i don can yin te /
analyzed: rigs te / 'di ltar nyams su myong ba ni brdzun pa'i don can yin te /
translated: Because that which is experienced has a false meaning,

original: nyams su myong ba yin pa'i phyir rab rib can gyis zla ba gnyis nyams su myong ba bzhin no //
analyzed: nyams su myong ba yin pa'i phyir rab rib can gyis zla ba gnyis nyams su myong ba bzhin no //
translated: because it is experienced, like the experience of two moons by one with diseased vision.

original: de'i phyir nyams su myong ba yang bsgrub par bya ba dang mtshungs pa nyid yin pa'i phyir des phyir bzlog par rigs pa ma yin no zhes de dag la grags pa nyid kyis khong du chud par mdzad pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir nyams su myong ba yang bsgrub par bya ba dang mtshungs pa nyid yin pa'i phyir des phyir bzlog par rigs pa ma yin no zhes de dag la grags pa nyid kyis khong du chud par mdzad pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, because experience is similar to the probandum, it is not logical to use it as a counter-example. Thus he makes them understand by means of what is familiar to them.

original: de'i phyir dngos po rnams skye ba med pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir dngos po rnams skye ba med pa yin no //
translated: Therefore things are not produced.

original: de ltar re zhig de'i rang bzhin phyin ci log lhag par sgro btags pa'i gnyen por rab tu byed pa dang po brtsams pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar re zhig de'i rang bzhin phyin ci log lhag par sgro btags pa'i gnyen por rab tu byed pa dang po brtsams pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the first chapter is composed as an antidote to the misapprehension of the nature of the self.

original: de nas khyad par 'ga' zhig 'ga' zhig tu sgro btags pa'i khyad par de bsal bar bya ba'i phyir rab tu byed pa lhag ma brtsams pa yin te /
analyzed: de nas khyad par 'ga' zhig 'ga' zhig tu sgro btags pa'i khyad par de bsal bar bya ba'i phyir rab tu byed pa lhag ma brtsams pa yin te /
translated: Then, the remaining chapters are composed in order to remove the misapprehension of the self in some particular cases.

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la 'gro ba po dang / bgrod par bya ba dang 'gro bar bya ba la sogs pa khyad par ro cog ma lus pa yang yod pa ma yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i don du'o //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la 'gro ba po dang / bgrod par bya ba dang 'gro bar bya ba la sogs pa khyad par ro cog ma lus pa yang yod pa ma yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i don du'o //
translated: It is in order to demonstrate that in dependent origination, there is absolutely no such thing as a goer, a destination, or going, etc.

original: ci ste tshad ma dang gzhal bya'i tha snyad 'jig rten pa 'di nyid kho bo cag gi bstan bcos su brjod pa yin no snyam na /
