analyzed: ci ste tshad ma dang gzhal bya'i tha snyad 'jig rten pa 'di nyid kho bo cag gi bstan bcos su brjod pa yin no snyam na /
translated: If you think that the conventions of valid cognition and the object of valid cognition are expressed in our treatise just as they are in the world,

original: 'o na ni de brjod pa'i dgos pa bsnyad par bya dgos so //
analyzed: 'o na ni de brjod pa'i dgos pa bsnyad par bya dgos so //
translated: then you must state the purpose of expressing them.

original: gal te rtog ge pa dag gis mtshan nyid phyin ci log brjod pas /
analyzed: gal te rtog ge pa dag gis mtshan nyid phyin ci log brjod pas /
translated: If you think that the logicians express the characteristics incorrectly,

original: de brlag par byas pas kho bo cag gis de'i mtshan nyid yang dag par brjod pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de brlag par byas pas kho bo cag gis de'i mtshan nyid yang dag par brjod pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say, “We have stated the correct definition of valid cognition by refuting that,”

original: 'di yang mi rigs te /
analyzed: 'di yang mi rigs te /
translated: this is also illogical.

original: gal te 'jig rten la rtog ge ngan pas mtshan nyid phyin ci log brjod pas byas pa'i mtshon bya phyin ci log yod par 'gyur na ni de'i don du 'bad pa 'bras bu dang bcas par 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: gal te 'jig rten la rtog ge ngan pas mtshan nyid phyin ci log brjod pas byas pa'i mtshon bya phyin ci log yod par 'gyur na ni de'i don du 'bad pa 'bras bu dang bcas par 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: If the object of valid cognition were a mistaken object of reference due to the incorrect definition of valid cognition by bad logicians, then the effort to understand it would be fruitful.

original: de ni de ltar yang ma yin pas 'bad pa 'di don med pa nyid do //🔽gzhan yang gal te gzhal bya rtogs pa tshad ma la rag las pa yin na tshad ma de dag gang gis yongs su gcod par byed ces bya ba la sogs pa rtsod pa bzlog pa las bshad pa'i skyon de ma spangs pas yang dag pa'i mtshan nyid gsal
analyzed: de ni de ltar yang ma yin pas 'bad pa 'di don med pa nyid do // gzhan yang gal te gzhal bya rtogs pa tshad ma la rag las pa yin na tshad ma de dag gang gis yongs su gcod par byed ces bya ba la sogs pa rtsod pa bzlog pa las bshad pa'i skyon de ma spangs pas yang dag pa'i mtshan nyid gsal
translated: But since that is not the case, this effort is pointless.🔽Moreover, if the understanding of the object of comprehension depends on valid cognition, then by what is that valid cognition determined?

original: bar byed pa nyid kyang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: bar byed pa nyid kyang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Since the faults explained in the Vigrahavyāvartanī are not avoided, the correct definition is not clarified.

original: gzhan yang gal te rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid gnyis kyi dbang gis mtshan ma gnyis @20b smra na ni /
analyzed: gzhan yang gal te rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid gnyis kyi dbang gis mtshan ma gnyis @20b smra na ni /
translated: Moreover, if you assert two types of signs due to the two types of characteristics,

original: ci mtshan nyid de gnyis gang la yod pa'i mtshan gzhi de yod dam 'on te med /
analyzed: ci mtshan nyid de gnyis gang la yod pa'i mtshan gzhi de yod dam 'on te med /
translated: then do the bases characterized that possess those two characteristics exist or not?

original: gal te yod na ni de'i tshe de dag las gzhal bya yod pas ji ltar tshad ma gnyis yin /🔽'on te mtshan gzhi med na ni de'i tshe rten med pas mtshan nyid kyang yod pa ma yin pas ji ltar tshad ma gnyis su 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te yod na ni de'i tshe de dag las gzhal bya yod pas ji ltar tshad ma gnyis yin / 'on te mtshan gzhi med na ni de'i tshe rten med pas mtshan nyid kyang yod pa ma yin pas ji ltar tshad ma gnyis su 'gyur te /
translated: If they exist, then at that time, since objects of comprehension exist, how could there be two valid cognitions?

original: mtshan nyid 'jug pa ma yin na //
analyzed: mtshan nyid 'jug pa ma yin na //
translated: But if the bases characterized do not exist, then at that time, since there is no basis, the characteristics also do not exist. How could there be two valid cognitions?

original: mtshan gzhi 'thad par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mtshan gzhi 'thad par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: The characteristics do not apply🔽to the bases characterized.

original: mtshan gzhi 'thad pa ma yin na //
analyzed: mtshan gzhi 'thad pa ma yin na //
translated: If the bases characterized are not tenable,

original: mtshan nyid kyang ni yod ma yin //
analyzed: mtshan nyid kyang ni yod ma yin //
translated: the characteristics also do not exist.

original: zhes 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhes 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: This will be explained.

original: ci ste yang 'dis mtshon par byed pas ni mtshan nyid ma yin gyi /
analyzed: ci ste yang 'dis mtshon par byed pas ni mtshan nyid ma yin gyi /
translated: But if you say that that which indicates is not a characteristic,

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: then what is?

original: byed pa dang lugs ni phal che'o zhes bya bas las la lyu ta byas nas 'di mtshon par bya bas na mtshan nyid yin no snyam na /
analyzed: byed pa dang lugs ni phal che'o zhes bya bas las la lyu ta byas nas 'di mtshon par bya bas na mtshan nyid yin no snyam na /
translated: The suffix lyu is added to the verbal root, and since this is indicated by the suffix, it is a characteristic.

original: de lta na yang de nyid kyis mtshon par bya ba nyid du mi srid pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de lta na yang de nyid kyis mtshon par bya ba nyid du mi srid pa'i phyir /
translated: But even if that were so, since it is impossible for it to be indicated by that,

original: gang gis de mtshon par byed pa'i byed pa de dang las tha dad pa yin pa'i phyir nyes pa de nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gis de mtshon par byed pa'i byed pa de dang las tha dad pa yin pa'i phyir nyes pa de nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: then because the agent and action are different, that fault would ensue.

original: ci ste shes pa byed pa yin pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: ci ste shes pa byed pa yin pa'i phyir la /
translated: But if you think that since consciousness is the agent,

original: de yang rang gi mtshan nyid kyi khongs su 'du ba'i phyir nyes pa 'di med do snyam na /
analyzed: de yang rang gi mtshan nyid kyi khongs su 'du ba'i phyir nyes pa 'di med do snyam na /
translated: and since it is included among its own characteristics, this fault does not arise.

original: bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: bshad par bya ste /
translated: We reply:

original: re zhig 'dir ji ltar des de mtshon par byed pas sa'i sra ba dang / tshor ba'i myong ba dang / rnam par shes pa'i yul so sor rnam par rig pa ltar bdag nyid kyi rang gi ngo bo gzhan dang thun mong ma yin pa gang yin pa de ni rang gi mtshan nyid yin na /
analyzed: re zhig 'dir ji ltar des de mtshon par byed pas sa'i sra ba dang / tshor ba'i myong ba dang / rnam par shes pa'i yul so sor rnam par rig pa ltar bdag nyid kyi rang gi ngo bo gzhan dang thun mong ma yin pa gang yin pa de ni rang gi mtshan nyid yin na /
translated: Just as solidity is the intrinsic identity of earth, the experience of feeling, and the individual cognition of objects is the intrinsic identity of consciousness, in the same way, the intrinsic identity of the self is its own unique nature that is not shared with anything else.

original: rab tu grags pa dang rjes su 'brel pa'i bye brag tu bshad pa bor nas /🔽las su sgrub pa khas len zhing rnam par shes pa byed pa'i ngo bor rtogs pas ni /🔽rang gi mtshan nyid kho na las nyid yin zhing /
analyzed: rab tu grags pa dang rjes su 'brel pa'i bye brag tu bshad pa bor nas / las su sgrub pa khas len zhing rnam par shes pa byed pa'i ngo bor rtogs pas ni / rang gi mtshan nyid kho na las nyid yin zhing /
translated: But, setting aside the well-known and related explanations,🔽you assert that consciousness is established as an action and you understand it to be the nature of an agent.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid gzhan ni byed pa'i ngo bo yin no zhes bya ba 'di smras par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid gzhan ni byed pa'i ngo bo yin no zhes bya ba 'di smras par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, you would be saying that the intrinsic identity of consciousness is itself an action and that the intrinsic identity of an agent is the nature of an action.

original: de la gal te rnam par shes pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid byed pa yin na ni /
analyzed: de la gal te rnam par shes pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid byed pa yin na ni /
translated: If the intrinsic identity of consciousness is an action,

original: de la tha dad par gyur pa'i las shig yod par 'gyur dgos pas nyes pa de nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la tha dad par gyur pa'i las shig yod par 'gyur dgos pas nyes pa de nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: But then the error would ensue that it would be a different action.

original: ci ste sa la sogs par gtogs pa'i sra ba la sogs pa rnam par shes pas rtogs par bya ba gang yin pa de ni de'i las yin la /
analyzed: ci ste sa la sogs par gtogs pa'i sra ba la sogs pa rnam par shes pas rtogs par bya ba gang yin pa de ni de'i las yin la /
translated: If you think that the solidity, etc., belonging to earth, etc., which is to be cognized by consciousness, is its action,

original: de yang rang gi mtshan nyid las tha dad pa ma yin no snyam na /
analyzed: de yang rang gi mtshan nyid las tha dad pa ma yin no snyam na /
translated: and that it is not different from its own characteristic,

original: de lta na ni 'on rnam par shes pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid las ma yin pa'i phyir gzhal bya nyid du mi 'gyur te /🔽las kyi rang bzhin gyi rang @21a * //
analyzed: de lta na ni 'on rnam par shes pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid las ma yin pa'i phyir gzhal bya nyid du mi 'gyur te / las kyi rang bzhin gyi rang @21a * //
translated: then consciousness would not be an object of comprehension, because it is not different from the own characteristic of consciousness.

original: gi mtshan nyid kho na gzhal bya yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gi mtshan nyid kho na gzhal bya yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the own characteristic of the action is the object of comprehension.

original: de'i phyir gzhal bya ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de'i phyir gzhal bya ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Therefore, the object of comprehension is twofold:

original: rang gi mtshan nyid dang spyi'i mtshan nyid do zhes bya bar /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid dang spyi'i mtshan nyid do zhes bya bar /
translated: the own characteristic and the universal characteristic.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid cung zad cig ni gzhal bya yin te /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid cung zad cig ni gzhal bya yin te /
translated: Some of the own characteristic is the object of comprehension.

original: mtshon par bya bas na zhes de ltar bsnyad pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: mtshon par bya bas na zhes de ltar bsnyad pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: That which is called “the object of comprehension” is that which is to be comprehended by a means of valid knowledge.

original: cung zad cig ni gzhal bya ma yin te 'dis mtshon par byed pas na zhes brjod pa gang yin pa'o zhes khyad par 'di tsam zhig brjod par bya dgos so //
analyzed: cung zad cig ni gzhal bya ma yin te 'dis mtshon par byed pas na zhes brjod pa gang yin pa'o zhes khyad par 'di tsam zhig brjod par bya dgos so //
translated: But a small part is not an object of comprehension, that is, it is what is indicated by this.

original: ci ste de yang las su sgrub pa yin na ni /
analyzed: ci ste de yang las su sgrub pa yin na ni /
translated: But if that is also established as an object,

original: de'i tshe de la byed pa gzhan zhig yod par bya dgos la /
analyzed: de'i tshe de la byed pa gzhan zhig yod par bya dgos la /
translated: then it must be said that there is another action.

original: shes pa gzhan zhig byed pa'i ngo bor rtogs na yang thug pa med pa'i skyon du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shes pa gzhan zhig byed pa'i ngo bor rtogs na yang thug pa med pa'i skyon du 'gyur ro //
translated: And if another cognition is understood to be the nature of the action, there is the fault of infinite regress.

original: ci ste rang rig pa yod de des na rang rig pas des de 'dzin pa'i phyir las nyid yin dang / gzhal bya'i khongs su 'du ba yod pa yin no snyam du sems na /
analyzed: ci ste rang rig pa yod de des na rang rig pas des de 'dzin pa'i phyir las nyid yin dang / gzhal bya'i khongs su 'du ba yod pa yin no snyam du sems na /
translated: But if you think that since there is reflexive awareness, it is the object itself that is the action because it is apprehended by reflexive awareness, and so it is included among objects of comprehension,

original: bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: bshad par bya ste /
translated: then we reply:

original: dbu ma la 'jug pa las rang rig pa rgyas par bkag pa'i phyir rang gi mtshan nyid ni rang gi mtshan nyid gzhan gyis mtshon par byed pa la /
analyzed: dbu ma la 'jug pa las rang rig pa rgyas par bkag pa'i phyir rang gi mtshan nyid ni rang gi mtshan nyid gzhan gyis mtshon par byed pa la /
translated: Since reflexive awareness is extensively refuted in the Supplement to the Middle Way, it is not the case that one intrinsic nature is indicated by another intrinsic nature.

original: de yang rang rig pa des mtshon par byed do zhes bya ba ni rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de yang rang rig pa des mtshon par byed do zhes bya ba ni rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not logical to say that this reflexive awareness is what reveals it.

original: gzhan yang shes pa de yang mi srid pa'i phyir rang gi mtshan nyid las tha dad par ma grub la /
analyzed: gzhan yang shes pa de yang mi srid pa'i phyir rang gi mtshan nyid las tha dad par ma grub la /
translated: Moreover, since that cognition is impossible, it is not established as being different from its own nature.

original: mtshan gzhi med na rten med pa'i mtshan nyid 'jug pa med pa'i phyir rnam pa thams cad du yod pa ma yin pas rang rig pa ga la yod /
analyzed: mtshan gzhi med na rten med pa'i mtshan nyid 'jug pa med pa'i phyir rnam pa thams cad du yod pa ma yin pas rang rig pa ga la yod /
translated: And if there is no basis of characteristics, there is no characteristic that can apply to it. Therefore, since it does not exist in any way, how can there be reflexive awareness?

original: de skad du yang 'phags pa gtsug na rin po ches zhus pa las /
analyzed: de skad du yang 'phags pa gtsug na rin po ches zhus pa las /
translated: As it says in the Sūtra of the Questions of Ratnacūḍa:

original: de sems yang dag par rjes su ma mthong bas /
analyzed: de sems yang dag par rjes su ma mthong bas /
translated: Since he does not see the mind,

original: sems gang las byung zhes sems kyi rgyun kun du tshol zhing de 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: sems gang las byung zhes sems kyi rgyun kun du tshol zhing de 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: he searches for the mind’s continuum, wondering, “Where does the mind come from?”

original: dmigs pa yod pa las sems 'byung bar 'gyur ro snyam mo //🔽de yang 'di snyam du sems te /🔽ci dmigs pa de yang gzhan la sems de yang gzhan nam /
analyzed: dmigs pa yod pa las sems 'byung bar 'gyur ro snyam mo // de yang 'di snyam du sems te / ci dmigs pa de yang gzhan la sems de yang gzhan nam /
translated: He thinks, “The mind arises from the existence of an object.”🔽He thinks, “Is the object one thing and the mind another?

original: 'on te dmigs pa gang yin pa de nyid sems yin /
analyzed: 'on te dmigs pa gang yin pa de nyid sems yin /
translated: Or is the object itself the mind?”

original: gal te re zhig dmigs pa yang gzhan la sems kyang gzhan na ni sems de gnyis su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te re zhig dmigs pa yang gzhan la sems kyang gzhan na ni sems de gnyis su 'gyur ro //
translated: If the object of observation is one thing and the mind is another, then the mind would be twofold.

original: 'on te dmigs pa gang yin pa de nyid sems yin na ni /
analyzed: 'on te dmigs pa gang yin pa de nyid sems yin na ni /
translated: But if the object of observation is the mind itself,

original: sems kyis sems de ji ltar mthong bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: sems kyis sems de ji ltar mthong bar 'gyur te /
translated: how could the mind see that mind?

original: sems kyis sems de mthong bar mi rung ngo //
analyzed: sems kyis sems de mthong bar mi rung ngo //
translated: The mind cannot see that mind.

original: 'di lta ste dper na ral gri'i so de nyid kyis ral gri'i so de nyid bcad @21b par mi nus pa dang / sor mo'i rtse mo de nyid kyis sor mo'i rtse mo de nyid la reg par mi nus pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: 'di lta ste dper na ral gri'i so de nyid kyis ral gri'i so de nyid bcad @21b par mi nus pa dang / sor mo'i rtse mo de nyid kyis sor mo'i rtse mo de nyid la reg par mi nus pa de bzhin du /
translated: For example, the edge of a sword cannot cut the edge of that same sword, and the tip of a finger cannot touch the tip of that same finger.

original: sems de nyid kyis sems de nyid mthong bar mi nus so snyam nas /
analyzed: sems de nyid kyis sems de nyid mthong bar mi nus so snyam nas /
translated: In the same way, the mind cannot see that same mind.

original: de 'di ltar tshul bzhin rab tu sbyor ba la /
analyzed: de 'di ltar tshul bzhin rab tu sbyor ba la /
translated: When he applies himself in this way,

original: gang sems mi gnas pa /
analyzed: gang sems mi gnas pa /
translated: he sees that the mind does not abide,

original: chad pa ma yin pa /🔽rtag pa ma yin pa /
analyzed: chad pa ma yin pa / rtag pa ma yin pa /
translated: is not cut off,🔽is not permanent,

original: ther zug tu mi gnas pa /
analyzed: ther zug tu mi gnas pa /
translated: does not abide eternally,

original: rgyu med pa ma yin /
analyzed: rgyu med pa ma yin /
translated: is not without a cause,

original: rkyen dang mi 'gal ba de las kyang ma yin pa /
analyzed: rkyen dang mi 'gal ba de las kyang ma yin pa /
translated: is not in contradiction with conditions,🔽is not from itself,

original: gzhan las kyang ma yin pa /
analyzed: gzhan las kyang ma yin pa /
translated: is not from another,🔽is not from both,🔽and is not from no cause.

original: de nyid kyang ma yin pa gzhan yang ma yin pa'i sems kyi rgyud sems kyi 'khri shing /
analyzed: de nyid kyang ma yin pa gzhan yang ma yin pa'i sems kyi rgyud sems kyi 'khri shing /
translated: The continuum of mind is a vine of mind.

original: sems kyi chos nyid /
analyzed: sems kyi chos nyid /
translated: The reality of mind is a vine of mind.🔽The non-abiding of mind is a vine of mind.🔽The non-movement of mind is a vine of mind.🔽The non-appearance of mind is a vine of mind.🔽The intrinsic identity of mind is a vine of mind.

original: sems kyi mi gnas pa dang / sems rgyu ba med pa dang / sems snang ba med pa dang / sems kyi rang gi mtshan nyid de ji ltar de bzhin nyid 'khrug par mi byed pa de ltar shes so //
analyzed: sems kyi mi gnas pa dang / sems rgyu ba med pa dang / sems snang ba med pa dang / sems kyi rang gi mtshan nyid de ji ltar de bzhin nyid 'khrug par mi byed pa de ltar shes so //
translated: In this way, one should know suchness as it is, without disturbing it.

original: de ltar mthong ngo //
analyzed: de ltar mthong ngo //
translated: In this way, one should see suchness as it is, without disturbing it.🔽In this way, one should know the mind as it is, without disturbing it.🔽In this way, one should see the mind as it is, without disturbing it.

original: de bzhin nyid ji lta ba de bzhin du sems de dag dben pa nyid du rab tu shes /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid ji lta ba de bzhin du sems de dag dben pa nyid du rab tu shes /
translated: In this way, one should know the mind as it is, without disturbing it.🔽In this way, one should see the mind as it is, without disturbing it.🔽In this way, one should know the mind as it is, without disturbing it.🔽In this way, one should see the mind as it is, without disturbing it.🔽In this way, one should know the mind as it is, without disturbing it.

original: de bzhin du mthong ba 'di ni rigs kyi bu byang chub sems dpa'i sems la sems kyi rjes su lta ba'i dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'i spyod pa yongs su dag pa'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de bzhin du mthong ba 'di ni rigs kyi bu byang chub sems dpa'i sems la sems kyi rjes su lta ba'i dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'i spyod pa yongs su dag pa'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: In this way, one should see the mind as it is, without disturbing it.

original: de'i phyir de ltar rang rig pa med la /🔽de med pas gang zhig gang gis mtshon par byed /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar rang rig pa med la /🔽de med pas gang zhig gang gis mtshon par byed /
translated: In this way, one should know the mind as it is, without disturbing it.🔽In this way, one should see the mind as it is, without disturbing it.🔽In this way, one should know the mind as it is, without disturbing it.🔽In this way, one should see the mind as it is, without disturbing it.🔽In this way, one should know the mind as it is, without disturbing it.🔽In this way, one should see the mind as it is, without disturbing it.🔽In this way, one should know the mind as it is, without disturbing it.🔽In this way, one should see the mind as it is, without disturbing it.🔽In this way, one should know the mind as it is, without disturbing it.🔽In this way, one should see the mind as it is, without disturbing it.🔽In this way, one should know the mind as it is, without disturbing it.🔽In this way, one should see the mind as it is, without disturbing it.🔽In this way, one should know the mind as it is, without disturbing it.🔽In this way, one should see the mind as it is, without disturbing it.🔽In this way, one should

original: gzhan yang mtshan nyid de mtshan gzhi las tha dad par 'gyur ram tha mi dad par 'gyur grang /
analyzed: gzhan yang mtshan nyid de mtshan gzhi las tha dad par 'gyur ram tha mi dad par 'gyur grang /
translated: Moreover, would that characteristic be different from the basis of those characteristics or not different?

original: de la gal te re zhig tha dad pa yin na ni /
analyzed: de la gal te re zhig tha dad pa yin na ni /
translated: If first it were different,

original: de'i tshe mtshan gzhi las tha dad pa'i phyir mtshan nyid ma yin pa bzhin du mtshan nyid kyang mtshan nyid ma yin par 'gyur la /
analyzed: de'i tshe mtshan gzhi las tha dad pa'i phyir mtshan nyid ma yin pa bzhin du mtshan nyid kyang mtshan nyid ma yin par 'gyur la /
translated: then because it is different from the basis of those characteristics, the characteristic would not be a characteristic, just like what is not a characteristic.

original: mtshan nyid las tha dad pa'i phyir mtshan gzhi yang mtshan gzhi ma yin pa ltar mtshan gzhir mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mtshan nyid las tha dad pa'i phyir mtshan gzhi yang mtshan gzhi ma yin pa ltar mtshan gzhir mi 'gyur ro //
translated: And because it is different from the characteristic, the basis of those characteristics would not be a basis of characteristics, just like what is not a characteristic.

original: de bzhin du mtshan nyid mtshan gzhi las tha dad pa'i phyir mtshan gzhi mtshan nyid la ltos pa med par yang 'gyur te /
analyzed: de bzhin du mtshan nyid mtshan gzhi las tha dad pa'i phyir mtshan gzhi mtshan nyid la ltos pa med par yang 'gyur te /
translated: In the same way, because the characteristic is different from the basis of those characteristics, the basis of those characteristics would not rely on the characteristic.

original: de'i phyir de mtshan gzhi ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de mtshan gzhi ma yin te /
translated: Therefore it would not be a basis of those characteristics,

original: mtshan nyid la ltos pa med pa'i phyir nam mkha'i me tog bzhin no //
analyzed: mtshan nyid la ltos pa med pa'i phyir nam mkha'i me tog bzhin no //
translated: because it does not rely on the characteristic, like a sky flower.

original: ci ste mtshan nyid dang mtshan nyid kyi gzhi dag tha mi dad pa nyid yin na ni //
analyzed: ci ste mtshan nyid dang mtshan nyid kyi gzhi dag tha mi dad pa nyid yin na ni //
translated: But if the characteristic and the basis of those characteristics are not different,

original: de'i tshe mtshan nyid las tha mi dad pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i tshe mtshan nyid las tha mi dad pa'i phyir /
translated: At that time, because it is not different from the characteristic,

original: mtshan nyid kyi rang gi bdag nyid bzhin du mtshan gzhi'i mtshan gzhi nyid nyams par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mtshan nyid kyi rang gi bdag nyid bzhin du mtshan gzhi'i mtshan gzhi nyid nyams par 'gyur ro //
translated: like the intrinsic reality of the characteristic, the basis of the characteristic would be destroyed.

original: mtshan gzhi las tha mi dad pa'i phyir mtshan nyid kyang mtshan nyid kyi rang bzhin du mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: mtshan gzhi las tha mi dad pa'i phyir mtshan nyid kyang mtshan nyid kyi rang bzhin du mi 'gyur te /
translated: Because it is not different from the basis of the characteristic, the characteristic would not be the intrinsic reality of the characteristic,

original: mtshan gzhi'i rang gi bdag nyid bzhin no //
analyzed: mtshan gzhi'i rang gi bdag nyid bzhin no //
translated: like the intrinsic reality of the basis of the characteristic.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: @22a * // mtshan nyid mtshan gzhi las gzhan na //
analyzed: @22a * // mtshan nyid mtshan gzhi las gzhan na //
translated: If the characteristic were different from the basis of the characteristic,

original: mtshan gzhi de mtshan med par 'gyur //
analyzed: mtshan gzhi de mtshan med par 'gyur //
translated: the basis of the characteristic would be without a characteristic.

original: tha dad med na de dag ni //🔽med par khyod kyis gsal bar bstan //
analyzed: tha dad med na de dag ni // med par khyod kyis gsal bar bstan //
translated: If they were not different,

original: zhes bshad do //🔽de nyid dang gzhan nyid las ma gtogs par mtshan gzhi dang mtshan nyid 'grub pa'i thabs gzhan yod pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: zhes bshad do // de nyid dang gzhan nyid las ma gtogs par mtshan gzhi dang mtshan nyid 'grub pa'i thabs gzhan yod pa yang ma yin te /
translated: you have clearly taught that they would not exist.

original: de skad du /
analyzed: de skad du /
translated: And:🔽If they were established as the same entity

original: gang dag dngos po gcig pa dang // dngos po gzhan pa nyid du ni //
analyzed: gang dag dngos po gcig pa dang // dngos po gzhan pa nyid du ni //
translated: or different entities,

original: 'grub par 'gyur ba yod min na //
analyzed: 'grub par 'gyur ba yod min na //
translated: they would not exist.

original: de gnyis grub pa ji ltar yod //
analyzed: de gnyis grub pa ji ltar yod //
translated: How could those two be established?

original: ces 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ces 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: This will be explained.

original: ci ste brjod du med pa nyid du 'grub par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: ci ste brjod du med pa nyid du 'grub par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If you think that non-expression is established,

original: de ni 'di ltar ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar ma yin te /
translated: that is not so.

original: phan tshun rnam par dbye ba yongs su shes pa med pa yin na /
analyzed: phan tshun rnam par dbye ba yongs su shes pa med pa yin na /
translated: If the mutual differentiation of the two is not understood,

original: brjod du med pa nyid ces bya bar 'gyur na /🔽gang na rnam par dbye ba yongs su shes par 'gyur ba med pa der ni 'di ni mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: brjod du med pa nyid ces bya bar 'gyur na / gang na rnam par dbye ba yongs su shes par 'gyur ba med pa der ni 'di ni mtshan nyid do //
translated: then they are said to be inexpressible.

original: 'di ni mtshan gzhi'o zhes khyad par du yongs su gcod pa med pas gnyi ga yang med pa nyid de /
analyzed: 'di ni mtshan gzhi'o zhes khyad par du yongs su gcod pa med pas gnyi ga yang med pa nyid de /
translated: But where there is no understanding of differentiation, there is no determination of the difference between this characteristic and that characterized.

original: de'i phyir brjod du med pa nyid du yang grub pa med de //
analyzed: de'i phyir brjod du med pa nyid du yang grub pa med de //
translated: Since both are non-existent, non-expression is also not established.

original: gzhan yang gal te shes pa byed pa yin na /
analyzed: gzhan yang gal te shes pa byed pa yin na /
translated: Moreover, if consciousness is the agent,

original: yul yongs su gcod pa'i byed pa po gang zhig yin /
analyzed: yul yongs su gcod pa'i byed pa po gang zhig yin /
translated: what is the object that is determined?

original: byed pa po med par byed pa la sogs pa rnams yod pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: byed pa po med par byed pa la sogs pa rnams yod pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Without an agent, action and so on do not exist,

original: gcod pa'i bya ba bzhin no //
analyzed: gcod pa'i bya ba bzhin no //
translated: like the action of cutting.

original: ci ste der sems la byed pa po nyid du rtog na /
analyzed: ci ste der sems la byed pa po nyid du rtog na /
translated: But if you imagine that the mind is the agent in that,

original: de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: that is not logical.

original: 'di ltar don tsam lta ba ni sems kyi bya ba yin la don gyi khyad par lta ba ni sems las byung ba rnams kyi bya ba yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar don tsam lta ba ni sems kyi bya ba yin la don gyi khyad par lta ba ni sems las byung ba rnams kyi bya ba yin te /
translated: Thus, the mind’s action is to see the mere object, and the action of the mental factors is to see the particular of the object.🔽It is stated:

original: de la don mthong rnam par shes //
analyzed: de la don mthong rnam par shes //
translated: Seeing the object is consciousness.

original: de yi khyad par sems las byung //
analyzed: de yi khyad par sems las byung //
translated: Seeing its particular is a mental factor.

original: zhes khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //🔽byed pa la sogs pa rnams ni bdag nyid ji lta bu'i bya ba phal pa sgrub pa'i sgo nas /
analyzed: zhes khas blangs pa'i phyir ro // byed pa la sogs pa rnams ni bdag nyid ji lta bu'i bya ba phal pa sgrub pa'i sgo nas /
translated: Because of that assertion.🔽With regard to such things as action, they become action, etc., in the sense of accomplishing a principal action by accomplishing a common action in whatever way they themselves exist.

original: gtso bor gyur pa'i bya ba cig bsgrub par bya ba la yan lag gi ngo bor gyur pa las byed pa la sogs pa nyid du 'gyur na /
analyzed: gtso bor gyur pa'i bya ba cig bsgrub par bya ba la yan lag gi ngo bor gyur pa las byed pa la sogs pa nyid du 'gyur na /
translated: They become the nature of a part.

original: 'dir ni shes pa rnam par shes pa gnyis la gtso bor gyur pa'i bya ba gcig med do //
analyzed: 'dir ni shes pa rnam par shes pa gnyis la gtso bor gyur pa'i bya ba gcig med do //
translated: But here, there is no single principal action of the two consciousnesses.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: Well then, what is it?

original: rnam par shes pa'i gtso bor gyur pa'i bya ba ni don tsam yongs su gcod pa yin la /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i gtso bor gyur pa'i bya ba ni don tsam yongs su gcod pa yin la /
translated: The principal action of consciousness is to determine the mere object.

original: don gyi khyad par yongs su gcod pa ni shes pa'i gtso bor gyur pa'i bya ba yin te /
analyzed: don gyi khyad par yongs su gcod pa ni shes pa'i gtso bor gyur pa'i bya ba yin te /
translated: The principal activity of consciousness is the determination of the particular object.

original: des na shes pa byed pa nyid ma yin la /
analyzed: des na shes pa byed pa nyid ma yin la /
translated: Therefore, consciousness is not the agent.

original: sems kyang byed pa po nyid ma @22b yin no //
analyzed: sems kyang byed pa po nyid ma @22b yin no //
translated: And the mind is not the agent.

original: de'i phyir nyes pa de nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir nyes pa de nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, the same error arises.

original: ci ste chos thams cad bdag med pa zhes bya ba'i lung las na /
analyzed: ci ste chos thams cad bdag med pa zhes bya ba'i lung las na /
translated: If you think that because of the scriptural passage, “All things are without self,”

original: byed pa po rnam pa thams cad du med pa'i phyir bya ba la sogs pa'i tha snyad ni byed pa po med kyang yod pa nyid do snyam na /
analyzed: byed pa po rnam pa thams cad du med pa'i phyir bya ba la sogs pa'i tha snyad ni byed pa po med kyang yod pa nyid do snyam na /
translated: the conventions of action, etc., exist even though there is no agent, because the agent does not exist in any way,

original: 'di yang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di yang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: this is not so,

original: lung gi don yang dag par ma bzung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lung gi don yang dag par ma bzung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the meaning of the scriptural passage is not properly grasped.

original: 'di yang dbu ma 'jug pa las bstan zin to //
analyzed: 'di yang dbu ma 'jug pa las bstan zin to //
translated: This has already been explained in the Madhyamakāvatāra.

original: ci ste yang dper na mchi gu'i lus sgra gcan gyi mgo zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: ci ste yang dper na mchi gu'i lus sgra gcan gyi mgo zhes bya ba la /
translated: If you think that, for example, in the expression, “The body of Rahu, the head of Rahu,”

original: lus dang mgo las tha dad pa'i khyad par med kyang khyad par dang khyad par gyi gzhi'i dngos po yod pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: lus dang mgo las tha dad pa'i khyad par med kyang khyad par dang khyad par gyi gzhi'i dngos po yod pa de bzhin du /
translated: although there is no difference from the body and the head, the entities of the difference and the basis of the difference exist,🔽in the same way,

original: rang gi mtshan nyid las tha dad pa'i sa la sogs pa med kyang sa'i rang gi mtshan nyid ces bya bar 'gyur ro snyam na /🔽de ni de ltar ma yin te /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid las tha dad pa'i sa la sogs pa med kyang sa'i rang gi mtshan nyid ces bya bar 'gyur ro snyam na / de ni de ltar ma yin te /
translated: Though earth and so on do not exist separately from their intrinsic identity, they are called the intrinsic identity of earth.

original: mi mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That is not so, because they are not similar.

original: lus dang mgo'i sgra dag ni blo dang lag pa la sogs pa ltar lhan cig 'byung ba'i dngos po gzhan la ltos pa dang bcas te 'jug pas /
analyzed: lus dang mgo'i sgra dag ni blo dang lag pa la sogs pa ltar lhan cig 'byung ba'i dngos po gzhan la ltos pa dang bcas te 'jug pas /
translated: The terms body and head are like the terms mind and hand, which are used in dependence on other coemergent things.

original: lus dang mgo'i sgra tsam la dmigs pa'i blo skyes pa lta zhig gang gi lus gang gi mgo snyam du lhan cig dpyod pa'i dngos po gzhan la re ba dang bcas pa nyid du 'gyur la /🔽cig shos kyang khyad par gzhan dang 'brel pa bsal bar 'dod pas 'jig rten pa'i brda'i rjes su byed pa /
analyzed: lus dang mgo'i sgra tsam la dmigs pa'i blo skyes pa lta zhig gang gi lus gang gi mgo snyam du lhan cig dpyod pa'i dngos po gzhan la re ba dang bcas pa nyid du 'gyur la / cig shos kyang khyad par gzhan dang 'brel pa bsal bar 'dod pas 'jig rten pa'i brda'i rjes su byed pa /
translated: When the mind observes the mere terms body and head, it is as if it were hoping for another coemergent thing, wondering whose body and whose head.🔽The other term, which is asserted to eliminate the connection with another attribute,

original: khyad par mchi gu dang sgra gcan gyi sgras rtogs pa po'i re ba sel bar byed do zhes bya bar rigs na /
analyzed: khyad par mchi gu dang sgra gcan gyi sgras rtogs pa po'i re ba sel bar byed do zhes bya bar rigs na /
translated: follows the conventions of the world and is suitable to be understood as a term that fulfills the expectations of the person who understands it.

original: 'dir ni sra ba la sogs pa las tha dad pa'i sa la sogs pa med pas khyad par dang khyad par can gyi dngos po mi rigs so //
analyzed: 'dir ni sra ba la sogs pa las tha dad pa'i sa la sogs pa med pas khyad par dang khyad par can gyi dngos po mi rigs so //
translated: But since earth and so on are not different from solidity and so forth, it is illogical that they are the entities of the attributes and the basis of the attributes.

original: gal te mu stegs pa dag gis mtshan gzhi tha dad par khas blangs pa'i phyir de'i ngor khyad par brjod pa la skyon med do zhe na /
analyzed: gal te mu stegs pa dag gis mtshan gzhi tha dad par khas blangs pa'i phyir de'i ngor khyad par brjod pa la skyon med do zhe na /
translated: If you say that there is no error in speaking of attributes in terms of the basis of those attributes because tīrthikas accept that the basis of those attributes is different,

original: de ni de ltar ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni de ltar ma yin te /
translated: that is not so.

original: mu stegs pas kun tu brtags pa'i dngos po rigs pa dang 'gal ba dag ni rang gi gzhung lugs la khas blangs par mi rigs te /
analyzed: mu stegs pas kun tu brtags pa'i dngos po rigs pa dang 'gal ba dag ni rang gi gzhung lugs la khas blangs par mi rigs te /
translated: It is illogical to accept in one’s own system things that are imagined by tīrthikas and that are contradicted by reasoning.

original: tshad ma gzhan la sogs pa khas blangs par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshad ma gzhan la sogs pa khas blangs par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It would follow that one would accept other valid means of knowledge and so on.

original: gzhan yang lus kyi rten can khyad par du byed pa 'jig rten pa'i tha snyad kyi yan lag tu gyur pa ma brtags na grub pa rten pa po mchi gu dang / mgo'i rten can brten pa po sgra gcan ni gang zag la sogs par brtags pa ltar yod @23a * //
analyzed: gzhan yang lus kyi rten can khyad par du byed pa 'jig rten pa'i tha snyad kyi yan lag tu gyur pa ma brtags na grub pa rten pa po mchi gu dang / mgo'i rten can brten pa po sgra gcan ni gang zag la sogs par brtags pa ltar yod @23a * //
translated: Moreover, the basis of the body is the attribute of the world’s conventions. It is established without analysis. The supported is the razor. The basis of the head is the supported Rāhu. It is imagined to be a person and so on.

original: pa'i phyir dpe 'di rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: pa'i phyir dpe 'di rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, this example is not correct.

original: gal te de tsam zhig dmigs pas lus dang mgo las tha dad pa'i don gzhan ma grub pa'i phyir dpe grub pa nyid do zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de tsam zhig dmigs pas lus dang mgo las tha dad pa'i don gzhan ma grub pa'i phyir dpe grub pa nyid do zhe na /
translated: If you say that the example is established because the meaning of “other” is not established as separate from the body and the head,

original: de ni de ltar ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni de ltar ma yin te /
translated: that is not so.

original: 'jig rten pa'i tha snyad la de ltar rnam par dpyod pa mi 'jug pa'i phyir dang / 'jig rten pa'i dngos po rnams ni ma brtags par yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i tha snyad la de ltar rnam par dpyod pa mi 'jug pa'i phyir dang / 'jig rten pa'i dngos po rnams ni ma brtags par yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because such an analysis does not occur in worldly convention and because worldly things exist without analysis.

original: ji ltar rnam par dpyad na gzugs la sogs pa las tha dad par bdag med mdo  kyi /
analyzed: ji ltar rnam par dpyad na gzugs la sogs pa las tha dad par bdag med mdo  kyi /
translated: When analyzed, the self does not exist separately from form and so on.

original: 'on kyang phung po la brten nas 'jig rten gyi kun rdzob tu 'di yod pa nyid yin pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: 'on kyang phung po la brten nas 'jig rten gyi kun rdzob tu 'di yod pa nyid yin pa de bzhin du /
translated: Nevertheless, it exists conventionally in the world in dependence on the aggregates.

original: sgra gcan dang mchi gu gnyis kyang yin pas dpe grub pa med do //
analyzed: sgra gcan dang mchi gu gnyis kyang yin pas dpe grub pa med do //
translated: Since Rāhu and the pestle also exist in the same way, the example is not established.

original: de bzhin du rnam par dpyad na sa la sogs pa dag la yang sra ba la sogs pa las tha dad pa'i mtshan gzhi med la /
analyzed: de bzhin du rnam par dpyad na sa la sogs pa dag la yang sra ba la sogs pa las tha dad pa'i mtshan gzhi med la /
translated: Similarly, when analyzed, hardness and so on do not exist separately from earth and so on.

original: mtshan gzhi las tha dad par rten med pa'i mtshan nyid kyang med mod kyi /
analyzed: mtshan gzhi las tha dad par rten med pa'i mtshan nyid kyang med mod kyi /
translated: Nor is there a characteristic that is not supported, that is, that is separate from the basis of characteristic.

original: de lta na yang 'di ni kun rdzob tu yod de /
analyzed: de lta na yang 'di ni kun rdzob tu yod de /
translated: However, it does exist conventionally.

original: de bas na slob dpon rnams kyis phan tshun ltos pa tsam gyis grub pa'i sgo nas grub par rnam par gzhag pa mdzad do //
analyzed: de bas na slob dpon rnams kyis phan tshun ltos pa tsam gyis grub pa'i sgo nas grub par rnam par gzhag pa mdzad do //
translated: Therefore, the masters have presented it as established by mere mutual dependence.

original: 'di ni de kho na ltar gdon mi za bar khas blang bar bya ste /
analyzed: 'di ni de kho na ltar gdon mi za bar khas blang bar bya ste /
translated: This must be accepted just as it is, without doubt.

original: de lta ma yin na kun rdzob 'thad pa dang ldan pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na kun rdzob 'thad pa dang ldan pa ma yin nam /
translated: Otherwise, would not the conventional be devoid of justification?

original: des na 'di de kho na nyid du 'gyur gyi kun rdzob tu mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na 'di de kho na nyid du 'gyur gyi kun rdzob tu mi 'gyur ro //
translated: In that case, it would be reality and not the conventional.

original: 'thad pas rnam par dpyad pa na mchi gu la sogs pa dag kho na mi srid pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'thad pas rnam par dpyad pa na mchi gu la sogs pa dag kho na mi srid pa ni ma yin te /
translated: When analyzed with reasoning, it is not that things such as a clay pot are simply impossible.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What then?

original: 'chad par 'gyur ba'i 'thad pas gzugs dang tshor ba la sogs pa rnams kyang yod pa ma yin pas /
analyzed: 'chad par 'gyur ba'i 'thad pas gzugs dang tshor ba la sogs pa rnams kyang yod pa ma yin pas /
translated: Form, feeling, and so on do not exist because of the reasoning that will be explained.

original: de dag kyang mchi gu la sogs pa bzhin du kun rdzob tu yod pa yin pa nyid du khas blangs par 'gyur na /
analyzed: de dag kyang mchi gu la sogs pa bzhin du kun rdzob tu yod pa yin pa nyid du khas blangs par 'gyur na /
translated: Moreover, you would have to accept that they exist conventionally, like a razor and so on.

original: de ltar yang ma yin pas /
analyzed: de ltar yang ma yin pas /
translated: But this is not the case.

original: 'di ni yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, this is not the case.

original: brten nas brtags par rnam par gzhag pa 'di yang dbu ma la 'jug pa las rgyas par bstan pas de nyid las yongs su btsal bar bya'o //
analyzed: brten nas brtags par rnam par gzhag pa 'di yang dbu ma la 'jug pa las rgyas par bstan pas de nyid las yongs su btsal bar bya'o //
translated: This presentation of dependent imputation is taught extensively in the Supplement to the Middle Way. Therefore, you should seek it out there.

original: ci ste zhib mor dpyad pa 'dis ci zhig bya ste /
analyzed: ci ste zhib mor dpyad pa 'dis ci zhig bya ste /
translated: If you think, “What is the use of this fine analysis?

original: kho bo cag tshad ma dang gzhal bya'i tha snyad thams cad bden pa yin no zhes ni mi smra'i /
analyzed: kho bo cag tshad ma dang gzhal bya'i tha snyad thams cad bden pa yin no zhes ni mi smra'i /
translated: We do not say that all conventions of valid knowledge and objects of knowledge are true.

original: 'on kyang 'jig rten la rab tu grags pa'i tshul 'dis rnam par 'jog par byed par 'gyur ro snyam na /
analyzed: 'on kyang 'jig rten la rab tu grags pa'i tshul 'dis rnam par 'jog par byed par 'gyur ro snyam na /
translated: However, we posit them by means of a method that is well known in the world,”

original: bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: bshad par bya ste /
translated: we reply as follows.

original: dpyad pa zhib mo 'jig rten pa'i tha snyad la bcug pa 'dis ci dgos zhes kho bo cag kyang de skad du smra ste /
analyzed: dpyad pa zhib mo 'jig rten pa'i tha snyad la bcug pa 'dis ci dgos zhes kho bo cag kyang de skad du smra ste /
translated: We also say, “What is the use of this fine analysis that engages with worldly conventions?”

original: kun rdzob @23b phyin ci log tsam gyis bdag gi ngo bo yod par rnyed pa /
analyzed: kun rdzob @23b phyin ci log tsam gyis bdag gi ngo bo yod par rnyed pa /
translated: The self, whose nature is found to exist merely by the error of the concealer,

original: thar pa 'dod pa rnams kyi thar pa 'dren par byed pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba sog pa'i rgyur gyur pa 'di ni ji srid de kho na nyid ma rtogs pa de srid du gnas par 'gyur mod /
analyzed: thar pa 'dod pa rnams kyi thar pa 'dren par byed pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba sog pa'i rgyur gyur pa 'di ni ji srid de kho na nyid ma rtogs pa de srid du gnas par 'gyur mod /
translated: will remain as long as reality is not realized, and it is the cause for accumulating the roots of virtue that lead to liberation for those who desire liberation.

original: khyod ni don dam pa dang kun rdzob kyi bden pa la mi mkhas pas la lar 'thad pa bcug nas rigs pa ma yin pa las de 'jig par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: khyod ni don dam pa dang kun rdzob kyi bden pa la mi mkhas pas la lar 'thad pa bcug nas rigs pa ma yin pa las de 'jig par byed pa yin no //
translated: But you, being unskilled in ultimate and conventional truth, sometimes introduce a semblance of logic and destroy it with illogicality.

original: kho bo ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa rnam par 'jog pa la mkhas pa'i phyir /
analyzed: kho bo ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa rnam par 'jog pa la mkhas pa'i phyir /
translated: We, however, being skilled in positing conventional truth,

original: 'jig rten pa'i phyogs nyid la gnas te kun rdzob kyi phyogs gcig bsal ba'i phyir bkod pa'i 'thad pa gzhan 'thad pa gzhan gyis zlog par byed cing 'jig rten gyi rgan rabs ltar /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i phyogs nyid la gnas te kun rdzob kyi phyogs gcig bsal ba'i phyir bkod pa'i 'thad pa gzhan 'thad pa gzhan gyis zlog par byed cing 'jig rten gyi rgan rabs ltar /
translated: remain in the worldly perspective and refute with logic the other side of the conventional, which is posited by others, just as elders in the world do.

original: 'jig rten gyi chos lugs las nyams pa khyod kho na zlog par byed pa yin gyi kun rdzob ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi chos lugs las nyams pa khyod kho na zlog par byed pa yin gyi kun rdzob ni ma yin no //
translated: You alone are refuted in terms of worldly convention, but not in terms of the ultimate.

original: de'i phyir gal te 'jig rten pa'i tha snyad du yin na ni /
analyzed: de'i phyir gal te 'jig rten pa'i tha snyad du yin na ni /
translated: Therefore, if you are speaking in terms of worldly convention,

original: de'i tshe mtshan nyid bzhin du mtshan gzhir yang gdon mi za bar 'gyur bar bya dgos te /
analyzed: de'i tshe mtshan nyid bzhin du mtshan gzhir yang gdon mi za bar 'gyur bar bya dgos te /
translated: then just as with the characteristics, you must also accept the characterized.

original: de'i phyir nyes pa de nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir nyes pa de nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, the same fault would apply.

original: 'on te don dam par yin na ni de'i tshe mtshan gzhi med pas mtshan nyid gnyis kyang med pas tshad ma gnyis su ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: 'on te don dam par yin na ni de'i tshe mtshan gzhi med pas mtshan nyid gnyis kyang med pas tshad ma gnyis su ga la 'gyur /
translated: But if you are speaking in terms of the ultimate, then since the characterized does not exist, the two characteristics also do not exist. So how could there be two valid cognitions?

original: ci ste sgra rnams la bya ba dang byed pa po'i 'brel bar sngon du 'gro ba can gyi bye brag tu bshad pa de lta bu khas len par mi byed do zhe na /
analyzed: ci ste sgra rnams la bya ba dang byed pa po'i 'brel bar sngon du 'gro ba can gyi bye brag tu bshad pa de lta bu khas len par mi byed do zhe na /
translated: But you do not accept that the explanations are preceded by the relation of the object and the agent.

original: 'di ni shin tu dka' ste /
analyzed: 'di ni shin tu dka' ste /
translated: This is very difficult.

original: khyod bya ba dang byed pa po'i 'brel bas rab tu zhugs pa'i sgra de dag kho nas tha snyad byed cing /
analyzed: khyod bya ba dang byed pa po'i 'brel bas rab tu zhugs pa'i sgra de dag kho nas tha snyad byed cing /
translated: You use only those words that are engaged through the relation of the object and the agent.

original: bya ba dang byed pa po la sogs pa'i sgra'i don yang mi 'dod pas /
analyzed: bya ba dang byed pa po la sogs pa'i sgra'i don yang mi 'dod pas /
translated: Since the meaning of words such as action, agent, etc. is not accepted,

original: ae ma kyi hud khyod ni 'dod pa tsam la rag las te 'jug pa nyid do //
analyzed: ae ma kyi hud khyod ni 'dod pa tsam la rag las te 'jug pa nyid do //
translated: alas, alas, you are engaged in this merely out of desire.

original: gang gi tshe de ltar gzhal bya gnyis gnas pa med pa de'i tshe lung la sogs pa rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid kyi yul can ma yin pa nyid kyi sgo nas tshad ma gzhan nyid ma yin pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi tshe de ltar gzhal bya gnyis gnas pa med pa de'i tshe lung la sogs pa rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid kyi yul can ma yin pa nyid kyi sgo nas tshad ma gzhan nyid ma yin pa ma yin no //
translated: When the two kinds of objects of comprehension do not exist in this way, then scripture, etc. are not other valid cognitions in terms of being the objects of the characteristics of their own and general characteristics.

original: gzhan yang bum pa mngon sum mo zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa 'jig rten pa'i tha snyad ma bsdus pa'i phyir dang / 'phags pa ma yin pa'i tha snyad khas blangs pa'i phyir mtshan nyid ma khyab pa nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan yang bum pa mngon sum mo zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa 'jig rten pa'i tha snyad ma bsdus pa'i phyir dang / 'phags pa ma yin pa'i tha snyad khas blangs pa'i phyir mtshan nyid ma khyab pa nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: Moreover, since worldly conventions such as “the pot is directly perceptible” are not included, and since the conventions of non-āryas are accepted, the definition is not inclusive.

original: des na 'di ni mi rigs so //
analyzed: des na 'di ni mi rigs so //
translated: Therefore this is not correct.

original: ci ste bum pa'i nye bar len pa sngon po la sogs pa dag ni mngon sum gyi tshad mas yongs su gcad par bya ba yin pa'i phyir mngon sum yin te /
analyzed: ci ste bum pa'i nye bar len pa sngon po la sogs pa dag ni mngon sum gyi tshad mas yongs su gcad par bya ba yin pa'i phyir mngon sum yin te /
translated: But if the appropriated objects of a vase, such as blue, are direct perception because they are objects discerned by the valid knowledge of direct perception,

original: de'i phyir ji ltar rgyu la 'bras @24a * //🔽bu btags pa byas te /🔽sangs rgyas rnams ni 'byung ba bde //
analyzed: de'i phyir ji ltar rgyu la 'bras @24a * // bu btags pa byas te / sangs rgyas rnams ni 'byung ba bde //
translated: then just as the result is imputed to the cause,

original: zhes bsnyad pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: zhes bsnyad pa de bzhin du /
translated: as in the statement, “The arising of buddhas is happiness,”

original: sngon po la sogs pa mngon sum du gyur pa'i rgyu can gyi bum pa yang 'bras bu la rgyus btags pa byas nas mngon sum zhes bya bar brjod do snyam na /
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa mngon sum du gyur pa'i rgyu can gyi bum pa yang 'bras bu la rgyus btags pa byas nas mngon sum zhes bya bar brjod do snyam na /
translated: so too the vase, which is the result of direct perception, is imputed to the cause and is called “direct perception.”

original: rnam pa de lta bu'i yul la ni btags pa mi rigs te /
analyzed: rnam pa de lta bu'i yul la ni btags pa mi rigs te /
translated: Such an object is not suitable to be imputed because

original: 'byung ba ni 'jig rten na bde ba las tha dad par dmigs la /
analyzed: 'byung ba ni 'jig rten na bde ba las tha dad par dmigs la /
translated: arising is observed in the world to be different from happiness.

original: de yang 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid kyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir dang / dka' ba brgya phrag du ma'i rgyu can yin pa'i phyir bde ba ma yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: de yang 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid kyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir dang / dka' ba brgya phrag du ma'i rgyu can yin pa'i phyir bde ba ma yin pa nyid do //
translated: Moreover, because it is the nature of the characteristics of conditioned phenomena and because it is the cause of many hundreds of difficulties, it is not happiness.

original: de la bde ba zhes brjod pa na 'brel pa med pa nyid yin pas rnam pa de lta bu'i yul la nye bar btags pa rigs na /
analyzed: de la bde ba zhes brjod pa na 'brel pa med pa nyid yin pas rnam pa de lta bu'i yul la nye bar btags pa rigs na /
translated: If it is reasonable to impute such a kind of object,

original: bum pa mngon sum zhes bya ba 'dir ni gang zhig brtags nas mngon sum nyid du 'gyur ba bum pa zhes bya ba mngon sum ma yin pa logs shig tu dmigs pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: bum pa mngon sum zhes bya ba 'dir ni gang zhig brtags nas mngon sum nyid du 'gyur ba bum pa zhes bya ba mngon sum ma yin pa logs shig tu dmigs pa yang ma yin no //
translated: then in the case of the expression “the direct perception of a pot,” since a pot is not a separate object of direct perception that is imputed to be direct perception,🔽then it is not reasonable to impute it to be direct perception.

original: gal te sngon po la sogs pa las tha dad pa'i bum pa med pa'i phyir btags pa'i mngon sum nyid du 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: gal te sngon po la sogs pa las tha dad pa'i bum pa med pa'i phyir btags pa'i mngon sum nyid du 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If you say that because a pot is not different from blue and so on, it is imputed to be direct perception,

original: de lta na yang ches shin tu btags par mi rigs te /
analyzed: de lta na yang ches shin tu btags par mi rigs te /
translated: then even so, it is not reasonable to impute it to be direct perception.

original: gzhi gdags bya med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhi gdags bya med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the basis of imputation does not exist.

original: bong bu'i rva la rnon po nye bar 'dogs pa ni rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: bong bu'i rva la rnon po nye bar 'dogs pa ni rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not reasonable to impute sharpness to the horn of a donkey.

original: gzhan yang gal te 'jig rten gyi tha snyad kyi yan lag tu gyur pa'i bum pa sngon po la sogs pa las tha dad par gyur pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gzhan yang gal te 'jig rten gyi tha snyad kyi yan lag tu gyur pa'i bum pa sngon po la sogs pa las tha dad par gyur pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: Moreover, if a pot is not different from blue and so on, which are parts of the conventions of the world,🔽then it is not reasonable to impute it to be direct perception.

original: de nye bar btags pa pa'i mngon sum nyid du rtogs na ni de lta na ni sngon po la sogs pa yang sa la sogs pa las tha dad pa med pas sngon po la sogs pa yang btags pa pa'i mngon sum nyid du rtogs shig / ji skad🔽du / ji ltar gzugs sogs ma gtogs par //
analyzed: de nye bar btags pa pa'i mngon sum nyid du rtogs na ni de lta na ni sngon po la sogs pa yang sa la sogs pa las tha dad pa med pas sngon po la sogs pa yang btags pa pa'i mngon sum nyid du rtogs shig / ji skad du / ji ltar gzugs sogs ma gtogs par //
translated: If you think that it is a nominal direct perception, then since blue, etc. are not different from earth, etc. you should think that blue, etc. are also nominal direct perception.🔽As it is said:🔽Just as a pot does not exist

original: bum pa yod pa ma yin pa //🔽de bzhin rlung la sogs pa ni //
analyzed: bum pa yod pa ma yin pa // de bzhin rlung la sogs pa ni //
translated: apart from form, etc.🔽In the same way, form does not exist

original: ma gtogs gzugs kyang yod ma yin //🔽zhes bshad do //
analyzed: ma gtogs gzugs kyang yod ma yin // zhes bshad do //
translated: apart from wind, etc.

original: de'i phyir de lta bu la sogs pa'i 'jig rten gyi tha snyad ni mtshan nyid kyis ma bsdus pa'i phyir mtshan nyid ma khyab pa nyid do //
analyzed: de'i phyir de lta bu la sogs pa'i 'jig rten gyi tha snyad ni mtshan nyid kyis ma bsdus pa'i phyir mtshan nyid ma khyab pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, since such worldly conventions are not included in the definition, the definition is not inclusive.

original: de kho na nyid gzigs pa la ltos nas ni bum pa la sogs pa dang sngon po la sogs pa rnams mngon sum nyid du mi 'dod do //
analyzed: de kho na nyid gzigs pa la ltos nas ni bum pa la sogs pa dang sngon po la sogs pa rnams mngon sum nyid du mi 'dod do //
translated: But in dependence on seeing reality, pots, etc. and blue, etc. are not accepted as direct perception.

original: 'jig rten gyi kun rdzob tu ni bum pa la sogs pa rnams mngon sum nyid du khas blang bar bya ba kho na'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi kun rdzob tu ni bum pa la sogs pa rnams mngon sum nyid du khas blang bar bya ba kho na'o //
translated: In the conventional truth of the world, vases and so on are only to be accepted as direct perception.

original: ji skad du bzhi brgya pa las //
analyzed: ji skad du bzhi brgya pa las //
translated: As it is said in the Catuhfi śataka:

original: gzugs mthong @24b tshe na bum pa ni //
analyzed: gzugs mthong @24b tshe na bum pa ni //
translated: When one sees a form,

original: thams cad kho na mthong mi 'gyur //
analyzed: thams cad kho na mthong mi 'gyur //
translated: one does not see the vase at all.

original: bum pa mngon sum zhes bya 'ang //
analyzed: bum pa mngon sum zhes bya 'ang //
translated: And who would say that the vase is direct perception

original: de nyid rig pa su zhig smra //
analyzed: de nyid rig pa su zhig smra //
translated: when it is known by the intellect?

original: rnam par dpyad pa 'di nyid kyis //🔽blo mchog ldan pas dri zhim dang // mngar dang 'jam pa thams cad dag / so sor dgag par bya ba yin //
analyzed: rnam par dpyad pa 'di nyid kyis // blo mchog ldan pas dri zhim dang // mngar dang 'jam pa thams cad dag / so sor dgag par bya ba yin //
translated: By this very analysis,🔽one who has the highest intellect should individually refute

original: zhes bshad do //
analyzed: zhes bshad do //
translated: all that is sweet-smelling, sweet, and soft.

original: gzhan yang mngon sum gyi sgra ni lkog tu ma gyur pa'i don gyi rjod par byed pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gzhan yang mngon sum gyi sgra ni lkog tu ma gyur pa'i don gyi rjod par byed pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Moreover, the word “direct” is used to refer to an object that is not hidden.

original: dbang po mngon du phyogs pa'i don ni mngon sum yin no //
analyzed: dbang po mngon du phyogs pa'i don ni mngon sum yin no //
translated: An object that is directly perceived by the senses is direct perception.

original: 'di la dbang po mngon du phyogs pas zhes bya ba nas bum pa dang sngon po la sogs pa lkog tu ma gyur pa rnams mngon sum nyid du grub par 'gyur la /
analyzed: 'di la dbang po mngon du phyogs pas zhes bya ba nas bum pa dang sngon po la sogs pa lkog tu ma gyur pa rnams mngon sum nyid du grub par 'gyur la /
translated: In this regard, the term “manifest” in the phrase “the sense faculty is manifest” means that the pot, the blue color, etc., which are not hidden, are established as direct perception.

original: de yongs su gcod par byed pa'i shes pa ni rtsva dang sog ma'i me bzhin du mngon sum gyi rgyu can yin pa'i phyir mngon sum nyid du rjod par byed do //
analyzed: de yongs su gcod par byed pa'i shes pa ni rtsva dang sog ma'i me bzhin du mngon sum gyi rgyu can yin pa'i phyir mngon sum nyid du rjod par byed do //
translated: And the cognition that determines them is described as direct perception because it is caused by direct perception, like the fire produced by rubbing two pieces of wood together.

original: gang zhig dbang po dang dbang po so so la 'jug pas zhes bya bas mngon sum gyi sgra bye brag tu 'chad par byed pa /
analyzed: gang zhig dbang po dang dbang po so so la 'jug pas zhes bya bas mngon sum gyi sgra bye brag tu 'chad par byed pa /
translated: Someone explains the term “direct perception” as “that which engages the sense faculty and the individual sense object.”

original: de ltar na ni shes pa ni dbang po'i yul can ma yin pa'i phyir dang / yul gyi yul can yin pa'i phyir bye brag tu bshad pa mi rigs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar na ni shes pa ni dbang po'i yul can ma yin pa'i phyir dang / yul gyi yul can yin pa'i phyir bye brag tu bshad pa mi rigs par 'gyur te /
translated: If that were the case, it would be illogical to explain the term “direct perception” in this way, because cognition is not the possessor of a sense faculty and it is the possessor of an object.

original: yul so so ba 'am don so so ba nyid ces bya bar ni mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yul so so ba 'am don so so ba nyid ces bya bar ni mi 'gyur ro //
translated: It would not be called “the possessor of a separate object” or “the possessor of a separate meaning.”

original: ci ste ji ltar rnam par shes pa 'byung ba gnyi ga la rag las pa yin yang rnam par shes pa rnams rten gsal ba dang zhan pa'i rjes su byed pa'i phyir dang / de dag gyur na 'gyur ba'i phyir /
analyzed: ci ste ji ltar rnam par shes pa 'byung ba gnyi ga la rag las pa yin yang rnam par shes pa rnams rten gsal ba dang zhan pa'i rjes su byed pa'i phyir dang / de dag gyur na 'gyur ba'i phyir /
translated: Though consciousness arises in dependence on both, since consciousness conforms to the clarity and weakness of its support and since it changes when that changes,

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa zhes rten nyid kyis ston par 'gyur ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa zhes rten nyid kyis ston par 'gyur ba de bzhin du /
translated: the eye consciousness is taught by its support itself.

original: don dang don so so la 'jug mod kyi de lta na yang dbang po dang dbang po la brten nas 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa ni rten gyis bstan pas mngon sum nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: don dang don so so la 'jug mod kyi de lta na yang dbang po dang dbang po la brten nas 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa ni rten gyis bstan pas mngon sum nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: Though it engages objects and individual objects, consciousness engages objects in dependence on the sense faculties and consciousness engaged in dependence on the sense faculties is taught by its support itself.🔽It is direct perception because it is taught by its support itself,

original: rnga'i sgra nas kyi myu gu zhes thun mong ma yin pa'i rgyus ston pa ni mthong ba yin no snyam na /
analyzed: rnga'i sgra nas kyi myu gu zhes thun mong ma yin pa'i rgyus ston pa ni mthong ba yin no snyam na /
translated: like the sound of a drum and the sprout of barley, which are taught by their uncommon causes.

original: 'di ni snga ma dang mi 'dra ba yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni snga ma dang mi 'dra ba yin te /
translated: This is not similar to the previous example.

original: der ni gzugs kyi rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pas yul gyi rnam par shes pa bstan na /
analyzed: der ni gzugs kyi rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pas yul gyi rnam par shes pa bstan na /
translated: In the previous example, consciousness of form and so on teaches the consciousness of the object.

original: rnam par shes pa drug gi rnam par dbye ba ma bstan par 'gyur te /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa drug gi rnam par dbye ba ma bstan par 'gyur te /
translated: If the six consciousnesses were not taught, the six consciousnesses would not be taught.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa ni mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa dang lhan cig yul gcig la 'dug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa ni mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa dang lhan cig yul gcig la 'dug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because mental consciousness is simultaneous with eye consciousness, etc., on the same object.

original: 'di ltar sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa drug la rnam par shes pa zhes brjod @25a * //🔽na ni / ci rnam par shes pa 'di dbang po gzugs can las skyes pa zhig gam /
analyzed: 'di ltar sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa drug la rnam par shes pa zhes brjod @25a * // na ni / ci rnam par shes pa 'di dbang po gzugs can las skyes pa zhig gam /
translated: Thus, if the six consciousnesses of blue, etc., were called consciousness,🔽one would have to ask, “Is this consciousness produced from a physical sense faculty or is it mental?”

original: 'on te yid las byung ba zhig ces shes pa re ba dang bcas pa yid du 'gyur la /
analyzed: 'on te yid las byung ba zhig ces shes pa re ba dang bcas pa yid du 'gyur la /
translated: Mental consciousness would be the one that has a question,

original: rten gyis bstan na ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa'i yul la 'jug pa yin yang phan tshun dbye ba grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rten gyis bstan na ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa'i yul la 'jug pa yin yang phan tshun dbye ba grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: but if it is taught by means of its support, then even though mental consciousness engages the object of eye consciousness, etc., their mutual distinction is established.

original: 'dir ni tshad ma'i mtshan nyid brjod par 'dod pas rtog pa dang bral ba tsam zhig mngon sum nyid du khas blangs pas rnam par rtog pa las 'di khyad par du mngon par 'dod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'dir ni tshad ma'i mtshan nyid brjod par 'dod pas rtog pa dang bral ba tsam zhig mngon sum nyid du khas blangs pas rnam par rtog pa las 'di khyad par du mngon par 'dod pa'i phyir /
translated: Here, since it is the definition of valid cognition that is being stated, by accepting mere freedom from misconception to be direct perception, it is clearly asserted that this is superior to conception.

original: thun mong ma yin pa'i rgyus bstan pa la dgos pa cung zad kyang ma mthong ngo //
analyzed: thun mong ma yin pa'i rgyus bstan pa la dgos pa cung zad kyang ma mthong ngo //
translated: Therefore, I see no need to teach it by a unique cause.

original: tshad ma'i grangs su 'jug pa gzhal bya'i gzhan gyi dbang yin pa'i phyir dang / gzhal bya'i rnam pa'i rjes su byed pa tsam gyis rang gi ngo bo yod par rnyed pa'i tshad ma dag gi rang gi ngo bo rnam par 'jog pa'i phyir dbang pos bstan pa cung zad kyang mi ma kho bas rnam pa thams cad du yul kho nas bstan🔽par rigs so //
analyzed: tshad ma'i grangs su 'jug pa gzhal bya'i gzhan gyi dbang yin pa'i phyir dang / gzhal bya'i rnam pa'i rjes su byed pa tsam gyis rang gi ngo bo yod par rnyed pa'i tshad ma dag gi rang gi ngo bo rnam par 'jog pa'i phyir dbang pos bstan pa cung zad kyang mi ma kho bas rnam pa thams cad du yul kho nas bstan🔽par rigs so //
translated: Since the number of valid cognitions is dependent on the other, the object of comprehension, and since the nature of valid cognitions that find their existence by merely conforming to the aspect of the object of comprehension is posited by the object of comprehension, there is not the slightest need to teach it by the sense faculties. Therefore, in every way, it is logical that it is taught by the object alone.

original: gal te 'jig rten na brjod par 'dod pa'i don la mngon sum gyi sgra rab tu grags pa'i phyir dang / don so so zhes bya ba'i sgra ma grags pa'i phyir rten kho nas bye brag tu bshad pa la rten par byed do zhe na /
analyzed: gal te 'jig rten na brjod par 'dod pa'i don la mngon sum gyi sgra rab tu grags pa'i phyir dang / don so so zhes bya ba'i sgra ma grags pa'i phyir rten kho nas bye brag tu bshad pa la rten par byed do zhe na /
translated: If you say that the term “direct perception” is well known in the world to refer to the object that is desired, and that the term “individual object” is not well known, then the explanation of the term “direct perception” should be based on the word “object.”

original: bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: bshad par bya ste /
translated: We reply:

original: mngon sum gyi sgra 'di 'jig rten la grags pa ni yod mod kyi /
analyzed: mngon sum gyi sgra 'di 'jig rten la grags pa ni yod mod kyi /
translated: The term “direct perception” is indeed well known in the world.

original: de ji ltar 'jig rten na yin pa de ltar ni kho bo cag gis smras pa nyid do //
analyzed: de ji ltar 'jig rten na yin pa de ltar ni kho bo cag gis smras pa nyid do //
translated: But we have explained how it is known in the world.

original: 'jig rten pa'i don ji ltar gnas pa spangs nas de bye brag tu 'chad par byed na ni /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i don ji ltar gnas pa spangs nas de bye brag tu 'chad par byed na ni /
translated: If you reject the meaning of “direct perception” as it is known in the world and explain it differently,

original: rab tu grags pa'i sgra yang spong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rab tu grags pa'i sgra yang spong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: then you also reject the well-known term “direct perception.”

original: de'i phyir mngon sum zhes bya ba de ltar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir mngon sum zhes bya ba de ltar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, the term “direct perception” would not exist.

original: zlos pa'i don med pa'i phyir dbang po'i skad cig gcig gi rten can mig gi rnam par shes pa gcig mngon sum nyid du yang mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: zlos pa'i don med pa'i phyir dbang po'i skad cig gcig gi rten can mig gi rnam par shes pa gcig mngon sum nyid du yang mi 'gyur la /
translated: Because the meaning of “repetition” is not established, a single moment of a sense faculty would not be the basis of a single instance of visual consciousness that is direct perception.

original: re re la mngon sum nyid med na ni mang po rnams la yang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: re re la mngon sum nyid med na ni mang po rnams la yang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If each one does not have direct perception, then many also will not have it.

original: rtog pa dang bral ba'i shes pa nyid mngon sum nyid du khas blangs pa'i phyir dang / des kyang 'jig rten pa'i tha snyad byed pa med pa'i phyir dang / 'jig rten pa'i tshad ma dang gzhal bya'i tha snyad bshad par 'dod pa'i phyir na mngon sum tshad mar rtog pa ni don med pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rtog pa dang bral ba'i shes pa nyid mngon sum nyid du khas blangs pa'i phyir dang / des kyang 'jig rten pa'i tha snyad byed pa med pa'i phyir dang / 'jig rten pa'i tshad ma dang gzhal bya'i tha snyad bshad par 'dod pa'i phyir na mngon sum tshad mar rtog pa ni don med pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: Because it is accepted that the very cognition free from conceptuality is direct perception, and because it does not perform the conventions of the world, and because it is asserted that the conventions of the world and the valid cognition that evaluates them are explained, the conception of direct perception as valid cognition is pointless.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa @25b dang ldan pas sngon po shes kyi sngon po'o snyam du ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i lung yang mngon sum gyi mtshan nyid brjod pa'i don can gyi skabs ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir dang / dbang po'i rnam par shes pa lnga po rnams blun pa nyid du ston par byed pa nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa @25b dang ldan pas sngon po shes kyi sngon po'o snyam du ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i lung yang mngon sum gyi mtshan nyid brjod pa'i don can gyi skabs ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir dang / dbang po'i rnam par shes pa lnga po rnams blun pa nyid du ston par byed pa nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: The scripture that states “Consciousness possessing eye consciousness knows blue but does not think ‘blue’” is not the context for stating the definition of direct perception, and because it shows that the five sense consciousnesses are ignorant.

original: lung las kyang rtog pa dang bral ba'i rnam par shes pa kho na mngon sum nyid ma yin pas 'di ni mi rigs so //🔽de'i phyir gal te mtshan gzhi 'am rang gi mtshan nyid dam spyi'i mtshan nyid kyang rung ste /
analyzed: lung las kyang rtog pa dang bral ba'i rnam par shes pa kho na mngon sum nyid ma yin pas 'di ni mi rigs so // de'i phyir gal te mtshan gzhi 'am rang gi mtshan nyid dam spyi'i mtshan nyid kyang rung ste /
translated: And in the scriptures, it is said that only consciousness free from conceptualization is direct perception.

original: 'jig rten na yod na ni thams cad mngon sum du dmigs par bya ba yin pa'i phyir na lkog tu ma gyur pa yin te /
analyzed: 'jig rten na yod na ni thams cad mngon sum du dmigs par bya ba yin pa'i phyir na lkog tu ma gyur pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, if the basis of characteristics, whether it is a specific characteristic or a universal characteristic, exists in the world, then it is not hidden, because everything is to be perceived by direct perception.

original: de'i phyir de'i yul can gyi rnam par shes pa dang lhan cig tu mngon sum nyid du rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: de'i phyir de'i yul can gyi rnam par shes pa dang lhan cig tu mngon sum nyid du rnam par gzhag go //
translated: Therefore, the consciousness that has it as its object is established as direct perception together with it.

original: zla ba gnyis la sogs pa dag ni rab rib can ma yin pa'i shes pa la ltos nas mngon sum nyid ma yin la /
analyzed: zla ba gnyis la sogs pa dag ni rab rib can ma yin pa'i shes pa la ltos nas mngon sum nyid ma yin la /
translated: As for the two moons and so on, they are not direct perception in relation to the consciousness of one who does not have an eye disease.

original: rab rib can la sogs pa la ltos nas ni mngon sum nyid kho na'o //
analyzed: rab rib can la sogs pa la ltos nas ni mngon sum nyid kho na'o //
translated: But they are direct perception in relation to one who has an eye disease.

original: lkog tu gyur pa'i yul can rtags bsgrub par bya ba la mi 'khrul ba las skyes pa'i shes pa ni rjes su dpag pa'o //
analyzed: lkog tu gyur pa'i yul can rtags bsgrub par bya ba la mi 'khrul ba las skyes pa'i shes pa ni rjes su dpag pa'o //
translated: Inference is the knowledge that arises from a reason that is nonerroneous in relation to the object that is hidden.

original: dbang po las 'das pa'i don mngon sum du rig cing yid ches par gyur pa dag gi tshig gang yin pa de ni lung ngo //
analyzed: dbang po las 'das pa'i don mngon sum du rig cing yid ches par gyur pa dag gi tshig gang yin pa de ni lung ngo //
translated: The words of those who have direct knowledge and confidence in the meaning that is beyond the senses are scripture.

original: 'dra pa las nyams su myong ba'i don rtogs pa ni nye bar 'jal ba ste /
analyzed: 'dra pa las nyams su myong ba'i don rtogs pa ni nye bar 'jal ba ste /
translated: Analogy is the understanding of a meaning that is experienced through similarity,

original: dper na ba man ni ba lang dang 'dra'o snyam pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na ba man ni ba lang dang 'dra'o snyam pa lta bu'o //
translated: as when one thinks, “A gayal is like a cow.”

original: de'i phyir de ltar tshad ma bzhi las 'jig rten gyi don rtogs par rnam par 'jog pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar tshad ma bzhi las 'jig rten gyi don rtogs par rnam par 'jog pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the understanding of the meaning of the world is established through these four valid cognitions.

original: de dag kyang phan tshun ltos pas 'grub par 'gyur te /🔽tshad ma dag yod na gzhal bya'i don dag tu 'gyur la /
analyzed: de dag kyang phan tshun ltos pas 'grub par 'gyur te / tshad ma dag yod na gzhal bya'i don dag tu 'gyur la /
translated: Moreover, they are established through mutual dependence.🔽If there are valid cognitions, then there are objects of comprehension.

original: gzhal bya'i don dag yod na tshad ma dag tu 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: gzhal bya'i don dag yod na tshad ma dag tu 'gyur gyi /
translated: If there are objects of comprehension, then there are valid cognitions.

original: tshad ma dang gzhal bya gnyis ngo bo nyid kyis grub pa ni yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: tshad ma dang gzhal bya gnyis ngo bo nyid kyis grub pa ni yod pa ma yin no //
translated: However, valid cognitions and objects of comprehension do not exist inherently.

original: de'i phyir mthong ba ji lta ba bzhin du 'jig rten pa nyid yin la rag ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir mthong ba ji lta ba bzhin du 'jig rten pa nyid yin la rag ste /
translated: Therefore, the world is just as it appears to be.

original: spros pas chog go //
analyzed: spros pas chog go //
translated: Enough of this elaboration!

original: dkyus ma nyid bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: dkyus ma nyid bshad par bya'o //
translated: I will explain the main point.

original: 'dir rang gi sde pa dag na re /
analyzed: 'dir rang gi sde pa dag na re /
translated: Here, our own Buddhist schools say:

original: gang 'di 'di skad du dngos po rnams bdag las skye ba ma yin te /🔽zhes smras pa de ni rigs te /
analyzed: gang 'di 'di skad du dngos po rnams bdag las skye ba ma yin te / zhes smras pa de ni rigs te /
translated: It is correct to say that things do not arise from themselves,

original: rang las skye ba don med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang las skye ba don med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is pointless for things to arise from themselves.

original: gang yang gnyi ga la skye ba ma yin te zhes smras pa de yang rigs te /
analyzed: gang yang gnyi ga la skye ba ma yin te zhes smras pa de yang rigs te /
translated: It is also correct to say that things do not arise from both themselves and others,

original: yan lag gcig ma tshang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yan lag gcig ma tshang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because one of the two parts is lacking.

original: rgyu med pa'i phyogs ni shin tu tha chad @26a * //
analyzed: rgyu med pa'i phyogs ni shin tu tha chad @26a * //
translated: The position that things arise without a cause is the most inferior

original: yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yin pa'i phyir /
translated: because it is easy to refute.

original: de dgag pa yang rigs na /
analyzed: de dgag pa yang rigs na /
translated: If it is correct to refute that,

original: gang 'di skad du gzhan las skye ba yang ma yin te zhes smras pa de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang 'di skad du gzhan las skye ba yang ma yin te zhes smras pa de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: then it is incorrect to say that things do not arise from other,🔽because the Transcendent Lord has taught that only things that are other generate things,

original: gang gi phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis gzhan du gyur pa dag kho na dngos po rnams kyi skyed par byed par bstan pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis gzhan du gyur pa dag kho na dngos po rnams kyi skyed par byed par bstan pa'i phyir te /
translated: as it is said:

original: rkyen rnam bzhi ste rgyu dang ni //
analyzed: rkyen rnam bzhi ste rgyu dang ni //
translated: There are four conditions: causal,

original: dmigs pa dang ni de ma thag / bdag po yang ni de bzhin te //
analyzed: dmigs pa dang ni de ma thag / bdag po yang ni de bzhin te //
