translated: objective, immediately preceding, and dominant.

original: rkyen lnga pa ni yod ma yin //
analyzed: rkyen lnga pa ni yod ma yin //
translated: There is no fifth condition.

original: de la sgrub par byed pa ni rgyu yin no zhes bya ba'i mtshan nyid las na gang zhig gang gi sgrub byed sa bon gyi ngo bor gnas pa de ni de'i rgyu'i rkyen no //🔽dmigs pa gang gis skye bar 'gyur ba'i chos can bskyed pa de ni de'i dmigs pa'i rkyen no //
analyzed: de la sgrub par byed pa ni rgyu yin no zhes bya ba'i mtshan nyid las na gang zhig gang gi sgrub byed sa bon gyi ngo bor gnas pa de ni de'i rgyu'i rkyen no // dmigs pa gang gis skye bar 'gyur ba'i chos can bskyed pa de ni de'i dmigs pa'i rkyen no //
translated: The cause is that which establishes the effect.🔽The cause is the condition qua cause of that effect which is established by that cause, just as the seed is of the sprout.🔽The object is the condition qua object of that effect which arises in dependence on the object.

original: rgyu 'gags ma thag pa ni 'bras bu 'byung ba'i rkyen yin te /
analyzed: rgyu 'gags ma thag pa ni 'bras bu 'byung ba'i rkyen yin te /
translated: The immediately antecedent condition is the condition of the effect which arises immediately after the cessation of the cause.

original: dper na sa bon 'gags ma thag pa myu gu 'byung ba'i rkyen yin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na sa bon 'gags ma thag pa myu gu 'byung ba'i rkyen yin pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, the immediately antecedent condition of the sprout is the seed which has just ceased.

original: gang zhig yod pas gang 'byung ba de ni de'i bdag po'o //
analyzed: gang zhig yod pas gang 'byung ba de ni de'i bdag po'o //
translated: The dominant condition is that which is the cause of the effect by its mere existence.

original: 'di dag ni rkyen bzhi'o //
analyzed: 'di dag ni rkyen bzhi'o //
translated: These are the four conditions.

original: gzhan gang dag sngar skyes pa dang lhan cig skyes pa dang / phyis skye ba la sogs pa de dag ni 'di rnams kyi khongs su 'dus pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan gang dag sngar skyes pa dang lhan cig skyes pa dang / phyis skye ba la sogs pa de dag ni 'di rnams kyi khongs su 'dus pa yin no //
translated: Whatever other conditions are mentioned, such as the prior, simultaneous, subsequent, etc., are included in these four.

original: dbang phyug la sogs pa dag ni rkyen ma yin te /
analyzed: dbang phyug la sogs pa dag ni rkyen ma yin te /
translated: God, etc., are not conditions.

original: de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: For this reason,

original: rkyen lnga pa ni yod ma yin //
analyzed: rkyen lnga pa ni yod ma yin //
translated: There is no fifth condition.

original: zhes nges par gzung ba yin no //
analyzed: zhes nges par gzung ba yin no //
translated: Thus, it is ascertained.

original: de'i phyir gzhan du gyur pa 'di dag las dngos po rnams skye ba'i phyir gzhan las skye ba yod pa yin no zhes 'dzer to //
analyzed: de'i phyir gzhan du gyur pa 'di dag las dngos po rnams skye ba'i phyir gzhan las skye ba yod pa yin no zhes 'dzer to //
translated: Therefore, since things arise from these other conditions, arising from other does exist.

original: de la bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: de la bshad par bya ste /
translated: In response to this, Nāgārjuna explains:

original: dngos po rnams ni rkyen gzhan du gyur pa dag las skye ba ma yin pa nyid de /
analyzed: dngos po rnams ni rkyen gzhan du gyur pa dag las skye ba ma yin pa nyid de /
translated: Things do not arise from other conditions.

original: 'di ltar / dngos po rnams kyi rang bzhin ni //
analyzed: 'di ltar / dngos po rnams kyi rang bzhin ni //
translated: The essence of things

original: rkyen la sogs la yod ma yin //
analyzed: rkyen la sogs la yod ma yin //
translated: Does not exist in conditions and so on.

original: bdag gi dngos po yod min na //
analyzed: bdag gi dngos po yod min na //
translated: If their own entities do not exist,

original: gzhan dngos yod pa ma yin no //🔽gal te 'bras bur gyur ba'i dngos po rnams rgyu la sogs pa'i rkyen gzhan du gyur pa 'dus pa'am so so ba'am 'dus pa dang so so ba dag gam /🔽rgyu dang rkyen gyi tshogs pa las gzhan 'ga' zhig la yang rung ste /
analyzed: gzhan dngos yod pa ma yin no // gal te 'bras bur gyur ba'i dngos po rnams rgyu la sogs pa'i rkyen gzhan du gyur pa 'dus pa'am so so ba'am 'dus pa dang so so ba dag gam / rgyu dang rkyen gyi tshogs pa las gzhan 'ga' zhig la yang rung ste /
translated: Other entities do not exist.

original: skyes pa'i snga rol du yod par gyur na ni /
analyzed: skyes pa'i snga rol du yod par gyur na ni /
translated: If things that are effects existed prior to the assembly of causes and conditions, such as conditions that are causes, and so on, or individually, or both assembled and individually, or from something other than the assembly of causes and conditions, or from a combination of causes and conditions,

original: de dag las skye bar 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: de dag las skye bar 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: then things would arise from other.

original: gang zhig skye ba'i snga rol du yod par 'gyur ba de ltar yang ma yin te /
analyzed: gang zhig skye ba'i snga rol du yod par 'gyur ba de ltar yang ma yin te /
translated: But it is not like that, because it exists prior to arising.

original: gal te yod par gyur na ni /
analyzed: gal te yod par gyur na ni /
translated: If it existed,

original: gzung du yod pa'am skye ba don med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzung du yod pa'am skye ba don med par 'gyur ro //
translated: it would be apprehended, and arising would be pointless.

original: de'i phyir dngos po @26b rnams kyi rang bzhin ni rkyen la sogs pa dag la yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir dngos po @26b rnams kyi rang bzhin ni rkyen la sogs pa dag la yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the essence of things does not exist in conditions and so on.

original: bdag gi dngos po yod pa ma yin pa nyid yin na gzhan gyi dngos po yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: bdag gi dngos po yod pa ma yin pa nyid yin na gzhan gyi dngos po yod pa ma yin no //
translated: If the essence of things does not exist, the nature of being other does not exist.

original: 'byung bas na dngos po ste skye ba'o //
analyzed: 'byung bas na dngos po ste skye ba'o //
translated: “Thing” means arising.

original: gzhan gyi dngos po ni gzhan dag las skye ba ste de yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dngos po ni gzhan dag las skye ba ste de yod pa ma yin no //
translated: The nature of being other is arising from other, and that does not exist.

original: de'i phyir dngos po rnams gzhan du gyur pa dag las skye bo zhes bya ba 'di rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir dngos po rnams gzhan du gyur pa dag las skye bo zhes bya ba 'di rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore it is illogical to say that things arise from things that are other.

original: rnam pa gcig tu na rgyu med pa can du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir myu gu la sogs pa 'bras bur gyur pa'i dngos po rnams kyi rang bzhin ni /
analyzed: rnam pa gcig tu na rgyu med pa can du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir myu gu la sogs pa 'bras bur gyur pa'i dngos po rnams kyi rang bzhin ni /
translated: In another way, because it would follow that things would arise without a cause, the essence of things that are effects, such as sprouts,

original: sa bon la sogs pa rkyen rnam par 'gyur ba med pa'i rang bzhin can dag yod pa na yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: sa bon la sogs pa rkyen rnam par 'gyur ba med pa'i rang bzhin can dag yod pa na yod pa ma yin no //
translated: If seeds and so on exist, then conditions do not exist as things that are essentially unchanging.

original: de'i phyir rkyen la sogs pa rnams ci la ltos nas gzhan nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i phyir rkyen la sogs pa rnams ci la ltos nas gzhan nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, in dependence on what would conditions and so on be different?

original: byams pa dang nyer sbas dag ni yod pa gnyis kho na phan tshun ltos pa'i gzhan nyid du 'gyur na /
analyzed: byams pa dang nyer sbas dag ni yod pa gnyis kho na phan tshun ltos pa'i gzhan nyid du 'gyur na /
translated: Only two things that exist can be different in mutual dependence, like Maitreya and Upagupta.

original: sa bon dang myu gu gnyis ni de ltar cig car ba ma yin no //
analyzed: sa bon dang myu gu gnyis ni de ltar cig car ba ma yin no //
translated: But the seed and sprout are not like that, because they are not simultaneous.

original: de'i phyir 'bras bu rnams kyi bdag gi dngos po yod pa ma yin na //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'bras bu rnams kyi bdag gi dngos po yod pa ma yin na //
translated: Therefore, the entity of effects does not exist.

original: sa bon la sogs pa rnams la gzhan gyi dngos po ste gzhan nyid yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: sa bon la sogs pa rnams la gzhan gyi dngos po ste gzhan nyid yod pa ma yin no //
translated: The otherness of seeds and so on, that is, their difference, does not exist.

original: de'i phyir gzhan du bsnyad du med pa kho na'i phyir gzhan las skye ba ma yin pas dngos po rnams gzhan las skye'i zhes bya ba 'di ni mi rung ngo //
analyzed: de'i phyir gzhan du bsnyad du med pa kho na'i phyir gzhan las skye ba ma yin pas dngos po rnams gzhan las skye'i zhes bya ba 'di ni mi rung ngo //
translated: Therefore, because it cannot be said that they are different, things do not arise from other. Therefore, it is not tenable to say, “Things arise from other.”

original: de'i phyir gzhan gyi lung gi dgongs pa mngon par ma shes pa nyid de /
analyzed: de'i phyir gzhan gyi lung gi dgongs pa mngon par ma shes pa nyid de /
translated: Therefore, you have not understood the intended meaning of the scriptures.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dag ni rigs pa dang 'gal ba'i dag mi gsung la /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dag ni rigs pa dang 'gal ba'i dag mi gsung la /
translated: The Tathāgatas do not teach what is inconsistent with reason.

original: lung gi dgongs pa yang gong du nye bar bstan zin to //
analyzed: lung gi dgongs pa yang gong du nye bar bstan zin to //
translated: And the intended meaning of the scriptures has already been explained above.

original: de'i phyir de ltar rkyen dag las skye bar smra ba bkag pa yin dang / bya ba las skye bar smra ba ni /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar rkyen dag las skye bar smra ba bkag pa yin dang / bya ba las skye bar smra ba ni /
translated: Thus, the assertion that things arise from conditions has been refuted, and the assertion that things arise from activity is also refuted.

original: mig dang gzugs la sogs pa'i rkyen dag ni dngos su rnam par shes pa skyed par mi byed kyi /
analyzed: mig dang gzugs la sogs pa'i rkyen dag ni dngos su rnam par shes pa skyed par mi byed kyi /
translated: The conditions such as eyes and form do not directly generate consciousness.

original: rnam par shes pa skye ba'i bya ba sgrub par byed pa'i phyir rkyen zhes bya la /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa skye ba'i bya ba sgrub par byed pa'i phyir rkyen zhes bya la /
translated: They are called conditions because they establish the activity that generates consciousness.

original: bya ba des kyang rnam par shes pa skyed par byed de /
analyzed: bya ba des kyang rnam par shes pa skyed par byed de /
translated: And that activity generates consciousness.

original: de'i phyir rnam par shes pa skye ba'i bya ba rkyen dang ldan pa ni rnam par shes pa skyed par byed pa yin gyi rkyen dag ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam par shes pa skye ba'i bya ba rkyen dang ldan pa ni rnam par shes pa skyed par byed pa yin gyi rkyen dag ni ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, the activity that generates consciousness, which possesses conditions, generates consciousness, but the conditions do not.

original: dper na / 'bras chen gyi 'tshod pa'i bya ba bzhin no snyam du sems so //
analyzed: dper na / 'bras chen gyi 'tshod pa'i bya ba bzhin no snyam du sems so //
translated: For example, it is like the activity of cooking rice.

original: bshad pa / bya ba rkyen dang ldan pa med //
analyzed: bshad pa / bya ba rkyen dang ldan pa med //
translated: Nāgārjuna responds: Activity does not possess conditions.

original: gal te bya ba 'ga' zhig yod par gyur na ni /
analyzed: gal te bya ba 'ga' zhig yod par gyur na ni /
translated: If there were some action,

original: de mig la sogs pa'i rkyen dag gis rkyen dang ldan pas rnam par shes pa skyed par @27a * //🔽byed pa zhig na /
analyzed: de mig la sogs pa'i rkyen dag gis rkyen dang ldan pas rnam par shes pa skyed par @27a * // byed pa zhig na /
translated: then it would generate consciousness by possessing conditions, through the conditions of the eye and so on.

original: yod pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: yod pa ni ma yin no //
translated: But it does not exist.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: 'dir bya ba 'di 'dod pa na rnam par shes pa skyes zin pa la 'dod dam /
analyzed: 'dir bya ba 'di 'dod pa na rnam par shes pa skyes zin pa la 'dod dam /
translated: Here, if you assert this action, do you assert it in regard to consciousness that has already arisen,

original: ma skyes pa la 'am skye bzhin pa la yin grang na /
analyzed: ma skyes pa la 'am skye bzhin pa la yin grang na /
translated: or in regard to that which has not yet arisen, or in regard to that which is in the process of arising?

original: de la skyes zin pa la mi rigs te /
analyzed: de la skyes zin pa la mi rigs te /
translated: In regard to that which has already arisen, it is not tenable.

original: bya ba ni dngos po sgrub par byed pa yin na /
analyzed: bya ba ni dngos po sgrub par byed pa yin na /
translated: If action establishes an entity,

original: dngos po grub par gyur na ni de la bya bas ci zhig dgos te /
analyzed: dngos po grub par gyur na ni de la bya bas ci zhig dgos te /
translated: then if the entity has already been established, what need is there for action?

original: 'di ni skyes par gyur pa slar yang skye bar 'gyur ba rigs pa ma yin nyid //
analyzed: 'di ni skyes par gyur pa slar yang skye bar 'gyur ba rigs pa ma yin nyid //
translated: It is not rational for that which has already arisen to arise again.

original: ces bya ba la sogs pa dbu ma la 'jug pa las bstan pa yin no //🔽ma skyes pa la yang mi rigs te /
analyzed: ces bya ba la sogs pa dbu ma la 'jug pa las bstan pa yin no // ma skyes pa la yang mi rigs te /
translated: This and more is taught in the Madhyamakāvatāra.🔽In regard to that which has not yet arisen, it is also not tenable.

original: skye ba 'di ni byed pa med par rigs pa'i ngo bo 'ang min //
analyzed: skye ba 'di ni byed pa med par rigs pa'i ngo bo 'ang min //
translated: This arising is not rational without an agent.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is said, “The effect does not exist in the conditions individually or collectively.”

original: dngos po skye bzhin pa la yang bya ba srid pa ma yin te /
analyzed: dngos po skye bzhin pa la yang bya ba srid pa ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it possible for the activity of arising to exist in a thing that is in the process of arising,

original: skyes pa dang ma skyes pa las ma gtogs pa'i skye bzhin pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skyes pa dang ma skyes pa las ma gtogs pa'i skye bzhin pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because apart from that which has arisen and that which has not arisen, there is no third thing that is in the process of arising.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it has been said:

original: skye bzhin pa ni phyed skyed phyir //
analyzed: skye bzhin pa ni phyed skyed phyir //
translated: Because it is half-generated,

original: skye bzhin pa ni skye ba min //
analyzed: skye bzhin pa ni skye ba min //
translated: that which is in the process of arising is not arising.

original: yang na thams cad skye bzhin pa //🔽nyid ni yin par thal bar 'gyur //
analyzed: yang na thams cad skye bzhin pa // nyid ni yin par thal bar 'gyur //
translated: Or else, it follows that everything

original: zhes gsungs so //🔽gang gi phyir /
analyzed: zhes gsungs so // gang gi phyir /
translated: is in the process of arising.

original: de ltar dus gsum du skye ba'i bya ba mi srid pa de'i phyir de ni yod pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar dus gsum du skye ba'i bya ba mi srid pa de'i phyir de ni yod pa yang ma yin no //
translated: Because in this way, the activity of arising is not possible in any of the three temporal periods, therefore it does not exist.

original: de nyid kyi phyir /🔽bya ba rkyen dang ldan pa med //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir / bya ba rkyen dang ldan pa med //
translated: For this very reason,

original: ces gsungs te /
analyzed: ces gsungs te /
translated: it is said: “The activity does not possess conditions.”

original: mo gsham gyi bu ba lang dang ldan no zhes ni brjod par bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: mo gsham gyi bu ba lang dang ldan no zhes ni brjod par bya ba ma yin no //
translated: It is not proper to say, “The barren woman’s son possesses a cow.”

original: 'di ni khyad par med par khyad par can yod min //
analyzed: 'di ni khyad par med par khyad par can yod min //
translated: Without distinction, the possessor does not exist.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa dbu ma la 'jug pa las bstan pa nyid do //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa dbu ma la 'jug pa las bstan pa nyid do //
translated: And so on.

original: gal te de lta na /
analyzed: gal te de lta na /
translated: If that is so,

original: 'o na rkyen dang mi ldan par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na rkyen dang mi ldan par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: then it would be devoid of conditions.

original: 'di yang rigs pa ma yin no zhes bshad pa ni /
analyzed: 'di yang rigs pa ma yin no zhes bshad pa ni /
translated: This is also illogical, as explained below.

original: rkyen dang mi ldan bya ba med //
analyzed: rkyen dang mi ldan bya ba med //
translated: An action devoid of conditions does not exist.

original: gang gi tshe bya ba rkyen dang ldan pa med pa de'i tshe ji ltar rkyen dang mi ldan pa rgyu med pa yod par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang gi tshe bya ba rkyen dang ldan pa med pa de'i tshe ji ltar rkyen dang mi ldan pa rgyu med pa yod par 'gyur te /
translated: When an action does not exist as possessing conditions, then how could an action devoid of conditions, that is, without a cause, exist?

original: snam bu snal ma'i rang bzhin du mi rigs pas /
analyzed: snam bu snal ma'i rang bzhin du mi rigs pas /
translated: It is not logical for a cloth to be the intrinsic nature of threads,

original: 'jag ma'i rang bzhin du khas len pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'jag ma'i rang bzhin du khas len pa ni ma yin no //
translated: and it is not accepted that it is the intrinsic nature of grass.

original: de'i phyir bya ba dngos po'i skyed par byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir bya ba dngos po'i skyed par byed pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore an action does not produce things.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here the opponent says:

original: gal te de ltar bya ba med na /
analyzed: gal te de ltar bya ba med na /
translated: If action does not exist in this way,

original: 'o na ni rkyen dag dngos po rnams kyi skyed par byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'o na ni rkyen dag dngos po rnams kyi skyed par byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: then conditions would be the producers of things.

original: bshad par bya ste /🔽bya ba mi ldan rkyen ma yin /
analyzed: bshad par bya ste / bya ba mi ldan rkyen ma yin /
translated: In response, Aryadeva says:🔽A condition that does not possess an action is not a condition.

original: gang gi tshe bya ba med pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: gang gi tshe bya ba med pa de'i tshe /
translated: When an action does not exist,

original: rkyen bya ba dang bral ba dang bya ba dang mi ldan pa rgyu med pa rnams ji ltar skyed par byed pa yin /
analyzed: rkyen bya ba dang bral ba dang bya ba dang mi ldan pa rgyu med pa rnams ji ltar skyed par byed pa yin /
translated: How could they generate things that are devoid of activity, that is, that are not related to activity, and that are without cause?

original: ji ste bya ba dang ldan pa dag kho na skyed par byed pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: ji ste bya ba dang ldan pa dag kho na skyed par byed pa yin no zhe na /
translated: But if only those that are related to activity generate,

original: @27b bshad pa /
analyzed: @27b bshad pa /
translated: then Nāgārjuna explains:

original: bya ba ldan yod 'on te na //
analyzed: bya ba ldan yod 'on te na //
translated: Do conditions exist in relation to activity?

original: ma yin no zhes skabs dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: ma yin no zhes skabs dang sbyar ro //
translated: Or do they not?

original: 'on te na'i sgra ni nges par gzung ba'o //
analyzed: 'on te na'i sgra ni nges par gzung ba'o //
translated: The word “or” has the sense of “only.”

original: de la bya ba med par bshad na /
analyzed: de la bya ba med par bshad na /
translated: If activity does not exist,

original: rkyen rnams ji ltar bya ba dang ldan pa nyid yin na ji ltar rnam par shes pa'i skye ba'i bya ba la brjod pa de bzhin du 'tshod pa'i bya ba la sogs pa'i dngos po dag la yang brjod par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rkyen rnams ji ltar bya ba dang ldan pa nyid yin na ji ltar rnam par shes pa'i skye ba'i bya ba la brjod pa de bzhin du 'tshod pa'i bya ba la sogs pa'i dngos po dag la yang brjod par rig par bya'o //
translated: then how could conditions be related to activity? Just as the activity of the arising of consciousness is described, so too the activity of cooking and so on should be understood in relation to things.

original: des na bya ba las kyang dngos po rnams skye ba med pas skye ba'i rjod par byed pa don gyis stong par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na bya ba las kyang dngos po rnams skye ba med pas skye ba'i rjod par byed pa don gyis stong par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, since things do not arise from activity, the expression “arising” is meaningless.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here the opponent says:

original: rkyen bya ba dang ldan no zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rnam par dpyad pa 'dis kho bo cag la ci dgos /
analyzed: rkyen bya ba dang ldan no zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rnam par dpyad pa 'dis kho bo cag la ci dgos /
translated: What purpose does this analysis serve for us?

original: gang gi phyir mig la sogs pa'i rkyen dag la brten nas dngos po rnam par shes pa la sogs pa rnams skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir mig la sogs pa'i rkyen dag la brten nas dngos po rnam par shes pa la sogs pa rnams skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: Because things such as consciousness arise in dependence on conditions such as the eyes,

original: de'i phyir mig la sogs pa rnams rkyen nyid yin zhing /
analyzed: de'i phyir mig la sogs pa rnams rkyen nyid yin zhing /
translated: therefore the eyes and so on are conditions,

original: rnam par shes pa la sogs pa rnams kyang de dag las skye ba yin no //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa la sogs pa rnams kyang de dag las skye ba yin no //
translated: and consciousness and so on arise from them.

original: 'di yang rigs pa ma yin no zhes bshad pa /
analyzed: 'di yang rigs pa ma yin no zhes bshad pa /
translated: This is illogical, as will now be explained:

original: 'di dag la brten skye bas na //
analyzed: 'di dag la brten skye bas na //
translated: Since they arise in dependence on these,🔽these are known as conditions.

original: de phyir 'di dag rkyen ces grag / ji srid mi skye de srid du //
analyzed: de phyir 'di dag rkyen ces grag / ji srid mi skye de srid du //
translated: As long as they do not arise,

original: 'di dag rkyen min ji ltar min //
analyzed: 'di dag rkyen min ji ltar min //
translated: how could they not be nonconditions?

original: gal te mig la sogs pa'i rkyen rnams la brten nas rnam par shes pa skye bas na 'di dag de'i rkyen zhes brjod na ni /
analyzed: gal te mig la sogs pa'i rkyen rnams la brten nas rnam par shes pa skye bas na 'di dag de'i rkyen zhes brjod na ni /
translated: If consciousness arises in dependence on conditions such as the eyes, and therefore these are called its conditions,

original: ji srid rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba'i 'bras bu de mi skye ba de srid du /
analyzed: ji srid rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba'i 'bras bu de mi skye ba de srid du /
translated: then as long as the effect called consciousness does not arise,

original: mig la sogs pa 'di dag rkyen ma yin pa ji ltar ma yin te /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa 'di dag rkyen ma yin pa ji ltar ma yin te /
translated: How could these eyes, etc. not be conditions?

original: rkyen ma yin pa nyid do snyam du dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: rkyen ma yin pa nyid do snyam du dgongs pa'o //
translated: The meaning is that they are not conditions.

original: bye ma dag las til mar bzhin du rkyen ma yin pa dag las ni skye ba yang ma yin no //
analyzed: bye ma dag las til mar bzhin du rkyen ma yin pa dag las ni skye ba yang ma yin no //
translated: Nor is there production from nonconditions, as from sand, etc., oil.

original: ci ste sngar rkyen ma yin par gyur pa las rkyen gzhan ci zhig cig la ltos nas rkyen nyid du 'gyur ro zhes bya bar 'dod na /
analyzed: ci ste sngar rkyen ma yin par gyur pa las rkyen gzhan ci zhig cig la ltos nas rkyen nyid du 'gyur ro zhes bya bar 'dod na /
translated: But if you maintain that something that previously was not a condition becomes a condition in dependence on some other condition,

original: 'di yang mi rung ste /
analyzed: 'di yang mi rung ste /
translated: that also is not tenable.

original: gang zhig rkyen ma yin pa 'di'i rkyen nyid du rtog pa /
analyzed: gang zhig rkyen ma yin pa 'di'i rkyen nyid du rtog pa /
translated: What is not a condition is not imagined to be a condition.

original: rkyen gzhan de'i rkyen nyid de yang rkyen yod na yin pas 'di la yang dpyad pa de nyid yin no //
analyzed: rkyen gzhan de'i rkyen nyid de yang rkyen yod na yin pas 'di la yang dpyad pa de nyid yin no //
translated: And that other condition, which is a condition of that, is a condition when it exists. Therefore, the same analysis applies to that.

original: de'i phyir de ni mi rigs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ni mi rigs so //
translated: Therefore, that is not tenable.

original: gzhan yang mig la sogs pa 'di dag rnam par shes pa'i rkyen du rtog pa na /
analyzed: gzhan yang mig la sogs pa 'di dag rnam par shes pa'i rkyen du rtog pa na /
translated: Moreover, when you imagine that these eyes, etc. are conditions of visual consciousness, etc.,

original: 'di yod pa'am med pa zhig la rtog grang na /
analyzed: 'di yod pa'am med pa zhig la rtog grang na /
translated: do you imagine that they are conditions when they exist or when they do not exist?

original: rnam pa thams cad du mi rigs so zhes bya bar bshad pa /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du mi rigs so zhes bya bar bshad pa /
translated: It is explained that they are not tenable in any way.

original: med dam yod pa'i don la yang //
analyzed: med dam yod pa'i don la yang //
translated: And also, with regard to an existent or nonexistent object,

original: rkyen ni rung ba ma yin te //
analyzed: rkyen ni rung ba ma yin te //
translated: conditions are not suitable.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: bshad pa / med na gang gi rkyen du 'gyur /
analyzed: bshad pa / med na gang gi rkyen du 'gyur /
translated: It is said: If it does not exist, what would be a condition?

original: yod na rkyen gyis ci zhig bya /
analyzed: yod na rkyen gyis ci zhig bya /
translated: If it exists, what would a condition do?

original: med pa ste /
analyzed: med pa ste /
translated: If it does not exist,

original: @28a * // yod pa ma yin pa'i don la ni rkyen du ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: @28a * // yod pa ma yin pa'i don la ni rkyen du ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: how could it be a condition of an object that does not exist?

original: gal te 'byung bar 'gyur bas ston par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: gal te 'byung bar 'gyur bas ston par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is taught because it will arise,

original: de ltar ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ltar ni ma yin te /
translated: that is not so.

original: gal te 'byung bar 'gyur bas bsnyad 'dod na /🔽nus pa med par 'di yi 'byung 'gyur ni //
analyzed: gal te 'byung bar 'gyur bas bsnyad 'dod na / nus pa med par 'di yi 'byung 'gyur ni //
translated: If you assert that it is taught because it will arise,

original: yod min ces bya ba la sogs pas nyes pa brjod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yod min ces bya ba la sogs pas nyes pa brjod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: then the error is stated by “If it does not exist, its arising is not possible.”

original: yod na ste bdog pa skye ba thob zin pa la yang rkyen yongs su brtag pas 'bras bu med pa nyid do //
analyzed: yod na ste bdog pa skye ba thob zin pa la yang rkyen yongs su brtag pas 'bras bu med pa nyid do //
translated: If it exists, that is, if it is obtained, then the result is pointless because of the postulation of conditions for that which has already arisen.

original: de ltar rkyen 'dus pa rnams 'bras bu skyed par nus pa med pas rkyen nyid ma yin par bsnyad nas /
analyzed: de ltar rkyen 'dus pa rnams 'bras bu skyed par nus pa med pas rkyen nyid ma yin par bsnyad nas /
translated: Thus, since the assembly of conditions is not capable of generating a result, it is not a condition.

original: de'i 'og tu so so ba rnams rkyen nyid ma yin par bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu so so ba rnams rkyen nyid ma yin par bstan par bya'o //
translated: Then, it will be shown that the individual conditions are not conditions.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here, someone might say,

original: gal te de ltar rkyen rnams mi srid mod kyi /
analyzed: gal te de ltar rkyen rnams mi srid mod kyi /
translated: “Although it is impossible for conditions to exist in that way,

original: de lta na yang mtshan nyid nye bar bstan pa las rkyen grub pa yod pa nyid do //
analyzed: de lta na yang mtshan nyid nye bar bstan pa las rkyen grub pa yod pa nyid do //
translated: still, because the characteristics of conditions are taught, conditions do exist.”

original: de la sgrub par byed pa ni rgyu'o zhes rgyu'i rkyen gyi mtshan nyid brjod de yod pa ma yin pa mo gsham gyi bu la ni mtshan nyid nye bar ston pa la mi brjod do //
analyzed: de la sgrub par byed pa ni rgyu'o zhes rgyu'i rkyen gyi mtshan nyid brjod de yod pa ma yin pa mo gsham gyi bu la ni mtshan nyid nye bar ston pa la mi brjod do //
translated: In this regard, the characteristic of the causal condition is stated as “that which establishes is the cause.” But the characteristics of nonexistent things, such as the son of a barren woman, are not stated.

original: gal te de'i mtshan nyid yod par gyur na ni /
analyzed: gal te de'i mtshan nyid yod par gyur na ni /
translated: If the characteristics of the son of a barren woman existed,

original: rgyu'i rkyen du 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: rgyu'i rkyen du 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: then it would be the causal condition.

original: yod pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: yod pa ni ma yin te /
translated: But it does not exist.

original: gang gi phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir /
translated: Because:🔽When a phenomenon is not established as existent,

original: gang tshe chos ni yod pa dang // med dang yod med mi 'grub pa //
analyzed: gang tshe chos ni yod pa dang // med dang yod med mi 'grub pa //
translated: nonexistent, or both existent and nonexistent,

original: ji ltar sgrub byed rgyu zhes bya //
analyzed: ji ltar sgrub byed rgyu zhes bya //
translated: How could it be called “that which establishes”🔽and be a cause?

original: de lta yin na mi rigs so //
analyzed: de lta yin na mi rigs so //
translated: That is not tenable.

original: de la sgrub par byed pa ni skyed par byed pa ste /
analyzed: de la sgrub par byed pa ni skyed par byed pa ste /
translated: In this regard, that which establishes is that which gives rise to.

original: gal te bsgrub par bya ba'i chos 'grub na ni /
analyzed: gal te bsgrub par bya ba'i chos 'grub na ni /
translated: If the phenomenon to be established were established,

original: skyed par byed pa'i rgyus de bskyed par 'gyur na /
analyzed: skyed par byed pa'i rgyus de bskyed par 'gyur na /
translated: then the producing cause would produce it.

original: 'grub pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: 'grub pa yang ma yin te /
translated: But it is not established,

original: yod pa dang med pa dang gnyi ga la ngo bo 'grub pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yod pa dang med pa dang gnyi ga la ngo bo 'grub pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no establishment of an entity that is existent, nonexistent, or both.

original: de la yod pa ni 'grub pa ma yin te yod pa'i phyir ro //🔽med pa yang ma yin te yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la yod pa ni 'grub pa ma yin te yod pa'i phyir ro // med pa yang ma yin te yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Among them, the existent is not established because it exists.🔽The nonexistent is not established because it does not exist.

original: yod pa dang med pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: yod pa dang med pa yang ma yin te /
translated: The existent and nonexistent is not established because

original: phan tshun 'gal ba'i don gcig med pa'i phyir dang / phyogs gnyi ga la brjod pa'i skyon du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phan tshun 'gal ba'i don gcig med pa'i phyir dang / phyogs gnyi ga la brjod pa'i skyon du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: mutually contradictory things do not have a single object, and the error that has been stated applies to both positions.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar 'bras bu skye ba med pa de'i phyir rgyu'i rkyen yang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar 'bras bu skye ba med pa de'i phyir rgyu'i rkyen yang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Since the arising of an effect does not exist in that way, therefore the causal condition also does not exist.

original: de'i phyir mtshan nyid yod pa'i phyir rgyu'i rkyen yod pa yin no zhes smras pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir mtshan nyid yod pa'i phyir rgyu'i rkyen yod pa yin no zhes smras pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: Therefore, it was said, “Because the characteristic exists, the causal condition exists.”

original: de lta yin na mi rigs so //
analyzed: de lta yin na mi rigs so //
translated: But if that were so, it would be illogical.

original: da ni dmigs pa'i rkyen dgag pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni dmigs pa'i rkyen dgag pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to refute the objective condition, it is said:

original: yod pa'i chos 'di dmigs pa ni //
analyzed: yod pa'i chos 'di dmigs pa ni //
translated: The objective condition of this existent

original: med pa kho na nye bar bstan //
analyzed: med pa kho na nye bar bstan //
translated: phenomenon is taught to be just nonexistent.

original: ci ste chos ni dmigs med na //
analyzed: ci ste chos ni dmigs med na //
translated: If a phenomenon does not have an objective condition,

original: dmigs pa yod par ga la 'gyur //🔽zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: dmigs pa yod par ga la 'gyur // zhes gsungs so //
translated: how could an objective condition exist?

original: 'dir dmigs @28b pa dang bcas pa'i chos gang dag ce na /
analyzed: 'dir dmigs @28b pa dang bcas pa'i chos gang dag ce na /
translated: Here, what are the phenomena that have objective conditions?

original: sems dang sems las byung ba thams cad do //
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba thams cad do //
translated: All minds and mental factors.

original: zhes bya ba'i lung las na /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i lung las na /
translated: This is a scriptural reference.

original: sems dang sems las byung ba rnams gzugs la sogs pa'i dmigs pa gang gis ci rigs par skyed par byed pa de ni de dag gi dmigs pa'i rkyen yin pa na /🔽yod pa dag la brtag gam /
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba rnams gzugs la sogs pa'i dmigs pa gang gis ci rigs par skyed par byed pa de ni de dag gi dmigs pa'i rkyen yin pa na / yod pa dag la brtag gam /
translated: Since minds and mental factors are generated by any objective condition, such as form, that objective condition is the objective condition of those.

original: med pa dag la yin grang /
analyzed: med pa dag la yin grang /
translated: Do you imagine that objective condition to be existent or nonexistent?

original: de la yod pa dag la ni dmigs pa'i rkyen de don med de /
analyzed: de la yod pa dag la ni dmigs pa'i rkyen de don med de /
translated: If it is existent, that objective condition is meaningless.

original: chos bskyed par bya ba'i phyir dmigs pa yongs su rtog par byed na /
analyzed: chos bskyed par bya ba'i phyir dmigs pa yongs su rtog par byed na /
translated: If you imagine an objective condition in order to generate a phenomenon,

original: de ni dmigs pa'i snga rol du yod pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni dmigs pa'i snga rol du yod pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: that phenomenon already exists prior to the objective condition.

original: ci ste de ltar chos rang gi bdag nyid dmigs pa med par rab tu grub na /
analyzed: ci ste de ltar chos rang gi bdag nyid dmigs pa med par rab tu grub na /
translated: But if it is well established that phenomena do not have an objective self,

original: 'di ni dmigs pa dang ldan par brtags pas ci zhig bya /🔽de'i phyir yod pa bdog pa'i chos sems la sogs pa 'di dmigs pa med pa kho na khyed cag gis rang 'dod kyi dmigs pa dang bcas pa yin no zhes nye bar bstan pa 'ba' zhig tu zad kyi /
analyzed: 'di ni dmigs pa dang ldan par brtags pas ci zhig bya / de'i phyir yod pa bdog pa'i chos sems la sogs pa 'di dmigs pa med pa kho na khyed cag gis rang 'dod kyi dmigs pa dang bcas pa yin no zhes nye bar bstan pa 'ba' zhig tu zad kyi /
translated: then what is the point of imagining that they have an objective support?

original: 'di la dmigs pa dang 'brel pa cung zhig yod pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di la dmigs pa dang 'brel pa cung zhig yod pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, you have merely taught that these existent phenomena, such as the mind, which do not have an objective support, have an objective support, but you have not taught that they have the slightest connection with an objective support.

original: ci ste med pa la dmigs pa yongs su rtog par byed na /
analyzed: ci ste med pa la dmigs pa yongs su rtog par byed na /
translated: If you imagine that they have a nonexistent objective support,

original: de yang rigs pa ma yin te /🔽chos 'di dmigs pa med par ni //
analyzed: de yang rigs pa ma yin te / chos 'di dmigs pa med par ni //
translated: that also is not logical.🔽You have taught that this phenomenon

original: yin pa kho nar nye bar bstan //🔽zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: yin pa kho nar nye bar bstan // zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: is only without an objective support.

original: 'di ltar yod pa ma yin pa la ni dmigs pa dang 'brel pa yod pa ma yin no //🔽chos 'di dmigs pa med pa ni /
analyzed: 'di ltar yod pa ma yin pa la ni dmigs pa dang 'brel pa yod pa ma yin no // chos 'di dmigs pa med pa ni /
translated: In this regard, that which does not exist does not have a connection with an objective support.🔽You have taught that this phenomenon

original: yin pa ste gyur pa kho nar khyod kyis nye bar bstan te /
analyzed: yin pa ste gyur pa kho nar khyod kyis nye bar bstan te /
translated: is only without an objective support.

original: dmigs pa dang bcas par zhes bya ba ni tshig gi lhag ma'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa dang bcas par zhes bya ba ni tshig gi lhag ma'o //
translated: The phrase “along with their objects” is a verbal supplement.

original: ci ste chos ni dmigs med na //
analyzed: ci ste chos ni dmigs med na //
translated: If a dharma does not exist,

original: dmigs pa yod par ga la 'gyur /🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dmigs pa yod par ga la 'gyur / zhes bya ba la /
translated: how could there be an object?

original: ci ste'i sgra ni dri ba'o //
analyzed: ci ste'i sgra ni dri ba'o //
translated: Here, the word “if” is a question.

original: ga la 'gyur zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: ga la 'gyur zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs so //
translated: The phrase “how could there be” is a reason.

original: des na don ni /
analyzed: des na don ni /
translated: The meaning of this is as follows:

original: ci ste de ltar chos yod pa ma yin zhing mi bdog pa ni dmigs pa med na /
analyzed: ci ste de ltar chos yod pa ma yin zhing mi bdog pa ni dmigs pa med na /
translated: If a dharma does not exist and is not found, and if it does not exist as an object,

original: yang dmigs pa yod par ga la 'gyur zhes bya ba 'dir 'gyur te /
analyzed: yang dmigs pa yod par ga la 'gyur zhes bya ba 'dir 'gyur te /
translated: how could there be an object?

original: dmigs par byed pa med pa'i phyir dmigs pa yang med do zhes bya bar dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: dmigs par byed pa med pa'i phyir dmigs pa yang med do zhes bya bar dgongs pa'o //
translated: The idea is that because there is no object, there is no subject.

original: ji ltar sems dang sems las byung ba rnams dmigs pa dang bcas par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar sems dang sems las byung ba rnams dmigs pa dang bcas par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How do mind and mental factors come to have objects?

original: mtshan nyid 'di ni kun rdzob pa yin gyi /
analyzed: mtshan nyid 'di ni kun rdzob pa yin gyi /
translated: This characteristic is conventional, not ultimate.

original: don dam pa ni ma yin pas nyes pa med do //
analyzed: don dam pa ni ma yin pas nyes pa med do //
translated: Therefore, there is no fault.

original: da ni mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen dgag pa'i phyir /🔽chos @29a * //
analyzed: da ni mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen dgag pa'i phyir / chos @29a * //
translated: Now, in order to refute the condition that is an equivalent and immediate antecedent,

original: rnams skyes pa ma yin na //
analyzed: rnams skyes pa ma yin na //
translated: If dharmas are not produced,

original: 'gag pa 'thad par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'gag pa 'thad par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Cessation would not be tenable.

original: de phyir de ma thag mi rigs //
analyzed: de phyir de ma thag mi rigs //
translated: Therefore, immediately after that, it is not tenable.

original: 'gags na rkyen yang gang zhig yin //
analyzed: 'gags na rkyen yang gang zhig yin //
translated: If it has ceased, what would be the condition?

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: This is what is said.

original: de la tshigs su bcad pa phyed phyi ma'i rkang pa go bsnor bar blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de la tshigs su bcad pa phyed phyi ma'i rkang pa go bsnor bar blta bar bya'o //
translated: Here, the second half of the verse should be read with the lines reversed.

original: yang gi sgra ni 'gags na yang zhes rim pa bzhin du sbyar ro //
analyzed: yang gi sgra ni 'gags na yang zhes rim pa bzhin du sbyar ro //
translated: The word “also” is to be supplied to the line “if it has ceased.”

original: des na 'di skad du /
analyzed: des na 'di skad du /
translated: Therefore, this is how the verse should be read:

original: 'gags na rkyen yang gang zhig yin //
analyzed: 'gags na rkyen yang gang zhig yin //
translated: If it has ceased, what would be the condition?

original: de'i phyir de ma thag mi rigs //🔽zhes 'don par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ma thag mi rigs // zhes 'don par 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, immediately after that, it is not tenable.🔽This is how the verse should be read.

original: de skad du gsungs pa ni tshigs su bcad pa sdeb ba'i phyir yin no //
analyzed: de skad du gsungs pa ni tshigs su bcad pa sdeb ba'i phyir yin no //
translated: This is said for the sake of versification.

original: de la rgyu 'gag ma thag pa 'bras bu skye ba'i rkyen du 'gyur ba ni mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen gyi mtshan nyid yin te /
analyzed: de la rgyu 'gag ma thag pa 'bras bu skye ba'i rkyen du 'gyur ba ni mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen gyi mtshan nyid yin te /
translated: Here, the immediately preceding cessation of the cause being the condition for the arising of the effect is the characteristic of the similar and immediately antecedent condition.

original: 'di la dpyad par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di la dpyad par bya'o //
translated: This should be analyzed.

original: myu gu la sogs pa 'bras bur gyur pa'i chos rnams skyes pa ma yin na /
analyzed: myu gu la sogs pa 'bras bur gyur pa'i chos rnams skyes pa ma yin na /
translated: If the effects, such as sprouts, have not arisen,

original: rgyu sa bon la sogs pa'i 'gag pa 'thad par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgyu sa bon la sogs pa'i 'gag pa 'thad par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: The cessation of the cause, the seed, and so on, would not be tenable.

original: gang gi tshe 'di de lta yin pa de'i tshe rgyu 'gag pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gang gi tshe 'di de lta yin pa de'i tshe rgyu 'gag pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: When that is so, since the cause does not cease,

original: myu gu'i mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen gang zhig yin par 'gyur /
analyzed: myu gu'i mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen gang zhig yin par 'gyur /
translated: what would be the equivalent immediately preceding condition of the sprout?

original: ci ste 'bras bu ma skyes par yang sa bon 'gag par 'dod na ni /
analyzed: ci ste 'bras bu ma skyes par yang sa bon 'gag par 'dod na ni /
translated: But if you assert that the seed ceases even though the effect has not yet arisen,

original: de lta na sa bon 'gags na ste med par gyur na /
analyzed: de lta na sa bon 'gags na ste med par gyur na /
translated: then when the seed has ceased, that is, when it has been destroyed,

original: myu gu'i rkyen yang gang zhig yin la /
analyzed: myu gu'i rkyen yang gang zhig yin la /
translated: what would be the condition of the sprout?

original: sa bon 'gag pa'i rkyen yang gang zhig yin te /
analyzed: sa bon 'gag pa'i rkyen yang gang zhig yin te /
translated: And what would be the condition of the cessation of the seed?🔽Both would be without a cause.

original: 'di gnyi ga rgyu med par 'gyur ro zhes 'chad pa ni /
analyzed: 'di gnyi ga rgyu med par 'gyur ro zhes 'chad pa ni /
translated: This is explained in the lines:

original: 'gags na rkyen yang gang zhig yin //🔽zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'gags na rkyen yang gang zhig yin // zhes bya ba'o //
translated: When it has ceased, what would be its condition?

original: yang gi sgra ni skye ba med pa la ltos pa ste /
analyzed: yang gi sgra ni skye ba med pa la ltos pa ste /
translated: The word “and” is for the sake of including the nonarisen.

original: des na myu gu ma skyes par sa bon 'gag par 'dod na yang gnyi ga rgyu med pa can du 'gyur te /
analyzed: des na myu gu ma skyes par sa bon 'gag par 'dod na yang gnyi ga rgyu med pa can du 'gyur te /
translated: Thus, if you assert that the seed ceases even though the sprout has not arisen, both would be without a cause.

original: de'i phyir de ma thag mi rigs //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ma thag mi rigs //
translated: Therefore, the immediately preceding condition is illogical.

original: zhes bya'o // yang na /
analyzed: zhes bya'o // yang na /
translated: Or,🔽🔽

original: bdag las ma yin gzhan las min //
analyzed: bdag las ma yin gzhan las min //
translated: Not from self, not from other,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas skye ba bkag pa yin la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas skye ba bkag pa yin la /
translated: and so on, refutes arising.

original: skye ba bkag pa de la dgongs nas /
analyzed: skye ba bkag pa de la dgongs nas /
translated: And intending to refute arising,🔽it is said:

original: chos rnams skyes pa ma yin na //
analyzed: chos rnams skyes pa ma yin na //
translated: If phenomena do not arise,

original: 'gag pa 'thad par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'gag pa 'thad par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: cessation is not tenable.

original: de phyir de ma thag mi rigs zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de phyir de ma thag mi rigs zhes gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, immediately after that, it is said:

original: gzhan yang / 'gags na rkyen yang gang zhig yin te /
analyzed: gzhan yang / 'gags na rkyen yang gang zhig yin te /
translated: If it has ceased, what would be the condition?

original: 'di la bshad pa ni snga ma nyid sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'di la bshad pa ni snga ma nyid sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: Here the explanation is to be applied just as before.

original: da ni bdag po'i rkyen bsal bar bzhed nas bshad pa /
analyzed: da ni bdag po'i rkyen bsal bar bzhed nas bshad pa /
translated: Now, wishing to dispel the dominant condition, he says:

original: sa bon la sogs pa /
analyzed: sa bon la sogs pa /
translated: Things such as seeds

original: dngos po rang bzhin med rnams kyi //
analyzed: dngos po rang bzhin med rnams kyi //
translated: that lack intrinsic reality

original: yod pa gang phyir yod min @29b na //
analyzed: yod pa gang phyir yod min @29b na //
translated: do not exist in the way they exist.🔽Therefore, the statement

original: 'di yod pas na 'di 'byung zhes //
analyzed: 'di yod pas na 'di 'byung zhes //
translated: “Because this exists, that arises”

original: bya ba 'di ni 'thad ma yin //
analyzed: bya ba 'di ni 'thad ma yin //
translated: is not tenable.

original: 'dir gang zhig yod pas gang 'byung ba de ni de'i bdag po yin no zhes bya ba ni bdag po'i rkyen gyi mtshan nyid yin na /
analyzed: 'dir gang zhig yod pas gang 'byung ba de ni de'i bdag po yin no zhes bya ba ni bdag po'i rkyen gyi mtshan nyid yin na /
translated: Here, if the characteristic of the dominant condition is that whatever exists and from which something arises is its dominant condition,

original: dngos po rnams ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: dngos po rnams ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i phyir /
translated: Because things arise in dependence on conditions,

original: rang bzhin med pa na gang zhig 'di zhes rgyu nyid du bsnyad pa de ga la yod cing /
analyzed: rang bzhin med pa na gang zhig 'di zhes rgyu nyid du bsnyad pa de ga la yod cing /
translated: they are essenceless. How could that which is called a cause exist?

original: gang yang 'di zhes 'bras bu nyid du ston pa de ga la yod /
analyzed: gang yang 'di zhes 'bras bu nyid du ston pa de ga la yod /
translated: How could that which is called an effect exist?

original: de'i phyir mtshan nyid las kyang rkyen grub pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir mtshan nyid las kyang rkyen grub pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, conditions do not exist through their own characteristics.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here, someone might say,

original: snal ma la sogs pa dag las snam bu la sogs pa skye bar dmigs nas /
analyzed: snal ma la sogs pa dag las snam bu la sogs pa skye bar dmigs nas /
translated: Since cloth and so on are observed to arise from threads and so on,

original: snal ma sogs pa dag snam bu la sogs pa'i rkyen yin no //
analyzed: snal ma sogs pa dag snam bu la sogs pa'i rkyen yin no //
translated: threads and so on are the conditions of cloth and so on.

original: bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: bshad par bya ste /
translated: In response to this, Nāgārjuna explains:

original: snam bu la sogs pa 'bras bu 'byung ba nyid yod pa ma yin na /
analyzed: snam bu la sogs pa 'bras bu 'byung ba nyid yod pa ma yin na /
translated: Since the arising of effects such as cloth does not exist,

original: rkyen rnams kyi rkyen nyid lta 'grub par ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: rkyen rnams kyi rkyen nyid lta 'grub par ga la 'gyur /
translated: how could the conditionality of conditions be established?

original: ji ltar snam bu la sogs pa 'bras bu 'byung ba med pa de ltar bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ji ltar snam bu la sogs pa 'bras bu 'byung ba med pa de ltar bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate how the arising of effects such as cloth does not exist,🔽The effect does not exist

original: rkyen rnams so so 'dus pa las //🔽'bras bu de ni med pa nyid //
analyzed: rkyen rnams so so 'dus pa las //🔽'bras bu de ni med pa nyid //
translated: in the assembly of conditions.

original: rkyen rnams la ni gang med pa //
analyzed: rkyen rnams la ni gang med pa //
translated: How can that which does not exist in conditions

original: de ni rkyen las ji ltar skye //🔽zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de ni rkyen las ji ltar skye // zhes gsungs so //
translated: arise from conditions?

original: de la snal ma dang tshig pa dang thag zangs dang / son shing la sogs pa so so ba dag la snam bu so sor yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de la snal ma dang tshig pa dang thag zangs dang / son shing la sogs pa so so ba dag la snam bu so sor yod pa ma yin te /
translated: In this regard, a cloth does not exist separately in each of the conditions, such as thread, a shuttle, a needle, a loom, and so on,

original: de dag la ma dmigs pa'i phyir dang / rgyu mang pos 'bras bu mang por thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag la ma dmigs pa'i phyir dang / rgyu mang pos 'bras bu mang por thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not perceived in them, and because it would follow, absurdly, that many effects would arise from many causes.

original: snal ma la sogs pa 'dus pa dag la yang snam bu yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: snal ma la sogs pa 'dus pa dag la yang snam bu yod pa ma yin te /
translated: A cloth also does not exist in the collection of threads, and so on,

original: yan lag re re ba dag la med pa'i phyir dang / 'bras bu gcig dum bu skye bar thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yan lag re re ba dag la med pa'i phyir dang / 'bras bu gcig dum bu skye bar thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it does not exist in each of the parts and because it would follow, absurdly, that the effect would arise in parts.

original: de'i phyir 'bras bu med pas rkyen dag med do //🔽ci ste de ni med par yang //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'bras bu med pas rkyen dag med do // ci ste de ni med par yang //
translated: Therefore, because the effect does not exist, the conditions do not exist.

original: rkyen de dag las skye 'gyur na //
analyzed: rkyen de dag las skye 'gyur na //
translated: If it were to arise from those conditions🔽even though it does not exist,

original: zhes bya bar bsams par gyur na ni /🔽rkyen ma yin pa dag la yang //
analyzed: zhes bya bar bsams par gyur na ni / rkyen ma yin pa dag la yang //
translated: then it would follow, absurdly, that

original: 'bras bu yod pa ma yin pas //
analyzed: 'bras bu yod pa ma yin pas //
translated: an effect would exist even though it does not exist in the conditions.

original: rkyen ma yin pa 'jog ma dag las kyang snam bu ci'i phyir na skye bar mi 'gyur /
analyzed: rkyen ma yin pa 'jog ma dag las kyang snam bu ci'i phyir na skye bar mi 'gyur /
translated: But why doesn’t cloth arise from nonconditions, such as a rabbit’s horns?

original: de'i phyir 'bras bu 'byung ba med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'bras bu 'byung ba med do //
translated: Therefore, an effect does not arise.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Objection:

original: gal te 'bras bu gzhan zhig yin zhing rkyen yang gzhan yin par 'gyur na ni /
analyzed: gal te 'bras bu gzhan zhig yin zhing rkyen yang gzhan yin par 'gyur na ni /
translated: If an effect were one thing and conditions another,

original: de'i tshe ci rkyen dag la 'bras bu yod dam med ces bya bar bsams par gyur na /
analyzed: de'i tshe ci rkyen dag la 'bras bu yod dam med ces bya bar bsams par gyur na /
translated: then one would have to consider whether an effect exists or does not exist in conditions.

original: 'bras bu tha dad pa ni med do //
analyzed: 'bras bu tha dad pa ni med do //
translated: But an effect that is different does not exist.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What then?

original: rkyen gyi rang bzhin kho na yin no //
analyzed: rkyen gyi rang bzhin kho na yin no //
translated: It is the nature of conditions.

original: bshad par bya ste /🔽'bras bu rkyen gyi @30a * //
analyzed: bshad par bya ste / 'bras bu rkyen gyi @30a * //
translated: In response, Aryadeva says:🔽The effect is not

original: rang bzhin ni //🔽rkyen rnams bdag gi rang bzhin min //
analyzed: rang bzhin ni // rkyen rnams bdag gi rang bzhin min //
translated: The nature of conditions.

original: bdag dngos min las 'bras bu gang //
analyzed: bdag dngos min las 'bras bu gang //
translated: How can an effect arise from

original: de ni de ltar rkyen rang bzhin //🔽gal te 'bras bu rkyen gyi rang bzhin rkyen gyi rnam par 'gyur ba yin no zhes rnam par 'jog na ni /
analyzed: de ni de ltar rkyen rang bzhin // gal te 'bras bu rkyen gyi rang bzhin rkyen gyi rnam par 'gyur ba yin no zhes rnam par 'jog na ni /
translated: That which is not its nature?

original: de mi rigs te /
analyzed: de mi rigs te /
translated: If you posit that the effect is the nature of conditions and the transformation of conditions, that is illogical.

original: gang gi phyir rkyen rnams kyang bdag gi rang bzhin ma yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir rkyen rnams kyang bdag gi rang bzhin ma yin te /
translated: Because the conditions are not of the nature of the self.

original: rkyen ma yin pa'i ngo bo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rkyen ma yin pa'i ngo bo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that they are not of the nature of non-conditions.

original: snam bu ni snal ma'i rang bzhin can no zhes bya bar brjod na ni /
analyzed: snam bu ni snal ma'i rang bzhin can no zhes bya bar brjod na ni /
translated: If it is said that the cloth is of the nature of the threads,

original: gal te snal ma dag rang gi ngo bor grub par gyur na /
analyzed: gal te snal ma dag rang gi ngo bor grub par gyur na /
translated: if the threads were to exist by way of their own intrinsic reality,

original: snam bur 'gyur na /
analyzed: snam bur 'gyur na /
translated: then the cloth would exist.

original: de dag ni cha shas kyi rang bzhin gyi rnam par 'gyur ba yin gyi /
analyzed: de dag ni cha shas kyi rang bzhin gyi rnam par 'gyur ba yin gyi /
translated: But they are transformations of the nature of the parts.

original: rang bzhin gyis grub pa ni yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis grub pa ni yod pa ma yin no //
translated: They do not exist by way of an intrinsic reality.

original: de'i phyir bdag nyid kyi rang bzhin ma yin pa de dag la snam bu zhes bya ba'i 'bras bu gang yin pa de ltar snal ma'i rang bzhin du 'gyur /
analyzed: de'i phyir bdag nyid kyi rang bzhin ma yin pa de dag la snam bu zhes bya ba'i 'bras bu gang yin pa de ltar snal ma'i rang bzhin du 'gyur /
translated: Therefore, how could the effect called cloth be of the nature of the threads, since they are not of the nature of the self?

original: ji skad du /🔽snam bu rgyu las 'grub 'gyur zhing //
analyzed: ji skad du / snam bu rgyu las 'grub 'gyur zhing //
translated: As it is said:🔽Cloth is established from causes.

original: rgyu yang gzhan las 'grub 'gyur bas //🔽gang zhig rang gi 'grub med pa //
analyzed: rgyu yang gzhan las 'grub 'gyur bas // gang zhig rang gi 'grub med pa //
translated: And the causes are established from other causes.🔽How could that which is not established by itself

original: des gzhan bskyed par ji ltar 'gyur //🔽zhes bshad do //
analyzed: des gzhan bskyed par ji ltar 'gyur //🔽zhes bshad do //
translated: give rise to another?

original: de phyir rkyen gyi rang bzhin min //
analyzed: de phyir rkyen gyi rang bzhin min //
translated: Therefore, the effect does not have the nature of conditions.

original: de'i phyir rkyen gyi rang bzhin gyi 'bras bu ni yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir rkyen gyi rang bzhin gyi 'bras bu ni yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the effect that has the nature of conditions does not exist.

original: 'o na rkyen ma yin pa'i rang bzhin du 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na rkyen ma yin pa'i rang bzhin du 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: But if it does not have the nature of conditions, it has the nature of nonconditions.

original: rkyen min rang bzhin 'bras bu ni //
analyzed: rkyen min rang bzhin 'bras bu ni //
translated: The effect that has the nature of nonconditions

original: yod min te /
analyzed: yod min te /
translated: Does not exist.

original: gang gi tshe snam bu snal ma'i rang bzhin du yang med pa de'i tshe 'gal ba 'jog ma'i rang bzhin du ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: gang gi tshe snam bu snal ma'i rang bzhin du yang med pa de'i tshe 'gal ba 'jog ma'i rang bzhin du ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: When a cloth does not exist in the nature of threads, then how could it exist in the nature of something else?

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here, you say:

original: 'bras bu med du zad mod /
analyzed: 'bras bu med du zad mod /
translated: Granted that the effect does not exist,

original: rkyen dang rkyen ma yin pa'i nges pa ni yod pa yin te /🔽de ltar yang khyod kyis gal te 'bras bu med pa yang rkyen dag las skye na /
analyzed: rkyen dang rkyen ma yin pa'i nges pa ni yod pa yin te / de ltar yang khyod kyis gal te 'bras bu med pa yang rkyen dag las skye na /
translated: the ascertainment of conditions and nonconditions exists.

original: rkyen ma yin pa dag las kyang ci'i phyir skye ba ma yin zhes smras la /
analyzed: rkyen ma yin pa dag las kyang ci'i phyir skye ba ma yin zhes smras la /
translated: In that case, you say, “If an effect that does not exist arises from conditions, then why does it not arise from nonconditions?”

original: snam bu dang re lde zhes bya ba'i 'bras bu med na ni snal ma dang 'jog ma dag rkyen dang rkyen ma yin pa nyid du yang mi rigs te /
analyzed: snam bu dang re lde zhes bya ba'i 'bras bu med na ni snal ma dang 'jog ma dag rkyen dang rkyen ma yin pa nyid du yang mi rigs te /
translated: If the effect called cloth and the effect called a fence do not exist, then it is not tenable that threads and sticks are conditions and nonconditions.

original: des na 'bras bu yang yod pa yin no //
analyzed: des na 'bras bu yang yod pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the effect also exists.

original: bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: bshad par bya ste /
translated: We respond:

original: gal te 'bras bu yod par gyur na ni /
analyzed: gal te 'bras bu yod par gyur na ni /
translated: If the effect existed,

original: rkyen dang rkyen ma yin pa dag tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rkyen dang rkyen ma yin pa dag tu 'gyur ro //
translated: then conditions and nonconditions would exist.

original: 'di ltar 'bras bu yod na ni 'di dag ni 'di'i rkyen yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'bras bu yod na ni 'di dag ni 'di'i rkyen yin no //
translated: In this way, if the effect existed, it would be said, “These are its conditions.”

original: 'di dag ni 'di'i rkyen ma yin no zhes bya bar 'gyur na /
analyzed: 'di dag ni 'di'i rkyen ma yin no zhes bya bar 'gyur na /
translated: And it would be said, “These are not its conditions.”

original: de yang rnam par dpyad pa na med pa nyid de /
analyzed: de yang rnam par dpyad pa na med pa nyid de /
translated: But when analyzed, they do not exist.

original: de'i phyir 'bras bu med pas na //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'bras bu med pas na //
translated: Therefore, because the effect does not exist,

original: rkyen min rkyen du ga la 'gyur te /
analyzed: rkyen min rkyen du ga la 'gyur te /
translated: how could there be nonconditions and conditions?

original: rkyen dang rkyen @30b ma yin par zhes tshig bsdu'o //
analyzed: rkyen dang rkyen @30b ma yin par zhes tshig bsdu'o //
translated: “Conditions and nonconditions” is a compound.

original: de'i phyir dngos po rnams skye ba yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir dngos po rnams skye ba yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore things do not arise.

original: ji skad du 'phags pa dkon mchog 'byung gnas kyi mdo las /
analyzed: ji skad du 'phags pa dkon mchog 'byung gnas kyi mdo las /
translated: As the noble Multitude of Jewels Sūtra says,

original: gang na'ang stong pa rig pa med pa na //
analyzed: gang na'ang stong pa rig pa med pa na //
translated: Where there is no emptiness and no awareness,

original: nam mkha' bar snang bya yi rjes dang mtshungs //
analyzed: nam mkha' bar snang bya yi rjes dang mtshungs //
translated: like the trace of a bird in the sky,

original: gang na'ang ngo bo nyid 'ga' yod min pa //
analyzed: gang na'ang ngo bo nyid 'ga' yod min pa //
translated: where there is no essence at all,

original: de ni nam yang gzhan gyi rgyur mi 'gyur //
analyzed: de ni nam yang gzhan gyi rgyur mi 'gyur //
translated: it can never be the cause of another.

original: gang gi ngo bo nyid ni mi rnyed pa //🔽rang bzhin med de ji ltar gzhan gyi rkyen //
analyzed: gang gi ngo bo nyid ni mi rnyed pa // rang bzhin med de ji ltar gzhan gyi rkyen //
translated: Whose essence is not found,🔽Is essenceless. How could it be a condition of another?

original: rang bzhin med pa gzhan gyis ci zhig bskyed //
analyzed: rang bzhin med pa gzhan gyis ci zhig bskyed //
translated: How could the essenceless be produced by another?

original: rgyu de bde bar gshegs pas bstan pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu de bde bar gshegs pas bstan pa'o //
translated: That cause is taught by the Sugata.

original: thams cad chos kyang mi g-yo brtan par gnas //
analyzed: thams cad chos kyang mi g-yo brtan par gnas //
translated: All phenomena are also stable and do not move.

original: mi 'gyur 'tshe ba med cing zhi ba ste //
analyzed: mi 'gyur 'tshe ba med cing zhi ba ste //
translated: They are unchanging, harmless, and peaceful.

original: ji ltar nam mkha' shes pa med pa bzhin //
analyzed: ji ltar nam mkha' shes pa med pa bzhin //
translated: Just like space, they are not cognizable.

original: de la mi shes 'gro ba rmongs par 'gyur //
analyzed: de la mi shes 'gro ba rmongs par 'gyur //
translated: The ignorant wander in delusion about them.

original: ji ltar ri bo dag ni mi sgul ba //
analyzed: ji ltar ri bo dag ni mi sgul ba //
translated: Just as mountains are unshakable,

original: de bzhin chos rnams rtag tu bskyod mi nus //
analyzed: de bzhin chos rnams rtag tu bskyod mi nus //
translated: So phenomena are always unshakable.🔽The Victor taught that phenomena

original: 'chi 'pho med cing skye ba med pa yi //🔽chos rnams de ltar rgyal bas rab tu bstan //
analyzed: 'chi 'pho med cing skye ba med pa yi // chos rnams de ltar rgyal bas rab tu bstan //
translated: Are without death, transmigration, and birth.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang / de bzhin du /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang / de bzhin du /
translated: And similarly,

original: chos gang skye ba med cing 'byung ba med //
analyzed: chos gang skye ba med cing 'byung ba med //
translated: Any phenomenon that is unborn and unoriginated,

original: 'chi 'pho med cing rga bar mi 'gyur ba //
analyzed: 'chi 'pho med cing rga bar mi 'gyur ba //
translated: That is without death, transmigration, and aging,

original: mi yi seng ge yis ni der ston zhing //
analyzed: mi yi seng ge yis ni der ston zhing //
translated: The Lion among Men taught that to be nirvana.

original: sems can brgya phrag dag ni de la bkod //
analyzed: sems can brgya phrag dag ni de la bkod //
translated: And he established hundreds of sentient beings in that.

original: gang la ngo bo nyid ni gang yang med //
analyzed: gang la ngo bo nyid ni gang yang med //
translated: That which has no intrinsic reality at all,

original: gzhan yang ma yin sus kyang mi rnyed pa //
analyzed: gzhan yang ma yin sus kyang mi rnyed pa //
translated: That which is not other, and which no one finds,

original: nang nam yin phyi rol dag na yang //
analyzed: nang nam yin phyi rol dag na yang //
translated: That which is not found internally or externally,

original: mi rnyed de dag la ni mgon pos bkod //
analyzed: mi rnyed de dag la ni mgon pos bkod //
translated: The Protector has established those.

original: bde bar gshegs pas zhi ba'i 'gro gsungs kyang //
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pas zhi ba'i 'gro gsungs kyang //
translated: The Sugata has said that going is peace,

original: 'gro ba gang yang rnyed par mi 'gyur te //
analyzed: 'gro ba gang yang rnyed par mi 'gyur te //
translated: But no going at all is found,

original: de dag 'gro las grol bar rnam par gsungs //
analyzed: de dag 'gro las grol bar rnam par gsungs //
translated: And he has declared that they are free from going.

original: grol nas sems can mang po grol bar mdzad //🔽ces gsungs pa lta bu'o //🔽slob dpon zla ba grags pa'i zhal snga nas sbyar ba'i tshig gsal ba las /
analyzed: grol nas sems can mang po grol bar mdzad // ces gsungs pa lta bu'o // slob dpon zla ba grags pa'i zhal snga nas sbyar ba'i tshig gsal ba las /
translated: Having been freed, he has freed many sentient beings.

original: rkyen brtag pa zhes bya ba rab tu byed pa dang po'i 'grel pa'o /🔽// /'dir smras pa /
analyzed: rkyen brtag pa zhes bya ba rab tu byed pa dang po'i 'grel pa'o / // /'dir smras pa /
translated: This concludes the commentary on the first chapter, the chapter on conditions, in the Ornament of the Middle Way composed by the master Kamalaśīla.

original: gal te yang skye ba bkag pa las rten cing 'grel par 'byung ba'i khyad par 'gag pa med pa la sogs pa grub mod kyi /
analyzed: gal te yang skye ba bkag pa las rten cing 'grel par 'byung ba'i khyad par 'gag pa med pa la sogs pa grub mod kyi /
translated: Here, someone might say, “Although the cessation of arising is established through the refutation of arising, the special features of dependent arising, such as being free from cessation,

original: de ltar na yang rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba 'gro ba med pa dang 'ong ba med pa grub par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar na yang rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba 'gro ba med pa dang 'ong ba med pa grub par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Still, in order to establish that dependent origination is devoid of going and coming,

original: 'gro ba dang 'ong ba'i bya ba dgag par bya ba'i ched du /
analyzed: 'gro ba dang 'ong ba'i bya ba dgag par bya ba'i ched du /
translated: in order to refute the activity of going and coming,

original: rab tu grags pa'i 'thad pa gzhan cung zad brjod par bya dgos so //
analyzed: rab tu grags pa'i 'thad pa gzhan cung zad brjod par bya dgos so //
translated: we must state a few other well-known arguments.

original: @31a * // brjod par bya ste /🔽gal te 'gro ba zhes bya ba nges pa zhig yod na de song ba'i lam gyi rnam pa'am /
analyzed: @31a * // brjod par bya ste / gal te 'gro ba zhes bya ba nges pa zhig yod na de song ba'i lam gyi rnam pa'am /
translated: Let us explain.🔽If so-called going exists, then it must be analyzed in terms of the path

original: ma song ba'am bgom pa zhig la brtag grang na /
analyzed: ma song ba'am bgom pa zhig la brtag grang na /
translated: over which one has gone, that over which one has not gone, and that over which one is going.

original: rnam pa thams cad du rigs pa ma yin no zhes bshad pa /🔽re zhig song la mi 'gro ste //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du rigs pa ma yin no zhes bshad pa / re zhig song la mi 'gro ste //
translated: But in no way is it tenable.🔽First, one does not go where one has gone.

original: ma song ba la'ang 'gro ba med //
analyzed: ma song ba la'ang 'gro ba med //
translated: One also does not go where one has not gone.

original: song dang ma song ma gtogs par //
analyzed: song dang ma song ma gtogs par //
translated: Apart from where one has gone and where one has not gone,

original: bgom pa shes par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bgom pa shes par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: one cannot say that one goes where one is going.

original: de la lam gyi rnam par 'gro ba'i bya ba 'gags pa la ni song ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la lam gyi rnam par 'gro ba'i bya ba 'gags pa la ni song ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Here, the activity of going that has ceased in the aspect of the path is called “where one has gone.”

original: 'gro ba'i bya ba ma skyes pa la ni ma song zhes bya la /
analyzed: 'gro ba'i bya ba ma skyes pa la ni ma song zhes bya la /
translated: The activity of going that has not yet arisen is called “where one has not gone.”

original: da ltar ba 'gro ba'i bya bas zin pa la ni sgom pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: da ltar ba 'gro ba'i bya bas zin pa la ni sgom pa zhes brjod do //
translated: That which is present and engaged in the action of going is said to be “that which is being gone over.”

original: de la song ba 'gro ba'i bya ba 'gags pa gang yin pa de ni sgom pa zhes bya ba'i sgra 'gro ba'i bya ba da ltar ba dang 'brel pa brjod pa 'dis brjod na 'brel pa med pa de'i phyir na re zhig song ba la 'gro'o zhes bya🔽ba ni mi rigs so //
analyzed: de la song ba 'gro ba'i bya ba 'gags pa gang yin pa de ni sgom pa zhes bya ba'i sgra 'gro ba'i bya ba da ltar ba dang 'brel pa brjod pa 'dis brjod na 'brel pa med pa de'i phyir na re zhig song ba la 'gro'o zhes bya ba ni mi rigs so //
translated: If that which has gone, where the action of going has ceased, is described by the term “that which is being gone over,” which is connected with the present action of going, then it is unrelated. Therefore it is illogical to say that that which has gone is where one goes.

original: re zhig gi sgras ni dgag pa'i rim pa ston pa'o //
analyzed: re zhig gi sgras ni dgag pa'i rim pa ston pa'o //
translated: The word “first” indicates the order of negation.

original: ma song ba la yang 'gro ba ma yin te /
analyzed: ma song ba la yang 'gro ba ma yin te /
translated: It is also not where one has not yet gone.

original: ma song ba ni 'gro ba'i bya ba ma skyes pa ma 'ongs pa la brjod la /
analyzed: ma song ba ni 'gro ba'i bya ba ma skyes pa ma 'ongs pa la brjod la /
translated: Where one has not yet gone is where the action of going has not yet arisen, that is, where it is future.

original: 'gro ba zhes bya ba ni da ltar byung ba yin te /
analyzed: 'gro ba zhes bya ba ni da ltar byung ba yin te /
translated: Where one goes is where the action of going is present.

original: de'i phyir ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba gnyis shin tu tha dad pas /
analyzed: de'i phyir ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba gnyis shin tu tha dad pas /
translated: Therefore, since the future and the present are completely different,

original: ma song ba la yang 'gro ba zhes bya ba mi rigs te /
analyzed: ma song ba la yang 'gro ba zhes bya ba mi rigs te /
translated: it is also illogical to say that where one has not yet gone is where one goes.

original: gal te ma song ba yin na ni ji ltar 'gro ba yin la /
analyzed: gal te ma song ba yin na ni ji ltar 'gro ba yin la /
translated: If it is where one has not yet gone, how could one go there?

original: 'on te 'gro na ni de ji ltar ma song ba yin /
analyzed: 'on te 'gro na ni de ji ltar ma song ba yin /
translated: But if it goes, then how could it be where one has not yet gone?

original: bgom pa la yang 'gro ba med de /
analyzed: bgom pa la yang 'gro ba med de /
translated: Going does not exist on that being gone over.

original: gang gi phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir /
translated: Why is that?

original: song dang ma song ma gtogs par //
analyzed: song dang ma song ma gtogs par //
translated: Apart from where one has gone and where one has not yet gone,

original: bgom pa shes par mi 'gyur ro //🔽'di na 'gro ba pos yul gang brgal bar gyur pa de ni /
analyzed: bgom pa shes par mi 'gyur ro // 'di na 'gro ba pos yul gang brgal bar gyur pa de ni /
translated: going is not seen.

original: de'i song ba'i yul yin la /
analyzed: de'i song ba'i yul yin la /
translated: Here, the place that a goer has traversed is the place where he has gone.

original: gang brgal bar ma gyur pa de ni de'i ma song ba yin na /
analyzed: gang brgal bar ma gyur pa de ni de'i ma song ba yin na /
translated: The place that he has not yet traversed is the place where he has not yet gone.

original: song ba dang ma song ba las tha dad par bgom pa zhes bya ba lam gyi rnam pa gzhan gsum pa ni ma mthong ngo //
analyzed: song ba dang ma song ba las tha dad par bgom pa zhes bya ba lam gyi rnam pa gzhan gsum pa ni ma mthong ngo //
translated: Apart from where he has gone and where he has not yet gone, a third category called that being gone over is not seen.🔽Why is that?

original: gang gi phyir de ltar bgom pa shes par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar bgom pa shes par mi 'gyur te /
translated: Because going is not seen,

original: shes par mi 'gyur ba dang rtogs par mi 'gyur ba de'i phyir bgom pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: shes par mi 'gyur ba dang rtogs par mi 'gyur ba de'i phyir bgom pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: and because it is not cognized and not realized, therefore that being gone over does not exist.

original: de'i phyir de 'gro ba'i bya bas zin pa ma yin zhing 'gro ba ma yin pas bgom pa la yang 'gro ba med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir de 'gro ba'i bya bas zin pa ma yin zhing 'gro ba ma yin pas bgom pa la yang 'gro ba med do //
translated: Therefore, because it is not engaged by the action of going, and because it is not going, going does not exist on that being gone over.

original: ci ste 'gro bzhin pa'i 'gro ba po'i rkang pas mnan pa'i phyogs gang yin pa de ni bgom pa'ang yin par 'gyur ro snyam na /
analyzed: ci ste 'gro bzhin pa'i 'gro ba po'i rkang pas mnan pa'i phyogs gang yin pa de ni bgom pa'ang yin par 'gyur ro snyam na /
translated: But if you think that the place where the foot of the goer who is in the process of going is placed is the path being gone over,

original: de ltar ma @31b yin te /
analyzed: de ltar ma @31b yin te /
translated: then that is not so.

original: rkang pa yang rdul phra rab 'dus pa yin pa'i phyir sor mo'i rtse mo la gnas pa'i rdul phra rab kyi rgyab kyi phyogs gang yin pa de ni de'i song ba'i khongs su gtogs pa yin zhing /
analyzed: rkang pa yang rdul phra rab 'dus pa yin pa'i phyir sor mo'i rtse mo la gnas pa'i rdul phra rab kyi rgyab kyi phyogs gang yin pa de ni de'i song ba'i khongs su gtogs pa yin zhing /
translated: Because the foot is a composite of subtle particles, the rear part of the subtle particle on the toe is included in the gone,

original: rkang ba'i rdul phra rab rting par gnas pa'i mdun gyi phyogs gang yin pa de ni de'i ma song ba'i khongs su gtogs pa yin zhing /
analyzed: rkang ba'i rdul phra rab rting par gnas pa'i mdun gyi phyogs gang yin pa de ni de'i ma song ba'i khongs su gtogs pa yin zhing /
translated: the front part of the subtle particle of the heel is included in the not-yet-gone,

original: rdul phra rab las ma gtogs pa'i rkang pa yang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rdul phra rab las ma gtogs pa'i rkang pa yang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: and apart from the subtle particles, the foot does not exist.

original: de'i phyir song ba dang ma song ba las tha dad par bgom pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir song ba dang ma song ba las tha dad par bgom pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore the path being gone over does not exist as something different from the gone and the not-yet-gone.

original: de ltar rkang pa la ji ltar rnam par dpyad par byas pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: de ltar rkang pa la ji ltar rnam par dpyad par byas pa de bzhin du /
translated: Just as the foot is analyzed,🔽so too the goer is not the path being gone over.

original: rdul phra rab rnams la yang shar nub kyi phyogs kyi cha dang 'brel pa'i sgo nas rnam par dpyad par bya'o //
analyzed: rdul phra rab rnams la yang shar nub kyi phyogs kyi cha dang 'brel pa'i sgo nas rnam par dpyad par bya'o //
translated: Also, the subtle particles should be analyzed in terms of their relation to the eastern and western directions.

original: de'i phyir de ma thag tu skye bzhin pa'i rnam par dpyad pas phyed song bar gyur pa'i bgom pa rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ma thag tu skye bzhin pa'i rnam par dpyad pas phyed song bar gyur pa'i bgom pa rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not logical that the path being traversed is half gone because it is being analyzed as being in the process of arising.
