original: de'i phyir bgom pa la 'gro ba ma yin no zhes bya bar grub po //
analyzed: de'i phyir bgom pa la 'gro ba ma yin no zhes bya bar grub po //
translated: Therefore, it is established that going does not exist on the path being traversed.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here, someone might say this:

original: bgom pa la ni 'gro ba yod pa nyid de 'di na /
analyzed: bgom pa la ni 'gro ba yod pa nyid de 'di na /
translated: Going exists on the path being traversed because

original: gang na g-yo ba de na 'gro //🔽de yang gang phyir bgom pa la //
analyzed: gang na g-yo ba de na 'gro // de yang gang phyir bgom pa la //
translated: where there is movement, there is going.🔽And that movement does not exist

original: g-yo ba song min ma song min //
analyzed: g-yo ba song min ma song min //
translated: where one has gone or where one has not gone.

original: de phyir bgom la 'gro ba yod //
analyzed: de phyir bgom la 'gro ba yod //
translated: Therefore, going exists on the path being traversed.

original: de la g-yo ba ni rkang pa 'degs pa dang 'jog pa'i mtshan nyid can no //
analyzed: de la g-yo ba ni rkang pa 'degs pa dang 'jog pa'i mtshan nyid can no //
translated: Here, movement has the characteristic of lifting and placing the foot.

original: gang gi phyir 'gro bzhin pa'i 'gro ba po'i g-yo ba yul gang na yod pa'i yul de nyid na 'gro ba yod pa yin la //
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'gro bzhin pa'i 'gro ba po'i g-yo ba yul gang na yod pa'i yul de nyid na 'gro ba yod pa yin la //
translated: Because the movement of the goer who is in the process of going exists only where it is, going exists there.

original: g-yo ba de yang song ba'i lam la yod pa ma yin zhing /
analyzed: g-yo ba de yang song ba'i lam la yod pa ma yin zhing /
translated: That which is moving does not exist on the path that has been traversed.

original: ma song ba la yang ma yin te /
analyzed: ma song ba la yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor does it exist on the path not yet traversed.

original: 'on kyang bgom pa kho na la yod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang bgom pa kho na la yod pa yin no //
translated: However, it does exist on that being traversed.

original: de'i phyir bgom pa kho na la 'gro ba yod pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir bgom pa kho na la 'gro ba yod pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, going exists only on that being traversed.

original: gang zhig tu 'gro ba dmigs pa de ni bgom pa yin la /
analyzed: gang zhig tu 'gro ba dmigs pa de ni bgom pa yin la /
translated: That on which going is observed is that being traversed.

original: de yang bya bas zin pa yin no //
analyzed: de yang bya bas zin pa yin no //
translated: Moreover, it is that which is engaged by the action of going.

original: de'i phyir bgom pa kho na la 'gro ba yod do //
analyzed: de'i phyir bgom pa kho na la 'gro ba yod do //
translated: Therefore, going exists only on that being traversed.

original: 'dir 'gro ba gcig ni shes pa'i don yin la /
analyzed: 'dir 'gro ba gcig ni shes pa'i don yin la /
translated: Here, one instance of “going” refers to the object of the action of going.

original: gzhan ni yul gzhan du phyin pa'i don yin no zhes bya ba'o //🔽de ltar brtags kyang bgom pa la 'gro ba med do zhes bya bar bshad pa /
analyzed: gzhan ni yul gzhan du phyin pa'i don yin no zhes bya ba'o // de ltar brtags kyang bgom pa la 'gro ba med do zhes bya bar bshad pa /
translated: The other refers to the object of arriving at another place.

original: bgom la 'gro ba yin par ni //🔽ji lta bur na 'thad par 'gyur //
analyzed: bgom la 'gro ba yin par ni // ji lta bur na 'thad par 'gyur //
translated: Even though it is analyzed in this way, it is said that going does not exist on that being traversed.🔽How could it be tenable

original: gang tshe 'gro ba med pa yi //
analyzed: gang tshe 'gro ba med pa yi //
translated: that going exists on that being traversed?🔽Because that being traversed

original: bgom pa 'thad pa med phyir ro //
analyzed: bgom pa 'thad pa med phyir ro //
translated: is not tenable without going.

original: 'dir khyed 'gro ba'i bya ba dang ldan pa nyid las bgom par brjod par 'dod cing /
analyzed: 'dir khyed 'gro ba'i bya ba dang ldan pa nyid las bgom par brjod par 'dod cing /
translated: Here you assert that that being traversed is described as that on which the action of going exists.

original: de la yang 'gro ba @32a * //
analyzed: de la yang 'gro ba @32a * //
translated: The first of these is the path of seeing.🔽

original: zhes smra na /
analyzed: zhes smra na /
translated: If you say that it is,

original: 'dir 'gro ba'i bya ba ni gcig yin pas /
analyzed: 'dir 'gro ba'i bya ba ni gcig yin pas /
translated: then in this context, since the action of going is one,

original: des lam bgom pa brjod par 'gyur mod /
analyzed: des lam bgom pa brjod par 'gyur mod /
translated: it would express the path that is being gone over.🔽But it is not tenable to connect the phrase “he goes” with the path that is being gone over.

original: 'gro'o zhes yang bgom par bya ba dang 'brel par ni mi rigs te de'i phyir /🔽bgom la 'gro ba yin par ni //
analyzed: 'gro'o zhes yang bgom par bya ba dang 'brel par ni mi rigs te de'i phyir / bgom la 'gro ba yin par ni //
translated: Therefore it is said:🔽How could it be tenable

original: ji lta bur ni 'thad par 'gyur //
analyzed: ji lta bur ni 'thad par 'gyur //
translated: that going exists on that being gone over?

original: zhes bya'o // gtan tshigs bshad pa /🔽gang tshe 'gro ba med pa yi //
analyzed: zhes bya'o // gtan tshigs bshad pa / gang tshe 'gro ba med pa yi //
translated: The explanation of the reason🔽When there is no going

original: bgom pa 'thad pa med phyir ro //🔽'gro ba med pa ni 'gro ba dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: bgom pa 'thad pa med phyir ro // 'gro ba med pa ni 'gro ba dang bral ba'o //
translated: The path being gone over is not tenable.🔽“ Without going” means being devoid of going.

original: bgom pa zhes bya ba ni 'gro bzhin pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bgom pa zhes bya ba ni 'gro bzhin pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: “ The path being gone over” means that which is being gone over.

original: dgos pa ni gang gi tshe 'gro ba'i bya ba gcig ni bgom pa zhes bya ba der nye bar mkho ba'i phyir dang / gnyis pa med pa'i phyir la 'gro'o zhes bya ba'i brjod pa 'di yang 'gro ba med par mi 'thad pa de'i tshe bgom pa la 'gro'o zhes bya ba la ngag gi don yongs su rdzogs pa yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: dgos pa ni gang gi tshe 'gro ba'i bya ba gcig ni bgom pa zhes bya ba der nye bar mkho ba'i phyir dang / gnyis pa med pa'i phyir la 'gro'o zhes bya ba'i brjod pa 'di yang 'gro ba med par mi 'thad pa de'i tshe bgom pa la 'gro'o zhes bya ba la ngag gi don yongs su rdzogs pa yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The purpose is this: When one action of going is required in that which is called “that being gone over,” and a second action of going does not exist, and when it is untenable to say “he goes” without going, then at that time, in “he goes where he is being gone over,” the meaning of the statement is not complete.

original: bya ba gnyis pa med pa'i phyir bgom pa zhes bya ba 'di tsam zhig srid kyi /
analyzed: bya ba gnyis pa med pa'i phyir bgom pa zhes bya ba 'di tsam zhig srid kyi /
translated: Because a second action of going does not exist, only “that being gone over” is possible,

original: 'gro'o zhes bya ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'gro'o zhes bya ba ni ma yin no //
translated: but not “he goes.”

original: ci ste 'gro'o zhes bya ba de nyid dang / 'gro ba'i bya ba 'brel par 'dod na /
analyzed: ci ste 'gro'o zhes bya ba de nyid dang / 'gro ba'i bya ba 'brel par 'dod na /
translated: But if you assert that the statement “he goes” is connected with the action of going,

original: de lta yin na bgom pa'i brjod pa la bya ba dang 'brel pa med pas /
analyzed: de lta yin na bgom pa'i brjod pa la bya ba dang 'brel pa med pas /
translated: then in that case, since the statement “that being gone over” is not connected with the action of going,🔽the meaning of the statement is not complete.

original: ngag gi don yongs su rdzogs pa nyid ma yin no zhes bshad pa /🔽gang gi bgom pa la 'gro ba //
analyzed: ngag gi don yongs su rdzogs pa nyid ma yin no zhes bshad pa / gang gi bgom pa la 'gro ba //
translated: This is explained in the following:🔽Where there is going on that being gone over,

original: de yi bgom la 'gro med par //
analyzed: de yi bgom la 'gro med par //
translated: there is no going on that being gone over.

original: thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: It follows that

original: gang gi phyir bgom la 'gro ba yin phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir bgom la 'gro ba yin phyir ro //
translated: Because going exists on that being gone over.

original: rgol ba gang gi bgom pa la 'gro'o zhes bya ba'i phyogs yin zhing /
analyzed: rgol ba gang gi bgom pa la 'gro'o zhes bya ba'i phyogs yin zhing /
translated: For the opponent, the position is that “going exists on that being gone over.”

original: gang zhig bgom pa'i ming can du gyur pa 'gro ba'i bya bas stong pa la 'gro ba'i bya ba brten par gyur bar 'dod pa de'i phyogs la bgom pa la 'gro ba med par thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang zhig bgom pa'i ming can du gyur pa 'gro ba'i bya bas stong pa la 'gro ba'i bya ba brten par gyur bar 'dod pa de'i phyogs la bgom pa la 'gro ba med par thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: For the one who asserts that the activity of going is based on that being gone over, which is empty of the activity of going, it follows that going does not exist on that being gone over.

original: de'i bgom pa 'gro ba dang bral bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i bgom pa 'gro ba dang bral bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Because that being gone over would be devoid of going.

original: 'di ltar 'di'i bgom pa la 'gro ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'di'i bgom pa la 'gro ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because going exists on that being gone over.

original: gang gi phyir gyi sgra ni 'di ltar gyi don no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir gyi sgra ni 'di ltar gyi don no //
translated: The word “because” has the meaning “since.”

original: 'di ltar rgol ba de'i ltar na ni 'gro'o zhes bya ba der bya ba nye bar mkho ba'i phyir 'gro ba dang bral ba'i bgom pa kho na la 'gro ba yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar rgol ba de'i ltar na ni 'gro'o zhes bya ba der bya ba nye bar mkho ba'i phyir 'gro ba dang bral ba'i bgom pa kho na la 'gro ba yin te /
translated: Since, according to the opponent, the activity of going is required there, where it is said “he goes,” going exists on that being gone over, which is devoid of going.

original: de'i phyir bgom pa la 'gro ba dang bral bar thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir bgom pa la 'gro ba dang bral bar thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore it follows that that being gone over would be devoid of going.

original: ci ste bgom pa dang 'gro'o zhes bya ba gnyi ga yang bya ba dang 'brel par 'dod na ni /
analyzed: ci ste bgom pa dang 'gro'o zhes bya ba gnyi ga yang bya ba dang 'brel par 'dod na ni /
translated: But if you maintain that both “that being gone over” and “going” are related to action,

original: de lta na yang /
analyzed: de lta na yang /
translated: then in that case,

original: bgom la 'gro ba yod na ni //
analyzed: bgom la 'gro ba yod na ni //
translated: If going exists where one has gone,

original: 'gro ba gnyis su thal 'gyur te //
analyzed: 'gro ba gnyis su thal 'gyur te //
translated: then going would be twofold.

original: @32b gang gis de bgom gyur pa dang // de la 'gro ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: @32b gang gis de bgom gyur pa dang // de la 'gro ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: One would be that by virtue of which it becomes that being gone over, and the other would be the going there.

original: 'gro ba gang dang ldan pas lam gyis bgom pa zhes bya ba'i brjod pa rnyed par 'gyur pa de ni 'gro ba gcig yin no //
analyzed: 'gro ba gang dang ldan pas lam gyis bgom pa zhes bya ba'i brjod pa rnyed par 'gyur pa de ni 'gro ba gcig yin no //
translated: The first is the going by virtue of which one acquires the expression “that being gone over” by means of the path.

original: gang gis lam de bgrod pa'i gzhir gyur pa'i bgom pa de la 'gro ba ni gnyis pa ste /🔽bgom pa la 'gro ba yod na 'gro ba 'di gnyis su thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gis lam de bgrod pa'i gzhir gyur pa'i bgom pa de la 'gro ba ni gnyis pa ste / bgom pa la 'gro ba yod na 'gro ba 'di gnyis su thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The second is the going by virtue of which the path becomes the basis for that being gone over.🔽If going exists where one has gone, then going would be twofold.

original: 'gro ba gnyis yod mod skyon ci yod ce na //
analyzed: 'gro ba gnyis yod mod skyon ci yod ce na //
translated: But if you maintain that there is no error because there is only one going,

original: skyon 'di yod de gang gi phyir //🔽'gro ba gnyis su thal 'gyur na //
analyzed: skyon 'di yod de gang gi phyir // 'gro ba gnyis su thal 'gyur na //
translated: then in that case,🔽If going is twofold,

original: 'gro ba po yang gnyis su 'gyur //
analyzed: 'gro ba po yang gnyis su 'gyur //
translated: then the goer also would be twofold.

original: yang ci'i phyir 'gro ba po gnyis su thal bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir 'gro ba po gnyis su thal bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Why would the goer be twofold?

original: bshad pa / gang phyir 'gro ba med par ni //
analyzed: bshad pa / gang phyir 'gro ba med par ni //
translated: Nāgārjuna responds:🔽Because without going,

original: 'gro po 'thad par mi 'gyur phyir //
analyzed: 'gro po 'thad par mi 'gyur phyir //
translated: The goer is not tenable.

original: gang phyir bya ba ni /🔽gdon mi za bar las sam byed pa po yang rung ste /
analyzed: gang phyir bya ba ni / gdon mi za bar las sam byed pa po yang rung ste /
translated: Because,

original: rang gi sgrub par byed pa la ltos pa yin la /
analyzed: rang gi sgrub par byed pa la ltos pa yin la /
translated: without doubt, any action must rely on either an object or an agent.

original: 'gro ba'i bya ba 'di yang byed pa po la gnas pa yin te /
analyzed: 'gro ba'i bya ba 'di yang byed pa po la gnas pa yin te /
translated: And this action of going is based on the goer.

original: de'i phyir 'gro ba po la ltos pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'gro ba po la ltos pa yin no //
translated: Therefore it relies on the goer.

original: lha sbyin gcig 'gro ba na byed pa po gnyis pa yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: lha sbyin gcig 'gro ba na byed pa po gnyis pa yod pa ma yin te /
translated: When Yajñadatta goes, there is no second agent.

original: de'i phyir byed pa po gnyis pa med pa'i phyir bya ba gnyis med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir byed pa po gnyis pa med pa'i phyir bya ba gnyis med do //
translated: Therefore, because there is no second agent, there is no second action.

original: de'i phyir bgom pa la 'gro ba yod do zhes bya ba 'thad pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir bgom pa la 'gro ba yod do zhes bya ba 'thad pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore it is not tenable to say that going exists on that being gone over.

original: ci ste gang gi tshe lha sbyin 'di 'dug bzhin du smra bar yang byed cing lta bar yang byed pa de'i tshe byed pa po gcig bya ba du ma dang ldan par mthong ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: ci ste gang gi tshe lha sbyin 'di 'dug bzhin du smra bar yang byed cing lta bar yang byed pa de'i tshe byed pa po gcig bya ba du ma dang ldan par mthong ba de bzhin du /
translated: But if you say that when Yajñadatta is sitting and he both speaks and sees, at that time one agent is seen to possess many actions,

original: 'gro ba po gcig la bya ba gnyis yod par 'gyur ro snyam nam yin te /
analyzed: 'gro ba po gcig la bya ba gnyis yod par 'gyur ro snyam nam yin te /
translated: One might think that a single goer would have two actions.

original: gang gi phyir nus pa byed pa po yin gyi rdzas ni ma yin la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir nus pa byed pa po yin gyi rdzas ni ma yin la /
translated: But that is not so, because the one who has the ability is the agent, not the substance.

original: bya ba tha dad pas de'i sgrub byed nus pa yang tha dad par grub pa yin te /
analyzed: bya ba tha dad pas de'i sgrub byed nus pa yang tha dad par grub pa yin te /
translated: And since the actions are different, the abilities that accomplish them are also established as different.

original: 'dug pa'i bya bas smra ba por 'gyur ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dug pa'i bya bas smra ba por 'gyur ba ni ma yin no //
translated: But it is not that the goer becomes the speaker through the action of sitting.

original: gal te rdzas gcig yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te rdzas gcig yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that the substance is one,

original: de lta yin du chug mod rdzas ni byed pa po ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta yin du chug mod rdzas ni byed pa po ma yin te /
translated: then that may be so, but the substance is not the agent.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What is it then?

original: nus pa yin na de yang tha dad pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: nus pa yin na de yang tha dad pa kho na yin no //
translated: The ability is different.

original: gzhan yang gcig dus gcig tu bya ba 'dra ba gnyis kyi byed pa po gnyis yin par yang ma mthong ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang gcig dus gcig tu bya ba 'dra ba gnyis kyi byed pa po gnyis yin par yang ma mthong ste /
translated: Moreover, we never see a single thing as the agent of two similar actions at one time.

original: de'i phyir 'gro ba po gcig la 'gro ba gnyis med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'gro ba po gcig la 'gro ba gnyis med do //
translated: Therefore, a single goer does not have two goings.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here the opponent says:

original: gal te yang de ltar yin mod kyi /
analyzed: gal te yang de ltar yin mod kyi /
translated: Even if that is so,

original: 'on kyang lha sbyin 'gro'o zhes brjod pa las na 'gro ba po lha sbyin la 'gro ba dmigs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang lha sbyin 'gro'o zhes brjod pa las na 'gro ba po lha sbyin la 'gro ba dmigs pa yin no //
translated: But when it is said “Devadatta goes,” going is observed in Devadatta, the goer.

original: de'i phyir 'gro ba ni yod pa nyid de /🔽'gro ba'i @33a * //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'gro ba ni yod pa nyid de / 'gro ba'i @33a * //
translated: Therefore, going exists.

original: rten 'gro ba po yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rten 'gro ba po yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the goer, the basis of going, exists.

original: brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: brjod par bya ste /
translated: We reply:

original: gal te 'gro ba'i rten 'gro ba po yod na de ltar 'gyur ba zhig na de ni med do //
analyzed: gal te 'gro ba'i rten 'gro ba po yod na de ltar 'gyur ba zhig na de ni med do //
translated: If the goer existed, then it would be so, but it does not.

original: ci ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ci ltar zhe na /
translated: How so?🔽We have explained:

original: bshad pa / gal te 'gro bo med 'gyur na //
analyzed: bshad pa / gal te 'gro bo med 'gyur na //
translated: If the goer did not exist,

original: 'gro ba 'thad par mi 'gyur te //
analyzed: 'gro ba 'thad par mi 'gyur te //
translated: going would not be tenable.

original: 'gro ba med na 'gro ba po //
analyzed: 'gro ba med na 'gro ba po //
translated: If going did not exist,

original: yod pa nyid du ga la 'gyur //
analyzed: yod pa nyid du ga la 'gyur //
translated: how could the goer exist?

original: 'gro ba po med par rten med pa'i 'gro ba med do zhes bshad zin to //
analyzed: 'gro ba po med par rten med pa'i 'gro ba med do zhes bshad zin to //
translated: We have already explained that without a goer, there is no going that is without a basis.

original: de'i phyir gal te 'gro ba po med 'gyur na ste bsal na 'gro ba yod pa ma yin la /🔽'gro ba med na rgyu med pa'i //
analyzed: de'i phyir gal te 'gro ba po med 'gyur na ste bsal na 'gro ba yod pa ma yin la / 'gro ba med na rgyu med pa'i //
translated: Therefore, if the goer did not exist—that is, if it were refuted—going would not exist.🔽If going did not exist,

original: 'gro ba yod par ga la 'gyur //
analyzed: 'gro ba yod par ga la 'gyur //
translated: how could there be a goer without a cause?

original: de'i phyir 'gro ba med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'gro ba med do //
translated: Therefore, going does not exist.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here, someone says:

original: 'gro ba ni yod pa nyid de /
analyzed: 'gro ba ni yod pa nyid de /
translated: Going exists.🔽

original: de'i sgo nas de dang ldan pa brjod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i sgo nas de dang ldan pa brjod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Going exists because it is said that one who possesses it goes.

original: 'di na 'gro ba po ni 'gro ba dang ldan pa yin la //
analyzed: 'di na 'gro ba po ni 'gro ba dang ldan pa yin la //
translated: Here, one who possesses going is a goer.

original: de dang ldan pa las kyang 'gro ba yin no //🔽gal te 'gro ba med par gyur na ni /
analyzed: de dang ldan pa las kyang 'gro ba yin no // gal te 'gro ba med par gyur na ni /
translated: And from one who possesses it, going occurs.

original: 'gro ba dang mi ldan pa'i lha sbyin la 'gro'o zhes brjod par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'gro ba dang mi ldan pa'i lha sbyin la 'gro'o zhes brjod par mi 'gyur te /
translated: If going did not exist, then it would not be said that Yajñadatta, who does not possess going, goes,

original: khar ba med na khar ba can du brjod pa med pa bzhin no //
analyzed: khar ba med na khar ba can du brjod pa med pa bzhin no //
translated: just as it is not said that one who does not possess a goad has a goad.

original: brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: brjod par bya ste /
translated: We say:

original: gal te 'gro'o zhes bya ba'i brjod pa 'di nyid yod na /
analyzed: gal te 'gro'o zhes bya ba'i brjod pa 'di nyid yod na /
translated: If the expression “he goes” existed,

original: 'gro ba yod par 'gyur na de ni med de /
analyzed: 'gro ba yod par 'gyur na de ni med de /
translated: then going would exist, but it does not.

original: gang gi phyir /🔽re zhig 'gro bo mi 'gro ste //
analyzed: gang gi phyir / re zhig 'gro bo mi 'gro ste //
translated: Why is that?🔽First, a goer does not go.

original: 'gro ba po min 'gro ba min //
analyzed: 'gro ba po min 'gro ba min //
translated: One who does not go does not go.

original: 'gro po 'gro po min las gzhan //
analyzed: 'gro po 'gro po min las gzhan //
translated: Apart from a goer and a nongoer,

original: gsum pa gang zhig 'gro bar 'gyur //
analyzed: gsum pa gang zhig 'gro bar 'gyur //
translated: what third goes?

original: 'dir 'gro bar byed pas na 'gro ba po yin na /
analyzed: 'dir 'gro bar byed pas na 'gro ba po yin na /
translated: Here, if one goes because of going,

original: de ni re zhig mi 'gro'o //
analyzed: de ni re zhig mi 'gro'o //
translated: then a goer does not go.

original: ji ltar mi 'gro ba de ltar ni tshigs su bcad pa 'og ma gsum gyis ston par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji ltar mi 'gro ba de ltar ni tshigs su bcad pa 'og ma gsum gyis ston par 'gyur ro //
translated: The next three verses will show how it does not.

original: 'gro ba po ma yin pa yang mi 'gro ste /
analyzed: 'gro ba po ma yin pa yang mi 'gro ste /
translated: One who is not a goer does not go.

original: 'gro ba po ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni gang zhig 'gro ba'i bya ba dang bral ba yin la /
analyzed: 'gro ba po ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni gang zhig 'gro ba'i bya ba dang bral ba yin la /
translated: One who is not a goer is one who is devoid of the action of going.

original: 'gro'o zhes bya ba'i sgra 'di ni 'gro ba'i bya ba dang ldan pa la 'jug pa yin te /🔽de'i phyir 'di gal te 'gro ba po ma yin na ni ji ltar 'gro la /
analyzed: 'gro'o zhes bya ba'i sgra 'di ni 'gro ba'i bya ba dang ldan pa la 'jug pa yin te / de'i phyir 'di gal te 'gro ba po ma yin na ni ji ltar 'gro la /
translated: The term “goes” applies to one who possesses the action of going.🔽Therefore, if he is not a goer, how could he go?

original: 'on te 'gro na ni 'di 'gro ba po ma yin zhes bya /
analyzed: 'on te 'gro na ni 'di 'gro ba po ma yin zhes bya /
translated: But if he goes, then how could he not be a goer?

original: gal te de gnyis las tha dad pa zhig 'gro'o zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de gnyis las tha dad pa zhig 'gro'o zhe na /
translated: If you say that one who is different from these two goes,

original: de ltar ma yin te /
analyzed: de ltar ma yin te /
translated: that is not so.

original: gang zhig la 'gro'o zhes bya bar rtog pa 'gro ba po dang 'gro ba po ma yin pa las ma gtogs pa'i gsum pa zhes bya ba yang gang zhig yod /
analyzed: gang zhig la 'gro'o zhes bya bar rtog pa 'gro ba po dang 'gro ba po ma yin pa las ma gtogs pa'i gsum pa zhes bya ba yang gang zhig yod /
translated: What third person, apart from the goer and the nongoer, is there that you imagine goes?

original: de'i phyir 'gro ba med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'gro ba med do //
translated: Therefore going does not exist.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here the opponent says:

original: 'gro ba po ma yin pa mi 'gro la /
analyzed: 'gro ba po ma yin pa mi 'gro la /
translated: One who is not a goer does not go.

original: gnyi ga ma gtogs pa yang mi 'gro ste /
analyzed: gnyi ga ma gtogs pa yang mi 'gro ste /
translated: But one who is not both does not go.

original: 'o na ci @33b zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci @33b zhe na /
translated: What then?

original: 'gro ba po kho na 'gro ba yin no //
analyzed: 'gro ba po kho na 'gro ba yin no //
translated: Only one who goes goes.

original: 'di yang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di yang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: But that also does not exist.🔽Why is that?

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽'di ltar / gang tshe 'gro ba med par ni //🔽'gro po 'thad par mi 'gyur na //
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na / 'di ltar / gang tshe 'gro ba med par ni // 'gro po 'thad par mi 'gyur na //
translated: Because:🔽When one who goes does not exist

original: re zhig 'gro bo 'gro'o zhes //
analyzed: re zhig 'gro bo 'gro'o zhes //
translated: Without going,

original: ji ltar 'thad pa nyid du 'gyur /
analyzed: ji ltar 'thad pa nyid du 'gyur /
translated: How could it be tenable🔽To say “one who goes goes”?

original: 'gro ba po 'gro'o zhes bya ba'i ngag 'dir 'gro ba'i bya ba ni gcig nyid yin la /
analyzed: 'gro ba po 'gro'o zhes bya ba'i ngag 'dir 'gro ba'i bya ba ni gcig nyid yin la /
translated: In the statement “One who goes goes,” there is only one action of going.

original: des kyang 'gro'o zhes bya bar brjod par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: des kyang 'gro'o zhes bya bar brjod par 'gyur zhing /
translated: And by that, it is said “he goes.”

original: 'gro ba po zhes bya ba'i brjod pa la ni 'gro ba'i bya ba gnyis pa yod pa ma yin pas gang gi tshe 'gro ba med par 'gro ba po ste /
analyzed: 'gro ba po zhes bya ba'i brjod pa la ni 'gro ba'i bya ba gnyis pa yod pa ma yin pas gang gi tshe 'gro ba med par 'gro ba po ste /
translated: But in the statement “one who goes,” there is no second action of going. Therefore, when one who goes does not exist without going,

original: mi 'gro bar 'gro ba po zhes bya ba yod pa ma yin pa de'i tshe 'gro ba po 'gro'o zhes bya ba mi rigs so //
analyzed: mi 'gro bar 'gro ba po zhes bya ba yod pa ma yin pa de'i tshe 'gro ba po 'gro'o zhes bya ba mi rigs so //
translated: that is, when one who does not go is called “one who goes,” then it is not tenable to say “one who goes goes.”

original: 'gro'o zhes bya ba ni yin du chug na /
analyzed: 'gro'o zhes bya ba ni yin du chug na /
translated: Even if it were tenable to say “he goes,”

original: 'gro ba po zhes bya ba 'di mi srid pas /
analyzed: 'gro ba po zhes bya ba 'di mi srid pas /
translated: Since the goer is impossible,

original: rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: it is illogical.

original: ci ste 'gro ba dang ldan pa las 'gro ba po 'gro ba dang bcas pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: ci ste 'gro ba dang ldan pa las 'gro ba po 'gro ba dang bcas pa yin no zhe na /
translated: But if you say that the goer is endowed with going, and therefore the goer possesses going,

original: de ltar na yang 'gro ba'i bya ba gnyis pa med pa'i phyir 'gro'o zhes brjod pa yod par mi 'gyur ro zhes bshad pa /🔽gang gi phyogs la 'gro ba po //🔽'gro ba de la 'gro med pa'i //
analyzed: de ltar na yang 'gro ba'i bya ba gnyis pa med pa'i phyir 'gro'o zhes brjod pa yod par mi 'gyur ro zhes bshad pa / gang gi phyogs la 'gro ba po // 'gro ba de la 'gro med pa'i //
translated: then in that case, since there is no second action of going, the statement “he goes” would not exist.🔽This is explained in the following:🔽In the system of the opponent,🔽the goer would be a goer

original: 'gro po yin par thal 'gyur te //🔽'gro po 'gro bar 'dod phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gro po yin par thal 'gyur te // 'gro po 'gro bar 'dod phyir ro //
translated: without going,🔽because the goer is asserted to go.

original: rgol ba gang gi 'gro ba dang ldan pa nyid las 'gro ba po yin no zhes bya ba'i phyogs yin zhing /
analyzed: rgol ba gang gi 'gro ba dang ldan pa nyid las 'gro ba po yin no zhes bya ba'i phyogs yin zhing /
translated: In the system of the opponent, the one who possesses going is the goer.🔽In that system,

original: 'gro ba po 'gro bar 'dod pa de la /🔽'gro ba po'i brjod pa 'gro ba dang bcas pas /
analyzed: 'gro ba po 'gro bar 'dod pa de la / 'gro ba po'i brjod pa 'gro ba dang bcas pas /
translated: the goer who possesses going

original: 'gro ba med par 'gro ba po 'gro'o zhes bya bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'gro ba med par 'gro ba po 'gro'o zhes bya bar 'gyur te /
translated: would be a goer without going.

original: 'gro ba'i bya ba gnyis pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gro ba'i bya ba gnyis pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because there is no second action of going.

original: de'i phyir 'gro ba po 'gro'o zhes bya ba mi rigs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'gro ba po 'gro'o zhes bya ba mi rigs so //
translated: Therefore, it is not logical to say “The goer goes.”

original: 'gro ba med pa'i 'gro po yin par zhes bya ba'i ngag 'di'i 'gro ba po zhes bya ba'i sgra ni 'gro ba'i bya ba 'di'i don la 'jug go //🔽ci ste 'gro ba po 'gro'o zhes gnyi ga yang /
analyzed: 'gro ba med pa'i 'gro po yin par zhes bya ba'i ngag 'di'i 'gro ba po zhes bya ba'i sgra ni 'gro ba'i bya ba 'di'i don la 'jug go // ci ste 'gro ba po 'gro'o zhes gnyi ga yang /
translated: In this statement “The goer exists without going,” the word “goer” refers to the referent of the action of going.🔽But if you assert that both the goer and going exist,

original: 'gro ba dang ldan par 'dod do zhe na /🔽de lta na yang /
analyzed: 'gro ba dang ldan par 'dod do zhe na / de lta na yang /
translated: then the goer would go.

original: gal te 'gro po 'gro 'gyur na //
analyzed: gal te 'gro po 'gro 'gyur na //
translated: But if the goer went,

original: 'gro ba gnyis su thal 'gyur te //
analyzed: 'gro ba gnyis su thal 'gyur te //
translated: then going would have two parts.🔽The goer would be manifest by means of going,

original: gang gis 'gro por mngon pa dang // 'gro por gyur nas gang 'gro ba'o //🔽'gro ba gang dang ldan pas 'gro ba po zhes bya bar mngon zhing brjod pa 'gro ba gcig po de dang / 'gro ba por gyur nas gang 'gro ba ste /
analyzed: gang gis 'gro por mngon pa dang // 'gro por gyur nas gang 'gro ba'o // 'gro ba gang dang ldan pas 'gro ba po zhes bya bar mngon zhing brjod pa 'gro ba gcig po de dang / 'gro ba por gyur nas gang 'gro ba ste /
translated: and having become a goer, he would go.

original: 'gro ba'i bya ba gang zhig byed pa ste /
analyzed: 'gro ba'i bya ba gang zhig byed pa ste /
translated: The goer would be manifest by means of the going that he possesses, and he would be called “a goer.” Having become a goer, he would go, that is, he would perform the action of going.

original: 'gro ba gnyis po 'di dag tu thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'gro ba gnyis po 'di dag tu thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: But in this case, going would have two parts.

original: de'i phyir 'gro ba po gnyis su yang thal bar 'gyur ro zhes gong ma bzhin du skyon brjod @34a * //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'gro ba po gnyis su yang thal bar 'gyur ro zhes gong ma bzhin du skyon brjod @34a * //
translated: Therefore, the error of the consequence that there would be two goers would ensue, as before.

original: par bya'o // de'i phyir 'gro'o zhes bya bar brjod pa don med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: par bya'o // de'i phyir 'gro'o zhes bya bar brjod pa don med par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, the expression “he goes” would be meaningless.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Objection:

original: gal te yang de ltar yin mod kyi /
analyzed: gal te yang de ltar yin mod kyi /
translated: Even if that is so,

original: de lta na yang lha sbyin 'gro'o zhes bya ba'i brjod pa yod pa'i phyir 'gro ba yod do //
analyzed: de lta na yang lha sbyin 'gro'o zhes bya ba'i brjod pa yod pa'i phyir 'gro ba yod do //
translated: since the expression “God goes” exists, going exists.

original: de ltar ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ltar ni ma yin te /
translated: Response: That is not so.

original: gang gi phyir ci 'di 'gro ba por gyur pa zhig gam /
analyzed: gang gi phyir ci 'di 'gro ba por gyur pa zhig gam /
translated: Because this analysis — “Does the goer go,

original: 'on te 'gro ba po ma yin pa zhig gam /🔽de gnyis las tha dad pa zhig 'gro grang /
analyzed: 'on te 'gro ba po ma yin pa zhig gam / de gnyis las tha dad pa zhig 'gro grang /
translated: or does the nongoer go,

original: zhes dpyad pa 'di ni lha sbyin gyi rten can yin la /
analyzed: zhes dpyad pa 'di ni lha sbyin gyi rten can yin la /
translated: or does something other than the goer and the nongoer go?” — is based on God.

original: rnam pa thams cad du 'thad pa yang ma yin pas 'di ni gyi na'o //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du 'thad pa yang ma yin pas 'di ni gyi na'o //
translated: Since it is not tenable in any way, this is just nonsense.

original: 'dir smras pa /🔽'gro ba ni yod pa nyid de //
analyzed: 'dir smras pa / 'gro ba ni yod pa nyid de //
translated: Objection:🔽Going exists because

original: de'i rtsom pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i rtsom pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: its beginning exists.

original: 'di na lha sbyin sdod pa btang nas 'gro bar rtsom la /
analyzed: 'di na lha sbyin sdod pa btang nas 'gro bar rtsom la /
translated: But when Devadatta is standing here and begins to go,

original: rus sbal gyi spu yod pa ma yin pa'i gos ni rtsom pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: rus sbal gyi spu yod pa ma yin pa'i gos ni rtsom pa yang ma yin no //
translated: the cloth that is not the hair of a tortoise does not begin.

original: brjod par bya ste /🔽gal te de'i rtsom pa nyid yod na /
analyzed: brjod par bya ste / gal te de'i rtsom pa nyid yod na /
translated: We reply:🔽If the beginning of going exists,

original: 'gro ba yod par 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: 'gro ba yod par 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: then going would exist.

original: de ni med do //🔽song la 'gro ba rtsom med de //🔽ma song ba la'ang 'gro rtsom med //
analyzed: de ni med do // song la 'gro ba rtsom med de // ma song ba la'ang 'gro rtsom med //
translated: But it does not exist.🔽The beginning of going does not exist where one has gone.🔽The beginning of going does not exist where one has not gone.

original: bgom la rtsom pa yod min na //
analyzed: bgom la rtsom pa yod min na //
translated: The beginning of going does not exist where one goes.

original: gang du 'gro ba rtsom par byed //
analyzed: gang du 'gro ba rtsom par byed //
translated: Where would the beginning of going occur?

original: gal te 'gro ba'i rtsom pa de yod na /🔽de'i tshe song ba'i lam la'am /
analyzed: gal te 'gro ba'i rtsom pa de yod na / de'i tshe song ba'i lam la'am /
translated: If the beginning of going exists,🔽then the beginning of going would occur where one has gone,

original: ma song ba'am bgom pa zhig la rtsom par 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: ma song ba'am bgom pa zhig la rtsom par 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: where one has not gone, or where one goes.

original: de la song ba la ni 'gro ba'i rtsom pa med de /
analyzed: de la song ba la ni 'gro ba'i rtsom pa med de /
translated: The beginning of going does not exist where one has gone.

original: song ba ni 'gro ba'i bya ba 'gags pa yin na /
analyzed: song ba ni 'gro ba'i bya ba 'gags pa yin na /
translated: If the activity of going has ceased,

original: gal te der 'gro ba rtsom na ni de song ba nyid du mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te der 'gro ba rtsom na ni de song ba nyid du mi 'gyur te /
translated: then if the beginning of going were there, it would not be where one has gone,

original: 'das pa dang da ltar ba dag ni 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'das pa dang da ltar ba dag ni 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the past and present are mutually exclusive.

original: ma song ba la yang 'gro ba'i rtsom pa med de /
analyzed: ma song ba la yang 'gro ba'i rtsom pa med de /
translated: Also, there is no beginning of going where one has not yet gone.

original: ma 'ongs pa dang de lta ba dag ni 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa dang de lta ba dag ni 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the future and the present are mutually exclusive.

original: bgom pa la yang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: bgom pa la yang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Also, it does not exist where one is going.

original: de med pa'i phyir dang / bya ba gnyis su thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir dang // byed pa po gnyis su thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de med pa'i phyir dang / bya ba gnyis su thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir dang // byed pa po gnyis su thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that does not exist, because it follows that there would be two actions, and because it follows that there would be two performers.

original: de'i phyir de ltar thams cad du 'gro ba'i rtsom pa ma gzigs nas //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar thams cad du 'gro ba'i rtsom pa ma gzigs nas //
translated: Thus, since the beginning of going is not seen anywhere,

original: gang du 'gro ba rtsom par byed //
analyzed: gang du 'gro ba rtsom par byed //
translated: Where does the beginning of going occur?

original: ces gsungs so //
analyzed: ces gsungs so //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: ji ltar 'gro ba yod pa ma yin pa de ltar bstan par bya ba'i phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: ji ltar 'gro ba yod pa ma yin pa de ltar bstan par bya ba'i phyir bshad pa /
translated: In order to demonstrate how going does not exist, it is said:

original: 'gro ba rtsom pa'i snga rol na //
analyzed: 'gro ba rtsom pa'i snga rol na //
translated: Prior to the beginning of going,

original: gang du 'gro ba rtsom 'gyur ba //
analyzed: gang du 'gro ba rtsom 'gyur ba //
translated: Where does the beginning of going occur?

original: bgom pa med cing song ba med //
analyzed: bgom pa med cing song ba med //
translated: There is no where one is going, and no where one has been.

original: ma song 'gro ba ga la yod //
analyzed: ma song 'gro ba ga la yod //
translated: How can there be going where one has not yet gone?

original: 'di ltar gang gi tshe lha sbyin 'dug par gyur pa de'i tshe 'gro ba rtsom pa yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar gang gi tshe lha sbyin 'dug par gyur pa de'i tshe 'gro ba rtsom pa yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Thus, when Devadatta is sitting, at that time the beginning of going does not exist.

original: de la 'gro ba rtsom pa'i snga rol du ni gang du 'gro ba @34b rtsom par 'gyur ba bgom pa'i lam gyi rnam pa yod pa ma yin la /
analyzed: de la 'gro ba rtsom pa'i snga rol du ni gang du 'gro ba @34b rtsom par 'gyur ba bgom pa'i lam gyi rnam pa yod pa ma yin la /
translated: But prior to the commencement of going, the aspect of the path where one would commence going does not yet exist.

original: song ba yang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: song ba yang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: And that gone over also does not yet exist.

original: de'i phyir song ba dang bgom pa med pa'i phyir 'di gnyis la 'gro ba'i rtsom pa med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir song ba dang bgom pa med pa'i phyir 'di gnyis la 'gro ba'i rtsom pa med do //
translated: Therefore, because that gone over and the path over which one is going do not exist, the commencement of going does not exist in these two.

original: ci ste gal te yang 'gro ba rtsom pa'i snga rol du song ba med cing bgom pa med mod kyi /
analyzed: ci ste gal te yang 'gro ba rtsom pa'i snga rol du song ba med cing bgom pa med mod kyi /
translated: But if you think that although prior to the commencement of going that gone over does not exist and the path over which one is going does not exist,

original: de lta na yang gang du 'gro ba rtsom par 'gyur ba ma song ba ni yod pa yin te /
analyzed: de lta na yang gang du 'gro ba rtsom par 'gyur ba ma song ba ni yod pa yin te /
translated: nevertheless, that over which one has not yet gone exists, where one would commence going,

original: der 'gro ba rtsom par 'gyur ro snyam na brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: der 'gro ba rtsom par 'gyur ro snyam na brjod par bya ste /
translated: and going commences there, then we would reply:

original: ma song 'gro ba ga la yod //
analyzed: ma song 'gro ba ga la yod //
translated: How could there be going where one has not yet gone?

original: ma song ba ni 'gro ba'i bya ba ma skyes shing 'gro ba'i bya ba ma brtsams pa yin na /
analyzed: ma song ba ni 'gro ba'i bya ba ma skyes shing 'gro ba'i bya ba ma brtsams pa yin na /
translated: If where one has not yet gone is where the action of going has not yet arisen and the action of going has not yet commenced,

original: der 'gro ba rtsom mo zhes bya ba 'di ni ma 'brel pa yin no zhes bshad pa ni /
analyzed: der 'gro ba rtsom mo zhes bya ba 'di ni ma 'brel pa yin no zhes bshad pa ni /
translated: then this statement “Going commences there” is incoherent.

original: ma song 'gro ba ga la yod //
analyzed: ma song 'gro ba ga la yod //
translated: How could there be going where one has not yet gone?

original: ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: ces bya ba'o //
translated: This is the response.🔽If the beginning of going does not exist on that being gone over,🔽where being gone over exists, then that being gone over does not exist.

original: gal te yang song ba dang ma song ba dang bgom pa dag la 'gro ba'i rtsom pa med mod kyi /
analyzed: gal te yang song ba dang ma song ba dang bgom pa dag la 'gro ba'i rtsom pa med mod kyi /
translated: If the beginning of going does not exist on that being gone over,

original: song ba dang ma song ba dang bgom pa dag ni yod pa yin la /
analyzed: song ba dang ma song ba dang bgom pa dag ni yod pa yin la /
translated: where being gone over exists, then that being gone over does not exist.

original: 'gro ba med na ni 'di dag mi rung ngo zhe na /🔽brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: 'gro ba med na ni 'di dag mi rung ngo zhe na / brjod par bya ste /
translated: If the beginning of going does not exist on that being gone over,🔽where being gone over exists, then that being gone over does not exist.🔽If the beginning of going does not exist on that being gone over,

original: gal te 'di dag nyid yod na 'gro ba yod par 'gyur ba zhig go //🔽'gro ba'i rtsom pa yod na ni /
analyzed: gal te 'di dag nyid yod na 'gro ba yod par 'gyur ba zhig go // 'gro ba'i rtsom pa yod na ni /
translated: where being gone over exists, then that being gone over does not exist.🔽If the beginning of going does not exist on that being gone over,🔽where being gone over exists, then that being gone over does not exist.

original: gang du 'gro ba'i bya ba 'gags pa de ni song ba zhes brtag par bya la /
analyzed: gang du 'gro ba'i bya ba 'gags pa de ni song ba zhes brtag par bya la /
translated: If the beginning of going does not exist on that being gone over,

original: gang du da lta bar gyur pa de ni bgom pa yin zhing /🔽gang du ma skyes pa de ni ma song ba yin no zhes brtag na /
analyzed: gang du da lta bar gyur pa de ni bgom pa yin zhing / gang du ma skyes pa de ni ma song ba yin no zhes brtag na /
translated: where being gone over exists, then that being gone over does not exist.🔽If the beginning of going does not exist on that being gone over,🔽where being gone over exists, then that being gone over does not exist.🔽If the beginning of going does not exist on that being gone over,🔽where being gone over exists, then that being gone over does not exist.

original: gang gi tshe 'gro ba'i bya ba rtsom pa nyid yod pa ma yin pa de'i tshe /🔽'gro rtsom rnam pa thams cad du //
analyzed: gang gi tshe 'gro ba'i bya ba rtsom pa nyid yod pa ma yin pa de'i tshe / 'gro rtsom rnam pa thams cad du //
translated: If the beginning of going does not exist on that being gone over,

original: snang ba med pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: snang ba med pa nyid yin no //
translated: where being gone over exists, then that being gone over does not exist.🔽If the beginning of going does not exist on that being gone over,

original: song ba ci zhig bgom pa ci //
analyzed: song ba ci zhig bgom pa ci //
translated: where being gone over exists, then that being gone over does not exist.

original: ma song ci zhig rnam par brtag / thams cad du 'gro ba'i rtsam pa nyid dmigs pa med na /
analyzed: ma song ci zhig rnam par brtag / thams cad du 'gro ba'i rtsam pa nyid dmigs pa med na /
translated: What is there to investigate?

original: phyin ci log tu dus gsum du rtog par ci ste byed /
analyzed: phyin ci log tu dus gsum du rtog par ci ste byed /
translated: If the activity of going does not exist in any of the three times, then why imagine that the three times are distorted?

original: de'i brjod pa'i rgyu 'gro ba yang lta ga la yod /
analyzed: de'i brjod pa'i rgyu 'gro ba yang lta ga la yod /
translated: How could there be any going that is the cause of the expression “he goes”?

original: de'i phyir 'di ni rigs pa ma yin no //🔽'dir smras pa 'gro ba ni yod pa nyid de /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di ni rigs pa ma yin no // 'dir smras pa 'gro ba ni yod pa nyid de /
translated: Therefore this is not a proper analogy.

original: de'i gnyen po yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i gnyen po yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Here, someone might say, “Going exists because its opposite exists.

original: gang la gnyen po yod pa de ni yod pa yin te /
analyzed: gang la gnyen po yod pa de ni yod pa yin te /
translated: That which has an opposite exists,

original: snang ba dang mun pa bzhin dang / pha rol dang tshu rol dang the tshom dang gtan la phebs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: snang ba dang mun pa bzhin dang / pha rol dang tshu rol dang the tshom dang gtan la phebs pa bzhin no //
translated: like light and darkness, this side and the other side, doubt and certainty.

original: 'gro ba la yang gnyen po gnas pa yod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'gro ba la yang gnyen po gnas pa yod pa yin no //
translated: And the opposite of going is staying.”

original: brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: brjod par bya ste /
translated: We reply:

original: gal te de'i gnyen po gnas pa yod na ni 'gro ba yod par 'gyur ba zhig na de ni med do //
analyzed: gal te de'i gnyen po gnas pa yod na ni 'gro ba yod par 'gyur ba zhig na de ni med do //
translated: If staying existed, then going would exist, but it does not.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: 'dir gnas pa 'di 'gro ba po'am /
analyzed: 'dir gnas pa 'di 'gro ba po'am /
translated: Here, is staying the goer,

original: 'gro ba po ma yin pa'am /
analyzed: 'gro ba po ma yin pa'am /
translated: or is it not the goer?

original: de gnyis las gzhan pa zhig la brtags @35a * //
analyzed: de gnyis las gzhan pa zhig la brtags @35a * //
translated: If it is something other than those two,

original: grang na / rnam pa thams cad du mi rung ngo zhes bshad pa /🔽re zhig 'gro po mi sdod de //
analyzed: grang na / rnam pa thams cad du mi rung ngo zhes bshad pa / re zhig 'gro po mi sdod de //
translated: it is completely untenable.🔽First, the goer does not rest,

original: 'gro ba po min sdod pa min //
analyzed: 'gro ba po min sdod pa min //
translated: and the nongoer does not rest.

original: 'gro po 'gro po min las gzhan //
analyzed: 'gro po 'gro po min las gzhan //
translated: Apart from the goer and the nongoer,

original: gsum pa gang zhig sdod par 'gyur //
analyzed: gsum pa gang zhig sdod par 'gyur //
translated: what third thing rests?

original: 'gro ba po ji ltar mi sdod pa de ltar ni tshigs su bcad pa phyi mas ston par 'gyur ro //🔽'gro ba po ma yin pa yang mi sdod de /
analyzed: 'gro ba po ji ltar mi sdod pa de ltar ni tshigs su bcad pa phyi mas ston par 'gyur ro // 'gro ba po ma yin pa yang mi sdod de /
translated: The next verse shows how the goer does not rest.🔽The nongoer does not rest either.

original: de ni sdod pa nyid yin na /
analyzed: de ni sdod pa nyid yin na /
translated: If he is a nongoer,

original: de la gnas pa gzhan gyis dgos pa ci zhig yod /
analyzed: de la gnas pa gzhan gyis dgos pa ci zhig yod /
translated: what use is there for him to rest?

original: gnas pa gcig gis ni 'gro ba po ma yin par 'gyur la /
analyzed: gnas pa gcig gis ni 'gro ba po ma yin par 'gyur la /
translated: If he is a nongoer, what use is there for him to rest?

original: gzhan gyis ni sdod par 'gyur ro zhes gnas pa gnyis su thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir gnas pa po yang gnyis su thal bar 'gyur bas nyes pa snga ma bzhin du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyis ni sdod par 'gyur ro zhes gnas pa gnyis su thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir gnas pa po yang gnyis su thal bar 'gyur bas nyes pa snga ma bzhin du 'gyur ro //
translated: Since it follows that the resting itself would be twofold, the fault would be the same as before.

original: 'gro ba po dang 'gro ba po ma yin pa las ma gtogs pa'i don yang med do //
analyzed: 'gro ba po dang 'gro ba po ma yin pa las ma gtogs pa'i don yang med do //
translated: And there is no object other than the goer and the nongoer.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here, someone says:

original: 'gro ba po ma yin pa mi sdod la /
analyzed: 'gro ba po ma yin pa mi sdod la /
translated: The nongoer does not rest.

original: 'gro ba po dang 'gro ba po ma yin pa las gzhan pa yang mi sdod de /
analyzed: 'gro ba po dang 'gro ba po ma yin pa las gzhan pa yang mi sdod de /
translated: And that which is neither the goer nor the nongoer does not rest.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: But what does?

original: 'gro ba po nyid sdod do //
analyzed: 'gro ba po nyid sdod do //
translated: The goer rests.

original: de ltar ni ma yin te gang gi phyir /
analyzed: de ltar ni ma yin te gang gi phyir /
translated: This is not so, because:

original: gang tshe 'gro ba med par ni //
analyzed: gang tshe 'gro ba med par ni //
translated: When there is no going,

original: 'gro po 'thad par mi 'gyur na //🔽re zhig 'gro po sdod do zhes //
analyzed: 'gro po 'thad par mi 'gyur na // re zhig 'gro po sdod do zhes //
translated: The goer is not tenable.

original: ji ltar 'thad pa nyid du 'gyur //
analyzed: ji ltar 'thad pa nyid du 'gyur //
translated: How then could it be tenable🔽To say “The goer rests”?

original: gang gi tshe 'di sdod do zhes brjod pa de'i tshe de la gnas pa dang / 'gal ba'i 'gro ba yod pa ma yin la /
analyzed: gang gi tshe 'di sdod do zhes brjod pa de'i tshe de la gnas pa dang / 'gal ba'i 'gro ba yod pa ma yin la /
translated: When it is said “He rests,” at that time, for him, there is no going that is incompatible with resting.

original: 'gro ba med par yang 'gro ba por brjod pa yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'gro ba med par yang 'gro ba por brjod pa yod pa ma yin te /
translated: And without going, it is not said that he is a goer.

original: de'i phyir 'gro ba po sdod do zhes bya ba ni mi 'thad do //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'gro ba po sdod do zhes bya ba ni mi 'thad do //
translated: Therefore, to say “The goer rests” is untenable.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here, someone says:

original: 'gro ba ni yongs su yod pa nyid de ldog par yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gro ba ni yongs su yod pa nyid de ldog par yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Going does exist because stopping exists.

original: 'di na 'gro ba las ldog pa na gnas pa rtsom par byed na /
analyzed: 'di na 'gro ba las ldog pa na gnas pa rtsom par byed na /
translated: Here, if one reverses from going, then one begins to rest.

original: 'gro ba med na ni de las ldog par mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'gro ba med na ni de las ldog par mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: But if there is no going, then one does not reverse from it.

original: brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: brjod par bya ste /
translated: We reply:

original: gal te de las ldog pa nyid yod na /
analyzed: gal te de las ldog pa nyid yod na /
translated: If reversing from it exists,🔽then going would exist.

original: 'gro ba yod par 'gyur na don med de /
analyzed: 'gro ba yod par 'gyur na don med de /
translated: But that is meaningless.

original: 'di ltar / bgom las ldog par mi 'gyur te //
analyzed: 'di ltar / bgom las ldog par mi 'gyur te //
translated: One does not reverse from where one has gone,

original: song dang ma song las kyang min //🔽de gnyis 'gro ba po song ba'i lam las ni mi ldog ste /
analyzed: song dang ma song las kyang min // de gnyis 'gro ba po song ba'i lam las ni mi ldog ste /
translated: Nor from where one has not gone.

original: 'gro ba med pa'i phyir ro //🔽ma song ba las kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: 'gro ba med pa'i phyir ro // ma song ba las kyang ma yin te /
translated: One does not reverse from the path where one has gone because there is no going there.

original: 'gro ba med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //🔽bgom pa las kyang mi ldog ste /
analyzed: 'gro ba med pa nyid kyi phyir ro // bgom pa las kyang mi ldog ste /
translated: One does not reverse from where one has not gone because there is no going there.

original: de ma dmigs pa'i phyir dang / 'gro ba'i bya ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ma dmigs pa'i phyir dang / 'gro ba'i bya ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: One also does not reverse from where one is going because that is not observed and because there is no action of going there.

original: de'i phyir 'gro ba las ldog pa med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'gro ba las ldog pa med do //
translated: Therefore, reversing from going does not exist.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here, someone says:

original: gal te 'gro ba'i 'gran zla gnas @35b pa med pas 'gro ba med pa yin na /
analyzed: gal te 'gro ba'i 'gran zla gnas @35b pa med pas 'gro ba med pa yin na /
translated: If going does not exist because there is no place to go that is the rival🔽of going, then what is the point of saying:

original: de lta na 'o na 'gro ba grub par bya ba'i phyir gnas pa grub par bya ste /
analyzed: de lta na 'o na 'gro ba grub par bya ba'i phyir gnas pa grub par bya ste /
translated: But if that is so, then in order to establish going, you must establish staying,

original: de grub pas 'gro ba grub pa yin no //
analyzed: de grub pas 'gro ba grub pa yin no //
translated: and because that is established, going is established.

original: de'i phyir gnas pa ni yod pa nyid de 'gran zla yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir gnas pa ni yod pa nyid de 'gran zla yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, staying exists because its opposite exists.

original: gnas pa'i 'gran zla ni 'gro ba yin la /
analyzed: gnas pa'i 'gran zla ni 'gro ba yin la /
translated: The opposite of staying is going,

original: de ni yod pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni yod pa yin no //
translated: and that exists.

original: de'i phyir gnas pa yang yod pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir gnas pa yang yod pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, staying also exists,

original: 'gran zla yod pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'gran zla yod pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: because its opposite exists.

original: 'di yang mi rung ste /
analyzed: 'di yang mi rung ste /
translated: This is also not tenable.

original: 'di ltar / 'gro ba dang ni 'jug pa dang // ldog pa yang ni 'gro dang mtshungs //
analyzed: 'di ltar / 'gro ba dang ni 'jug pa dang // ldog pa yang ni 'gro dang mtshungs //
translated: Because: Going, beginning, and reversal Are just like going.

original: 'dir gnas pa bsgrub pa'i phyir bkod pa'i 'gro ba gang yin pa de ni 'gro ba dang mtshungs te /
analyzed: 'dir gnas pa bsgrub pa'i phyir bkod pa'i 'gro ba gang yin pa de ni 'gro ba dang mtshungs te /
translated: Here, the going that you posit in order to establish staying is just like going.

original: 'gro ba sun 'byin pa dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'gro ba sun 'byin pa dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is similar to the refutation of going.🔽As it is said:

original: ji ltar / re zhig 'gro po mi sdod de //
analyzed: ji ltar / re zhig 'gro po mi sdod de //
translated: First, a goer does not rest.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas /
translated: And so on.

original: 'gro ba rab tu bsgrub pa'i phyir gtan tshigs nyid du nye bar bkod pa'i gnas pa la sun 'byin pa brjod pa de bzhin du 'dir yang gnas pa bsgrub pa'i phyir gtan tshigs nyid du nye bar bkod pa'i 'gro ba la yang /🔽re zhig gnas po mi 'gro ste //
analyzed: 'gro ba rab tu bsgrub pa'i phyir gtan tshigs nyid du nye bar bkod pa'i gnas pa la sun 'byin pa brjod pa de bzhin du 'dir yang gnas pa bsgrub pa'i phyir gtan tshigs nyid du nye bar bkod pa'i 'gro ba la yang / re zhig gnas po mi 'gro ste //
translated: Just as you have stated a refutation of the position that posits going as the reason for establishing resting, in the same way, here you also state a refutation of the position that posits resting as the reason for establishing going.🔽First, the one who rests does not go.🔽

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa gnyis 'don pa go bsnor te sun 'byin pa brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa gnyis 'don pa go bsnor te sun 'byin pa brjod par bya'o //
translated: Just as you have stated the refutation of the position that posits going as the reason for establishing resting, in the same way, here you should state the refutation of the position that posits resting as the reason for establishing going, by rearranging the two verses that begin “The goer does not rest” and so on.

original: des na 'gro ba med la de med pas 'gran zla gnas pa yang med do //
analyzed: des na 'gro ba med la de med pas 'gran zla gnas pa yang med do //
translated: Therefore, since going does not exist, resting, which is its counterpart, also does not exist.

original: de ltar re zhig 'gro ba ni 'gro ba dang 'dra bar gsal bar bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar re zhig 'gro ba ni 'gro ba dang 'dra bar gsal bar bya'o //
translated: Thus, just like going, resting should be clarified.

original: ci ste gnas pa ni yod pa nyid de /
analyzed: ci ste gnas pa ni yod pa nyid de /
translated: But if resting exists,

original: de'i rtsom pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i rtsom pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: then its beginning would exist.

original: 'dir 'gro ba btang nas gnas pa rtsom par 'gyur la /
analyzed: 'dir 'gro ba btang nas gnas pa rtsom par 'gyur la /
translated: Here, having given up going, one would begin resting.

original: rtsom pa gang yin pa de yang yod par ji ltar mi 'gyur snyam na /
analyzed: rtsom pa gang yin pa de yang yod par ji ltar mi 'gyur snyam na /
translated: How could that beginning not exist?

original: brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: brjod par bya ste /
translated: In response, Nāgārjuna explains:🔽The beginning of resting does not exist🔽For one who goes and for one who does not go.

original: 'jug pa yang 'gro ba dang mtshungs par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: 'jug pa yang 'gro ba dang mtshungs par brjod par bya'o //
translated: And the engagement of that which is being gone over should be described in the same way as going.

original: de la ji ltar sngar /
analyzed: de la ji ltar sngar /
translated: In that regard, just as previously,

original: song la 'gro ba'i rtsom med de //
analyzed: song la 'gro ba'i rtsom med de //
translated: The beginning of going does not exist where one has gone,🔽and so on, the beginning of going is refuted,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'gro ba'i rtsom pa bkag pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'gro ba'i rtsom pa bkag pa de bzhin du /
translated: so too,

original: 'dir yang / gnas la gnas pa'i rtsom med de /
analyzed: 'dir yang / gnas la gnas pa'i rtsom med de /
translated: The beginning of staying does not exist where one has stayed,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas tshigs su bcad pa gsum go bsnor te gnas pa'i 'jug pa la yang 'gro ba dang mtshungs par bsal bar bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas tshigs su bcad pa gsum go bsnor te gnas pa'i 'jug pa la yang 'gro ba dang mtshungs par bsal bar bya'o //
translated: and so on, the three verses should be rearranged and the engagement of that which is being stayed on should be described in the same way as going.

original: ci ste gnas pa ni yod pa nyid de de las ldog pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ci ste gnas pa ni yod pa nyid de de las ldog pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But staying exists because its opposite exists.

original: 'dir lha sbyin gnas par gyur nas gnas pa las ldog pa na 'gro ba rtsom par 'gyur te /🔽gal te gnas pa yod par ma gyur na ni de las ldog par @36a * //
analyzed: 'dir lha sbyin gnas par gyur nas gnas pa las ldog pa na 'gro ba rtsom par 'gyur te / gal te gnas pa yod par ma gyur na ni de las ldog par @36a * //
translated: Here, when Devadatta, having become a stayer, stops staying, he begins going.

original: yang mi 'gyur ro snyam na /🔽brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: yang mi 'gyur ro snyam na / brjod par bya ste /
translated: If staying did not exist, then stopping it would not exist.

original: gal te de'i ldog pa yod par gyur na ni gnas pa yod par 'gyur na /
analyzed: gal te de'i ldog pa yod par gyur na ni gnas pa yod par 'gyur na /
translated: But if its stopping exists, then staying would exist.

original: de ni med de /
analyzed: de ni med de /
translated: But that does not exist.

original: gang gi phyir ldog par yang ni 'gro dang mtshungs te /🔽gnas pa las ldog pa yang 'gro ba las ldog pa dang mtshungs par bsal bar bya ba yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir ldog par yang ni 'gro dang mtshungs te / gnas pa las ldog pa yang 'gro ba las ldog pa dang mtshungs par bsal bar bya ba yin no //
translated: Because it is similar to going where one has gone and not gone.🔽The refutation of stopping while staying is similar to the refutation of going where one has gone and not gone.

original: ji ltar 'gro ba 'gog pa na //
analyzed: ji ltar 'gro ba 'gog pa na //
translated: As it was said:
